Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 8  Wickets (Winners)
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Buckle Up Chennai, It's a Blockbuster Final -   vs  


Cricket fans, hold onto your hats! The IPL 2024 final is here, and the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai is set to erupt! Tonight, two titans collide – the ever-consistent Kolkata Knight Riders, led by the shrewd Shreyas Iyer, and the rampaging Sunrisers Hyderabad under the fiery leadership of Pat Cummins!

KKR has been the team to beat all season. They've dominated the points table, a fortress built on the explosive starts of Sunil Narine and Phil Salt, the solidity of Venkatesh Iyer, and the sheer power of Andre Russell. And let's not forget Mitchell Starc, the most expensive buy of the season, who's been worth every penny – remember his demolition job on SRH in Qualifier 1? It was pure fire!

But SRH are no pushovers. They've been the comeback kings, defying odds and rewriting records. Their batting, led by the young gun Abhishek Sharma and the classy Travis Head, has been a whirlwind, even smashing the highest IPL score ever – a mind-boggling 287!

These two teams have already clashed twice this season, and both encounters were heart-stopping thrillers. But a final is a different beast. It's about nerves of steel, about handling the big occasion. KKR boasts two IPL titles, while SRH is hungry for their second.

The battle lines are drawn. Starc and Cummins, two of the world's best pacers, will be breathing fire right from the first ball. Watch out for Iyer's tactical masterstrokes and Russell's brute force. Can SRH's openers continue their fireworks, and will the experience of Bhuvneshwar Kumar hold firm?

Chennai, the stage is set! The crowd will be a sea of yellow and orange, the noise deafening. Every ball will be a battle, a test of skill and temperament. This is a match for the ages, a night etched in IPL history. So, don't miss a single second! Turn up the volume, grab your favorite snacks, and get ready to witness the crowning of the IPL 2024 champions! Will it be the Knight Riders' reign of consistency, or will the Orange Army rise to the occasion? Let the fireworks begin!


Head-To-Head In IPL :




Facts for the Finale :

Shreyas Iyer will be the first captain in the history of IPL to lead two different franchises in the Finals.
Pat Cummins is the second Australian captain to lead SRH in the finals.
Since IPL 2015, KKR and SRH are the only two teams to have played IPL finals after playing Eliminator.
Both SRH and KKR's last IPL final loss came against CSK and now both these teams will play their finals in Chennai.
SRH will be appearing in their third IPL finals: All the three finals have been led by an overseas captain.
KKR will be appearing in their fourth IPL finals.



IPL Playoffs Stats At MA Chidambaram Stadium  :




The Final Battle  :



Road To Final IPL 2024 :

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ian Bishop and Matthew Hayden : "A red Soil pitch for the finals, 63m and 70m are the square boundaries, while down the ground 77m. Red Soil does tend to have a lot of bounce, this is a well-prepared pitch and we can hope for a high-scoring game. we can expect a score of around 175-190. This is the third final at this venue and there have been high scores in both the previous finals. Not a lot of spin, but significant bounce. Unconventional shots and horizontal bat shots is what the batters will look to do against spin. The groundsmen have made sure that dew does not play a factor tonight as well"

 


TOSS :
  has won the toss and has elected to   first

 

Pat Cummins, SRH Skipper: " Looks like a good track, although I am never good at reading wickets. But this looks pretty fine. There was no dew the other night, doesn't seem there will be today as well. We are playing a particular style, won't work every time but when it does, it will be damaging. Good to be back here at Chepauk. It is a different soil, but you are asking the wrong bloke. Shahbaz Shahbaz comes in for Abdul Samad"

 

Shreyas Iyer,  Skipper:  We would have bowled first anyway. The track looks different than the Eliminator.  We need to stick to our strengths and need to execute our plans. We have been backing each other. Whenever we have been put under pressure, we have worked out well. A lot of players are playing their first IPL finals so there will be nervousness but hopefully we can win it here at Chepauk like the last finals here."

SRH - 40/3 (6.7 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || KKR - 72/1 (12 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)

Death overs (15-18.3 overs):-
SRH - 23/2 in 3.3 overs (6.5 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

KOLKATA KNIGHT RIDERS    HAVE WON THE 17TH EDITION OF THE INDIAN PREMIER LEAGUE!  
PURPLE WAVES DESCEND AT THE CHEPAUK SKY 

 

It was a total knockout  in the IPL 2024 finale as completely dominated  . Opting to bat first backfired for SRH as they lost both openers within the first couple of overs. Starc was phenomenal in the powerplay, taking two crucial wickets.

Russell and Rana tightened the screws during the middle overs, giving nothing away to the SRH batters. Rana took 2 wickets while Russell grabbed 3, significantly slowing down the scoring rate. Markram's 20 and Cummins' 24 were the highest scores for SRH.

Chasing a modest target of 113, KKR had little to worry about. Despite losing Narine early, Gurbaz came out firing on all cylinders. Venkatesh Iyer then sealed the deal, smashing a blistering 50 with a strike rate of 200, hammering the final nail in SRH's coffin.

MOST T20 TITLES BY PLAYERS:

17 - DWAYNE BRAVO
16 - KIERON POLLARD
15 - SHOAIB MALIK
11 - SUNIL NARINE*


Virat Kohli  , gets the Orange Cap for his magnificent batting performances, scoring 741 Runs  
Harshal Patel  , gets the Purple Cap for terrific bowling performances, picking up 24 Wickets  
Sunil Narine  , gets the MVP for the season , accumulating 450.0 Points 


 

Mitchell Starc is Player of the Match   
 

Mitchell Starc: " A great for KKR. What a season. Probably the two most exciting teams in the final. I think we had a fantastic squad and we remained such a consistent side with contributions from everyone. That was a big part of our success. About the game tonight We lost the toss and got used to the ball first. Having watched the game two nights before here, we didn't know what to expect but the bowling unit showed all the skills they have and the wicket-taking balls. It was a lot of fun for me personally and we have got an exciting attack."

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: " I thought they bowled fantastically. We did not have enough on the board. We were outplayed tonight. They gave nothing away. Just like the last game in Ahmedabad. It was a tricky track to figure out. Didn't feel like a 200-plus wicket. 160 would have given us a chance. The style of our play, particularly with the bat, scoring 250 three times is a good feat. So it was a great season. I had not worked with many of the guys before but it was great working with them. A great squad and the staff was amazing. Had a great time."

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper:  It was comprehensive. Every player responded well to what was demanded of them and stood up. It's difficult to express the feelings. So much to cherish right now. Today, we were lucky enough to bowl first. Everything went in our way. Congrats to SRH for the way they played throughout. It was a high-pressure game and Mitchell Starc had been so good off-field. Phenomenal work ethic, and something to learn from him. Russell has got a magic wand and he never fails to deliver. In the majority of the games, he gave us breakthroughs. Venkatesh Iyer made things easy for us. As I said earlier, everyone stepped up. No one individual took us here; it was a cumulative effort. It was a flawless season for us. We played invincible Cricket."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As the sun dips below the horizon in Chennai, MA Chidambaram Stadium is set to come alive with the roar of the Indian Premier League’s Qualifier 2. It’s a clash that’s more than just a game; it’s a narrative rich with drama, anticipation, and the promise of a cricketing spectacle that will have fans and novices riveted to their seats.

The Sunrisers Hyderabad  , a team that has ridden the waves of triumph and tribulation, are poised for a resurgence. Their arsenal, brimming with talent and tenacity, is ready to unleash a storm upon the Rajasthan Royals  , a team of royal lineage, whose journey to this juncture has been nothing short of a knight’s tale.

Today's encounter isn’t just about cricket; it’s a chess match on a 22-yard pitch, where strategy will intertwine with skill, and where the bold will rise. Will SRH’s phoenix-like spirit see them soar to meet the Knight Riders in the final showdown? Or will the Royals, with their blend of youthful exuberance and seasoned sagacity, craft a victory that’s as much a work of art as it is a display of brute force?

In this high-octane Qualifier 2, every delivery will carry the weight of expectation, every stroke will be a brush with destiny, and every catch will be a moment captured in the annals of time. The air is thick with anticipation, the crowd’s energy palpable, as we await a contest that promises to be a crescendo of the cricketing symphony that is the IPL.

Head-To-Head In IPL:




Players Battle To Watch Out For:




The Power Play Dominance  :



 

Sharma - The Six Hitting Sensation  :



Parag- The Cornerstone of the Middle Order  :

 


 

Pitch Report | Ian Bishop and Matthew Hayden:

Bishop: "We are in Chennai for Qualifier 2, and the reward for the winner is a place in the grand final of TATA IPL 2024. The loser is out. There is a nice breeze flowing across the ground, but the humidity is quite severe.

We are on pitch number seven. It's interesting because this pitch hasn't been used at all in TATA IPL 2024. It's uniquely positioned in the square. It's just 61 meters to my left, 72 meters to my right, and 77 meters down the ground. Matthew Hayden is here with me. He has spent a few seasons here. This pitch looks darker compared to the others. What does that mean for us?"

Hayden: "This surface is extremely hard, made of black clay, which means it will hold together well. There will be a nice bounce for the pacers but not much turn for the spinners. The only advantage for spinners will be the huge boundary. In terms of runs, I feel it's a 175-180 kind of wicket. Don't be surprised if Sunrisers Hyderabad bat first if they win the toss, as their blueprint is to score massive and put pressure on the Royals."

Bishop: "The groundsmen say there won't be any dew tonight."




TOSS:  Won the Toss and Elected to Field First   


 

Sanju Samson |  Skipper: "We would like to bowl first, considering what Chepauk usually offers in the second stage of a match.We're doing our best to recover. Our doctors and physios are working hard to get us fit. Me and Sanga discussed that we batted to 70% of our potential and still managed to cross the line. We need to do a bit better with our batting.Each game and venue, with its unique dimensions and climate, is the beauty of the IPL. We are well prepared and looking forward to this game.We're going with the same lineup." 
 

Pat Cummins |  Skipper: "Yeah, that's fine. We would have bowled first as well, but we've batted well first this tournament.We have to be aggressive. It won't work every time, but you have to stay positive. We were well below our best in Ahmedabad. You'll see a better performance tonight.We're having discussions about the bowling department. The boundaries are a bit bigger here, Unadkat comes into the side. Also, Aiden Markram joins in the lineup ."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):- 
SRH - 68/3 (11.3 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)  ll  RR - 51/1 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):-
SRH - 64/3 (7.1 rpo, 1x4 , 4x6)  ll  RR - 51/5 (5.7 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):-
SRH - 43/3 (8.6 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  ll  RR - 37/1 (6.4 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) 
 

In a crunch Qualifier 2, Sunrisers Hyderabad bowled their way into the IPL 2024 final, outclassing Rajasthan Royals in a low-scoring thriller. Defending a modest 175, SRH’s bowlers spun a web around RR, who fell 36 runs short, setting up a grand finale clash with Kolkata Knight Riders.

SRH’s innings wobbled early, losing quick wickets, including Abhishek Sharma’s blitz of 12 off 5. However, Heinrich Klaasen’s fiery 50 off 34 balls, laced with 4 massive sixes, and Rahul Tripathi’s rapid 37 off 15 balls steadied the ship. Despite Trent Boult and Avesh Khan snaring 3 wickets each, SRH managed to post a competitive total.

The chase was a rocky road for RR. Yashasvi Jaiswal’s explosive 42 off 21 gave hope, but SRH’s Shahbaz Ahmed (3/23) and Abhishek Sharma (2/24) turned the screws tight, dismantling RR’s middle order. Dhruv Jurel’s lone battle, scoring an unbeaten 56 off 35, was in vain as the rest of the lineup crumbled.

Key moments included SRH’s early wickets and Shahbaz Ahmed’s game-changing spell. Despite Jurel’s heroics, RR couldn’t muster the partnerships needed, and SRH’s bowlers shone, securing a spot in the final showdown.

As SRH gear up to face KKR, the Royals will reflect on a season that promised much but ultimately fell short. The stage is set for a pulsating final, with SRH looking to cap off their bowling brilliance with the ultimate prize.
 


 

Sanju Samson  Skipper: "It was a big game. I'm really proud of how we bowled in the first innings. We fell short in the middle overs against their spin, and that's where we lost the game. The wicket started turning in the second innings, and they used that advantage well. We could have used more reverse-sweeps or better use of the crease against their left-arm spin. They bowled really well.We've had some brilliant games over the last three years and found great talent like Riyan Parag and Dhruv Jurel. I'm really happy for Sandeep Sharma; he has done a great job as a replacement. The final will be exciting, with both teams looking confident."

 

Pat Cummins  Skipper : "Yeah, a hundred percent. The boys have been fantastic throughout the season. There has been a great vibe in the dressing room, and you can see that. The final was the goal, and we've made it.We knew our strength was our batting, but we wouldn't underestimate the experience in the side. Guys like Bhuvi, Natarajan, and Unadkat keep stepping up.(On who decided to bring in Shahbaz Ahmed as the impact sub) It was Daniel Vettori. He wants as many left-arm spinners as possible.(On Abhishek Sharma's bowling) That was a surprise. Travis Head went out with a couple of right-handed batters. But he did really well in the middle overs.Finals are always funny. You never know. With 170 on the board, after a couple of wickets, things can really turn.It is. For the whole franchise and everyone involved, it's a great moment, and hopefully, we'll go all the way."

Player of the Match: Shahbaz Ahmed


Shahbaz Ahmed : " The captain and coach asked me to be ready for any situation. We had a collapse, so I was used. When I was batting, I felt the ball was stopping, and there was some purchase when Avesh and Sandeep were bowling.I'm very proud to win the award in a big game. I've enjoyed the journey; our team's atmosphere has been relaxed. We will celebrate only after winning the final. Tonight, we'll just relax."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
In a thrilling IPL Eliminator at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, Rajasthan Royals  and Royal Challengers Bengaluru  are set to clash in a battle royally dubbed "The Clash of Royals." RCB rides into this high-stakes game on a remarkable wave of momentum, having won six consecutive matches to secure their playoff spot after teetering on the brink of elimination. Leading the charge for Bengaluru are Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar, who have consistently been at the forefront of the team's scoring. They've been well-supported by Faf du Plessis and Dinesh Karthik, who have provided solid starts and finishes respectively. Yash Dayal has also been a key contributor, bolstering a bowling lineup that has risen to the occasion under scrutiny.

Conversely, Rajasthan Royals have encountered a significant downturn in their campaign, suffering four straight losses after an initially dominant start that saw them win eight of their first nine matches. Now placed third, they face the pressure of the Eliminator. The absence of Jos Buttler, coupled with Yashasvi Jaiswal's dip in form, poses additional challenges. However, their seasoned bowling trio of Trent Boult, Ravichandran Ashwin, and Yuzvendra Chahal, despite recent underperformance, are expected to elevate their game for this critical encounter.

The stakes are high: the victor advances to Qualifier 2, edging closer to the final, while the loser faces elimination. Which team will rise to the occasion in this royal  battle?

Head-To-Head In IPL :




Battles To Watch Out For  :




The Pendulum Swing :



The Perfect Power-Player  :



The Skipper's Special :

 

Pitch Report | Ian Bishop and Matthew Hayden

Bishop:"The Eliminator! You lose and you go home. Both teams coming in with contrasting form. RCB, winning streak. RR on a losing streak. I'm standing here just beside the pitch that was used yesterday and the boundaries were equidistant. Today, it is slightly different. Away to my right, 61 m. That's a short side. 68 m to my left and 73 m down the ground. Again, the captains will be looking for the match-ups and force the guys to hit to the bigger boundary. Matthew Hayden who could clear all these easily. Matthew come in and what do you think about tonight's surface?"

Hayden: "I see that it is very similar actually. It's quite dry. It's extremely firm. It's maybe got a little bit of grass cover. Last night, in my opinion, the dew dramatically affected the game. It became a lot better as the evening went on. It's currently now 43 degrees Celsius. It has been 48 degrees Celsius. It has been sweat on. But there is so much water in the surface that it is creating so much of dew.

But on the surface, as a whole, also the wicket on this wicket has been something that the groundsmen had to control because of the heat. There was a little bit of seam movement early on and a little bit of swing. So watch out for those fast bowlers to get that movement laterally or through the air. Otherwise, this wicket was a very high-scoring wicket in the group stages. Lots of runs." 




TOSS :  Won The Toss and Elected to Bowl  


 

Sanju Samson  Skipper :"We've opted to bowl first, considering the dew factor later in the evening. It's all about the right mindset tonight, how we approach this challenge. It's fantastic to be back in this incredible stadium, the atmosphere is electric.Cricket is a game of ups and downs. We've had our share of setbacks, but the key is to bounce back with character, and that's what we're determined to do tonight.Injuries have been a challenge this IPL, but we've been fortunate. Tonight, Shimron Hetmyer returns to the side, and otherwise, the team remains unchanged." 
 

Faf du Plessis  Skipper:"Winning the toss would've been ideal to set a total with the dew coming in. We saw some swing and seam for the bowlers yesterday, especially early on. This pitch seems a touch drier, perhaps because of the artificial surface on top.Our approach remains the same - 'Mindsight.' Back your skills, play your game.The last match against Chennai was a nail-biter, but sometimes, less is more. You don't need a superhero effort in the playoffs. Some might think longer meetings are key at this stage, but it's all about showing the boys I completely trust them.We're sticking with the same playing XI."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs):-
RCB - 50/1 (8.3 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || RR - 47/1 (7.8 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
RCB - 75/4 (8.3 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || RR - 79/3 (8.8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
RCB - 47/3 (9.4 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || RR - 48/2 in 4 overs (12 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

 

 

Rajasthan Royals  broke Royal Challengers Bengaluru's six-match winning streak with a crucial four-wicket victory in the IPL playoffs Eliminator and also ended their own four match losing streak. Asked to bat first, RCB posted a competitive total of 172/8, thanks to contributions from Rajat Patidar (34), Virat Kohli (33), and Mahipal Lomror (32). Ravichandran Ashwin led the bowling attack for RR with an economical 2/19 in his four overs, while Avesh Khan snagged three vital wickets, ending with figures of 3/44.

In pursuit of 173, Rajasthan Royals got off to a robust start with Yashasvi Jaiswal and Tom Kohler-Cadmore putting on 46 runs for the opening partnership during the powerplay. The middle order was steadied by Riyan Parag's composed 36, setting the stage for a thrilling finish. The Caribbean duo of Rovman Powell and Shimron Hetmyer then took over, guiding RR to victory with their crucial knocks. RCB's bowlers struggled to contain RR's batting prowess throughout the innings.

With this win, Rajasthan Royals advance to Qualifier 2, where they will face Sunrisers Hyderabad in Chennai on May 24th.  




Faf du Plessis  Skipper: "With the dew coming in the second innings, we were a few runs short on that pitch. You need extra runs to make it competitive. Credit to our boys for making a fight of it.Assessing the pitch, 180 is a good score. But with the Impact Player rule this season, par scores have shifted. Normally, that might have been par.With 1 win from 9, other teams might have collapsed, but we won six on the trot. The boys showed great character. Winning six in a row is not easy. We feel an extra 15-20 runs would have made it a fighting total." 
 

Sanju Samson  Skipper: "As I said at the toss, cricket and life teach us to bounce back from great and lean phases. Coming into the knockouts, we questioned ourselves but performed well today.Credit goes to the players. We've spent a lot of time studying the opposition's batters and planning our fielding. Credit to Sanga and Shane Bond for their extensive discussions and planning.Our batting unit is a mix of youngsters and experienced players. Seeing Yashasvi, Riyan, and Dhruv, all 22, perform is amazing.I'm not 100%, as we have a bug in the team. Many are unwell with coughs.We're looking forward to the next game. We have winning momentum, with a travel day and a practice session before the game. Keeping everyone fresh is key." 

Player of the Match: Ravichandran Ashwin  

Ravichandran Ashwin: "We haven't done incredibly well in recent games. Our batting struggled to post par-plus scores. We lost Jos Buttler, and Shimron Hetmyer was injured. These were crucial blows. Today’s game was off course, even when we were chasing. But the confidence will come back.In the first half of the season, my body wasn’t moving well, and I had an abdomen injury. I wanted to put my body on the line for the team. It was about finding rhythm and hitting the right lengths. Transitioning from Test matches to T20s, your body needs time to adjust. As the tournament progressed, I needed a lot of repetitions. It's not easy as I age, but I managed.

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The stage is set for a showdown that’s poised to be the talk of the town. As the IPL 2024 playoffs gear up, the Kolkata Knight Riders  and Sunrisers Hyderabad are ready to battle it out in what’s expected to be a clash for the ages. The Narendra Modi Stadium, a coliseum of modern cricket, awaits the arrival of these two formidable teams.

KKR, having dominated the league stages with their strategic mastery and power-packed performances, are looking to cement their place in the final. SRH, on the other hand, have been the season’s dark horses, making a spectacular comeback with their aggressive brand of cricket.

The head-to-head record tilts in favor of KKR, but in the pressure cooker of the playoffs, past records are just numbers. It’s the day that counts, and both teams are aware that it’s a fresh slate.

As the anticipation builds, the weather promises clear skies, ensuring a full game of thrilling cricket. The pitch, a batsman’s paradise, is ready to witness a flurry of boundaries and perhaps some record-breaking innings.

So, as we inch closer to the first ball, it’s the moment of truth—The Final Call. Will KKR’s dream run continue, or will SRH’s resurgence see them through? It’s more than a game; it’s a spectacle where strategy meets passion, where every run counts, and every wicket could turn the tide.

Tune in for a match that promises to be a feast for the senses. It’s not just about cricket; it’s about the glory, the drama, and the triumph of spirit. This is the IPL 2024 playoffs, where legends are made. Over to you, Ahmedabad, let the games begin!

Sunil Narine : All Round Star   -


  

Pitch Report | Matthew Hayden & Ian Bishop :

Bishop:"We're excited for Qualifier One of IPL 2024 here in Ahmedabad. It's very hot, and the outfield is lush and green. The dimensions are interesting: 63 meters square on either side and 70 meters down the ground, making it inviting for big hitters."

Hayden: "The pitch looks very dry. They removed the Hessian half an hour ago, and with the heat, moisture levels are crucial. The middle areas are quite dry, favoring off-pace deliveries. Watch for Pat Cummins and others who excel at this.There's a slight darker patch indicating some moisture, but overall, the pitch is hard and short, leading to high scores. Power hitters will play a major role, and both teams have plenty. Spin might come into play, but not much."

Bishop: "The groundsmen have confirmed there will be no dew due to the heat." 




TOSS :  Won The Toss and Elected to Bat   



 

Pat Cummins  Skipper: "We are going to bat first. The surface looks good, with the grass holding it firmly. Let's see how it behaves.Absolutely. We haven't played in the finals for a couple of years. The guys are excited, and hopefully, we'll play well tonight.Not too bad. Yesterday was a travel day, and we had a 10-day break before the last game." 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper:"I would have loved to bowl first. In an intense game like this, it's beneficial to know what the pitch does and what score we are chasing.The curator mentioned it's mixed soil. Let's see what it offers and how it plays.It's not about past achievements; it's about performance on the day. Finishing on top is great, but the tournament isn't over. We're proud of what we've done, but we have a big game ahead. We're taking it one game at a time and staying positive."

Knight Riders’ Dominant Victory Propels Them to IPL 2024 Final!

In a high-octane clash, the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) unleashed a blitzkrieg, bulldozing their way into the IPL 2024 final. Their eight-wicket triumph over the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in the first qualifier left fans awestruck.

KKR’s opening duo, Sunil Narine and Rahmanullah Gurbaz, set the stage on fire. They pummeled SRH’s bowlers, racing to 44 runs in the powerplay. Gurbaz’s cameo ended at 23, but Venkatesh Iyer joined Narine in the assault. By the end of the fielding restrictions, KKR had already amassed 63 runs.

Skipper Shreyas Iyer and Venkatesh Iyer continued the onslaught. Their 50-run partnership was a masterclass in controlled aggression. Venkatesh’s elegant fifty off 28 balls was matched by Shreyas, who reached his half-century in just 23 deliveries. The Iyers remained unbeaten, guiding KKR to victory in a mere 13.4 overs.

KKR’s bowlers were equally lethal. Mitchell Starc’s fiery spell dismantled SRH. He dismissed Travis Head for a golden duck and sent Abhishek Sharma packing. Nitish Reddy and Shahbaz Ahmed fell victim to Starc’s venomous deliveries, leaving SRH reeling at 39/4.

SRH fought back through Rahul Tripathi and Heinrich Klaasen. Their 62-run partnership steadied the ship. Klaasen’s aggressive innings ended at 32, but Tripathi’s gritty 55 kept SRH afloat. Unfortunately, a mix-up led to Tripathi’s run-out, and SRH finished at 159.

KKR’s bowlers hunted in packs. Starc’s 3/34 stole the show, while Varun Chakaravarthy’s economical 2/26 added to SRH’s woes. The bowlers paved the way for KKR’s batsmen.

SRH’s missed catches and strategic blunders cost them dearly. Captain Pat Cummins’ early bowling gamble backfired, and the Impact Player strategy misfired.

KKR’s emphatic win propels them to the IPL 2024 final, their fourth appearance in the tournament’s history. A decade after their last title, they stand on the brink of glory. Meanwhile, SRH faces the winner of the Eliminator, keeping their campaign alive. Shreyas Iyer become the first ever captain to lead two franchises to IPL finals, DC in 2020 and KKR in 2024 !

Stay tuned for more IPL 2024 fireworks as the road to the grand finale unfolds!

 

 

Pat Cummins Skipper: "We need to put this one behind us quickly. In T20 cricket, you have days when it doesn't work out. We earned the right to get another shot at reaching the final, and it's good we get another crack at it.It was just one of those days. A few guys didn't get starts, and we couldn't deliver with the ball either. We would have loved to have Umran on that wicket, but with wickets falling, we thought an extra batter was needed.I thought KKR bowled really well, and then the wicket got better for batting.Starting fresh at a new venue helps. We have a good body of work this season, and we hope to turn things around in Chennai." 
 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper: "Elated by the performance. Everyone chipped in, and I'm delighted with the way the team took responsibility.Traveling from one state to another isn't easy, especially from Kolkata to Guwahati. We weren't focused on the past but aimed to maximize tonight.The way each bowler stood up was brilliant. Even when we went at nine runs per over, the attitude to come back and pick wickets was crucial.Our bowling lineup's variety has been consistent. No one takes their place for granted, and we hope to continue the winning momentum.Gurbaz gave us an impactful start in his first game, and Sunil followed through. We made sure to carry forward that momentum.Communicating with Venkatesh was fun; he spoke Tamil, which I understand but can't speak, so I replied in Hindi (laughs).Right now, it's important to enjoy the moment. We've won an important game, but come match day, we'll stay focused."
 

Mitchell Starc (Player of the Match ): "We know how important the powerplay is. Taking early wickets against a team like Hyderabad disrupts their middle order. Travis and Abhishek have been playing well, liking the width to free their arms. Swinging the ball and keeping it in line with the stumps, as we did in the powerplay, was key. Our spinners and the whole bowling unit performed great tonight.(On Head's wicket) Got lucky, I guess (chuckles). It was nice to get Trav out early, but he'll probably come out swinging in the next game. They're exciting to watch and hugely talented.Our attack is young and raw, with skillful players ready to step in if needed. Guys like Harshit have been phenomenal. Our whole bowling attack has been great, and it's wonderful to see them firsthand. No doubt, they have many wickets in them in the IPL."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Ladies and gentlemen, brace yourselves for a cricketing spectacle that promises to be nothing short of a blockbuster!  Both teams, already through to the playoffs, are set to battle it out. KKR, riding high on a wave of victories, aims to keep the juggernaut rolling. Meanwhile, the Royals, having hit a rough patch with four consecutive losses, are desperate to rediscover their winning formula. A triumph today would seal a top-two finish for them, no matter how the tides turn in the SRH-PBKS game.As we gear up for the final league fixture, it’s a summit clash in Guwahati. The Knights, perched at the pinnacle, are unassailable at the top. But for the Royals, it’s a do-or-die affair to clinch that coveted top-two berth after a string of defeats.

Reflecting on their last outing, the Royals faced a setback against the Kings, with Riyan Parag’s valiant effort falling short. The Kings, led by Curran’s captain’s innings, overhauled RR’s total with ease.

Now, as we stand on the cusp of the 70th match of this electrifying Indian T20 League, it’s the final group game, a prelude to the playoff drama. Rajasthan, once a juggernaut with 8 wins from 9, now finds themselves in a must-win tussle to secure a top-two spot, sans their powerhouse Buttler. Kolkata, on a five-match unbeaten streak, will miss the services of their dynamo Salt, but Gurbaz is all set to step into those big shoes.

Rewind to their previous face-off this season at the iconic Eden Gardens, where Rajasthan chased down a mammoth 224 in a nail-biter. Expect fireworks once again as these two giants collide. Who will emerge victorious?

Head-To-Head In IPL:



Players Battles To Watch Out For:

 
 

Pitch Report | Anjum Chopra and Matthew Hayden:

Anjum: "It is nice to be in the Eastern part of the country for the last league game of the season. Actually, I am not very happy saying it. But since we are in Guwahati, we are in the center of the ground. The square boundaries are 61m and 62m, pretty much equidistant. The straight boundary is the one that challenges the batters a bit more at 73m. The last game played here wasn't high-scoring, but we often see high-scoring games here."

Hayden: "We've got a cracking wicket for the game. It's a different-looking surface from the last game, which was low-scoring. Last year, Rajasthan Royals got 199 on this same wicket, and Delhi Capitals couldn't chase it down. So, I'd suggest batting first. It's an extremely hard pitch with a good sheen to it, ideally prepared with an even covering of grass. There are a couple of areas on the pitch where the grass is missing but still has that sheen look. The ball will slide onto the bat. Remember, in the last game, the spinners came into play, and it was tricky for the batters who had to rotate the strike. This pitch looks better." 


[7:00 PM IST] - IT'S RAINING HERE AND THE TOSS IS DELAYED 

[7:37 PM IST] - THE RAIN HAS INTENSIFIED & MORE PARTS OF THE GROUND ARE COVERED 

[7:45 PM IST] - THE GROUND IS COVERED FULLY NOW 

[8:10 PM IST] - THE RAIN HAS REDUCED TO A DRIZZLE AND SOME COVERS ARE COMING OFF. THE GROUNDSMEN AND THE SUPER SOPPERS ARE CLEARING THE WET OUTFIELD. WE WILL START TO LOSE OVERS FROM 8:35 PM IST 

[8:40 PM IST] - APART FROM THE COVER ON THE PITCH THE OTHERS ARE REMOVED AND THE UMPIRES ARE IN THE MIDDLE  

[8:45 PM IST] - THE COVERS ARE BACK WITH THE DRIZZLES INCREASING 

[10:00 PM IST] - THE UMPIRES ARE ON THE FIELD WITH UMBRELLAS TO HAVE A CHAT WITH GROUND STAFF 

[10:15 PM IST] - WE WILL HAVE AN OFFICIAL INSPECTION AT 10:25 PM IST  
 
[10:25 PM IST] - WE HAVE 7 OVERS GAME IN HAND, THE FIRST BALL AT 10:45 PM IST   


TOSS UPDATE:   Won the Toss and Elected to bat 

 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper: "We are going to bowl; we don't know how the pitch will play. The outfield is wet. We have one change: Anukul Roy comes in." 

Sanju Samson   Skipper:"We wanted to bowl first as well. This pitch looks a lot better than the last one, which was dry. There has been a last-minute change. Nandre Burger comes in." 

[10:40 PM IST]: OH DEAR! THE RAIN HAS RETURNED AND THE COVERS ARE DRAGGED BACK ON BY THE GROUNDSMEN, THE CUT OFF TIME FOR A 5 OVER GAME IS 10: 56 PM IST  

[10:50 PM IST]: THE CAPTAIN SHAKE HANDS AND THE MATCH HAS BEEN ABANDONED  
 

As the curtains fall on the league stages of the IPL 2024, an unexpected twist came with the final match being abandoned due to weather, leading to a shared point for both teams. This outcome has propelled Sunrisers Hyderabad to the second spot, edging out Rajasthan Royals on net run rate.

The playoffs are now set with high stakes. Kolkata Knight Riders, leading the points table, are poised to clash with Sunrisers Hyderabad in a highly anticipated Qualifier 1 at the Narendra Modi Stadium on May 21. The winner will secure a spot in the grand finale, while the loser must face another challenge to keep their championship dreams alive.

Following closely, Rajasthan Royals will confront Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the Eliminator on May 22, promising another thrilling encounter. The Rajasthan players’ heartfelt lap of honor, acknowledging the unwavering support of the fans, was a fitting tribute to the end of the group games. With 70 matches behind us, the excitement now shifts to Ahmedabad, where the battle for the ultimate glory intensifies.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It’s that time again—the IPL showdown we’ve all been waiting for! Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) are locking horns with Punjab Kings (PBKS) in a high-octane clash. The stakes? Sky-high! 

SRH, led by the fiery Pat Cummins, have been scorching the pitch. Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma—like two blazing meteors—have anchored their batting lineup. But hold your horses! A recent washout against Gujarat Titans has left them a tad rusty. Now, they’re out to reclaim their mojo in this do-or-die group stage finale. 

PBKS, on the flip side, are playing with pride as their armor. Skipper Sam Curran, the swashbuckling hero, smashed an unbeaten 63 off just 41 balls in their last outing against Rajasthan Royals. But wait, there’s a twist! They’ll miss Jonny Bairstow and Sam Curran—like a ship without its anchors. Yet, their bowling brigade, led by Harshal Patel and Arshdeep Singh, stands tall. 

Now, picture this: the sun-kissed Hyderabad pitch, ready for battle. Bats will sing, boundaries will dance, and the crowd will roar. But here’s the twist in the tale: SRH needs a win and a sprinkle of luck in the Rajasthan game to secure a top-two spot. PBKS? They’re aiming to exit with a bang, fireworks lighting up the night sky.   


Head to Head 
SRH’s got the upper hand, winning their last two encounters against PBKS. In their previous face-off this season, SRH clinched victory by a mere 2 runs—a nail-biter that had fans on the edge of their seats! 



Milestone Alert 

1- Heinrich Klaasen (49) needs one four to complete 50 fours in IPL.
1- Jaydev Unadkat (99) needs one wicket to get to 100 IPL Wickets.
26- Aiden Markram (974) needs 26 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL. 
42 -Jitesh Sharma (2458) needs 42 runs to complete 2500 runs in T20s.  


Battles To Watch Out For 

  

 

Pitch Report | Mpumelelo Mbangwa & Brian Lara:

Mbangwa: "In Hyderabad, it’s very hot, especially during an afternoon game. Captains need to consider this. The field dimensions are 66 meters for the square boundaries and 78 meters down the ground."

Lara: "I’m expecting a lot of runs because there’s absolutely no grass on this surface. The lack of grass means the ball will get dirty quicker, which will help the spinners later on. However, given the aggressive nature of these two teams, I still expect a high-scoring game. There’s a bit of cracking on the surface, but I don’t think it will affect play for the next three hours.Any damage to this pitch will come from the bowler’s foot marks. There might be a bit of spin later, but it’s an absolute belter. SRH would love to finish this part of the tournament with another big score. Many teams fear bowling first against SRH. If I were the opposition, I’d prefer to bat first. I believe that the winning captain, whether it’s SRH or Punjab, will choose to bat first."  




TOSS :  Won the Toss and Elected to Bat   

 




 

Jitesh Sharma |   Skipper: " We've decided to bat first because the wicket looks good. We want to score big and get them out early.It's a proud moment to lead a franchise. I'm grateful for the opportunity and happy to have a bigger role.We have limited options as most of our overseas players have gone home. Only Rilee Rossouw remains to play this game. We have a good group of players waiting for their opportunity, and it will be nice to see their talent on display. I feel they will give their best.We always try to play a good brand of cricket. I just motivate the team; we have nothing to lose. We aim to give SRH a good fight and play good cricket." 
 

Pat Cummins |    Skipper: "The crowd has been awesome this season. Every time we've played here, the support has been very good.I'm not too upset. We would have batted first as well, but we're not unhappy with bowling firstWe've shown that in some games, things come together, but in others, we need to set a good total. As a bowling group, we're experienced and try to stay one step ahead of the opposition.I've got no idea. I'm a terrible reader of the wicket. Let's see how it behaves today.
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

PBKS - 61/0 (10.17 rpo, 8x4, 2x6) ll SRH - 84/2 (14 rpo, 7x4, 6x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
PBKS - 98/2 (10.89 rpo, 6x4, 7x6) ll SRH - 98/2 (10.89 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
PBKS - 55/3 (11 rpo, 3x4, 3x6) ll SRH - 33/2 (7.92 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) 

 

Sunrisers Hyderabad, with a display of sheer class and balance, have turned the tables today! It wasn’t all smooth sailing; they had their backs to the wall early on. But the middle order, they stood tall when it mattered. Abhishek Sharma and Heinrich Klaasen, take a bow! Their pivotal knocks have steered SRH to a win that’s as vital as they come.

With this clinical performance, the Sunrisers have soared to the second spot in the points table. The Punjab Kings, earlier in the day, put on a show with the willow. Taide, Rossouw, and Prabhsimran - the trio set the stage with a formidable 214/5. But the Sunrisers, they’ve been in imperious form with the bat, and today was no different. Despite losing Travis Head early, Abhishek and Tripathi launched a counter-attack in the powerplay, sending the Punjab bowlers into a tizzy. Nitish Reddy and Klaasen then stepped up, delivering the crucial blows. And though wickets fell towards the end, SRH crossed the line with an over to spare.

The stage is set, the players are ready, and the next game will be the decider. Will it be the Sunrisers or Rajasthan who will join KKR for Qualifier 1? The anticipation is palpable. Stay tuned for the evening’s clash to witness the playoff spots get locked in. What a day for cricket it’s going to be! 

 



 

Jitesh Sharma  Skipper: "It was totally fun. I'm excited that my boys really fought well, and I am very proud of them. It was a nice game without the overseas players, and we enjoyed it a lot.

It was a good score with this batting lineup. Klaasen and Abhishek deserve credit. My bowlers performed well. Discussions only help if you implement them on the field. We planned based on the wicket, and I'm happy with how we executed." 
 

 

Pat Cummins  Skipper : "Yeah, it's pretty cool. Pretty awesome. Winning six out of seven has been amazing, and the fans have been brilliantIt's been great. I didn't know many of the guys coming into the season, but there have been many great players, and we have gelled well.Amazing. I have said it a few times: I wouldn't be happy bowling to him( Abhishek Sharma) . He is a clean striker of the ball and runs down the track against spinners. Thankfully, he's on our side.Nitish is a class player. He seems to sum up the game pretty well and is a perfect fit in the top order.It's really satisfying and exciting to make the playoffs. Most of the guys, including myself, haven't played in the finals. We will know which game we will be playing in a few hours." 

Player of The Match:Abhishek Sharma 
 

Abhishek Sharma : " I felt things were going well for me, so I wanted to make the most of it for my team. From the first ball, my intent was to go after the bowler because the target was high, and I wanted to contribute.The hard work I've put in before this season is paying off now. In SMAT, I was clear about targeting and dominating the bowlers, and I want to continue with that approach as it’s working well.Brian Lara was our coach last year, and I worked a lot under him. I'm still in touch with him now.I wait for the balls I want the bowler to bowl to me. They are bowling loose and a bit defensively, so I make sure they are under pressure."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 27  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 27  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
In the grand tapestry of IPL 2024, the M Chinnaswamy Stadium is bracing for a showdown that’s nothing short of legendary. The Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) are on the brink of scripting history, playing their 100th T20 match on this sacred cricketing ground. With an unbroken winning streak on May 18th, the stadium has become a bastion of victory for RCB, a day when they’ve consistently turned the tide in their favor.

This season’s narrative for RCB reads like a blockbuster movie script. After a dismal start that saw them at the bottom of the table, they’ve surged back with a vengeance, stringing together wins that have left the fans spellbound. At the heart of this revival is the indomitable Virat Kohli, whose bat speaks a language of aggression and finesse, reminiscent of his golden run in 2016. The bowling contingent, too, has stepped up, transforming RCB into a cricketing powerhouse.

The stakes are sky-high as they face the formidable Chennai Super Kings (CSK), now under the fresh captaincy of Ruturaj Gaikwad. RCB’s mission is clear: they need a victory, and not just any win, but one that’s emphatic enough to elevate their Net Run Rate and secure a spot in the playoffs. They need to outclass CSK by 18 or more runs or chase a target with a minimum of 11 balls to spare. Conversely, CSK’s equation is straightforward – a win of any margin, or even a rain-induced washout, would propel them into the playoffs, simultaneously dashing RCB’s dreams.

As if the match itself wasn’t thrilling enough, the weather adds a layer of intrigue, with the possibility of rain casting a shadow over the proceedings. 

With the countdown to this monumental clash underway, the anticipation is palpable. RCB’s storied May 18th legacy and the milestone of their 100th T20 at the Chinnaswamy add an extra dimension to the drama. Will the stars align for RCB once again, or will this day mark a new chapter in their history? The stage is set, the players are ready, and the fans are waiting with bated breath for what promises to be an epic battle where glory and heartbreak are but a heartbeat away. 

Head-To-Head In IPL:


 

Milestone Alert

1- Dinesh Karthik (299) needs one dismissal to complete 300 Dismissals in T20s.

4- MS Dhoni (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes against RCB in IPL.

7- Virat Kohli (2993) needs seven runs to complete 3000 IPL runs at Chinnaswamy Stadium.

9- Ruturaj Gaikwad (91) needs nine sixes to complete 100 sixes in IPL.

44- MS Dhoni(4644) needs 44 runs to surpass Suresh Raina and become the leading run scorer for CSK in IPL.

76- Virat Kohli (7924) needs 76 runs to complete 8000 runs in IPL.

88- Dinesh Karthik (912) needs 88 runs to complete 1000 runs for RCB in IPL. 

Venue Stats In IPL 2024 at M.Chinnaswamy Stadium:



Players Battles To Watch Out For:



 

Pitch Report | Danny Morrison and Deep Dasgupta:

Morrison: "We are here for the blockbuster in the Garden City. This is going to be a cracker. We are in the middle of the pitch. To my right is 60m, to my left is also 60m, and downtown is 70m. The smaller pocket is under 60m. Joining me is our pitch guru, Deep Dasgupta."

Dasgupta: "The pitch has no grass and looks dry. It appears mosaic and broken, but it’s rock hard with no moisture content. Runs will be on offer, but the batters will need to apply themselves. We need to keep an eye on the weather as well. I've been here since yesterday, and we've only had drizzles so far."



TOSS:  Won the Toss and Elected to Field 



 

Ruturaj Gaikwad |   Skipper: "We will bowl first. The wicket looks good, there's no dew around, but the conditions are overcast. We want to capitalize on the first 2-3 overs. It’s a small ground, so chasing here should be comfortable.The pitch was a bit damp, but with the impact player rule, everyone comes hard. Every game in the IPL is a must-win. Nothing new for us; we've been in this situation before. We need to focus on our processes and winning the small battles is key for us." 


Faf du Plessis |  Skipper: "Yes, we would have liked to field first as well. We lost the toss a couple of days ago but still posted a big total and won the game.The toss isn't a big deal. Our confidence is high, and the boys are ready for it.It's set up nicely for us. Two good teams and one goes through. We’ll stick to our processes, keep things simple, and focus on the win without thinking too far ahead.We have no changes; it's the same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
[ 7:45 PM IST ]:- AW SNAP!!  RAIN STOPPED PLAY & COVERS ARE ON! 

[ 8:00 PM IST]: GOOD NEWS FROM THE VENUE, SOME COVERS ARE COMING OFF AS THE DRIZZLE HAS REDUCED AND THE SUPER SOPPERS ARE DOING THEIR THING 

[8:14 PM IST]: THE COVERS ARE FULLY OFF AND THE GROUNDSMEN ARE DOING THE FINAL TOUCHES, WE SHOULD HAVE THE PLAY RESUME AT 8:25 PM IST 

 

Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
RCB - 42/0 (7 rpo, 3x4, 3x6) ll CSK - 58/2 (9.67 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
RCB - 96/2 (10.67 rpo, 6x4, 6x6) ll CSK - 71/4 (7.89 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):- 
RCB - 80/3 (16 rpo, 5x4, 7x6) ll CSK - 62/1 (12.4 rpo, 5x4, 4x6) 
 

In the cauldron of Chinnaswamy, it was a spectacle that will be etched in the annals of IPL history. The Royal Challengers Bengaluru, with their backs against the wall, orchestrated a heist of epic proportions, snatching a playoff berth with a heart-stopping 27-run triumph over the Chennai Super Kings.

From the outset, CSK’s chase was a tale of woe, with Ruturaj Gaikwad’s exit for a golden duck setting the tone. Despite Rachin Ravindra’s valiant 61 and Rahane’s brisk 33, the Men in Yellow’s hopes were dashed as they stumbled to 191/7.

RCB’s bowlers, led by the fiery Yash Dayal and supported by Maxwell, Siraj, Ferguson, and Green, were relentless, ensuring CSK’s early exit. Earlier, RCB’s batsmen had blazed away to 218/5, with Kohli and du Plessis laying the groundwork, and Patidar and Green delivering the knockout punch.

As Bengaluru’s skies threatened rain, RCB needed a win of at least 18 runs or a chase with 11 balls to spare. They rose to the occasion, defying the elements and the odds, to seal a win that will be remembered for ages.

The night was a symphony of cricketing drama, ending with the RCB faithful in ecstasy and CSK left to ponder what could have been. Truly, Chinnaswamy was the stage for a clash that transcended the ordinary, nothing short of legendary. 
 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad |  Skipper : "It was a good wicket. For spinners, it was turning and gripping a little bit. I’m pretty happy with the target we set. To sum up the season, we’re pleased with winning seven out of 14 games. Injuries and not having Conway made a significant difference. We faced challenges right from the first game. Pathirana got injured, and we missed Fizz as well. Balancing the squad was difficult with these injuries. We couldn’t get over the line, but these things happen. Personal milestones don’t matter much to me; the ultimate goal is to win. We couldn’t achieve that, so I’m slightly disappointed personally." 

 

Faf du Plessis |  Skipper & Player of the Match : "What a night! Such a great atmosphere. It’s a pleasure to finish the season in front of the home crowd. There was a lot of rain on the pitch, and you don’t want that moisture. It felt like a day-five Test match in Ranchi! I’m really proud of the contributions from many batters at good strike rates. We were defending 175, not 201 or 218! We tried to get the ball changed tonight. I dedicate the Man of the Match award to Yash Dayal! I told him pace off on this wicket was the best option."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 18  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 18  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to Match 67, a scene of pride and a smidgen of prejudice, where Mumbai Indians  and Lucknow Super Giants , two teams relegated to playing for pride, are set to clash. Mumbai is marooned at the bottom of the table, teetering on the brink of replicating its 2022 fiasco. Meanwhile, LSG's chances of qualifying twinkle as faintly as a blue moon in the night sky.
The shining star for Mumbai has been Tilak Varma, swinging his bat with seasoned consistency, while Bumrah has been bowling brilliance, slicing through line-ups with lethal precision. On the flip side, LSG’s season skidded off track after a sprinter's start, largely due to the loss of their youthful pacer, Mayank Yadav. 
Rohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya, the dynamic duo of Mumbai, have hit a bit of a rough patch this season. But as the clock ticks down to the T20 World Cup, will these two pillars of Mumbai find their form and light up the scoreboard to turn their sputters into spectacular fireworks in time for the big dance?
As the Mumbai Indians gear up for their lap of honor, all eyes are on the home crowd. It’s a moment of truth at Wankhede — will it be applause or echoes of disappointment? Who will grab the glory in this Friday's thrilling showdown at Wankhede? Grab your popcorn and snacks; it’s time to watch the sparks fly! 

Head-To-Head In IPL:


 


A Breakdown of Bumrah's Brilliance this Season  :


Milestone Alert  :

5- Ayush Badoni (45) needs five fours to complete 50 fours for LSG in IPL.

7- Rohit Sharma (493) needs seven fours to complete 500 fours for MI in IPL

14- Suryakumar Yadav (2986) is just 14 runs away from completing 3000 runs for MI in IPL.

76- Marcus Stoinis (924) needs 76 runs to complete 1000 runs for LSG in IPL.

Players Battle To Watch Out For:


 

 

Pitch Report | Matthew Hayden & Sunil Gavaskar:

Hayden: "This wicket looks like an absolute beauty. Let’s talk about the dimensions: down the ground, it’s 72 meters; to my right, it’s 66 meters; and to my left, it’s 61 meters. We’re playing on wicket number eight, and it’s the fourth time at this venue. The scores have been diminishing here. Remember the last match? Suryakumar Yadav chased down a brilliant hundred against the Punjab Kings, showcasing his best performance."

Gavaskar: "This looks like a typical Mumbai pitch. There will be plenty of runs, but the spinners will get some assistance from the little cracks present. The pitch is a bit dry, which will provide grip for the spinners. If used well, they can make an impact. Winning the toss and batting first to put pressure on the opposition seems like a good strategy."

 

TOSS:  Won the Toss and Elected to Bowl  


 

Hardik Pandya |  Skipper: "We are going to bowl first. Chasing is usually better here as the ball comes nicely in the evening.Playing for the badge and pride is crucial. It's about the character we show and playing good cricket. Winning and playing well will be appreciated.Chasing gives us more freedom to express ourselves. We don't have much to think about, just go out and play a good game of cricket.We have a couple of changes: Bumrah is out, so Arjun plays. Tilak has an injury, so he misses out and Brevis comes in. David also misses out and someone else comes in." 


KL Rahul   Skipper : "Quinton misses out, with Devdutt Padikkal and Matt Henry coming in as the big changes. We’ll also look at using the Impact Player.Generally, it's a good batting wicket, but recent games have shown some variation. We'll see how it behaves after the first six overs and adjust our strategy accordingly.We're disappointed. We started the season well and were comfortably in the top four a couple of weeks ago, but a few losses have set us back. That's how this tournament goes. Today is an opportunity to play our best cricket and entertain the crowd."

LSG - 110/1 (12.22 rpo, 5x4, 9x6) ll  MI - 72/5 (8 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

LSG - 55/3 (11 rpo, 6x4, 3x6) ll  MI - 71/1 (14.2 rpo, 4x4, 5x6) 


[ 10:03 PM IST ]:- AW SNAP!! LOOKS LIKE THERE IS HEAVY DRIZZLES AND COVERS ARE ON THE FIELD NOW, THE RAIN HAS STOPPED PLAY.

[ 10:15 PM IST ]:- THE RAIN HAS STOPPED AND UMPIRES ARE ON THE FIELD WITH THE GROUND STAFF

[ 10:30 PM IST ]:- GOOD NEWS! THE COVERS ARE OFF AND PLAY TO RESUME AT 10:50 PM IST  WITH NO OVERS LOST. 


 

Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) delivered a knockout blow, defeating the Mumbai Indians (MI) by 18 runs in a high-scoring thriller. Despite being out of the playoff race, LSG signed off with a resounding bang, leaving a lasting impression.

Nicholas Pooran, the dynamite in LSG’s arsenal, exploded with a blistering 75 off just 29 balls. His innings was a fireworks display, propelling LSG to a formidable total of 214/6. KL Rahul, the steady anchor, chipped in with a solid 55, setting the stage for a challenging chase.

Mumbai, eager to salvage pride, witnessed Rohit Sharma blaze away to a scintillating 68. His partnership with Dewald Brevis provided a fiery start, but LSG’s bowling attack turned the tide. Ravi Bishnoi and Naveen-ul-Haq, the architects of MI’s downfall, snared two wickets each. Despite Naman Dhir’s late fireworks (62* off 28), Mumbai’s chase fizzled out, leaving them stranded at 196/8.

Rain interruptions added drama, disrupting Mumbai’s momentum post-rain. Lucknow’s bowlers, especially Bishnoi and Krunal Pandya, strangled the middle order, taking crucial wickets at pivotal moments. The defeat epitomized Mumbai’s season—full of promise but lacking execution—as they finished at the bottom of the points table.

For LSG, this victory was a sweet farewell to a bitter campaign. Even though they missed the playoffs, ending the season with a win against a marquee team like Mumbai provided a much-needed morale boost. As the curtains fall on MI’s campaign, the focus shifts to rebuilding and coming back stronger next season. 

 




 

Hardik Pandya  Skipper: "It's been quite difficult. We didn't play good quality cricket this season, and that cost us. In this professional world, there are good days and bad days, but as professional cricketers, we always need to put our best foot forward.

I don't think effort was the issue, but as a group, we couldn't play smart or quality cricket, and the results reflect that. The whole season didn't go our way. It's okay, we can move past this game and look forward to the next season" 
 

KL Rahul  Skipper: " I thought we had a very strong team and had all bases covered. A couple of injuries, which happen to every team, hurt us a little bit. We didn't play well enough collectively. When the bowlers had a good game, the batters didn't. We just didn't come together as much as we wanted. This is the kind of game we were looking for where the batters are scoring, and the bowlers are doing their job, but we couldn't get it together.Mayank and Yudhvir were sent to South Africa to train with our coach, Morne Morkel. They got good facilities and treatment throughout the year so they could play this season.There's not much T20 cricket coming up now. This season has taught me where I stand and how I can do better and get back into the team. My role depends on what the team needs. I’ve done that my whole career.We would have liked Pooran to bat higher, but the senior players are better suited to absorb the pressure. When Stoinis was at number 3, we thought it was better to have the hard hitters down the order.I think I am on my father-in-law's team now, as we are cheering for Sharma ji ka beta and his team for the upcoming World Cup." 


Player of the Match: Nicholas Pooran 

Nicholas Pooran: "First of all, thanks to Jesus. Personally, I felt I had to do my job. Whatever the situation, you have to find a way. In Lucknow, it was tough with big boundaries. But I have been playing in these situations and just using the experience and making it count.I've batted at number 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. If I have to choose, I like the powerplay as well. I can't choose; I can bat at any position, and that's my strength. I can hit the spinners and I like to do those things for my team.I'm just blessed. I had a second chance to play this game.I would just enjoy it. I have overcome my challenges on and off the field, and a big thanks to the teams for supporting me. It has been a challenging journey, but thanks to the fans for their support.After tonight, it’s going to move there. It's back home. We are looking forward to it. The last couple of years have been tough for West Indies cricket and the fans, but we are really looking forward to it."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As the IPL 2024 crescendos into its climactic phases, the Sunrisers Hyderabad  are poised on the cusp of playoff glory, needing just a point to clinch their spot. The Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium sets the stage for this crucial showdown against the Gujarat Titans , a team out of the race but still hungry to disrupt SRH's ascent.

The dynamics of the match are intensely competitive, especially given SRH's impeccable timing in peaking. They return rejuvenated from an eight-day hiatus, fresh off a commanding victory where they chased down 166 against the Lucknow Super Giants in under ten overs. This explosive performance has not only boosted their net run rate but has also placed them as strong contenders for a direct Qualifier 1 berth, pending outcomes from Rajasthan Royals' camp.Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma have been nothing short of spectacular, with Sharma's recent 75-run blitz reasserting their dominance as openers. Their formidable partnership will be crucial against Gujarat, whose bowling attack, despite flashes of brilliance from players like Mohit Sharma, has struggled to consistently pin down opponents.

Gujarat, led by Shubman Gill, has had a season to forget, marred by inconsistent performances and strategic misfires. Despite showcasing their might with a massive 231 against Chennai Super Kings, courtesy of centuries from Gill and Sai Sudharsan, Their challenge will be to muster one last heroic effort to salvage pride and perhaps lay the groundwork for the next season.

As the titans clash in Hyderabad, it's more than just a game; it's a testament to resilience, strategy, and the sheer thrill of T20 cricket. With the playoffs just within reach, SRH looks to deliver another memorable performance, ensuring their journey continues towards the ultimate IPL glory.

Head-To-Head In IPL:

1 - Rashid Khan (149) needs one wicket to get to 150 IPL wickets.

4 - Wriddhiman Saha (296) needs four fours to complete 300 fours in IPL.

5 - Vijay Shankar (45) needs five sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL.

50 - David Miller (950) needs 50 runs to complete 1000 runs for GT in IPL.

Players Battles To Watch Out For:

 

7:00 PM IST: Toss has been delayed due to Rain  

7:15 PM IST: Good news, Covers are coming off and the Super Soppers are on the field doing their work 

7:45 PM IST: We were scheduled to have the toss at 8 PM and 8.15 PM for the match to start but WAIT... THE COVERS ARE BACK 

8:35 PM IST: We have started to lose overs 

10:10 PM IST: The captains walk into the middle and the players shake hands. Confirming the inevitable, MATCH HAS BEEN ABANDONED  


 

Rain played the spoilsport in Hyderabad tonight, forcing the abandonment of Match 66 between SRH and GT without a ball bowled. This marks the first washout in 76 IPL games at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium.

While both teams share a point, the outcome significantly impacts the playoffs.  Sunrisers Hyderabad, despite the damp squib, secured their playoff berth alongside Rajasthan Royals and Kolkata Knight Riders.  However, their dream of a top-two finish now requires a win against Punjab Kings in their final match and a Rajasthan Royals loss.

For Gujarat Titans, already eliminated, the rain adds insult to injury. Back-to-back washouts denied them even a chance to salvage pride in their final fixtures. This concludes a disappointing season for a team that has chased both metaphorical and literal stormy clouds.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The IPL playoff race is hotter than a tandoor, and tonight's clash between the Rajasthan Royals  and Punjab Kings  in Guwahati promises to be a scorcher! The Royals might have already secured their playoff spot, but that doesn't mean they're taking their foot off the gas. This match is all about grabbing that coveted top-two finish and some serious bragging rights.

The Royals were cruising like a maharaja on a camel, but three straight losses had them looking a little dusty. The biggest culprit? The departure of their batting main course, Jos Buttler, for the T20 World Cup. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson, the spotlight is on you! Can you step up and fill those giant gloves? They'll need some fiery support from Riyan Parag, the season's breakout star, and the ever-reliable Dhruv Jurel. Don't forget the bowling attack! Trent Boult and Sandeep Sharma are still the strike bowlers, but Yuzvendra Chahal needs to stop leaking runs like a punctured water balloon.

 Don't underestimate the wounded Kings! They may be IPL's bottom dwellers, but they've shown flashes of brilliance with stunning knocks and nail-biting finishes. With their overseas stars, Jonny Bairstow and Sam Curran, getting ready for international duty, it's time for the domestic talent to shine. Keep an eye on the explosive batting of Prabhsimran Singh and Shashank Singh, while Arshdeep Singh needs to sharpen his death bowling skills like a diamond cutter. While technically playing away, the familiar atmosphere of Guwahati, thanks to some smart local branding by the Royals, might give them a slight home advantage. But for Punjab, this is a chance to play spoiler and potentially shake up the Royals' playoff position.

Will the Royals rediscover their winning ways and secure that top spot, or will the Kings pull off a mighty upset and send shockwaves through the playoff race? The tension is thicker than a mango lassi! Get ready for a Guwahati showdown

Head-To-Head In IPL:


 

Milestones Alert  :

1 - Shikhar Dhawan (99) needs one catch to complete 100 catches in IPL

3 - Yuzvendra Chahal (63) needs three wickets to become the leading wicket-taker for RR in IPL.

4 - Sanju Samson (296) needs four fours to complete 300 fours for RR in IPL

50 - Yashasvi Jaiswal is all set to play his 50th IPL Match  

50 - Jonny Bairstow is all set to play his 50th IPL Match  

Players Battles To Watch Out For:

  

 

Pitch Report | Deep Dasgupta and WV Raman:

Deep: "Welcome to the 13th venue of this IPL season, the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati. Traditionally, this is a good batting surface. The dimensions are 63m to my left, 60m to my right, and 70m straight down the ground. The shortest hit for the day is the third man pocket at 54m. The average score here has been on the higher side, around 199. I'm joined by WV Raman."

Raman: "This pitch is made of black soil and is nicely rolled. The curator has had ample time to prepare it as this is the first game here today. We can expect the batters to score heavily and perform well."

Deep: "The pitch might appear cracked, but having covered many games at Barsapara, I can assure you it plays much better than it looks. Don't be deceived by its appearance. Last season, both games here were won by the team batting first."

Raman: "While setting a total and defending it is possible, remember that India vs Australia T20I here saw Australia chasing a big score successfully in the final over. So, chasing could be a viable strategy."

Deep: "Ultimately, whether you bat first or second might not matter as much. The real question is, will the captain be brave enough to bat first on this surface?" 




TOSS:  Won the Toss and Elected to Bat  


 

Sanju Samson   Skipper: "We would like to bat first. This feels like a second home for us. We've had some of our guys here for the past few days checking for dew, and the information is that there's very little or none later in the game. So, we're choosing to bat first.The team has been performing exceptionally well. Both our batting and bowling units are strong, and the team environment is excellent. Everyone is relaxed and focused. We understand every game in the IPL is essentially a knockout, and the pressure is constant. But we are determined to stick together and deliver a great performance tonight.We'll be missing Jos (Buttler) for this game, with TKC stepping in to replace him. Donovan Ferreira might join us as our impact sub later on." 
 

Sam Curran  Skipper : "Yes, it's a big game against a very good team. We hope to spoil their party and finish on a high. It's been a tough campaign for us.We've lost some close games, which made the difference. We were good in patches, but hindsight is a wonderful thing. We want to end well and win this game and the next one.I'm desperate to win this game and get two points. We've made a few changes: Nathan Ellis gets his first game this season, Harpreet Brar returns, and there are other changes as well. Thank you."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

RR - 38/1 (6.3 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  ll  PBKS - 39/3 (6.5 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 overs) :-
