Death Overs (16-20 overs) :-
RR - 41/3 (8.2 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)  ll  PBKS - 42/1 in 3.5 overs (10.9 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) 

 

In a thrilling turn of events in IPL 2024, the Punjab Kings delivered a stunning blow in Guwahati, handing the Rajasthan Royals their fourth consecutive defeat. While this victory might not salvage Punjab's season, it certainly stirred the playoff pot, showcasing their capacity to disrupt the leaderboard.

Dubbed the road warriors this season, the Kings excelled in enemy territory by stifling the Royals to a modest 144. Despite the sluggish pitch, Punjab's bowlers, spearheaded by a laser-sharp attack, clipped RR's wings, preventing any momentum. The chase initially appeared dire for Punjab at 48/4, but then stepped in Captain Marvel, Sam Curran. Smashing a valiant unbeaten 63, Curran navigated the choppy waters with finesse. Supported by Ashutosh Sharma, who anchored the innings, Punjab overhauled the target with seven balls to spare, sealing a five-wicket triumph.

The Royals had a night marred by misfires but saw a silver lining as local hero Riyan Parag battled to a tenacious 48 off 34. Ravichandran Ashwin added some late dazzle with a rapid 28 off 19, but their efforts fell short as the bowling unit, despite Avesh Khan's 2/28 and Yuzvendra Chahal's dual strikes, failed to defend the total.

This setback leaves Rajasthan scrambling to recalibrate and secure a top-two finish, despite their assured playoff berth. Punjab, meanwhile, revels in their role as the season's spoilers, closing out with their spirits high and a resonant reminder of their potential. As the saga unfolds, the Royals are left to reflect on their stumbles, while the Kings exit stage left with a victory worth remembering.




 

 

Sanju Samson   Skipper: "We were expecting a better wicket. With the batting we have, we should have scored 160-165. That's where we lost the game.Having an additional bowling option is nice as it gets tough with just five, but I've gotten used to it over the last three years with our quality bowlers.We need to accept our failures and identify where we are falling short as a unit. At this critical stage of the tournament, it's about showing character and stepping up. We need players who can stand up and deliver for the team.We aimed for 160-170, and we need to play smart cricket, building those partnerships. We're hoping for favorable results in the upcoming games." 


 

Sam Curran  Skipper & Player of the Match : "I thought we played well as a group. We bowled with pride and determination, going for the win rather than just going through the motions.Nathan Ellis performed well, and we could have used him earlier in the season. The wicket was slow, as Jonny mentioned, but we had a good partnership with Jitesh, which allowed us to play smart cricket without going too hard. Both Jonny and I are leaving tomorrow morning for England duty, which is bittersweet as we'd have loved to stay till the end. Proud of the boys for their performance and character out there. Hindsight shows that losing close games cost us a playoff spot.There are plenty of positives, like the performances of Shashank, Ashutosh, and Harshal throughout the season. Proud of the team's character and hoping to end on a high with a win in Hyderabad.Thank you to the Punjab crowd for all their support throughout the tournament."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As the IPL 2024 sizzles to its climax, Delhi Capitals and Lucknow Super Giants gear up for a high-octane clash at the iconic Arun Jaitley Stadium. It’s crunch time, folks! Both teams are hanging by a thread at 12 points, with playoff dreams dimming faster than a Delhi sunset. DC, despite the home advantage, are scrambling after a slump, while LSG, with a game in hand, are barely keeping their heads above water.

The math is merciless: just winning isn't enough. DC, reeling from a tough loss to RCB, are desperate for a major comeback and not just any win—a colossal one to stay afloat in the NRR game. With Rishabh Pant back in the saddle after a timeout, can DC ignite a late spark? Or will it be a case of too little, too late?

Over in the LSG camp, the stakes are sky-high. After a stern chat from the team owner that went viral, KL Rahul and his squad are under the scanner. Their powerplay woes and a sagging death-over run rate have been their Achilles heel. Can they turn the tables in Delhi's cauldron?

And let's not forget LSG's net run rate. They need to not just win, but win big. Twice. Meanwhile, Jake Fraser-McGurk, DC’s silver lining, is the only batter in IPL history with a strike rate north of 200 after facing 100 balls. Can he dazzle again and kickstart DC's mid-season resurgence narrative?

It's a battle of nerves, strategy, and sheer will. Who will rise? Who will stumble? Get ready for a Tuesday blockbuster that promises fireworks, where every ball, every run, and every wicket could tilt the scales. Hold onto your hats, IPL fans, this one’s going to be a thriller! 

Head-To-Head In IPL:


 


Milestones Alert 

4 - KL Rahul (396) needs four fours to reach 400 fours in IPL.
6 - Marcus Stoinis (144) needs six fours to reach 150 fours in IPL.
9 - Krunal Pandya (141) needs nine fours to reach 150 fours in IPL.
6 - Quinton de Kock (994) needs six fours to reach 1000 fours in T20s.
6 - David Warner (444) needs six more fours to complete 450 fours in T20s. 
3 - Lalit Yadav (47) requires three catches to reach 50 catches in the T20 format.

Players Battle To Watch Out For:

 

 

Pitch Report  | Graeme Swann & Murali Kartik

Swann: "One thing I can tell you straight away: it's small. We all know that it's a high-scoring ground. To my off-side, it's just 60 meters—tiny. The leg side is a bit bigger at 66 meters, and straight down the ground, it's 70 meters. There's a bit of a breeze going down the ground, so even a slight blow on the ball will send it sailing for six. This pitch, number six, is part of a square known for its high-scoring games."

Kartik: "Looking at this track, it has a bit of a sheen, like my head. Running my hand across it confirms that it's just a superficial grasp, with the sheen standing out. It’s more of the same high-scoring nature we've seen. Captains winning the toss here usually opt to bat first, given the advantage it provides. We'll see if today's captain follows suit."

 


TOSS UPDATE:   Won The Toss and Elected to Field  



 

KL Rahul  Skipper: "We are going to bowl first. This decision aligns with our team's strategy and what we believe benefits us. By bowling first, we can get into the game early and then adapt our approach. We have experienced batters who can handle the pressure, taking it off the bowlers.Our goal remains the same: we need to win two games to progress. We've made some mistakes, but instead of dwelling on them, we need to be brave with both bat and ball, get into the contest, and focus on winning. It's about identifying what works best for the team on the day.Being brave is key. As a bowling unit, sometimes there's a hesitation to try new things. We need to bring out our skills early, stick to good lines and lengths, and keep the batters guessing. Our batters have performed well over the years; now it's about being bold and executing our plans." 
 

Rishabh Pant  Skipper: "We would have batted first. In many matches here, we've aimed to set a challenging total for the opposition and score as many runs as possible.Our focus is simple: give 100% and win the match.In the last game, losing too many wickets hurt our chase. We're not dwelling on that; we're looking forward to this match.Fielding has been a concern this season. As a captain, you can only encourage players to give their best, but dropping catches has cost us. We need to improve in that area."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
DC - 73/1 (12.2 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)  ll  LSG - 59/4 (9.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 overs) :-
DC - 63/2 (7 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)  ll  LSG - 76/3 (8.4 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 overs) :-
DC - 72/1 (14.4 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)  ll  LSG - 54/2 (10.8 rpo, 2x4, 4x6) 
 


The Delhi Capitals just pulled off a heist against the Lucknow Super Giants, snatching victory by a whisker (19 runs) and keeping their playoff dreams on life support!Early wobbles almost sent DC packing, but then Porel, the swashbuckling southpaw, went ballistic! A 21-ball fifty – pure fire! Stubbs the Stuntman chipped in with a late blitz (unbeaten 57), propelling DC to a meaty 208/4.LSG's chase started with a whimper. KL Rahul and Quinton de Kock disappeared faster than a naan at a wedding. Ishant Sharma, the fiery veteran, breathed fire, scorching the LSG top order with a sizzling 3-fer.But hold your horses!

Enter Nicholas Pooran, the left-handed lightning rod, who smashed the fastest fifty for LSG this season (61 off 27 balls). Just when it looked like LSG might pull off the impossible, their middle order turned to butterfingers. Half the side were back in the pavilion by the 8th over!Arshad Khan, wasn't ready to throw in the towel! He smashed a defiant 58 not out, keeping LSG's faint hope alive. But DC's bowlers, especially Axar Patel and Mukesh Kumar, the magicians, held their nerve.

They snatched the crucial wicket of Pooran, tilting the match firmly in DC's favor.LSG fell short at 189/9, leaving DC victors in a nail-biter! This win not only keeps DC's playoff dreams alive , but also guarantees a spot in the playoffs for the Rajasthan Royals – talk about a dramatic plot twist!The fight isn't over for DC! They've shown they're not going down without a scrap. This IPL season is getting hotter than a dragon's breath, and the thrilling conclusion is just around the corner! 
 





 

KL Rahul   Skipper: "The wickets stay pretty consistent throughout the 40 overs. Getting Jake out in the first over gave us a strong start, but this season has been tough with players coming in hard even after losing wickets. Shai Hope and Porel took the momentum away from us, though we managed well at the back end. I believe 200 was a par score, and we should have chased it down.Our main issue this season has been losing too many wickets in the powerplay, preventing us from getting solid starts. This has kept players like Stoinis and Pooran from coming in with a good foundation around the 7th or 8th over. This has been a significant factor in our current position."
 

Rishabh Pant   Skipper: "Pooran gave us a hard time, showcasing his caliber. The total was good enough, but we started the season with high hopes, only to face injuries and ups and downs. We can't complain as a franchise; we're still in playoff contention. Some things are beyond control. I missed the last game, and while I'm not saying I would have won it, it would have given us a better chance.The support from the country has been heartening, especially since I was playing after a year and a half. I loved every bit of it."

Player of the Match: Ishant Sharma 

Ishant Sharma : "I've been trying to bowl the knuckleball in recent games, though it wasn't going well, with Rishabh and Axar making fun of me. But I kept at it and got Virat out in the last game and KL tonight.

As a fast bowler with years of experience, I take it day by day. Big thanks to Patrick; because of him, I’ve been able to play nine matches despite an injury earlier. After defeats, we had discussions to strategize. Winning close games boosts confidence, and we aim to carry that momentum forward."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As the IPL 2024 hurtles towards a riveting climax, all eyes are locked on the Narendra Modi Stadium for a high-stakes clash. Gujarat Titans, with their backs against the wall, are all fired up to face the Kolkata Knight Riders, who are not just cruising into the playoffs but also celebrating a milestone— their 250th IPL match. It's a special night in Ahmedabad, where legends are made and dreams are either ignited or extinguished.

KKR, the seasoned gladiators of the league, have been the team to beat this season. With their playoff berth secured and sights set on a top-two finish, they come into the game oozing swagger and strategy. The dynamic duo of Phil Salt and Sunil Narine has been wreaking havoc at the top, turning opening overs into a blitzkrieg that’s been nothing short of explosive. Their spin sorcerers, Narine alongside Varun Chakaravarthy, have been spinning webs around batters, setting the stage for a showdown that could well be a masterclass in T20 cricket.

Gujarat, on the other hand, are desperate to keep the playoff flame alive. With Shubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan wielding their willows like warriors, they’re ready to battle it out and defy the odds. Their recent conquest over Chennai, sparked by centuries from their dynamic duo, has breathed new life into their campaign.

Tonight, as KKR marks a historic 250th match, the stage is set for a clash that’s charged with playoff fervor and historic significance. Will KKR’s celebration be a victorious one, or will Gujarat crash the party? Tune in, as this battle promises to be an epic saga of strategy, skill, and sheer IPL thrill. 

Head-To-Head In IPL:



Milestone Alert

1- Rashid Khan (149) needs one wicket to complete 150 wickets in IPL.

4- Rinku Singh (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL.

4- Mitchell Starc (46) needs four wickets to complete 50 IPL Wickets.

4- Sunil Narine (96) needs four sixes to complete 100 sixes in IPL.

5- Vijay Shankar (45) needs five sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL.

76- David Miller (2924) needs 76 runs to complete 3000 runs in IPL.

Players Battle To Watch Out For:


 

[7:00 IST PM] - The Toss had been Delayed due to Bad Weather  

[7:50 PM IST] - The rain continues to pour  

[8:15 PM IST] - Covers are still on 

[10:05 PM IST] -It's not looking good down there 

[10:15 PM IST] - Both captains are in the middle and having a chat but it doesn't look like they will be starting the game 

[10:22 PM IST] - The covers are coming off but there are still drizzles 
 

[10:30 PM IST] - The pitch covers are off, and the captains shake hands as the match officials inform them of the inevitable 
 


 

In a highly anticipated clash, the match between Gujarat Titans and Kolkata Knight Riders was unfortunately abandoned due to persistent rain, leaving both teams to share the points. This result saw KKR securing a spot in Qualifier 1, continuing their impressive run, while GT were eliminated from the tournament. Before the match was called off, both teams participated in a poignant moment, exchanging breast cancer awareness ribbons, highlighting the spirit of sportsmanship and community awareness. GT now looks to end their season on a high against SRH, and KKR aims to maintain their momentum as they advance into the playoffs.

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
High-Stakes Encounter at Chinnaswamy: RCB vs DC in a Playoff Decider. As the IPL 2024 season approaches its climax, Royal Challengers Bangalore  host Delhi Capitals  in a crucial matchup at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. Both teams are in a do-or-die situation, making this contest not just a game, but a potential playoff decider.RCB, after a rough start to the season, has seen a remarkable turnaround, winning their last four matches. This resurgence has been spearheaded by Virat Kohli, who returned to form with a blistering 47-ball 92 in their last game against Punjab Kings. The team's morale is high, and they are aiming to continue their winning streak to keep their playoff hopes alive. A loss here, however, would eliminate them from contention.

On the other side, DC is also in a tight spot, needing wins in their final games to secure a playoff spot. They come off a high-scoring victory over Rajasthan Royals, where their openers set up a big total, followed by a decisive bowling performance led by Kuldeep Yadav. However, DC will be without their regular captain Rishabh Pant due to a suspension, with Axar Patel stepping in as the leader for this critical game.The stakes are further complicated by the weather, with rain threatening to disrupt the game. A washout would be particularly detrimental to RCB, potentially ending their campaign, while DC could still survive but would prefer a full game to secure a win.

Both teams have their strengths lined up, with RCB possibly bringing in Glenn Maxwell or Lockie Ferguson based on the pitch and conditions, while DC might see the return of David Warner if he recovers in time from his injury. The tactical decisions, especially in the selection of the playing XI and the use of impact players, will be crucial in this high-pressure game.The matchup at the Chinnaswamy is set to be a thriller, with both teams aware that only a win can keep their playoff dreams alive. The passionate Bangalore crowd will be a significant factor, providing the home team with the extra boost needed in such a high-stakes game. As both teams gear up for this clash, the IPL sees yet another example of how the tournament's competitive nature brings out the best in teams when it matters the most.

Pitch Report:-

Bishop: "Here we are at Match 62 of the IPL, all set to get underway. The skies are heavy today; we've seen some raindrops earlier, and we're keeping our fingers crossed that the weather holds. We're on Pitch 8 today, which has a fascinating track record—182 was comfortably chased down here, 287 successfully defended, and just recently, RCB chased down 148 in just a few overs. Previously, this pitch was lush with live grass, but now it's been trimmed and is quite dry. Joining me is Matthew Hayden. Matthew, with the grass cut down from yesterday, how do you think this will affect the play today?"

Hayden: "What we're seeing is a pitch that's hard, dry, and completely devoid of grass. Previously, conditions like this really brought the quick bowlers into the game. Today, however, it seems the pacers might not have much of an advantage. This setup suggests we're in for another strong batting display. While it's uncertain if the spinners will find much grip, I'm anticipating a high-scoring affair with totals possibly reaching or surpassing 190 once again."


TOSS UPDATE:  Won the Toss and Elected to Field first
 

 

Axar Patel,  Skipper:
"It's always a great wicket here, and considering it's a smaller ground, keeping them to a low score would be ideal. We've discussed the importance of a strong start; that’s always been our strategy—to hit the ground running. As you might know, Rishabh was quite upset about his ban, as the bowlers were late, yet it's the captain who faces the consequences. Despite that, he’s assured us of his support throughout. For today's game, Kushagra will step in for Rishabh, and we'll also have Rasikh in the lineup."
 

Faf Du Plessis,  Skipper:-
"We would have made the same call. The pitch is showing less grass compared to before when there was more greenery. We're hoping it holds up well. At this point, every match is crucial, but we're coming in with a lot of confidence from our recent performances. Our approach is to first assess the conditions on the day and then decide when to ramp up the aggression. We really had to battle for this level of confidence early in the season, but now there's a strong sense of belief throughout the dressing room. We're fielding the same lineup for RCB today."

In the electrifying cauldron of M.Chinnaswamy Stadium, the Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) cooked up a spicy spectacle, scorching the Delhi Capitals (DC) by 47 runs to keep their playoff dreams aflame. It was a night where RCB's fiery bats blazed through DC's bowling, with Rajat "The Rocket" Patidar lighting up the scoreboard with a dazzling 52 off 32, backed by Will Jacks' rapid 41 and Cameron "Run Machine" Green's breezy 32*. As DC tried to douse the flames, Kuldeep Yadav found himself getting smoked for 52 runs, his wickets providing scant relief. The chase was a fizzler for DC, crumbling like a burnt-out Diwali sparkler, despite Axar Patel's gritty 57. The RCB bowlers, led by Yash Dayal with a sizzling 3/20, and Lockie "The Fast and the Furious" Ferguson, turned the pitch into a graveyard of DC's hopes. The fielding was on lock, tighter than Fort Knox, snuffing out any sparks with crucial run-outs and catches. As the dust settled, the Bangalore fortress roared victorious, with the crowd's cheers echoing the fiery saga of a team refusing to back down. With this win, RCB not only spices up the points table but also sends a hot, sizzling warning to their rivals: the chase for the trophy is as heated as ever. Next up, another do-or-die clash looms—so grab your popcorn and brace for more explosive T20 drama! 



 

Axar Patel,  Skipper: "The dropped catches definitely hurt us, costing us an extra 20-30 runs. When you lose four wickets in the powerplay, you're always playing catch-up.The pitch was tricky, two-paced, making it difficult to hit through the line consistently.Looking ahead, anything is possible. We have a travel day tomorrow, and we'll use that time to analyze and strategize for our final group-stage match. There's still an opportunity to turn things around."  
 

Faf du Plessis,  Skipper: "It's been brilliant. We've put in great performances and there's a genuine sense of satisfaction. It all comes down to confidence, which we've managed to find. Our batting has significantly improved, allowing us to post 200+ scores. Now, we're also seeing enhancements with the ball — taking wickets and bowling out the opposition, which is a fantastic feeling.In today's game, it wasn't so much about matchups but the conditions. The ball was swinging, which is why we used Swapnil sparingly since Axar was at the crease as well. We hope to give him more overs in the upcoming games." 

Player of the Match: Cameron Green 

Cameron Green: "Yes, it was a great game for our team. Unfortunately, our strong performance came a bit late in the season, but we're still in the hunt, and that's what matters. We were initially concerned about not reaching a 200 score. However, taking early wickets was crucial, especially since the pitch was challenging. We got a bit lucky, assessed the conditions well, and executed our plans effectively. We realized that keeping the pace on the ball was beneficial for the batters, whereas taking the pace off worked better for us, particularly since there was no dew tonight. We spent a lot of time getting adjusted to these conditions. Compared to last year's pitch, which was a road, this year's pitch offers something for the bowlers, which is a welcome change. Given the short boundaries, it's good to see bowlers getting some help. I'm really glad about how things turned out.

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Chennai Super Kings  Face Do-or-Die Battle Against Rajasthan Royals  at Chepauk. In a pivotal IPL clash, the Chennai Super Kings (CSK) host the Rajasthan Royals (RR) at the MA Chidambaram Stadium, with high stakes for both teams. CSK, reeling from a recent loss to Gujarat Titans, find themselves in a critical position, needing victories in their remaining games to secure a playoff spot. The team's performance has been hampered by injuries and inconsistency, placing them in a precarious fourth place tied with other contenders. The previous match saw CSK's bowling lineup struggle without key pacers, allowing GT's openers to post a massive total. Despite valiant efforts from Daryl Mitchell and Moeen Ali with the bat, CSK fell short by 35 runs. This loss has intensified the pressure on MS Dhoni and his squad to deliver back-to-back wins against RR and later against Royal Challengers Bangalore to avoid playoff elimination.

 

On the other side, RR, led by Sanju Samson, is on the verge of securing their playoff berth. A win against CSK would not only seal their spot but also position them favorably for a top-two finish. Despite recent defeats, RR's overall campaign has been strong, marked by consistent performances from both their batsmen and bowlers. Key players for CSK in this crucial match will be their spinners, especially given the potential turn on the Chepauk pitch in an afternoon game. RR's familiarity with spin, highlighted by Ravichandran Ashwin's expertise, could play a significant role in the game's dynamics. As CSK confronts their challenges, questions linger about MS Dhoni's future in the IPL, adding an emotional layer to the encounter. This match not only holds significance for the playoff race but also could mark an end of an era if it turns out to be Dhoni's last home game.

 

The narrative extends beyond the field as fans anticipate a thrilling contest. With both teams desperate for a win, the stage is set for a dramatic showdown at Chepauk, where strategy, skill, and perhaps a bit of luck will determine who advances closer to the IPL playoffs.

Pitch Report:-

Pommie Mbangwa :-
It's a scorcher out here today! Now, there's a slight quirk to this ground with the square boundaries measuring a bit uneven—66 meters on one side and 70 meters on the other. Straight down the ground, you're looking at a 79-meter hit. The surface itself is quite bare, not a blade of grass in sight, and with this heat, it's bound to dry out as the game progresses. Daren Ganga chimes in, suggesting that any initial moisture might make the pitch a tad tacky and sticky. We do expect some turn—this pitch has shown it before. Remember, CSK have cracked the 200-mark here twice this season, so understanding and adapting to how this pitch behaves in daylight will be crucial. That's the word down here, back to you!"

Darren Ganga:-

Now, the key factor to start with is the water content in the surface. It's critical because, as you can see, there's no grass—it's a bare pitch. I've spoken with the curator, and he assures me that the water content is normal. But with today's heat, maintaining that moisture will be the real test, particularly as it might get a bit tacky and sticky if it dries out, which could challenge the batsmen early on. Historically, this venue has favored the spinners. We've seen six matches here this season, and spinners have turned the ball on average 2.1 degrees more than the tournament average. So, do expect the spin to come into play significantly. Looking at the scores, the first innings average here is 183 in day games, though it dips a bit in the evening. Chennai, however, has excelled on this pitch, scoring over 200 in both games they played here at night. So, the team batting first today will likely target a similar score, aiming to set a challenging total right out of the gate."


 


TOSS UPDATE:  Won the Toss and Elected to Bat first
 



Sanju Samson,  Skipper:- 

"We've chosen to bat first today as the conditions seem favorable, with a decent wicket typical of day games and no dew expected. Adapting to the temperatures and conditions has been a significant part of our preparation, and conserving energy will be crucial. Our strategy against the opposition is to stick to the processes that have worked for us as a team and to focus on the elements within our control. As a batsman, I believe it's essential not to fixate on personal scores but to contribute effectively towards the team's success. Winning isn't just about individual achievements; it's about how we perform together as a unit."

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad,  Skipper:-

"Dew won't be a factor today, and regardless of whether we bat or bowl first, the pitch should remain consistent. It's crucial that we prepare mentally, both as a team and individually. We need to identify areas for improvement and possess the confidence to execute our roles effectively. We've struck the right balance in our lineup with Rachin and Rutu opening, and Mitchell at number three. Theekshana will take on the spinner's role. While it's a must-win game, our focus remains on believing in ourselves and backing each other to perform under pressure. Winning this game requires the right mindset. It's not just about individual brilliance; it's about coming together as a unit, being prepared to face challenges, and executing our plans with precision. Let's go out there and show what we're capable of."

got off to a sluggish start, while clamped down, keeping the runs in check without letting the wickets tumble. Big thanks to Simarjeet Singh, who popped the partnership bubble by escorting Jaiswal back to the pavilion. CSK's disciplined bowling kept the squeeze on RR's hitters, keeping the scoreboard from exploding.Simarjeet wasn't done just yet; he stepped up big time, snagging the key wickets of the dangerous Buttler and Samson, polishing off his spell with a shiny 3/26. As the innings edged towards the climax, Parag and Jurel cobbled together a gutsy 40-run partnership to add some respectability to the scoreboard. But just when they were getting cozy, Tushar Deshpande burst their bubble, striking twice in the final over. RR wrapped up at a modest 141/5.

In an innings marked by ebbs and flows, the team showcased a blend of strategic resilience and timely aggression. Ruturaj Gaikwad was the anchor, scoring a composed 42 off 41 balls, while Rachin Ravindra provided a brisk start with 27 from 18 deliveries. Shivam Dube added a rapid 18 off 11, and Sameer Rizwi's quick 15 off 8 helped propel the team to a competitive score. Key bowling contributions came from Ravichandran Ashwin, who snagged 2 crucial wickets for 35 runs, and Yuzvendra Chahal, who kept the runs in check while claiming a wicket. climbs up in the table to 3rd place and delay's "Q" beside.
 




Sanju Samson, Skipper:-
 "Initially, we aimed for around 170 after observing the wicket's slow and two-paced nature during the powerplay. Unfortunately, we ended up 20-25 runs short. Simarjeet bowled exceptionally well today, adapting to the conditions better than we did. Choosing to bat first seemed favorable at this venue, but as the game progressed, the pitch played slightly better than expected, especially in the second innings. Night games here typically favor chasing due to the dew, and with the summer heat intensifying, we anticipated the pitch would slow down further—it didn't quite pan out that way. The match stretching into the 18th over highlighted the challenging batting conditions. At this stage of the tournament, it's normal to be concerned about qualifications, but our focus remains on controlling what we can and sticking to our processes. I'll be encouraging the team to keep pushing forward and aim for a better outcome in our next game."

Ruturaj Gaikwad,  Skipper:-
"It's a wonderful feeling to secure a win in our last home game of the league stage, especially with the incredible support from the fans. Early in the game, at 55-1, it felt like we were cruising, but cricket is unpredictable, and a couple of quick wickets can change the momentum. As a captain, my role was to anchor the innings, especially with so many stroke-players in our team. We felt comfortable throughout, with minimal pressure until the very end. Regarding the pitch, it's the kind we thrive on. It allows our spinners to come into the game, and with the boundaries being larger, hitting sixes involves a bit more risk. Our bowling strategy here is usually tailored to the conditions; we take the pace off when the pitch is slower and opt for yorkers on flatter tracks."


Simarjeet Singh, Player of the Match:-
"I'm incredibly thankful to the CSK management, our physio, and my trainer for their exceptional support during my injury. It truly feels like a blessing to be back. Regarding my bowling strategy in the middle overs, after assessing the pitch conditions, the captain and I discussed and finalized our plan. We observed how the pitch was playing, which helped us make informed decisions about our bowling approach."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Eden Gardens is primed for a crucial IPL clash! Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), currently the table toppers, face Mumbai Indians (MI) in a match with contrasting stakes. KKR, fresh off a dominant win, seek a playoff berth on home soil, while Mumbai, already eliminated, aim to play spoilers.

KKR's red-hot form is a sight to behold. Openers Phil Salt and the resurgent Sunil Narine have been firing on all cylinders, setting up imposing totals. The middle order, freed from pressure, has seen Shreyas Iyer lead by example with his composed batting. Their bowling attack, spearheaded by Varun Chakaravarthy and Mitchell Starc, has been equally potent, with Starc hitting his groove at the right time.

Mumbai, despite a recent win, hasn't enjoyed a smooth season. Their batting, heavily reliant on Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan's consistency, has sputtered at times. Suryakumar Yadav, however, has been a lone warrior, recently smashing a century. Their bowling attack, though boasting Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance, lacks consistent support.

This match is a must-win for KKR. Victory not only secures a playoff spot but also bolsters their chances for a top-two finish in their final home game. For Mumbai, it's a chance to salvage pride and potentially disrupt the playoff race, offering glimpses of strategies for next season.

The Eden Gardens, known for its passionate crowd, is expected to be electric. Will KKR capitalize on their home advantage and recent form to clinch a victory? Or can MI pull off an upset and add a twist to the playoff race? This high-stakes encounter promises a thrilling night of IPL cricket.

Pitch Report | Danny Morrison 

"We're on pitch number 5 today, last used on the 23rd of March for the game against SRH. The boundary dimensions are 67 meters on one side and 62 meters on the other, with a 75-meter distance straight down the ground. Given that the pitch has been under covers for a while, spinners could find some favourable conditions here, possibly getting some extra purchases. However, if the pacers aren't precise with their line and length, they could easily be hit for runs. The cool air here in Kolkata could also lead to some swing, adding another element for the bowlers to exploit. 

 


TOSS UPDATE:  Won the Toss and Elected to Bowl first 


 

Hardik Pandya  |  Skipper : "We've decided to bowl first to better understand the pitch conditions, especially since it has been covered recently. Our focus is on playing quality cricket and fully realizing our potential. It’s crucial that we adapt to the situation at hand and avoid repeating past errors while enjoying our game.We are aware of the statistics but are concentrated on performing well today. The team is familiar with our track record here, and I'm eager to see how each player steps up and contributes to today's game."  
 

Shreyas Iyer  |   Skipper: "Toss outcomes are just part and parcel of the game; there's no room for complaints. This match is crucial for us as we aim to secure a playoff spot, symbolized by the 'Q' next to our name.Ideally, we would have chosen to bowl first considering the pitch has been under covers for the past two days and might play a bit tacky. Eden Gardens roared as the Kolkata Knight Riders, fueled by tactical brilliance and a sprinkle of spin magic, secured their IPL 2024 playoff berth in a thrilling T16 encounter against the Mumbai Indians. Rain may have tried to disrupt the flow, but KKR, with their strategic minds in overdrive, orchestrated a heist that left Mumbai bewildered.

Opting to bat first, KKR unleashed an early blitz. Venkatesh Iyer, a firecracker at the top, blazed a trail with a scorching 42 off just 21 balls. Valuable cameos from Nitish Rana, Andre Russell, and the ever-reliable Rinku Singh ensured they posted a competitive 157 on the board. Jasprit Bumrah, Mumbai's fiery pacer, tried his best to extinguish the KKR batting fire, but it wasn't enough.

Mumbai's chase began with promise, with their openers stitching together a 65-run partnership. Ishan Kishan, the left-handed maestro, played a swashbuckling knock of 40 off just 22 balls. However, the tide turned dramatically with the introduction of KKR's spin twins, Sunil Narine and Varun Chakaravarthy. Narine cast his spell with the dismissal of the dangerous Ishan Kishan, while Chakaravarthy tightened the noose by removing the skipper, Rohit Sharma. The run rate plummeted faster than a dropped ice cream cone!

Andre Russell, the muscle incarnate, joined the party by picking up two crucial wickets – Suryakumar Yadav and Tim David – further derailing Mumbai's chase. Chakaravarthy, the man of the moment, finished with a spellbinding 2/17, while Russell echoed his feat with a brace of his own. The pressure mounted with each passing over, and with 22 runs needed from the last over, the tension was thicker than fog in London. But young Harshit Rana, a knight in shining armor, rose to the occasion! He snatched the vital wickets of Naman Dhir and Tilak Varma early in the over, slamming the door shut on Mumbai's hopes and sealing a glorious victory for KKR.

This win wasn't just a ticket to the playoffs; it also solidified KKR's claim for a top-two finish, thanks to their superior net run rate.

 

 

Hardik Pandya  Skipper : "Our batting foundation was initially solid, but we failed to capitalize and maintain momentum, which ultimately cost us. The pitch was a bit inconsistent and slightly tacky, making it essential to keep the momentum going. Despite the challenging conditions, I think our bowlers performed well. It's notable that most of the boundaries were hit towards the wet covers area.Looking ahead to our last game, honestly, my approach is simple: just go out there, enjoy the game, and ensure we continue to play good cricket. That’s been my philosophy from the start. This season, we haven't played as well as we could have."  

 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper: "Before the game, I had a strong feeling we would qualify. Despite the nerves, we've been playing excellent cricket, with many players stepping up as game changers—today was a prime example. Even though we lost the toss, our performance proved we could win from any situation. The team's comeback after the powerplay in the first innings was a tremendous effort.I don't dwell on past records; each day is a new opportunity. Despite the challenging weather, we finished strong. It’s not always about who is the best; it’s about who performs well on the day. Facing Varun in the nets yesterday was tough; his leg-spin was difficult to handle. I trusted my instincts to go with Varun today, and he delivered brilliantly." 

Player of the Match: Varun Chakaravarthy

Varun Chakaravarthy: "Taking Rohit Sharma's wicket was special; I had never dismissed him before, so the celebration was inevitable. The wicket helped, and I utilized it to encourage him to play across the line. Narine and I discuss tactics often. Though we're similar tactically, our techniques differ; Narine bowls from in front of the hand, while I use the back of my hand. Playing at Eden Gardens, known for its small boundaries and initially flat pitches, has been a challenge. My approach hasn't changed since the start of the season, but the results are just starting to show now."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The pressure cooker's cranked up to eleven in the IPL as the Chennai Super Kings (CSK) lock horns with the Gujarat Titans (GT) in Ahmedabad! CSK, currently chilling at number four, need a win to keep their playoff dreams on a simmer. But for GT, languishing at the bottom of the table, this is a do-or-die clash – a win or their IPL journey goes up in smoke.

Despite their recent win against Punjab Kings, CSK's batting hasn't exactly been firing on all cylinders. While skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad has been a rock at the top, the rest of the top order, particularly Ajinkya Rahane, has been as consistent as a wobbly internet connection. Guys like Daryl Mitchell and Ravindra Jadeja will need to step up and become the middle-order anchors CSK desperately needs. But hey, on the bright side, their bowling attack has been a revelation! Even with key pacers Matheesha Pathirana and Mustafizur Rahman out injured, the rise of Tushar Deshpande and Jadeja's experience with the ball could put a serious dent in GT's batting plans.

GT, on the other hand, come into this match with their backs against the wall. They've been on a three-match losing streak, and their bowling attack has been about as effective as a wet firecracker. Their batting has shown flashes of brilliance with David Miller and Shahrukh Khan, but overall, it's been a patchy performance. But here's the thing: when a team has nothing to lose, they can be a real handful. Skipper Shubman Gill will be looking to prove his captaincy mettle and lead from the front. They might even pull a rabbit out of the hat and unleash some unexpected bowling heroes.

CSK has a clear psychological edge, having won their last three encounters against GT, including the IPL 2023 final. But cricket, as they say, is a funny game, and past performance doesn't guarantee future success. Plus, CSK needs to keep an eye on their positive net run rate.

This clash promises to be a spicy battle between a team desperate to stay alive (GT) and another determined to solidify their playoff spot (CSK). CSK's batting form and GT's bowling woes are the key areas to watch. While CSK might be the favourites on paper, GT's unpredictable nature with their backs against the wall adds a layer of delicious uncertainty. Get your popcorn ready, folks, because this high-pressure encounter is guaranteed to be a nail-biter!

Pitch Report | Nick Knight & Chris Morris:

Knight: "It's truly amazing to stand here in the middle of Narendra Modi Stadium, such an iconic venue. The atmosphere is just electric."

Morris: "This pitch has a healthy grass cover and feels quite solid, which is promising. I'm expecting a high-scoring encounter today. Both teams are likely to aim for the 200-run mark, a common sight in this IPL season. There might be a bit of swing early on with a couple of bowlers from each side who can exploit these conditions. Overall, the outfield looks great, and the stadium is stunning. I anticipate a lot of runs today, and I don't expect the pitch conditions to change significantly throughout the game.

Despite that one low-scoring game against Delhi Capitals where a team got bowled out for 89, the track has generally favored batters, with scores over 200 being quite typical. It's a batsman-friendly pitch." 



TOSS UPDATE:  Won the Toss and Elected to Field first  


 

Ruturaj Gaikwad   Skipper: "We've decided to bowl first. The pitch looks good but slightly sticky, which makes me believe it will be better to chase on this surface.The conditions here are quite similar to what we've experienced in the last two games in Chennai, except for one match on red soil which we didn't favor much.The atmosphere within the team is quite relaxed. In the IPL, it's normal to lose several games, but it's crucial to remain confident and ensure everyone is in a good mental state.We've faced some challenges with injuries and flu cases in the squad, but overall, I'm satisfied with how we've managed so far. For today's match, Rachin Ravindra will come in to replace Richard Gleeson."

 

Shubman Gill Skipper : "I would have preferred to bowl first too. It's a good wicket and it would have been ideal to know the target and then chase it down. We still have a slim chance of qualifying, about 1%, but as long as there's a possibility, we'll give it our all. The team's mood is like any other match; we believe in doing the best we can.The surface looks conducive for batting, so I'm confident we can keep them to a manageable score and then put up a good total ourselves. I don't anticipate any dew, which could work in our favor.We're making two changes today: Wriddhiman Saha has a niggle and will be replaced by Matthew Wade. Joshua Phillipe misses out due to team dynamics, allowing Kartik Tyagi to make his debut for us."

The Gujarat Titans sent a fiery message to the rest of the IPL with a dominant 35-run thrashing of the Chennai Super Kings! This win, at the fortress of Ahmedabad, wasn't just a victory; it was a revival.

Openers Gill and Sudharsan went absolutely berserk, rewriting the history books with a monstrous 210-run stand - the joint-highest ever in IPL history! Both batters reached scintillating centuries, leaving the CSK bowlers with nowhere to hide. The Titans piled on a mammoth 231 runs, a total that felt insurmountable from the outset.

CSK's chase resembled a horror show from the get-go. A first-over run-out set the wrong tone, and early dismissals of Rahane and Gaikwad left them reeling. While Mitchell and Ali fought valiantly with fifties, the CSK middle order simply couldn't handle the GT bowling attack.

Mohit Sharma emerged as the hero, snuffing out CSK's hopes with a crucial triple-wicket spell. Rashid Khan, back to his mesmerizing best, picked up key wickets in the death overs, ensuring MS Dhoni's unbeaten 26 remained a mere consolation.

This win is a shot in the arm for the Titans. They addressed their weaknesses, dominated with both bat and ball, and announced their return to the playoff race in emphatic fashion. CSK, despite the setback, are still in a decent position, but their inconsistencies need to be ironed out if they want to be serious contenders.

The IPL is wide open, folks! Every match is a nail-biter, and this win by the Titans throws the playoff picture wide open. Buckle up, cricket fans, because the race to the top four is about to get intense! 



 

Ruturaj Gaikwad |   Skipper: "Our fielding wasn't quite up to the mark today, and while our execution was still decent, they played some extraordinary shots and put pressure on us from the very first over. When you face two exceptional batters who can dominate all around the field, it’s tough to maintain control. Our inability to take wickets early on allowed them to keep the momentum and play confidently.

Things are moving quickly; I'm catching a flight tomorrow and we don't have much time to dwell on this. We have a day game in Chennai next, which will be challenging, especially against a strong team that's been performing well. To stay competitive in the tournament, we really need to step up our game for that match." 
 

Shubman Gill | Player of the Match & Skipper : " Batting in front of a large crowd definitely makes it easier; there's a sense of freedom that comes with it. We didn't set a specific target but aimed to maximize every opportunity presented to us.Our team has great camaraderie. We excel at running between the wickets, hitting gaps, and taking twos. We've batted together since last year, which has really built our understanding.This partnership is arguably the best opening duo GT has had. Mohit has been exceptional over the past few years, both with his bowling and batting. Though he’s had a couple of off games, that happens to everyone. With a few games left, I’m confident we can turn things around.We could have reached 250 today; we were about 10-15 runs short. In the final overs, they bowled well, which affected our net run rate going forward."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
In the serene setting of Dharamsala, Royal Challengers Bengaluru are set to battle Punjab Kings  in a pivotal IPL 2024 match. With both teams on the brink of elimination, this contest is expected to be a thrilling showcase of strategy and skill.

RCB, led by Faf du Plessis, has seen a dramatic turnaround, securing three consecutive wins thanks to strong performances from both bowlers and batsmen. Du Plessis has been instrumental, exemplified by his explosive 63 off 23 balls against Gujarat Titans, setting a high pace for the team. The bowlers, including Mohammed Siraj and Yash Dayal, have also stepped up, tightening their game at crucial moments.

PBKS, however, has struggled with consistency, despite showing potential in high-stakes games, like their record chase against Kolkata Knight Riders. The team has leaned heavily on talents such as Shashank Singh, but the experience of Jonny Bairstow remains key to their success.

This match is more than just a game; it's a test of nerve and strategy with playoff implications. RCB aims to leverage their aggressive batting approach, which has significantly improved their scoring rate, especially in the powerplays. PBKS, on the other hand, needs to tighten their death bowling to curb their opponents' scoring.

As the IPL 2024 heads towards its climax, this encounter promises not just T20 action but a dramatic battle for survival, making it a must-watch for every cricket fan.

Head-To-Head In IPL:


Pitctch Report | Darren Ganga 

" We're back on the same pitch used for the PBKS vs. CSK match. The boundaries measure 64 m to the off side, 62 m to the leg side, and 75 m straight down.The pitch sports a bit more grass than usual today, showing a tinge of green, but it's still dry and hard. Historically, the average first innings score for night matches here is 195. Batters typically find it tough to time the ball during the powerplay due to the extra bounce and something in the pitch for the fast bowlers. Spin could also be influential; accurate bowling can be quite effective on this surface. While it's a good batting wicket, there's a better balance with opportunities for bowlers too. Aiming for around 190 can set up a strong chance for a win."  




TOSS UPDATE: Punjab Kings won the toss and opt to bowl first.  


 

Sam Curran  Skipper : "We're bowling first. There seems to be something in the pitch for the bowlers, and we'll try to capitalize on that to put RCB under pressure. Despite losing our last chase, we're not dwelling on it. Our approach is simple—win every game and hope other results favor us. It’s tough losing, but morale is high. We're at a beautiful venue, and we’re hoping some new players make a significant impact. Liam Livingstone replaces Kagiso Rabada, and we're also making a strategic change with an impact player, leveraging our batting strength." 

Faf du Plessis  Skipper: "We would have opted to bowl first too. It's been a solid turnaround for us, and our focus is on improving each day. We're not concerned with the points table, just concentrating on what we need to do to succeed. There's one change in our lineup: Glenn Maxwell is out, and Lockie Ferguson is in."

The IPL drama reached new heights in Dharamsala as Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) outclassed Punjab Kings (PBKS) by a commanding 60 runs. This win not only reignited RCB's playoff hopes but extinguished PBKS's flickering flame.
Faf du Plessis provided a quick early cameo for RCB before being dismissed by debutant Vidhwath Kaverappa. But the spotlight belonged to the evergreen Virat Kohli. Gifted a couple of early lifelines, Kohli feasted on the bowling attack, composing a scintillating 92 off a mere 47 balls. Seven boundaries and six towering sixes peppered his innings, leaving the PBKS bowlers shell-shocked. Kohli wasn't a one-man show. Rajat Patidar and Cameron Green provided crucial support, anchoring vital half-century partnerships. Their collective efforts propelled RCB to a staggering 241/7, rewriting the record books for the highest T20 score at the Dharamsala stadium.
PBKS's chase sputtered from the start with Prabhsimran Singh departing early. A brief flicker of hope emerged with a 65-run stand between Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Rossouw (who smashed a fiery 61 off 27 balls). However, the RCB bowling attack, orchestrated by the crafty Karn Sharma and the fiery Mohammed Siraj, tightened the screws. Swapnil Singh's early breakthrough and Sharma's strategic bowling in the middle overs choked the flow of runs. PBKS's middle order, unable to handle the pressure, crumbled like a sandcastle, eventually falling short by a massive 60 runs.
This comprehensive victory not only highlighted RCB's balanced performance but also exposed PBKS's inconsistency. While RCB marches forward with renewed momentum and a playoff berth within reach, PBKS heads back to the drawing board after another disappointing season. The night in Dharamsala belonged to RCB, a night where Kohli's brilliance and the bowling unit's collective effort outshone a spirited but ultimately outmatched PBKS side. 

 


 

Sam Curran   Skipper : "It's slightly frustrating and obviously disappointing. There were many positive signs, but it wasn't enough to secure wins. Taking over the captaincy mid-tournament wasn't a distraction, as we have a talented group. I've really enjoyed leading this team. With two games left, we aim to finish strong. We're focused on winning these games and continuing to train hard. We're sorry to our fans for the season's disappointments and promise to return stronger next year.We've achieved record chases but also faced losses. There's a wealth of experience in our team, and we'll keep learning. We must stay dedicated and optimistic." 
 

Faf du Plessis Skipper: "It was a great game. Even after losing the toss and scoring 240, we showed strong effort. We've been repeating some mistakes, especially with not taking enough early wickets. We've changed our strategy in the powerplay, and it's paying off.I've been in cricket for a long time. It's crucial to find form and maintain momentum. Our players are stepping up, contributing both in batting and bowling. We emphasize playing our style, focusing on ourselves to prove our team's strength."

Player of the Match: Virat Kohli

Virat Kohli : "For me, at 36, it's about quality over quantity. I focus on practising less but improving specific skills. I introduced the slog sweep without much practice because I aim to find gaps and maintain a strong strike rate in the middle overs. Honesty is key. We were not up to mark in the first half of the tournament. A crucial team discussion in Kolkata turned things around. We've improved, especially in bowling, and the momentum has carried us since. We strive to make our fans proud and elevate our game. Although we're on a roll, we still depend on other outcomes, which is disappointing. We'd rather not rely on other results, but that's the current situation. Thank you."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Tonight,   lock horns with the   in a crucial mid-table clash. Both sides are locked on six wins, with SRH holding a narrow net run rate lead – a trump card in the IPL's wild game.SRH licked their wounds after a recent Mumbai defeat, their batting fizzling faster than a sparkler on a damp Diwali. But fret not Orange Army! Back at their fortress Rajiv Gandhi Stadium, where they've already scalped three wins, the home crowd roars like a hungry lion. And with Travis Head wielding his willow with consistent fury, things could get spicy for LSG.

Speaking of spice, LSG carry a curious hoodoo: they've conquered SRH in all three of their previous meetings. Can SRH finally rewrite history and slay the giant ?
LSG themselves are reeling from a KKR drubbing, their potent bowling attack resembling a damp firecracker. Skipper KL Rahul, ever the aggressor, needs a big knock to silence the doubters. Injuries also cloud their pace attack, with Mohsin Khan's availability uncertain. The pressure mounts on Naveen-ul-Haq and Yash Thakur to keep things tight.And then there's Nicholas Pooran – the enigma. Will he unleash his six-hitting prowess tonight, or leave us tantalized once again?

This is a mid-table melee with high stakes. A battle for bragging rights and a playoff lifeline. Will SRH avenge their past and reign supreme at home? Or will LSG defy the odds? Don't miss this nail-biter, folks, it promises fireworks!

Pitch Report | Sanjay Manjrekar & Matthew Hayden:

Manjrekar: "Today's match is on pitch number two, remembered for the season-high 277 runs, a record later surpassed. However, its fame remains. It's a central pitch today, which means there are no notably short boundaries; they are all roughly in the mid-sixties, varying by just a few meters, and the straight hit is particularly long. This setup favors spinners, who will appreciate the relatively larger boundary dimensions."

Hayden: "We're at the peak of the Indian summer, and Hyderabad feels like a clay oven today—extremely hot and dry. The pitch itself is hard and has begun showing tiny cracks. I doubt we'll see a record score today. It looks like a pitch where 200 runs is feasible, thanks to a very fast outfield and minimal dew expected tonight. Fast bowlers will likely use their cutters effectively, particularly in the middle overs. Bowlers like Natarajan can exploit these conditions well, especially towards the end of an innings."



TOSS:  Won the Toss and Elected to Bat first 



 

KL Rahul   Skipper: "We'll bat first. We've had high-scoring games here previously, so we aim to set a strong total early.This is a crucial match for both teams. We've been in such positions before, so our goal is to stay strong and enjoy the game. We're focusing on one thing at a time; starting with a solid performance in the first 6 overs and building from there.Our home record has been decent. Playing with home support always makes a difference, and we would have preferred that. However, away games have their merits too. We're familiar with the conditions and how they play out. Right now, our entire focus is on today's game."  

 

Pat Cummins  Skipper: "Yeah, thank you. My body tells me I'm 31, and with my birthday falling during the IPL, I'm expecting some cake on my face.We would have opted to bat first as well, but batting second here isn't much of a disadvantage based on past games, so I'm not too disappointed.It's hard to predict; this venue has seen high scores, so we'll just have to see how it unfolds.The challenge is relentless; you have to keep winning right until the end. Winning today is crucial, though I feel there are still a few games we haven’t quite perfected yet. We're making a couple of team changes today. Sanvir Singh comes in for Mayank Agarwal, and Viyaskanth replaces Marco Jansen."

SRH Torch LSG with Record-Breaking Batting Blitz!

Forget slow burns, tonight was a full-on pyrotechnic display by the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH)! They absolutely cremated the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 10 wickets with a WHOPPING 62 balls to spare
LSG, winning the toss and choosing to bat first, found the pitch a glue trap. They could only manage a modest 165/4, thanks to some late fireworks from Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*). Bhuvi (2/12) and Pat Cummins (1/47) kept things tight for SRH, ensuring LSG never really got going.
The chase was pure carnage. SRH openers, Travis Head (89* off 30) and Abhishek Sharma (75* off 28), went into beast mode. Boundaries rained like confetti at a wedding – 16 fours and 14 sixes between them! LSG dropped a couple of catches, but it was like trying to stop a runaway train with a feather. SRH chased down the target in a mind-blowing 9.4 overs! 

 


 

KL Rahul Skipper: "I'm at a loss for words. We've occasionally seen this type of batting on TV, but what we witnessed today was simply surreal. Every hit seemed perfectly executed. Truly, a testament to their exceptional skill.They've clearly worked incredibly hard on their six-hitting abilities, and it showed today. They didn’t even let us assess the pitch in the second innings; they were just relentless from the start.The pitch itself didn't change much, but facing batters with such fearless intent, who connect from the first ball, poses a significant challenge. The only strategy to counter such aggression is to take early wickets during the powerplay. Unfortunately, we couldn’t manage that today.After a loss, it's natural for decisions to be scrutinized. We fell short by 40-50 runs. Losing early wickets prevented us from building a strong innings, though Ayush and Nicky did well to help us reach 166. Even if we had set a target of 240, given their form, they likely would have chased it down." 

 

Pat CumminsSkipper : "(On whether the pitch changed during the innings break) It might as well have, with the way Trav and Abhi played. They were unstoppable. I let them play their game; they're both incredibly positive and skilled. As a bowler, it's challenging to control such aggression, especially with limited outfield protection. Travis's extraordinary hitting isn't surprising anymore. He's unconventional but effective, consistently finding the bat's middle. I hadn't seen much of him(Abhishek Sharma) before, but he's shown he's formidable against both seam and spin, playing with remarkable freedom.Par scores are rising due to good wickets and limited fielding restrictions. We were confident but finishing the game in just 9.4 overs was unexpected. We love the home-ground advantage, but today was something special." 

Player of the Match: Travis Head 

Travis Head : "It's been thrilling to bat with Abhi. My focus has been on good positioning and reacting quickly to the ball. I caught a rhythm early and aimed to exploit the powerplay. I've been honing my skills against spin, important for upcoming matches in the Caribbean and the World Cup. My coaches encourage the same aggressive approach, especially in the powerplay, and I aim to maintain this consistency to contribute to the team."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
In the buzzing cauldron of the Arun Jaitley Stadium, the Delhi Capitals  face a must-win clash against the formidable Rajasthan Royals . With the pitch in Delhi proving to be a goldmine for batsmen this season, spectators can brace themselves for another high-voltage encounter.

The Delhi Capitals, currently in a precarious sixth place, have shown flashes of brilliance but remain inconsistent. The dynamism of Jake Fraser-McGurk,combined with the power plays of Rishabh Pant and Tristan Stubbs, has been central to their strategy. On the other side, the Rajasthan Royals have exhibited a more robust form, anchored by their pacers who have been the most economical in the league with an average of 23.57. Their top-order has been prolific, despite some hiccups in the lower-middle order. The experience of their spinners and a formidable new-ball attack could be key in stifling DC's aggressive batting lineup.

Previous encounters this season saw the Royals narrowly edging out the Capitals, with a 12-run victory in Jaipur. Delhi’s middle order struggled in that game, and they will be keen to address this in the upcoming match.

Both teams have had their share of injuries and last-minute player assessments, which could play a crucial role in their strategies. For DC, the return of Ishant Sharma might bolster their bowling, while RR would hope their consistent lineup continues to deliver, particularly with Jos Buttler expected to bring his A-game.

As the Delhi sun sets, the stage is set for a clash that could either reignite the Capitals’ hopes or seal a playoff berth for the Royals. With their backs against the wall, Delhi would need to harness the home advantage and break free from the shackles of inconsistency. Meanwhile, Rajasthan, looking to reclaim the top spot, will bank on their disciplined bowling and explosive batting to carry the day.

Who will seize the moment under the lights of the IPL's grand amphitheatre? 

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

Pitch Report | Deep Dasgupta & Brian Lara :
 

Deep: "Believe it or not, the average score here is 249, with five out of six innings topping 200. The ground's small dimensions are a big factor. To my right, the boundary is just 59 meters, and behind me, the shortest side is only 53 meters. The longest stretch on my left reaches 67 meters, and it's 75 meters towards mid-wicket."

Lara: "The pitches initially had more grass, which masked the cracks. Now, more bare patches and cracks are visible. There's still a grass strip in the middle, but pitching up isn't effective as the ball slides under the bat. Bowlers should aim for a consistent good length. The pitch conditions seem secondary to how the batters are playing; another high-scoring game is likely."

Deep: "High scores are common here, and today should be similar, though slightly lower due to less grass. Talking with the curator, Ankit, he mentioned minimal dew lately. Winning the toss and batting first could be a smart move."


TOSS UPDATE :  Won the Toss and Elected to Field 

 


 

Sanju Samson  Skipper : "We prefer to bowl first. The pitch looks favorable for chasing, so that's our initial plan. We're prepared for both scenarios but after assessing our strengths and weaknesses, bowling first seemed the better choice. Team dynamics are vital for success; it's not just about skill but also the great personalities that enrich our team. These factors make our IPL experience unique and enjoyable." 
 

Rishabh Pant Skipper: "That was the strategy. Both teams have the same pitch conditions. This year, things are quite unpredictable with some injuries and health issues, but that's all part of the game. We need to perform across all departments. Our lineup remains largely the same, with Ishant returning and Gulbadin joining in. Plus, we're utilizing an extra batter as an impact player."

Delhi Capitals snatched victory from the jaws of defeat in a see-saw battle against Rajasthan Royals! The pitch, usually a batsman's paradise, saw a twist as Delhi posted a decent 221, powered by Fraser-McGurk's 50 off 20 balls.
Rajasthan's chase was a Sanju Samson special! His 86 off 46 kept them in the hunt, but his dismissal triggered a collapse. The lower order crumbled, falling short by 20 runs. Bowling woes plagued both sides, but spinners emerged as heroes. Ashwin's magic kept Delhi in check, while Kuldeep Yadav's spin web derailed Rajasthan's chase.
Strategic brilliance by Delhi with last-minute bowling changes saw Mukesh Kumar and Rasikh Salam hold their nerve and seal the win. Delhi are back in the playoff race! Rajasthan, despite being second, needs to address their death-overs woes. Buckle up folks, the IPL is about to get hotter than a last-over chase! 
 

 

Sanju Samson |   Skipper: "I believe the total was within our grasp. A rate of 12 runs per over on this pitch was achievable, but that's the unpredictable nature of the IPL. We felt that 220 was about 10 runs too many. We managed to regain some control but conceded a few too many runs towards the end."We've lost three very close games now. The key for us is to continue making slight adjustments. There's hardly any downtime in this tournament. Stubbs has adapted well to the conditions and batted brilliantly. He specifically went after our best bowlers, Yuzi Chahal and Sandeep Sharma, adding those crucial 20-30 extra runs that ultimately tipped the scales."  

Rishabh Pant |  Skipper: "The way our bowlers performed towards the end was the highlight for us and was very encouraging to see. We aim to learn from every game, irrespective of the outcome, and continue moving forward. Kuldeep's performance was particularly pleasing. We felt that keeping them to 200 was a reasonable target, and that guided our strategy." 

Player of the Match: Kuldeep Yadav 
 

Kuldeep Yadav | Player of the Match: "Bowling a good length is crucial, especially during the death overs. Having played against Ferreira in South Africa, I knew he favored the back foot. I aimed to keep my deliveries full and quick, which worked as I got him out on the first ball. I also threw in a couple of seam-up deliveries to gauge the batters' responses. It's all about the length, and sticking to that was my plan. Scoring over 200 puts pressure on bowlers but also presents opportunities for wickets, and I focused on playing to my strengths and maintaining belief."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
A side grappling at the bottom of the points table is set to clash with the Sunrisers from Hyderabad in Match 55 of IPL 2024 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. In their previous encounter, posted a formidable 277, met by MI's commendable 246 in response. Expect fireworks from both batting lineups, promising an enthralling contest at a venue renowned for high-scoring encounters. MI's hopes for the tournament seem bleak, while SRH still harbours strong aspirations for a playoff berth.
 


 

 

VENUE STATS:
T20 AT WANKHEDE IN IPL 2024: 
WON FIRST : 3
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 186

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Michael Clarke and Ian Bishop: "Five matches have been played here and 200 has been scored twice. A small ground. The square boundaries are just 61 & 62 while it is just 72 down the ground as well. A lot more consistent layer of grass on the surface. Nice and flat wicket apart from the area near the fuller length. No moisture on the track and it looks rock solid. Dew will probably play a part in the second innings.200 seems easy here and we are in for some royal entertainment!

 

 

TOSS:
 has won the toss and have   to Field first

 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper:  We're going to field. The pitch looks fresh. Would want to exploit the conditions early on. Anshul Kambhoj makes his debut for us. We play for pride and the badge that we wear. And for fans who have been with us through thick and thin."

 


Pat Cummins,  Skipper: " Mayank Agarwal comes back and he will go in at three. Dew is a factor here, but we have been batting well. Got 4 matches left and we need to win two at least so one game at a time and not thinking too far ahead"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
SRH - 56/1 (9.33 rpo, 6x4, 2x6) ll MI - 52/3 (8.67 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

 

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
SRH - 64/4 (7.11 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) ll MI - 87/0 (9.67 rpo, 11x4, 3x6)

 

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
SRH - 53/3 (10.6 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) ll MI - 35/0 in 2.2 Overs (15 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

 

 

 

 

set a target of 173-8 from their 20 overs, with Travis Head leading the scoring with 48 runs. Despite a slow start from other batters, Pat Cummins provided a crucial late surge to propel SRH to a competitive total. Mumbai's bowlers, especially Hardik Pandya and Piyush Chawla, applied consistent pressure, each claiming three wickets. Jasprit Bumrah continued his economical form, tightening the screws on Hyderabad's batters.

In response, overcame an early stumble, recovering from 31-3 inside the powerplay, thanks to a stellar performance from Suryakumar Yadav. Suryakumar's explosive 102 off 51 balls, featuring 12 fours and 6 sixes, was a masterclass in batting at the Wankhede Stadium. Tilak Varma supported well, remaining not out on 37, as Mumbai surpassed the target comfortably, finishing at 174-3 in just 17.2 overs. Sunrisers' bowlers found it challenging to contain Mumbai's hitters, eventually conceding the match with ease.

This victory is significant for Mumbai Indians, providing a much-needed boost to their morale as they struggle at the bottom of the points table. Conversely, Sunrisers Hyderabad must regroup swiftly to maintain their chances of reaching the playoffs.

 

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: " Few runs short for sure especially when you are at Wankhede you always want more. You always feel like you’re in, the wicket had a little bit in it so we were definitely in the game.  It’s T20 cricket, and it doesn't always work out. Surya played well. We like playing at home, we’ll wait and see what’s ahead of us. Hopefully, a few more fireworks and some win as well"

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper:  We want to play positive cricket and focus on the process, we feel we gave 10-15 runs more. The way the batters batted was excellent. In my bowling, I like to bowl in the right areas, I bowl according to the situation. Bowled in the right areas today and it worked. I was like Chawla had to bowl from the shorter side. You have to be accurate, the margin of error has become smaller these days for the bowlers. It's unbelievable, the best part of SKY is that he puts the bowlers under pressure. Lucky to have him in my team"

 

 

SKY is the Player of the Match 

Suryakumar Yadav: "I have done this after a long time. I fielded for 20 overs and batted for 18 overs, only tired nothing else to worry about.  I feel it was the need of the hour for me. I went out to bat, needed someone to bat till the end. I just enjoyed my time. It's from the Mumbai School of arts, have played a lot of cricket at Wankhede. Love it here"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Kolkata Knight Riders

Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 98  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The IPL doubleheader on Sunday heats up in the evening as Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) lock horns with Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at the Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow.  Both teams, currently IPL royalty are fighting for playoff berths, making this a battle for supremacy.

LSG are smarting from a previous defeat to KKR and will be baying for revenge on their home turf. Their batting needs a spark, especially at the top. Quinton de Kock's return is a sigh of relief, but all eyes will be on the in-form Marcus Stoinis, who's been a superhero with back-to-back winning knocks. Deepak Hooda and Nicholas Pooran add muscle to the middle order, but the loss of Mayank Yadav weakens their bowling. Spin wizard Amit Mishra might just weave his magic on this Lucknow turner.

KKR, on the other hand, are riding a wave. Their batting boasts explosiveness at the top with Phil Salt and Sunil Narine, while Shreyas Iyer and Venkatesh Iyer hold the fort in the middle. Rinku Singh will be looking to hit a big one before the World Cup.  Their bowling attack is equally fiery, with Mitchell Starc leading the pace and the spin twins, Varun Chakaravarthy and Narine, bamboozling batsmen.

The Lucknow pitch is known to be bowler-friendly, so don't expect a run-fest. Chasing can be a tricky proposition here as well, adding another layer of drama to this Sunday night showdown. Will LSG's batting find its mojo and emerge victorious, or will KKR continue their rampage and solidify their playoff spot? Buckle up, IPL fam, because this clash promises fireworks!

Head-To-Head In IPL:

 

Pitch Report: "A gentle breeze around the ground. This venue is one of the bigger grounds. Straight down the ground is 76m, square boundaries - 68m and 61m respectively. The dimensions will make a bit of a difference, we've seen the ball into the surface being used particularly with one side bigger than the other right throughout this tournament. When we come to the wicket, this is the third time that this surface is being used. There's a hint of green grass on it, but there are some bare red patches. We expect it to slow down a little bit more than it might have in the past. Anywhere around that, 190-200 will be a good score batting first

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: We will field. Just that we enjoy chasing not going deep into the wicket aspect. We have adapted well and there have been some amazing individual performances from the boys. There's been a lot of talk about strike-rate, and T20 cricket has changed a lot in the last couple of years. Yash Thakur comes in for Mayank Yadav."

 


Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: " We would have bowled too. Defending that score with five bowlers in the last game gave us a lot of confidence. There's a lot of self-belief in the camp, especially after the last game. We go unchanged. Hopefully, we continue with the same form"

 

 

Sunil Narine is the Player of the Match 

Sunil Narine: "It is very important to begin well. The support staff has been amazing with the support.  I think you have to pick your strengths and pick your spots, sometimes it works out and at times it does not. Chakaravarthy is picking up wickets, it's making my job easier to keep things tight. Glad to see him perform well. The boys are anxious and eager to play, so no matter what the situation is they are contributing for us."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
KKR - 70/1 (11.67 rpo, 11x4, 2x6) ll LSG - 55/1 (9.17 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

 

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
KKR - 101/2 (11.22 rpo, 4x4, 8x6) ll LSG - 75/7 (8.33 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

 

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
KKR - 64/3 (12.8 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)   || LSG - 7/2 (6 rpo, 0x4, 1x6) 

 

 

displayed dominance as they clinched victory by a commanding margin of 98 runs against the . Batting first, Kolkata Knight Riders set a formidable target of 235 runs for the loss of 6 wickets in their allotted 20 overs. Narine and Salt came out all guns blazing smashing 61 from just 26 balls. Salt accounted for 32 off 14 deliveries, while Narine top scored with 81 from just 39 deliveries. A late surge of 25 at a strike rate of 416 from Ramandeep helped KKR reach a huge total of 235. In response, Lucknow Super Giants faltered under the pressure of the steep chase, managing only 137 runs before being bowled out in 16.1 overs. Only Stoinis could go over the 30-run mark. Harshit Rana and Chakaravarthy picked 3 a piece while Narine was the most economical of the bowlers.  This comprehensive victory propelled Kolkata Knight Riders to a convincing win, showcasing their prowess with both bat and ball. KKR are now the table toppers!

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: It was a very big total that we were chasing. When you are chasing a big score, you go too hard and that sometimes backfires. We lost too many wickets while looking to go after everything.  Just a poor performance overall. We didn't hit our lengths consistently, just had a poor performance overall with bat, ball and in the field. It's clear, if we want to get to the top four, we have to win all four matches. That will give us a little bit of freedom to go out there and be a little bit more fearless, a little bit brave to take on the game"
 

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: " We are losing tosses but we are winning games that what matters. We had a great start in the powerplay thanks to Salty and Sunil. A lefty-righty combination makes thing difficult for the opposition. It's all about the freedom, to go out and express themselves. Going with a positive intent sometimes works and sometimes it does not.  They are setting us up and giving us momentum and no matter what the situation is, we are playing with a positive mindset. Looking forward to continuing doing the same"

 

 

Sunil Narine is the Player of the Match 

Sunil Narine : "It is very important to begin well. The support staff has been amazing with the support.  I think you have to pick your strengths and pick your spots, sometimes it works out and at times it does not. Chakaravarthy is picking up wickets, it's making my job easier to keep things tight. Glad to see him perform well. The boys are anxious and eager to play, so no matter what the situation is they are contributing for us."
