Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It's rematch time in the 'Battle of Kings' as Chennai Super Kings (CSK) head to the picturesque Dharamsala for a re-run against Punjab Kings (PBKS). The Chepauk drubbing still stings for CSK, and their top order, particularly Ajinkya Rahane, needs to find some form pronto. Ruturaj Gaikwad's flying form is a saving grace, but questions linger about their middle-overs mojo. Injuries haven't helped their bowling attack either, leaving them a tad patchy.

Meanwhile, PBKS are buzzing after their record run-chase and a convincing win over CSK. Jonny Bairstow's hot bat is a welcome addition to their batting line-up, while their bowling, especially the death bowling, seems to be plugging the leaks. This is a team on a roll, high on confidence and enjoying a bit of home advantage.

So, can CSK bounce back and exact revenge, or will the in-form Punjab Kings continue their rampage? The answer hinges on a few key areas: Can CSK batsmen like Shivam Dube translate their practice nets pyrotechnics into match-winning knocks? Will the afternoon Dharamsala negate the dew factor that hampered CSK in Chennai? And lastly, will Punjab's youthful exuberance trump CSK's experience in this clash of momentum versus pedigree? Buckle up, cricket fam, because this spicy Sunday afternoon encounter promises fireworks!

Head-To-Head in IPL:

 

Milestones Alert:
1 -Shivam Dube (99) needs one maximum to complete 100 sixes in IPL.
2 -MS Dhoni (248) needs two sixes to complete 250 sixes in IPL.
6 -Sam Curran (144) needs six maximums to complete 150 sixes in T20s.
69 -Jitesh Sharma (2431) needs 69 runs to complete 2500 runs in T20s.

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Graeme Swann and Brian Lara: "The boundaries are 62 & 64 respectively. A layer of grass covers and the air seems thin. Quite even but it's dry grass. There will be assistance with the new ball up front for the pacers. Not much for the spinners as the ball won't turn much. The batters will have a good outing."

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: We will field. Day game, try and see how it plays and later chase it. We have got two good wins with the same line up so we will go with the same eleven. Conditions should be fairly even throughout, It is about doing well in all three departments."

 


Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: " We've just stuck to our process and doing little things right. Not focussing on the opponents and their records, just want to do our process right. We have to make a lot of changes due to injury concerns in the squad. I'd say losing 10 tosses but winning 5 games is a positive. Mitchell Santner comes in place of Fizz"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
CSK - 60/1 (10 rpo, 4X4, 2X6) ll PBKS - 47/2 (7.83 rpo, 5X4, 2X6)

 

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
CSK - 57/4 (6.33 rpo, 8X4, 0X6) ll PBKS - 44/6 (4.89 rpo, 3X4, 1X6)

 

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
CSK - 50/4 (10 rpo, 3X4, 3X6) ll PBKS - 48/1 (9.6 rpo, 4X4, 2X6)

 

 

 

In a thrilling encounter, the got off to a promising start despite an early setback with the dismissal of Ajinkya Rahane. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Daryl Mitchell set a fiery pace, scoring at 10 runs per over in the powerplay, laying a solid foundation for the middle overs. However,  struck back with a double blow, removing Gaikwad and Shivam Dube off consecutive deliveries, shifting the momentum in their favour. CSK struggled against the mesmerizing spell of Rahul Chahar, finding themselves unable to counter his crafty bowling. Ravindra Jadeja's aggressive knock of 43 runs from 26 deliveries emerged as a silver lining in CSK's innings, helping them reach a competitive total of 167.

In response, PBKS faced an early setback losing Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Roussow in the second over, courtesy of some fiery bowling from Deshpande, who showcased his prowess with the new ball. The introduction of Jadeja further compounded PBKS's woes, as the left-arm spinner picked up three crucial wickets for just 20 runs in his four overs, putting a halt to any hopes of a PBKS comeback. Despite a valiant effort from their middle order, PBKS kept losing wickets at regular intervals, ultimately falling short by 8 runs in their first contest at Dharamshala. The match showcased a display of thrilling cricket, with both teams giving their all, but it was CSK who emerged victorious in the end.

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: " Thought we bowled well. Rahul Chahar and Harshal bowled amazingly. Was a good start to the game but was not meant to be.  The wicket was probably slower than we thought, we expected a little more pace and bounce. It remained the same later on as well.  Need to move on and stay headstrong.."


Ruturaj Gaikwad,  Skipper : "Losing the toss doesn't usually bother me much, especially after a win. Everyone seems to think it's good to lose the toss, but honestly, it matters to me. We initially thought we could push for a higher score like 180-200 given the start we had, but consecutive wickets fell, and we adjusted our target to 160-170, which felt slightly short. However, given how the pitch played later, it seemed just about par.Talking about Simarjeet's performance, he's really picked up pace, hitting around 150s in pre-season, though he didn’t get many chances earlier with Deepak, Shardul, Tushar, Pathirana, and Fizz around. It's great that he got to play today. We considered an impact batter but opted for a bowler, thinking a good spell might secure more for us than a few quick runs.Overall, it’s a huge relief to win, especially with all the injuries we've had. This morning, we weren't even sure who would play, so I'm really happy with how things turned out."


Player of the Match :- Ravindra Jadeja :
"The pitch for today's game was slow, which was pretty much anticipated due to the heat affecting it during this day game. In terms of our batting, we started strong in the powerplay but struggled to maintain momentum due to a lack of partnerships in the middle overs. I was aiming to establish a solid partnership to set up for a strong finish. As for our bowling, our pacers delivered upfront during the powerplay, with Tushar snagging two crucial wickets, and then Mitch and I managed to contain the opposition in the middle overs. Although the pitch appeared flat initially, it became challenging to play as the ball aged and didn't come onto the bat as expected. This being a new venue, it was tricky to predict the amount of turn or stoppage. We felt we were short by about 15-20 runs, but thankfully, our disciplined bowling in the powerplay and middle overs kept us in the game. My role as a batter is to anchor and build innings, looking to accelerate towards the end. However, when we lose early wickets, it's challenging to regain momentum, which is critical in matches that we eventually win."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Royal Challengers Bengaluru is set to clash with Gujarat Titans in a pivotal reverse fixture in the match number 52 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. In their recent encounter, Bengaluru outshone Gujarat by chasing down 201 runs with four overs to spare, a victory propelled by Will Jacks' explosive batting.

 

Coming into this match, RCB rides a wave of momentum, having secured back-to-back victories following a narrow one-run defeat against KKR. Positioned tenth in the standings with 6 points from ten games, RCB faces a must-win situation in every match remaining to keep their playoff hopes alive. Their recent performances have shown a timely peaking of form from both batters and bowlers, setting the stage for a spirited continuation of their winning streak.

 

Gujarat Titans, conversely, have encountered a rough patch this season, marked by a series of losses that have left them in a precarious eighth position with eight points from ten games. The team urgently needs victories to bolster their chances of advancing in the tournament. Despite Shubman Gill's underperformance relative to expectations, Sai Sudharsan has been a standout, amassing over 400 runs including two consecutive fifties. Faced with critical upcoming matches, Gujarat is under pressure to regroup and reclaim their form.

 

As both teams prepare for this crucial encounter, the stakes couldn't be higher, with each side desperate to secure a win to keep their playoff aspirations viable. Will RCB continue their resurgence, or will Gujarat find their footing and turn their fortunes around? This matchup promises high tension and thrilling cricket as both teams battle for survival in IPL 2024.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

In the four matches contested between the two teams, both teams have won two games each.

 

 

Milestones Alert:

2 -Dinesh Karthik (298) needs two dismissals to complete 300 dismissals in T20s
3 -Rashid Khan (147) needs three wickets to complete 150 wickets in IPL.
4 -Wriddhiman Saha (296) needs four fours to complete 300 fours in the league.
6 -Virat Kohli (12494) needs six runs to complete 12500 runs in T20s.
22- Rahul Tewatia (978) needs 22 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL.
25 -Faf du Plessis (9975) is 25 runs away from reaching 10000 runs in T20s.
75 -Sai Sudharsan (925) needs 75 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL.

 

Pitch Report (Ian Bishop & Matthew Hayden):

Bishop: "Back at the Chinnaswamy Stadium, folks. From the inner ring, we spot a few bare patches, so fielders, watch out for unpredictable bounces. Onto the pitch and boundary dimensions: 57 meters to my right, 64 to my left, with shorter boundaries down the ground. Expect some big hits."

Hayden: "Surface looks hard, a bit parched, but it'll shine up nicely for batting. Batsmen love the trusty bounce here, making it easy to find boundaries. Spinners might struggle with grip, but overall, it's a high-scoring ground."

Bishop: "I'll stay neutral on the dew factor, given yesterday's rain. Let's hope it doesn't play a big role tonight." 


TOSS UPDATE:   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD 

 

Faf du Plessis |  Skipper: "We've opted to chase. Given the pitch conditions, which seem fairly balanced, and the possibility of rain, chasing seems like the better option. The team spirit and conversations have been positive. We've been performing well, and the team is motivated. We've regained our batting form after initial struggles, and the boys are ready to deliver another good performance today."

 

Shubman Gill |  Skipper: "Our focus is on winning; it's something we've achieved in the past, so it's not new territory for us. The key is to perform at our best on the given day. While our bowling and batting have been up to the mark, our fielding has faltered a few times. We've addressed this issue, and hopefully, we'll see improvement today."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
GT - 23/3 (3.83 rpo, 2X4, 0X6) ll RCB - 92/1 (15.33 rpo, 10X4, 7X6)

 

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
GT - 79/2 (8.78 rpo, 7X4, 4X6) ll RCB - 60/5 in 7.4 Overs (7.83 rpo, 8X4, 1X6)

 

Death overs (16-20 overs):- 
GT - 45/5 in 4.3 Overs (10 rpo, 8X4, 1X6) 
 

RCB emerged victorious against GT in a thrilling encounter that unfolded in two contrasting halves. Openers Faf du Plessis (64 off 23 balls) and Virat Kohli (42 off 27 balls) provided a blistering start, amassing a record-breaking 92 runs in the powerplay. However, RCB's middle order suffered a dramatic collapse, slumping from a dominant position to 117/6.

Josh Little, in his IPL debut, emerged as GT's hero with a crucial 4/45, while Noor Ahmad chipped in with key wickets. Despite a valiant fightback, GT's bowlers were left chasing leather as Dinesh Karthik (21* off 12 balls) and Swapnil Singh (15* off 9 balls) steered RCB home with a composed partnership.

This win was a major boost for RCB, but their middle-order woes remain a concern. Nevertheless, they displayed their batting prowess and ability to handle pressure, leaving GT with their heads held high after a well-fought contest. 


 

 

Shubman Gill   Skipper : "Adapting to the wicket is crucial, especially in the initial overs. We aimed for 170-180, considering the conditions. Our approach in the powerplay, both with bat and ball, was key. Despite losing wickets early, we adjusted our strategy, prioritizing an extra batter. It's important to focus on the positives, learn from this game, and aim for better performances in the future."

Faf du Plessis  Skipper: "We've shown aggressiveness in recent games, particularly in our bowling and fielding. Adapting to the different wicket today was vital. Despite a nerve-wracking moment with wickets falling quickly, we aimed for a strong start and executed well. While there are lessons to learn in finishing games, I'm proud of the team's overall performance and look forward to improving further."

Player of the Match: Mohammed Siraj

Mohammed Siraj (Player of the Match): "Honestly, I didn't expect to play today due to feeling unwell, but decided to push through. Bowling with the new ball reminded me of past successes. Manifesting Saha's wicket and playing a pivotal role despite initial rhythm struggles felt gratifying. Continuous red-ball cricket has honed my skills, emphasizing the importance of precision in T20s."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 24  Runs

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Mumbai Indians are set to host Kolkata Knight Riders in Match Number 51 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the Wankhede Stadium. This crucial encounter finds both teams at pivotal moments in their campaigns.

 

Mumbai Indians find themselves in a precarious position, ranked ninth with just six points from ten matches. Despite facing consecutive defeats, MI still has a slim mathematical chance to qualify for the playoffs, provided they win all remaining matches by substantial margins and other results go their way. A loss in this match, however, would officially eliminate them from playoff contention. The team has relied heavily on Tilak Varma, who has consistently stepped up to anchor the batting, while Jasprit Bumrah has been a standout in the bowling department, excelling in both wicket-taking and maintaining a low economy rate. However, concerns about the form of their captain, who has had a disappointing IPL season, remain a significant challenge. Mumbai Indians are eager to turn their fortunes around and rekindle their winning ways.

 

Kolkata Knight Riders come into this game riding high after a commanding win over Delhi Capitals, thanks to a stellar bowling performance by Sunil Narine and Varun Chakaravarthy. Prior to this victory, KKR experienced two tough losses against PBKS and RR, where they posted substantial totals but failed to secure wins. Positioned second in the table with 12 points from nine games, KKR is looking to solidify their playoff position with a couple more wins. Narine and Phil Salt have been crucial with the bat, providing the team with solid starts. With a confident squad, KKR aims to maintain their momentum and extend their winning streak.
 

As both the teams gear up for exciting contests, the history says its Mumbai while the form says Kolkata. Who will emerge on top?

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the 32 games contested between the two, Mumbai Indians dominate the contest with 23 wins while Kolkata have won nine games.

 

Milestones Alert

3 -Mohammad Nabi (347) needs three wickets to complete 300 wickets in T20s
4 -Ishan Kishan (246) needs four fours to complete 250 fours in IPL.

KEY BATTLES:


 


Pitch Report ( Daren Ganga & Micheal Clarke)

Daren Ganga: "For this clash between Mumbai Indians and KKR, the conditions seem perfect for cricket. The boundary sizes vary, with the shorter square boundary measuring 60 meters to my right and 65 meters to the left. Down the ground, it's 74 meters. Overall, the pitch looks conducive to good cricket."

Michael Clarke: "From this end, the pitch appears dry, which could favour spin bowling. However, there's potential for pace and bounce from the other end due to the even grass covering. Winning the toss will be crucial, especially with the expected dew. Both teams have their strengths, with Mumbai relying on their quicks and KKR favouring spinners. We can expect a high-scoring game with good batting conditions." 

 

 

TOSS UPDATE:   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD



 

Hardik Pandya |  Skipper: "We've chosen to bowl first, playing for our pride. It's great to be back home and ready for an exciting match. The pitch is fresh, and we haven't had the opportunity to play on it this season, so we feel bowling first might be advantageous. We have one change: Naman Dhir replaces Nabi in the lineup."

 

Shreyas Iyer |   Skipper: "It's all about focusing on the details and doing the small things right. Despite the dew factor, we need to stay focused and believe in our abilities. The message to the team is crystal clear; everyone knows their role, and we're eager for a great game. We've decided to bat first and stick with the same lineup."

KKR - 57/4 (9.5 rpo, 7X4, 3X6) ll MI - 46/3 (7.67 rpo, 4X4, 2X6)

KKR - 71/1 (7.89 rpo, 4X4, 2X6) ll MI - 73/3 (8.11 rpo, 7X4, 2X6)

KKR - 41/5 in 4.5 Overs (8.48 rpo, 1X4, 4X6) ll MI - 26/4 in 3.5 Overs (6.78 rpo, 0X4, 2X6) 
 

Knight Riders Finally Conquer the Wankhede After 12 Years 

The Kolkata Knight Riders secured a crucial victory against the Mumbai Indians at the Wankhede Stadium, ending a 12-year winless streak at the iconic venue. This win solidifies their second-place position in the IPL 2024 table.

KKR posted a competitive 170 runs on a tricky, two-paced pitch. Their bowling attack then rose, with Mitchell Starc leading the charge. Starc finally found his rhythm, claiming crucial wickets and celebrating with gusto.

MI's chase faltered from the outset. Early dismissals of Ishan Kishan and Rohit Sharma put them on the back foot, and the rest of the batting order struggled to find momentum. Suryakumar Yadav's valiant 56 was a lone bright spot, but it wasn't enough to overcome the disciplined bowling performance by KKR.

This win significantly strengthens KKR's playoff aspirations, while MI's hopes for a postseason berth have become increasingly slim. 




 

Hardik Pandya |  Skipper :  It was a tough outing for us with the bat. We struggled to build partnerships and kept losing wickets, which is always costly in T20 cricket. As for the questions surrounding our performance, well, there's a lot to analyze, but it'll take some time to find those answers. But for now, not much to say. Our bowlers, though, did a fantastic job. The pitch got better after the first innings, and the dew factor came into play. We'll review the game and identify areas where we could have done better.In times like these, I always remind myself to keep fighting. You can't give up, even when the going gets tough. Challenges are a part of the game, but they also present opportunities to improve and become better.  
 

Shreyas Iyer |  Skipper: "Absolutely thrilled with the win and the conversation I had with Starcy about the importance of this game. Winning here at Wankhede after 12 years is truly special. We would have loved to savor this victory longer, but with another game in two days, our focus shifts to recovery. The impact rule played a crucial role in this game. Manish is a talented player, and it was great to see him build a partnership with Venky. All I had to tell the bowlers was that if we set a good total, we could defend it. The spinners were exceptional, executing our plans perfectly. Venkatesh Iyer's knock was fantastic. He's been eager to showcase his abilities, and today, he played beautifully. I'm happy for him." 

Player of the Match : Venkatesh Iyer  
 

Venkatesh Iyer | Player of Match: "Being adaptable is key in professional cricket, so I wanted to play a flexible role. Since I was hitting the ball well, I decided to anchor the innings, and it worked out nicely. This was the 4th or 5th time Manish was padded up, and finally, he got to bat today, all thanks to the impact player rule. It was beneficial to send someone like Manish to anchor the innings before Russell and Ramandeep. Throughout the innings, Manish guided me, offering insights on which bowlers to take on and which situations to handle. He's an experienced campaigner, and his mentorship was invaluable. Being a smarter cricketer allows you to make better decisions. While I could have taken on Piyush Chawla or any other seamer, I chose to play according to the situation. I'm a huge fan of Dada so I sought his advice on my stance and position, which worked out well for me. It was a fruitful conversation with him."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Sunrisers Hyderabad is set to host Rajasthan Royals in Match Number 50 of TATA IPL 2024 at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. As the tournament progresses, both teams are poised to deliver a captivating performance.

 

The Rajasthan Royals are riding high, leading the points table with eight wins from nine matches. A victory in this upcoming game would clinch their playoff berth, a testament to their dominant run this season. The team's success has been significantly aided by the stellar performance of their top four batters, who have consistently made valuable contributions. Additionally, their bowling attack has been formidable, with Yuzvendra Chahal reaching a personal milestone of 200 IPL wickets, underscoring the strength of RR's bowling lineup. With high confidence and momentum on their side, the Royals are looking to extend their winning streak.

 

On the other side, Sunrisers Hyderabad has shown impressive batting prowess throughout the season, marked by aggressive power hitting from the top and middle order. For the first time, they have surpassed 100 sixes in the IPL, with Abhishek Sharma, Travis Head, and Heinrich Klaasen leading the charge. However, after a strong start to the season, two consecutive losses have slightly derailed their campaign, placing them in fifth position with 10 points. With their playoff hopes at stake, the Sunrisers need to quickly move past their recent setbacks and regroup. T Natarajan has been a crucial part of their bowling unit, consistently delivering performances that bolster the team's chances.

 

As these two teams clash, Sunrisers Hyderabad aims to revive their campaign and push for a playoff spot, while Rajasthan Royals look to secure their position and continue their formidable form. This matchup promises to be a thrilling encounter filled with strategic gameplay and high stakes.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

Key Players Battles To Watch Out For:

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Graeme Swann and Sunil Gavaskar:   "Good day to play cricket, It not too warm, it seems like a lovely evening for a game of Cricket. The square boundaries are 61m and 64m while the pockets around are 70m, it is only 60m behind the wicket and down the ground is 73m. good track to bat on and there will be assistance for the turners. Pacers will enjoy bounce & carry because of the hardness of the surface but one can also expect lots of runs. SRH if they play the way they do You can be pretty certain that you'll get a score of 250 unless Rajasthan Royals pull out some magic tricks. This is a fresh wicket, which has never been used before."

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: We will bat first, the crowd seems pretty excited to see us bat first. We have always done well batting first and this is probably our strong suit. Looks like a good wicket to bat on. So yes we will look to put up a good score on the board and defend"

 


Sanju Samson, Skipper: " We would have batted as well. It does suit the team, we have done both well this season. It is paramount to have momentum on our side in this tournament. Lot of things have been going in our favour. We just want to stick to the same process."

clinched a thrilling victory over by a slender margin of just 1 run in a high-scoring encounter. Batting first, Sunrisers posted a formidable total of 201 for 3 in their allotted 20 overs, with notable contributions from Head (58), Klaasen (42*), and Nitish Reddy (76*). Sandeep Sharma was the pick of the bowlers going for just 7.8 r.p.o. In response, put up a valiant effort but fell agonizingly short, finishing with a total of 200 for 7. Yashasvi Jaiswal led the charge with a brisk 67, while Riyan Parag contributed a vital 77. Despite their efforts, Rajasthan Royals couldn't overhaul the target, falling short by just one run. reach 12 points with six wins to their tally. 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: " We have encountered some close contests, won a couple of them and lost this one. The way their bowlers came back was amazing, credit to them. This is a game of margins and it is not over till the last ball is bowled.  It was tough to bat against the new ball and when it got old, it became easier. Credit to Jaiswal and Parag for playing sensibly, It was them who got us to that position after Jos and myself got out early in."

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: It was an amazing game. That is the beauty of this format. Anything is possible.  Bhuvi executed that last ball was outstanding. That is  experience for you. Natarajan is a good yorker bowler, fortunately we got some wickets. Played some games here, and thought 200 could have been chased down. Nitish Reddy sums up the conditions pretty well, he's amazing with the bat, great in the field, and gives some overs with the ball as well. A good find for us"

 

 

Bhuvneshwar Kumar is Player of the Match 

Bhuvneshwar Kumar: "   I think that's my nature, I wasn't thinking about the result in the last over. There was no discussion in the last over, was just focussed on the process. Was thinking just about bowling two good balls, anything could happen. I wasn't thinking much, was just focussed on the process. The ball swung so much, can't pinpoint, really enjoyed it. Luckily got wickets today."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Chennai Super Kings are ready to welcome Punjab Kings for the 49th match of TATA IPL 2024 at MA Chidambaram Stadium. Both teams are riding high on significant victories.

 

Punjab Kings stride into this game after achieving a historic run chase against KKR, scoring 262 with an over to spare. This victory, marked by impressive performances from Jonny Bairstow, Shashank Singh, and Ashutosh Sharma, has boosted their confidence, and they aim to maintain this momentum. Their bowlers have also risen to the occasion, providing crucial breakthroughs.

 

On the other side, Chennai Super Kings enter this match buoyed by a dominant 78-run win in their previous outing. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Shivam Dube have been instrumental in their batting lineup, combining flamboyant strokes with power hitting. The bowling department has been strengthened by Mustafizur Rahman and Matheesha Pathirana, who have delivered standout performances.

 

With CSK having a strong record at home, winning four of their five matches, and PBKS having secured a win last time in Chennai, this matchup promises to be a thrilling encounter. Will CSK continue to dominate at home, or will PBKS carry forward their momentum for another win?

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

In the 28 matches played between the two teams, have won 15 games while have managed to win 13 games.

 


 

Milestones Alert:

PITCH REPORT: 
Matthew Hayden and Danny Morrison: " The square boundaries are 63m and 70 m while down the ground is 77m. It is a red soil track and a new pitch as well. There is grass cover and it seems rock solid. The last edition, there was more turn than this year. Can expect pace and carry, and it might very well be a high-scoring encounter. Dew will come into play and that makes the toss very important."

 

 

TOSS:
 has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: "We'll field first. New pitch, seems like a good track and we are excited after our last match.It is an amazing venue to play cricket and we hope to start well taking early wickets. We are confident after chasing 261. We need to have courage and be brave as they are a good team, especially at home. We are going with the same side"

 


Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: " We would have bowled as well, but we weren't exactly sure. Dew plays a factor so it is tough defending, but the fact that we won by 78 runs shows a lot about the team, but we'll be missing  Pathirana's services and also Tushar Deshpande misses out today. Pathirana has a slight niggle and Deshpande is not well. We will look to put up a good total. so We have got Shardul in his place and Richard Gleeson makes his debut."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
CSK - 55/0 (9.17 rpo, 9X4, 0X6) ll PBKS - 52/1 (8.67 rpo, 8X4, 1X6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
CSK - 47/3 (5.22 rpo, 0X4, 0X6) ll PBKS - 83/2 (9.22 rpo, 8X4, 3X6)

CSK - 60/4 (12 rpo, 4X4, 4X6) ll PBKS - 28/0 in 2.5 Overs ( 9.88 rpo, 1X4, 1X6)

 

got off to a good start after being asked to bat first by Sam Curran. The pair of Gaikwad and Rahane accumulated 55 in the powerplay going over 9 r.p.o. But the team lost momentum in the middle over phase where the team lost 3 wickets without a single boundary hit. Gaikwad top scored with 62 in CSK's below-par score of 162. The spin duo of Brar and Rahul Chahar picked two wickets each giving nothing away to the CSK batters. In response, lost Prabhsimran early but Jonny Bairstow continued his good form and made sure that the team compiled runs in the first six. Jonny B and Rilee Rossouw compiled 64 from 37 balls giving very little chance to CSK to stage a comeback. Shashank Singh and Sam Curran played sensibly for their 25 & 26 respectively to take the team home with 13 balls to spare. 

 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: " I feel we were probably 50-60 runs short. The pitch got better later on and was not the best when we were batting. So I feel we were well short of the score that would put PBKS under pressure.  To be honest, I'm under pressure when I go to the middle for the toss. I think the last two games, the conditions suited us better and the pitch was suitable as well, giving us a chance to fight hard and get to 200-plus score. Today, it wasn't the track to even get 180. It's a real problem when players miss out due to injuries and Chahal walking away in the first over did not help our cause either. It is difficult when you have only two bowlers, the dew took the spinners out of the equation as well. It was tough, but there're four games left and we will try and come back to winning ways."

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper:  Very happy with the way things went. Every time you come to Chennai and take two wins, always a special feeling.  We are in a position where we need to win all our games, we come up against the same opposition in a few days. We come against the same opposition so we have one up on them. It is a new game, new conditions but this win will give us a lot of confidence. I think our bowlers were superb, the spinners and Jonny striking them well, even the way we paced that chase, it was brilliant. Need to build on that confidence"

 

 

 

Harpreet Brar is Player of the Match

Harpreet Brar: "   It was a good track to bowl on, and even Rahul Chahar bowled well. I have been playing for last 6 years, so my confidence has been pretty high. Now bowling to these legends of the game like MS Paji and all it feels normal, I just bowl to my strengths. To be honest, I don't think wickets, my aim is only to bowl lots of dot balls and dot balls create the wickets. When there is spin in the wicket, the bowlers' confidence goes up and it is a bit helpful."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Lucknow Super Giants  are gearing up to host Mumbai Indians  in match number 48 of TATA IPL 2024 at Ekana Stadium. Both teams are looking to recover from recent losses and regain their footing in the competition.

 

The Super Giants, currently fifth in the standings with 10 points from nine games, faced a setback in their last match against the table-topping Rajasthan Royals. As they seek to return to their winning ways, LSG will lean on their top performers: KL Rahul, who leads their batting lineup with 378 runs from nine games, and Nicholas Pooran, who follows with 291 runs at a striking rate of 165.34. Yash Thakur, with 10 wickets, leads their bowling attack, supported by Mohsin Khan, who has taken seven wickets.

 

Meanwhile, Mumbai Indians come into this match after suffering consecutive losses, placing them second from the bottom of the table with just six points from nine games. With their playoff hopes hanging by a thread, MI needs a strong comeback. Key players like Tilak Varma and Rohit Sharma, who have scored 336 and 311 runs respectively, will be crucial for their resurgence. The bowling unit is anchored by Jasprit Bumrah, who has impressively claimed 14 wickets with an economy rate of 6.63, and Gerald Coetzee, who has added 12 wickets.

 

As both teams face crucial circumstances, this upcoming clash at Ekana Stadium promises high stakes and intense competition, with each side desperate to claim a victory and boost their prospects for the remainder of the season.

Pitch Report:

Graeme Swann and Aaron Finch: "It's a used pitch as we identified by the footmarks. 66m square - shorter side, the pockets are about 71m, straight down the ground it is 76m. 163 was the score here last time and they defended it. That should give the bowlers a lot of confidence. There is a little bit of grass on the surface and as we come down the strip a little bit more, you see some bare patches. I expect it to be on the slower side. Expect the ball to spin and hold in the wicket a little bit more. There's a bit of a breeze tonight. It is bowler's night." 

 



TOSS UPDATE:   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BOWL  

 



KL Rahul   Skipper : "We've opted to bowl first. The pitch looks good, and we want to put their batsmen under pressure and chase down the target. We're aiming to maintain balance and put on a good performance. We've made some changes in the team. Mayank Yadav is back, and we're eager to get him on the field. He's worked hard to recover from his injury, and we're pushing him to play confidently. He's crucial for us, especially in the bowling department." 

Hardik Pandya Skipper : "It's okay. We would've preferred to bowl first as well. The pitch seems a bit slow, and we'll see how it behaves. We need to focus on the basics and control what we can. Each game is crucial for us, so we're taking it one match at a time. Coetzee comes in for Wood. Despite the injuries and changes, we always believe in our abilities when we step onto the field."

 showcased a dominant bowling performance that restricted   to just 145. KL Rahul's decision to bowl first paid off as Mohsin Khan and Marcus Stoinis quickly removed key players Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav, curbing MI's scoring chances early in the game. Despite valiant efforts from Ishan Kishan (32 off 36), Wadhera (46 off 41), and Tim David (35* off 18), LSG's disciplined bowling held MI to under 150 runs, setting a target of 145 for LSG.

In response, LSG faced a challenging chase but ultimately succeeded, securing a win in the final over of the match. Marcus Stoinis starred with a dynamic 68 off 45 balls, while his pivotal 50-run partnership with KL Rahul provided much-needed stability. Although MI's bowlers gave it their all, Nicky P. held his nerve, playing a crucial role in LSG's four-wicket victory. This win elevated LSG to third in the standings, bolstering their playoff aspirations as they aim to finish the league stages strongly.

 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, MI Skipper: "I think losing early wickets is tough to recover from and that's what we couldn't do it. You have to see the ball and hit. We just missed those balls and got out. Just that you got to give it your all. A lot of things to learn from this game and it has been fantastic. I think Wadhera did good last year as well."

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "We still had batters in the middle including an experienced Pooran and KP. The pitch was a bit dry. 165-170 would have made it a competitive total. It takes some time to adjust to this wicket but our bowlers did well and put pressure on them. Happy to get those two points. We need to gain momentum in the back end of the tournament. Mayank had some pain in his sides. We need to take care of him and we are giving him a free hand."

 

Marcus Stoinis is the player of the match
Marcus Stoinis: "Nice to bowl with the new ball and I didn't expect to bowl three in the powerplay. Thought the wicket was okay but it was a little tricky. It was a dragged-down delivery which I got out to and was disappointing to get out. This is my third year and I have built close bonds with the franchise here as everything is good here."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Kolkata Knight Riders are set to host Delhi Capitals in match number 47 of TATA IPL 2024 at Eden Gardens. Both teams have secured five wins each, though Delhi has played two more games than Kolkata. The Knight Riders come into this match after enduring one of the most dramatic finishes in IPL history, having conceded a record chase of 262 to Punjab Kings on their home ground. Recent matches at Eden Gardens have consistently seen high scores, with two successful chases over 220 and a narrow miss, indicating a trend of high-scoring games this season. So far, scores over 200 have been recorded 29 times in 46 matches, with 18 resulting in wins.

 

Despite being strong on paper, KKR's bowling has faltered, contributing to two losses in their last three games. They aim to address these shortcomings as they seek to regain their winning form. Positioned second in the standings, Kolkata's openers, Phil Salt and Sunil Narine, have consistently given them strong starts.

 

Delhi Capitals, meanwhile, enter this game following a close 10-run win against Mumbai Indians, where they posted a formidable 257. The team has relied heavily on the scoring prowess of Rishabh Pant, Tristan Stubbs, and Jake Fraser-McGurk, with Fraser impressing with his aggressive starts. Pant, Stubbs, and Axar Patel have been crucial in the middle and death overs, contributing significantly. Delhi hopes to extend their winning streak, backed by Kuldeep Yadav and Khaleel Ahmed, who have each taken 12 wickets, bolstering their bowling attack.

 

As both teams prepare for this crucial encounter, the focus will be on adjusting strategies to exploit the high-scoring conditions at Eden Gardens, with KKR aiming to stabilize their campaign and Delhi looking to climb higher in the standings.

In the 32 games contested between the two teams, KKR have an upper-hand with 17 wins to DC's 15.

has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Rishabh Pant,  Skipper: "  We'll bat first. We Would like to put a total on the board. The wicket seems to be on the slower side. Prithvi Shaw comes back, and Kumar Kushagra misses out. Rasikh Dar starts in place of Mukesh I guess. We always talk about taking one game at a time."

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "We were looking to field first. Were having a chat and Rishabh he said 'We're looking to bat' and I said we're looking to field. We're trying to keep things as simple as possible. When you lose a game like that, scoring 260, it's easy for people to go away from each other and backbite. The idea is to keep everyone together. Mitchell Starc and Vaibhav Arora are back."

A clinical performance by at their den against a side which had momentum on their side. Spin was a crucial factor in the match and had no answers to the mystery of Narine and Chakaravarthy. DC's below-par total of 153 left their bowlers with little to defend. Chakaravarthy emerged as the standout performer, applying brakes on DC's scoring and claiming three crucial wickets in his four overs. Philip Salt's dominating innings at the top provided KKR with a solid start, setting the tone for the chase. Despite DC managing to pick up three wickets and momentarily applying pressure, the Iyers, Shreyas and Venkatesh, steered KKR to a comfortable win. DC had no chance to stage a comeback and ended up losing the contest convincingly.

 

 

Rishabh Pant, Skipper: "    It was a good decision to bat first. As a batting unit, we didn't do well, 150 was below par with how things were going. But we need to learn from our mistakes, every day is not your day. Winning 4 out of 5 a team was nice, but these kind of games come along in T20s. I think anything around 180-210 would have been a good score, we didn't give our bowlers enough runs to defend."

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "The ball started turning a bit after the powerplay, there was help for the turners. Happy that we bowled first, that gave us an idea on how it was playing. Pure bliss to see the way Narine is performing and even Phil Salt. Chakravarthy was not at his best in the last few matches. But today he came and delivered under pressure. The way he turned up today was simply brilliant. We have been thinking about qualification from game one, that has been our mindset."

 

 

Varun Chakaravarthy is Player of the Match 

Varun Chakaravarthy: "   Yes the wicket was holding up a little and it did turn a lot more in the second innings. I feel the ball where the catch was dropped was a better delivery, the ball that got me the wicket can be a six on any other ground. That has been the feature of this year's IPL, it has become a game of very small margins for the bowler. I personally enjoyed the wicket of Stubbs more. The support staff has played a huge role in my development as a player."

.

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 46 of the IPL 2024 match will see host at MA Chidambaram Stadium. Sunrisers Hyderabad, currently third on the points table with 5 wins from 7 games, will need Travis Head and T Natarajan to maintain their form while Chennai Super Kings, placed fifth after winning 4 of their 8 matches, will rely on Ruturaj Gaikwad's consistent batting and Mustafizur Rahman's bowling skills to climb up the rankings. This match promises to be an exciting encounter given the form and stakes for both teams.

In their last encounter at Hyderabad, Sunrisers Hyderabad clinched a comfortable six-wicket win over Chennai Super Kings, finishing their chase with 11 balls to spare. This previous victory adds an extra layer of anticipation for the upcoming match, as Chennai will be eager to level the score while Hyderabad aims to continue their winning momentum.

Head - to - Head in IPL :-

PITCH REPORT: 


Anjum Chopra and Samuel Badree:  "Slightly shorter on one side but it shouldn't make much of a difference. Down the ground, the shots need to be well-timed. It looks a bit dry. Some aberrations here, traditionally teams that have batted first have succeeded but not this season. Spinners haven't had a significant part in this season either as has been the case previously. It looks very dry, there's a mosaic underlay and there isn't a sheen that you have come to expect in this year's IPL. The same surface that was used in that game against GT where CSK scored over 200 runs."


 

TOSS:
SRH has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: "    We're going to field. Boys are pretty pumped up. We've got Bhuvi who's a very nice new ball bowler, I just fill in wherever required. We're going with one extra batter, Markande misses out. We've always looked to bowl first, maybe dew will be a factor later in the evening."

 

 

Ruturat Gaikwad, Skipper: "Was hoping to win the toss, nothing we can control much. If we put up runs against them they'll be under pressure. We have just lost those clutch moments in the matches, just 2-3 overs while batting when we couldn't capitalise. Even with bowling, we haven't gotten those starts in the powerplay and sometimes when we've got that we haven't been able to finish off well. Overall, we're happy with where we are but we're just looking to win those clutch moments"

In a high-octane clash between the and , the latter emerged victorious in a commanding fashion at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.sent in, got off to a good start with Ajinkya Rahane and Ruturaj Gaikwad at the crease. However, Rahane departed early, but Gaikwad along with Daryl Mitchell steadied the innings with a crucial partnership. Gaikwad's well-constructed innings of 98 runs off 54 balls laid the foundation for a formidable total. Shivam Dube's late cameo propelled Chennai Super Kings to a competitive total of 212/3 in their allotted 20 overs.  Chasing a challenging target, faltered right from the start, losing wickets at regular intervals. Tushar Deshpande's fiery spell wreaked havoc as he claimed four crucial wickets, dismantling the top order of Sunrisers. Despite brief resistance from Aiden Markram and Heinrich Klaasen, the Sunrisers' batting lineup collapsed under the relentless pressure exerted by the Chennai bowlers. They were eventually bowled out for a mere 134 runs in 18.5 overs, falling short by a significant margin of 78 runs.

 

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: "    We thought chasing was our best chance to win but unfortunately it didn't come off tonight. They Batted well but with our batting lineup, wicket was playing pretty well, so I thought we had a good chance. Nothing went right for us today but everyone in that lineup has won a game for us at some point this season. It's definitely dewy now, but it was pretty dewy in the first innings as well. It's only a couple of games so we'll look to bounce back quickly." 

 

 

 Skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad is the Player of the Match 

Ruturaj Gaikwad: "   Feeling pretty good. Tough to play in such wet conditions, and to be able to win by 70-odd runs is a clinical performance. Was a blessing in disguise at the toss. Too hot and humid conditions. Even the last game, was there batting for 20 overs and fielding for 20 overs. Today also almost the same. Wasn't thinking about a hundred. Wanted to make sure we get to 220-odd. Was disappointed that I missed 4-5 hits at the back end. During the innings break I felt it could make a difference and I was upset. But thankfully it was enough."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Gujarat Titans are set to host Royal Challengers Bengaluru in Match Number 45 of TATA IPL 2024 at the Narendra Modi Stadium. Both teams are struggling in the lower half of the points table, with the visitors currently at the bottom. Royal Challengers Bangalore come into this match with a bit of momentum, having secured a win against Sunrisers Hyderabad in their last outing, breaking a streak of six consecutive losses. They are keen to build on this recent success, especially with their bowling unit showing significant improvement.

On the other side, the Gujarat Titans are looking to recover from a narrow defeat against Delhi Capitals, where they lost by just four runs while chasing a formidable target of 225. A major concern for the Titans has been the lackluster performance of their middle order, which has contributed the least runs in the league so far this season. The team urgently needs these key players to step up if they are to compete effectively and return to winning ways. As both teams face off, Gujarat aims to leverage home advantage to overcome their challenges, while Bangalore looks to continue their revival in form.

 

Head-To-Head In IPL:

 

 

Potential Contenders for T20 World Cup:

 

Since IPL 2023, Virat Kohli has been in exceptional form, amassing 1,098 runs in just 25 innings with an average of 52 and a strike rate of 142.78. His outstanding performance has earned him the Orange Cap in IPL 2024. Kohli's consistent run-scoring and extensive experience are crucial for India's prospects at the upcoming World Cup. Selectors are considering whether to utilize him as an opener or at the number three position, aiming to capitalize on his ability to anchor the innings. His role will be pivotal in providing stability and guiding the team through high-pressure situations, ensuring India can build substantial totals or chase down challenging targets.

It should spin a bit and will be consistent even if you're batting first or second. 180 could be a good total, but both teams will rely heavily on spin and changes in variations.

Maxwell comes back in as it's a day game and he plays spin well plus now we have some firepower in the middle-order"

In a thrilling encounter at the Narendra Modi Stadium, secured a comprehensive victory over the by 9 wickets, chasing down a challenging target with ease.

 Opting to bat first, Gujarat Titans did not have the best of starts as Bengaluru's bowlers struck early, dismissing Saha and Gill to put pressure on the Titans. Sai Sudharsan's explosive innings, combined with Shahrukh Khan's aggressive cameo, propelled Gujarat to a formidable total of 200/3 in their allotted 20 overs. Chasing a daunting target, Royal Challengers Bengaluru got off to a flying start, courtesy of a blistering partnership between Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis. Although du Plessis departed after a quickfire cameo, Kohli anchored the innings with a sublime knock, well-supported by Will Jacks. The duo's clinical batting display ensured Bengaluru chased down the target comfortably with 4 overs to spare, finishing at 206/1. Jacks for his amazing striking was awarded man of the match.

 

 

Shubman Gill,  Skipper: "I think it was great hitting by them Kohli and Jacks. We need to come up with better plans and also need to execute them. When you are batting you can always think of scoring 15-20 runs more. We thought 200 was a good enough total for us, unfortunately, it didn't turn out the way we wanted it to."

 

Faf du Plessis,  Skipper: "I thought it was a really good wicket. When we bowled, we thought it was a total we could score. It feels like we've made progress in both departments. We were way off in the beginning of the tournament, but it feels like there's confidence in the group"

 

 

Will Jacks is Player of the Match 


Will Jacks: " Amazing feeling right now. Faf and Virat got us off to a very good start. I struggled early on, but Virat kept his intensity up and I had the chance to get my rhythm. Once we had the time-out, we said let's get two really good overs and win the game. I just kept going and amazing feeling right now."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Lucknow Super Giants are set to host Rajasthan Royals in Match Number 44 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the Ekana Stadium. Coming into this encounter, both teams are riding high on recent victories that showcased their formidable cricketing prowess. Lucknow Super Giants recently clinched a record-setting victory by achieving the highest run chase in the league against the defending champions, while Rajasthan Royals comfortably defeated a five-time champion team by a massive nine wickets.

 

Both teams witnessed centurions in their last matches, with Marcus Stoinis lighting up the scoreboard for LSG and Yashasvi Jaiswal finding form with a century for RR. Currently, the Royals are leading the points table with an impressive record of seven wins from eight games, indicating their dominant form this season. On the other hand, the Super Giants hold the fourth spot, having secured five victories from their eight outings.

 

The opening game between these two teams saw the Rajasthan Royals taking the win by 20 runs, setting the stage for an intriguing rematch. As both sides have players who have consistently risen to the occasion, this upcoming match promises to be a thrilling contest as each team aims to extend their winning streak and solidify their positions in the standings.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the four games played between the two teams, RR dominates the contest with three wins while LSG has a solitary win.

 

World Cup 2024 Contender:

Riyan Parag has been outstanding over the past year, particularly excelling while batting at number four. In just 15 matches, he has accumulated 714 runs, boasting an impressive average of 71.40 and a strike rate exceeding 170. Parag's proficiency in scoring swiftly during the middle overs highlights his potential as a valuable asset for the upcoming World Cup 2024. His consistent performances make him a strong contender to be considered for India's squad, offering reliable middle-order firepower.

Milestones Alert:-

5- Sanju Samson (195) needs five sixes to complete 200 sixes in IPL
19- Jos Buttler (2981) needs 19 runs to complete 3000 runs for RR in IPL.

4- KL Rahul (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes for LSG in IPL.
35- KL Rahul (4465) is 35 runs away from Reaching 4500 IPL runs.

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Matthew Hayden and Ian Bishop: " It's cooling down as we get into the evening here in Lucknow. 66m and 73m square boundaries while the straight boundary is massive at 80m. It's an incredibly lush outfield, the wicket is made up of black clay and it means it's not a friend of the spinners There are large chink of cracks, so there could be some movement for the pacers. There is a nice grass covering and the brown patches are well-rolled as well. Expect more runs, 200+ runs have been scored by the team batting first, the average 1st innings score has gone up to 170+ this season and we can expect runs on this surface".


 

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "We will bowl first. Looks like a decent wicket to bowl, but no guarantees. This season has been a bit different, some extra days in between games, that gives us time to rest and recover. We're playing the same team"

 


KL Rahul, Skipper: "  The wicket is good, there's not much dew in Lucknow and the wicket will play well for the entire 40 overs. We'll need to play some good cricket. It's nice to get past 200, every team would like to do so, but the dimensions of this ground favours the bowlers a bit more and we've enjoyed it. No changes for us."

LSG - 46/2 (7.6 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) ll RR - 60/1 (10 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

 

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-

LSG - 46/2 (9.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) ll RR - 55/0 (13.7 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)

 

 

 

In a thrilling encounter at the Ekana Stadium, the Rajasthan Royals emerged victorious by 7 wickets against the Lucknow Super Giants in a high-scoring affair. got off to a shaky start, losing early wickets including that of de Kock and Stoinis. However, skipper Rahul anchored the innings with a magnificent knock, well-supported by contributions from Deepak Hooda and Nicholas Pooran. Despite a flurry of late wickets, Ayush Badoni's blistering cameo propelled Lucknow to a formidable total of 196/5 in their allotted 20 overs. Chasing a challenging target,  The explosive duo of Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal gave a good head start. Skipper Sanju Samson led from the front after the openers departed in quick succession with a sensational unbeaten century, anchoring the chase with crucial partnerships alongside Riyan Parag and Dhruv Jurel. Samson's masterclass ensured Rajasthan chased down the target with an over to spare, finishing at 199/3. Samson was awarded the man of the match. 

 

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "  I think we were 20 runs short. We didn’t get an ideal start but with the partnership between myself and Hooda, we came back. In these sorts of games, the set batter had to score close to a hundred after getting to a half-century. I think we were 150 after about 15 overs, should have capitalized on it. I think it is clear that the team with more sixes ends up winning. We do try to hit our sixes but today we had to change our approach after those two early wickets. If Hooda pushed on and scored 20 more, and I got 20 more then we’d finish around 220. That would have been the difference, that’s the 20 runs we left behind. We’re seeing with every game how important it is to give the bowlers that extra cushion because they are under the pump."

 

 

Sanju Samson is the Player of the Match 


Sanju Samson: "   I am very lucky to be behind the wickets. There was some purchase with the new ball and then was a good wicket to bat on. The guys who came in and bowled one over in the power play do an important job. There has been a lot of planning behind the scenes. The support staff has been amazing. The form is temporary in this format. We have seen Jurel in Tests. We believe in him. He has been batting long hours in the nets. We have been a little lucky as well. We need to stick to the processes. One game at a time for us."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Delhi Capitals are set to clash with Mumbai Indians in match number 43 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Delhi is coming into this match following a close victory over Gujarat Titans, where they narrowly defended a total of 224, thanks to standout performances from Axar Patel and Rishabh Pant, and Mukesh Kumar's effective death bowling. With Jake Fraser-McGurk providing solid starts and Tristan Stubbs finishing strong, Delhi aims to maintain their winning momentum.

 

On the other side, Mumbai Indians are looking to recover from a heavy defeat against Rajasthan Royals, where their bowling vulnerabilities were exposed, especially as Jasprit Bumrah struggled against Yashasvi Jaiswal's batting onslaught. The recent inclusion of Nuwan Thushara has yet to yield significant results, but he is expected to play a crucial role alongside Bumrah in the death overs. Mumbai, having already secured a win against Delhi earlier this season, is eager to replicate that success and get back on the winning track. This match promises to be a compelling encounter as both teams vie for crucial points mid-season.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

In the 34 matches contested between the two teams, Mumbai Indians have the Upper-Hand with 19 victories over Delhi Capitals' 15 wins.

 

 

 

Potential Contenders for T20 World Cup 2024:

Tilak Varma has established himself as a standout performer in T20 cricket over the past year. Since IPL 2023, he has played 41 innings and amassed more than 1,240 runs, boasting a remarkable average of 45.92 and a strike rate of 149.21. With the T20 World Cup approaching, Tilak's performances this season are under close scrutiny by the selectors. His consistent ability to score runs at a high rate makes him a prime candidate for consideration, highlighting his potential impact at the international level.

 

 

 

Milestones Alert:

5- Mohammad Nabi (295) needs five wickets to complete 300 T20 Wickets.
40- Hardik Pandya (2460) needs 40 runs to complete 2500 runs in IPL
41- Rohit Sharma (11459) needs 41 runs to complete 11500 runs in T20s
42- Shai Hope (2458) needs 42 runs to complete 2500 runs in T20s.
100- Ishan Kishan is set to play his 100th IPL game.

 

Key Battles to Watch Out For:

 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Danny Morrison and Sanjay Manjrekar: " There is not a cloud in the sky and the mercury is almost touching 40, 39 degrees for an afternoon fixture. The dimensions to my left are 59 meters, on the other side 64 meters and downtown is roughly about 73, but the major concern is 54 meters behind the wicket on one side. There is no grass here and you'd think wow that is going to be brilliant for the spinners. It is like a sheet of marble. No grass will allow the spinners to have a bit of turn and if you look at the spin attacks, Delhi have a slight advantage for the spin attack they possess. Nothing for the seamers to be honest".

 

 

TOSS:
 has won the toss and have elected to first


 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "We're going to field first. The ground is small so It's better to bat second on a smaller ground. Every match is a new match, we make sure we are not out. We keep fighting and keep coming hard in each game. That is the brand of Cricket we want to play and put the best foot forward. The mood is fine, happy chats, all is well. Wood comes in for Coetzee"

 

Rishabh Pant, Skipper: "  We were looking to bat first anyway. I think it will get slower in the second innings. It has been amazing, we're getting the kind of wickets we want. As a team, we have to play well and we have been. This is something we talked about - how to control the innings. Bowling with the new ball and bowling at the death is difficult, one over here or there is making all the difference. Team for us, Prithvi Shaw misses out and Kumar Kushagra comes in."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs):-
DC - 92/0 (15.3 rpo, 12x4, 5x6) || MI - 65/3 (10.8 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
DC - 98/3 (10.8 rpo, 4x4, 8x6) || MI - 108/2 (12 rpo, 8x4, 7x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
DC - 67/1 (13.4 rpo, 6x4, 4x6) || MI - 74/4 (14.8 rpo, 4x4, 6x6)

 

 

It was a thrilling encounter between and ! Delhi Capitals posted a formidable total of 257/4 in their 20 overs, thanks to blistering performances by their batsmen. Jake Fraser-McGurk set the tone with a quickfire 84 off 27 balls, while Abishek Porel, Shai Hope, and skipper Rishabh Pant contributed significantly. Tristan Stubbs provided the finishing touch with an unbeaten 48, propelling the team to a commanding total. In response, Mumbai Indians fought hard but fell short by 10 runs, finishing at 247/9 in their 20 overs. Despite valiant efforts from their batsmen, including Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya, they couldn't chase down the target. Tim David played crucial cameo, but it wasn't enough. Delhi's bowlers, led by Mukesh Kumar and Rasikh Salam, applied pressure consistently, picking up crucial wickets at regular intervals.Overall, it was a high-scoring thriller with both teams showcasing their batting prowess, but Delhi Capitals emerged victorious, clinching the match by 10 runs. JFM was awarded the Man of the Match. 

 

 

 

 




Hardik Pandya,  Skipper: " The game is getting tighter by the day. What used to take a couple of overs to change is now happening in just a few balls. Given the intense pressure on the bowlers in such games, we've backed ourselves to adapt.Reflecting on our performance, there were moments where we could have been more aggressive, particularly during the middle overs. With a left-arm spinner like Axar Patel bowling, our left-handed batters could have taken more chances, which unfortunately we missed out on due to a lack of game awareness.Jake Fraser-McGurk's batting was truly impressive. He displayed maturity by selecting the right balls to attack, taking calculated risks, and utilizing the field effectively. It's a testament to the fearlessness of youth.As for the decision to bowl first, I wouldn't change it."


Rishabh pant,  Skipper: "We were pretty satisfied with our score, crossing the 250-mark. However, the impact player rule adds a new layer of complexity to the game with each passing day. As for keeping up to the stumps, it's definitely something I can do. Yet, it requires coordination with the bowlers, especially when they're delivering full and wide deliveries. It's a strategy to keep the batters in check within their crease.Today, it worked well, particularly against a batter like David who tends to walk down the pitch. Fraser-McGurk has been outstanding since day one, displaying remarkable growth in each match. It's precisely the kind of progress you hope to see in a young player.Regarding our playoff chances, they're gradually improving, but we're adopting a game-by-game approach, focusing on the present without getting ahead of ourselves."

Jake Fraser - McGurk is the Player of the Match 

Jake Fraser - McGurk:"It was nerve-wracking out there. Despite studying his footage all day, once you're in the game, everything changes, and you simply react to the ball. Testing yourself against the world's best bowler is always a challenge, but it's also an opportunity to learn and grow.You have to navigate through the highs and lows of the game, and innings like these certainly boost my confidence and contribute to the team's success. Being in the thick of the action, you truly realize the level of competition in the IPL compared to other leagues, and it's an incredible experience to be part of it."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Punjab Kings

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Kolkata Knight Riders  are set to host Punjab Kings  in Match Number 42 of TATA IPL 2024. Coming off a narrow victory over Royal Challengers Bangalore, KKR is well-positioned in second place in the points table and aims to maintain their winning momentum. On the other hand, Punjab Kings are struggling this season, having suffered back-to-back losses and languishing in ninth place on the leaderboard. With their top order failing to make significant scores, Punjab will be eager for a turnaround in fortunes and is desperate for a win to improve their standing.

Punjab's matches have predominantly been close encounters, with seven out of their eight games decided in the dramatic final overs. As the teams prepare to face off, the key question remains: Will KKR continue to dominate, or will Punjab manage to find the much-needed luck to swing the game in their favor? This matchup promises to be an intriguing contest as Punjab seeks to break their losing streak and KKR looks to solidify their top-table position.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

In the 32 games contested between the two teams, KKR has dominated the contest with 21 wins while PBKS has managed to win 11 times.

 

 

Front-runners  for the T20 World Cup 2024!
Rinku Singh has been sensational in the recent years in the T20s circuit, coming to the limelight after bashing five sixes against Yas Dayal in the 20th over doing a undoable task to get past KKR over line against the then defending champions Gujarat Titans. Since the start of IPL 2023, Rinku has amassed 1193 in just 38 innings averaging over 62 while striking at 162.09. Though his perfomance in the ongoing IPL is not as expected, he will be the potential contender for the finisher role given his past year performance.

 

 

Milestones Alert   :

PITCH REPORT: 


Katey Martin and Deep Dasgupta: "It's scorching at mid-40 degrees which will make it slightly uncomfortable for the players. 66m and 63m are the square boundaries while down the ground is 73m. This is going to play as it has right through the season, it has plenty of pace and bounce on offer, the pitch itself is rock solid, the silt content on this surface is around 70% or more, and in general, it's around 50-60%. There are a lot of patches on a good length area on both ends, the grass is abrasive and the spinners could get some help, especially in the first innings".

 

 

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to    first

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: "We will have a bowl. We had four games at home, but unfortunately lost all the matches, The guys are ready for the away games though. We know what we need to do from here, just go out and express ourselves. Liam Livingstone misses out while Jonny Bairstow is back in the side."


Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "  We've had different players stepping up at different times, that's a pleasing thing this season. Starc got a cut on his finger in the last game so he misses out and Dushmantha Chameera replaces him. Hoping to continue the same form and momentum."

RECORD BOOK RE-WRITTEN  

HIGHEST EVER RUN-CHASE IN ALL OF T20'S HAS BEEN BROKEN TONIGHT BY THE   


 

Highest Successful Chase in T20 Cricket :

262 by PBKS vs KKR in Eden Gardens in 2024

259 by South Africa vs West Indies in Centurion in 2023

 

 

In a thrilling encounter,  emerged victorious against by 8 wickets! Kolkata Knight Riders posted a competitive total of 261/6 in their 20 overs. Their innings was highlighted by explosive batting performances from Salt (75 off 37 balls) and Narine (71 off 32 balls). Venkatesh Iyer (39) and Russell (24) also contributed significantly to their team's total. However, despite their efforts, they couldn't prevent Punjab Kings from chasing down the target. Punjab Kings chased down the target with ease, reaching 262/2 in just 18.4 overs. Prabhsimran Singh smashing 54 from 20  provided a solid start, setting the stage for a successful chase. Jonny Bairstow played a brilliant unbeaten innings of 108 runs, steering his team to victory. Shashank Singh's quickfire 68 not out ensured Punjab Kings crossed the finish line comfortably.Overall, it was a dominant performance by Punjab Kings as they chased down the target with ease, securing a convincing 8-wicket win over Kolkata Knight Riders. Jonny B was awarded the man of the match.

 

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "  I would have taken 260 at the start of the day. The way the batters batted was tremendous to see, Narine was brilliant. The way Salt batted, they delivered and it was a treat for the eyes. Both the teams played tremendously, one of those games where you go back to the drawing board and see where it went wrong especially not being able to defend 260."

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: "Very pleasing with the win. Cricket is turning into baseball. We have had a few rough weeks. But we hung in there. The way guys train really hard.  We hung in there and managed to chase it down with balls to spare. Pleased for Bairstow. What an amazing knock. Shashank Singh has been the find of the tournament for us. Asutosh as well. Proud of everyone."

 

Jonny Bairstow is Player of the Match  


Jonny Bairstow: "   We got off to a good start. That was the key. They got off to a good start as well. You have to take risks in such matches. Sometimes luck will go your way. Some days it won't be your day. I tried to whack it as far as possible. If it is in your area, you have to go.  Shashank Singh is a special player with some serious hitting abilities."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Sunrisers Hyderabad   is poised to host Royal Challengers Bangalore  in Match Number 41 of the Tata IPL 2024 at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. The last clash between these two teams turned into a historic run-fest, with a staggering 549 runs scored, setting a record for the highest aggregate in T20 history.

 

Sunrisers Hyderabad comes into this match with strong momentum, having won five of their seven games and sitting third in the points table. They boast the highest total of this IPL season at 287 runs. In contrast, Royal Challengers Bangalore find themselves in a precarious position at the bottom of the standings, having lost seven games. Despite their struggles, RCB posted the highest total in a losing effort this season (262 runs), and Virat Kohli leads the tournament in runs, wearing the Orange Cap with 379 runs from eight games.

 

Royal  Challengers Bengaluru's main concern has been their bowling, as they have secured the fewest wickets in the tournament—only 34 in eight games—highlighting a critical area in need of improvement if they are to reverse their fortunes. Meanwhile, Sunrisers Hyderabad has been formidable in their batting, hitting a season-high 99 sixes in just seven games.

 

As these teams prepare to face off once again, the key question is whether Sunrisers will continue their explosive batting performance or if RCB’s bowlers will rise to the challenge and curb the high-flying Sunrisers. The match promises to be an exciting encounter with high stakes for both teams.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In as many as 24 games contested between the two teams, Sunrisers Hyderabad have won 13 games while Royal Challengers Bengaluru have managed to win 10 games. One game ended in no-result.

 

 

Potential Contenders for T20 World Cup:
Abhishek Sharma has emerged as a strong contender for a spot in Team India for this World Cup, amassing an impressive 968 runs across 28 innings in T20s since IPL 2023, averaging 35, and striking at over 183. His explosive ability to score quickly from the start makes him a particularly appealing option for selectors. Additionally, Abhishek's versatility is enhanced by his capability to bowl when required, adding valuable balance to the team. 

 

 

Milestones Alert  :

63 - Faf du Plessis (1437) needs 63 runs to complete 1500 runs for RCB in IPL.

100 - Jaydev Unadkat is gonna play his 100th IPL game 
250 - RCB is all set to play their 250th IPL game  

 

Key Battles to Watch Out For :
 


 

Records Created and Broken by SRH in TATA IPL 2024  :
 

 

 

Pitch Report |Samuel Badree and Simon Katich:

Badree: "In the IPL 2024, it's Sunrisers Hyderabad against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, a crucial match for RCB. We're back at Hyderabad's pitch number 2, where a massive 277 was scored against Mumbai Indians. The ground dimensions: 63m on the right, 66m on the left, and 76m straight down. Can we expect 300 tonight?"

Katich: " Absolutely! Though slightly rough, SRH is in top form, and this pitch looks perfect for batting. Expect fireworks like the 38 Sixes in the MI match. RCB showed promise against KKR, with Jacks and Patidar impressing. Can their bowlers contain SRH's powerhouse lineup?"

Badree: "Last time these teams clashed, they set a record with 549 runs. Will we see more records tumble tonight?"

 



TOSS UPDATE :   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT    

 


 

Faf du Plessis (RCB Captain): "Opting to bat first tonight. Despite being away, we feel the support from our fans. They've been in good form, so we aim to set a challenging total and build scoreboard pressure. We've shown resilience in recent games and aim to continue that momentum. No changes in our lineup."

 

Pat Cummins (SRH Captain): "Exciting to be back home after a series of away games. The support from the fans, both offline and online, is overwhelming. Regardless of batting first or second, we'll maintain our aggressive approach. Our bowlers have adapted well to the conditions, and tonight, we aim for some quick bowling."

In a thrilling match, emerged victorious against by 35 runs! Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted a competitive total of 206/7 in their 20 overs. Captain Virat Kohli led from the front with a solid knock of 51 runs, supported by Faf du Plessis (25) and Rajat Patidar (50). Contribution from Cameron Green (37*) bolstered their total.Chasing the target, Sunrisers Hyderabad managed to score 171/8 in their 20 overs. Abhishek Sharma and Shahbaz Ahmed fought hard, but they couldn't steer their team to victory. Royal Challengers' bowlers put up a disciplined performance, with Karn Sharma and Swapnil Singh picking up crucial wickets.Overall, it was a fantastic performance by Royal Challengers Bengaluru, who secured a convincing 35-run win over Sunrisers Hyderabad, maintaining their momentum in the tournament. Patidar was awarded the man of the match. 

 

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: " We gave away a few over par and we lost too many wickets.  Won't dwell on this one too much. We were gonna bat first, it seems to be working for us. Before the last few wins, we were thinking that we were a bowl-first team. Didn't go our way. I think it's our stronger suits, to be honest. It won't come off every game, but it's the way to go."

 

Faf du Plessis, Skipper: " Last 2 games, we've shown great signs of fight. SRH match was 270 plus, and we got 260. KKR game as well, a close one, 1 run. We've been close for a while, but you need to win matches to get confidence as a group. Will sleep easier tonight. You can't speak confidence into the group, can't fake confidence into the group. The only thing that gives confidence is performances."

 

Rajat Patidar is Player of the Match  
Rajat Patidar: "I was just keeping things in my mind that control the controllables. Whenever I go back home, I try to solve every issue that I encounter. Today I was backing myself to be in good shape against every bowler."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of Match 40 in the TATA IPL 2024, where the face off against the at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi. The Titans come on the back of a convincing victory at Mullanpur and will look to continue their winning run, whereas the home team Delhi will look to bounce back after their loss against Hyderabad at this venue, and can find solace from just a week back where they had played the Titans and bundled them out for just 89 (the lowest total of the season), to ensure a convincing victory. Another crucial battle on the cards tonight is between the spinners of the two sides, as the Titans have picked up the most wickets by spinners this season (19), followed by the Capitals (18). It will be crucial 2 points on the grab for Gujarat and Delhi, who are at the 6th and 8th place respectively. Which side's spinners will ride the momentum and help their team move up the table tonight ?

 

HEAD-TO-HEAD IN IPL:

The teams have won two each in the 4 times they have faced each other, with the Capitals getting on top in their most recent encounter this year. However, when they clashed in the Arun Jaitley stadium last year, it was the Titans who had emerged on top. Will it be a repeat of the same this year or can the Capitals do the double against the Titans?

 

 

Stats at Arun Jaitley Stadium:

The national capital hosted it's first game of this IPL in the Capital's previous game of the season against Sunrisers, and the Orange Army had posted 266 on board batting first and there were a whopping 465 runs scored in the game. Although last season's average score suggests only 176, there has been a recent trend of big scores at the venue in the WPL, where there were 7 totals of 180+ in the venue compared to just 2 at Bengaluru this year, and also a high avg score of 332 in the ODI WC held in India last year. The teams batting first had won 3/5 matches in the ODI WC, 7/11 matches in the WPL and also the last game held in this year's IPL at the venue. Will a similar trend follow suit today as well?

 

Milestones Alert   :
 

3 - Rashid Khan (147) needs three wickets to get to 150 wickets in IPL
5 - Vijay Shankar (45) needs five sixes to complete 50 IPL Sixes
5 - David Miller (195) needs five fours to complete 200 fours in the league
8 - Rishabh Pant (142) needs eight sixes to complete 150 sixes in IPL

26 - Rahul Tewatia (974) needs 26 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL
100 - Shubman Gill is all set to play his 100th IPL game  

 

Key Battles to watch out for:

 

 

Pitch Report:

Natalie Germanos: "Tonight's pitch at Feroz Shah Kotla has dimensions of 63 meters on the offside and 62 meters on the leg side, with a 72-meter boundary straight down the ground."

Deep Dasgupta: "Compared to the last game, there are some patches of dry grass on the pitch, which might affect the ball's behaviour. However, overall, it's still a good batting surface with potential assistance for spinners early on."

 

 

TOSS:

SHUBMAN GILL HAS CALLED IT RIGHT IN HIS 100TH IPL GAME AND  WILL FIELD FIRST !

 

 

Shubman Gill: "Opting to bowl first; we've been chasing well lately. This being my 100th IPL match is a milestone, but my focus is on winning tonight, which would put us in a better position. Cricket has its ups and downs, but it's crucial to stay mentally strong and focus on the present game, regardless of past results."

 

Rishabh Pant: "Losing the toss isn't a bad thing; we were planning to bat first anyway. We're keeping it simple today, focusing on consistency throughout the game. The pitch seems slower this time, and we're hoping dew doesn't become a factor like last time. Two changes: Shai Hope replaces David, and Sumit Kumar comes in for Lalit."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

DC - 44/3 (7.3 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)  ||  GT - 67/1 (11.2 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 overs):-
DC - 83/0 (9.2 rpo, 9x4, 3x6)  ||  GT - 80/4 (8.9 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)
