pick up two crucial points in a nail-biting run-fest at the Arun Jaitley stadium, as they win by 4 runs . After opting to field in his 100th IPL game, Shubman Gill and the Gujarat Titans got off to a great start in the Powerplay courtesy of Sandeep Warrier who picked up three wickets, after which Axar Patel and Rishabh Pant got together and stitched up a 113-run partnership with both of them scoring 's, to swing the momentum back in DC's favour. One of the highlights of the innings was Axar Patel's promotion in the batting order to Number 3, as he was crucial in taking down the Titan's Afghan spin duo (26 runs off 17 balls against Rashid Khan and 20 runs off 8 balls against Noor Ahmad). A late flourish from Pant and Stubbs ensured Delhi ended up with 224 on board, of which 97 were scored in the last 5!

Wriddhiman Saha and Sai Sudharsan got the off to a flyer in the chase, scoring their highest Powerplay score of the season. Sai Sudharsan continued his run to notch his maiden half-century of the season but Impact Player Rasikh Salam and the ever-consistent Kuldeep Yadav ensured that the Capitals picked up wickets in the middle to drag the momentum in their favour. A quickfire  from David Miller and some late fireworks from Rashid Khan and Sai Kishore took the game deep, but Mukesh Kumar and Delhi Capitals held their nerve and some brilliant display of fielding helped Delhi Capitals do the double over Gujarat Titans and move to sixth position on the table.

 

 

Shubman Gill, Gujarat Titans Skipper: "I think we played some really good cricket. Disappointing to lose in the end, but great character shown by everyone. When you're chasing 224, there's no point in talking about plans, just go out and score runs. At one stage, we thought we would be able to restrict them to 200-210, but we gave away some extra runs in the last 2-3 overs. Execution becomes very important, if there's a set batter or a finisher, you'll have to execute well. It's okay if there's something in the wicket, but on pitches like this, you'll have to make sure that you execute all your plans perfectly, be it the yorkers or the variations."

 

Rishabh Pant is the Player of the Match

Rishabh Pant: "I think it is about instincts as a captain, it will come off sometimes and happy it worked today. Surely at 43/3, we wanted to just keep going and target their main spinners. If we get something we will take it on and keep rotating the strike. Every day that I'm in the middle, I feel better. Every hour on the field matters, and I love being on the field. I think the first six in the match gives me confidence in a game. The more time I spend in the centre, the better I feel."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Lucknow Super Giants

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Chennai Super Kings  are set to face Lucknow Super Giants   in match number 39 of TATA IPL 2024 at MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. This match comes right after both teams faced each other, with Lucknow Super Giants taking the victory in their last encounter.

 

Chennai Super Kings comes into this game following their third away loss of the season against Lucknow. With eight points from seven games, they are currently fourth in the standings, just above Lucknow. Shivam Dube has been a standout for Chennai, scoring 245 runs at an average of 49 and a strike rate of 157. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad has also been in good form, amassing 241 runs at an average of 40. Chennai's bowling strength has been enhanced by their overseas pacers, Mustafizur Rahman and Matheesha Pathirana, who have collectively taken 20 wickets in seven games. With a perfect home record this season, Chennai aims to extend their winning streak on their home ground.

 

On the flip side, Lucknow Super Giants are buoyed by their recent victory over Chennai. They also have eight points from seven matches but are just a notch below Chennai in the fifth position on the points table. KL Rahul has been pivotal for Lucknow, accumulating 286 runs at an average of 40.85. He is well-supported by Nicholas Pooran and Quinton de Kock, who have contributed 246 and 228 runs, respectively. Yash Thakur leads their bowling attack with eight wickets, with substantial contributions from the rest of the bowling lineup. Riding on their recent success, Lucknow is looking to maintain their momentum and climb further up the leaderboard.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the four games played between the two, Lucknow has won two games while Chennai has won one game. One game ended in no-result.

 

 

IPL Stats at MA Chidambaram Stadium (Since 2023):

At this venue, over the course of 12 games since 2023, pacers have dominated the bowling statistics, capturing 90 wickets, whereas spinners have taken 55 wickets. The competition has been evenly matched between teams batting first and those chasing, with each claiming six wins. The average first-innings score recorded here is 171, indicating a moderately high-scoring ground.

 

 

Milestones Alert  :


1 - Moeen Ali (99) needs one catch to complete 100 catches in T20s.
3 - MS Dhoni (247) needs three sixes to get to 250 IPL Sixes.
4 - Marcus Stoinis (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes for LSG in IPL.
4 - Nicholas Pooran (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes for LSG in IPL.
48 - Shivam Dube (952) needs 48 runs to get to 1000 runs for CSK in IPL.

51 - KL Rahul (4449) needs 51 runs to complete 4500 runs in IPL.

 

Battle of Bigs To Watch Out For:

 

 

 

Pitch Report:

Ian Bishop and Matthew Hayden:

 "The afternoon was quite hot, but it's starting to cool off now. To the right, the distance measures about 66 meters, and to the left, it's just a meter more. The ground extends to 78 meters directly ahead. This pitch seems to present different conditions on each half. Near us, there are patches of grass, while the opposite end boasts a uniform grass cover. It's not likely to be a high-scoring pitch of 200 runs. Expect some early dew today, similar to the conditions in the KKR match. Spinners will thrive on this surface, and fast bowlers will need to slow their pace and use a lot of off cutters."

 

 

Toss:

KL Rahul from LSG calls right at the toss and will bowl first!
 

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "We opt to bowl first. There is a bit of dew and that will play an impact. The wicket is a bit slow and hopefully, we can put their batters under pressure. We played well, but we have left the result back in Lucknow. We know how challenging Chennai is, everyone will be cheering for them. We don't have any changes."

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, CSK Skipper: "I lost seven tosses in a row I think and have to work on that. There will be some dew later on, but you never know how the wicket will surprise you. You just need to go out there and express yourself. Just attack when the ball is in the arc. Hoping to set the foundation early on. Daryl comes in for Rachin. Pretty good to have three home games. However, it doesn't matter if you are batting first or bowling first, you need to play good cricket here to win."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs):-
CSK - 49/2 (8.2 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) || LSG - 45/2 (7.5 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
CSK - 86/1 (9.5 rpo, 8x4, 2x6) || LSG - 92/1 (10.2 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
CSK - 75/1 (15 rpo, 4x4, 8x6)  || LSG - 76/1 in 4.3 overs (16.8 rpo, 8x4, 5x6)

 

 

In a thrilling IPL showdown at Chepauk, LSG achieved an incredible feat, clinching a sensational victory over CSK, marking their second win against them this season. Marcus Stoinis emerged as the hero of the night, delivering a monumental innings that defied expectations. LSG won the toss and elected to field here at Chepauk considering the dew factor. CSK had a mixed start with Ajinkya Rahane falling early. Ruturaj Gaikwad, alongside Daryl Mitchell, steadied the innings. Despite Mitchell's early departure, Gaikwad's impressive knock of 108 not out and Shivam Dube's explosive 66 off 27 balls propelled CSK to 210. In the second innings, despite a shaky start with early losses, including Quinton de Kock and KL Rahul, LSG found themselves under pressure with a hefty target of 211. The game's pace changed dramatically as Stoinis, paired first with Nicholas Pooran and then Deepak Hooda, shifted gears dramatically. Stoinis not only scored a staggering 124 from 63 deliveries, but his innings also included a high-octane final over where he secured the win with three balls to spare.

 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, CSK Captain: "Tough to accept, but good game of cricket. LSG played well. We had the game in control till 14 overs, but Stoinis played a great innings. Dew played a part and it took our spinners out of the game. Otherwise, we could have controlled the game better and taken it deeper. But these are parts of the game. Jaddu is batting at number 4 since we lost the second wicket within the powerplay. I thought our target wasn’t enough."

 

KL Rahul, LSG Captain: "Very special. It was very special to pull it off from where we were before. Different conditions here. I think they started off really well and put us under pressure. 170-180 would’ve been a great total here but they batted really well. Full credit to Stoinis. It was not just power hitting, it was very clever batting. You need to go harder in the powerplay and the impact player rule also gives you a bit more depth. There’s no set plan, apart from the openers, everyone else is ready to go out whenever we feel it's right."

 

Marcus Stoinis is the Player of the Match  

Marcus Stoinis: "There were some bowlers we wanted to target and some bowlers we wanted to be more cautious against. There was a phase where I wasn’t able to hit the boundaries so it was great Pooran could come in and take the pressure off. Lots of ebbs and flows, just tried to keep it in control. I do think T20 cricket is changing, the impact player role and how teams are taking on the bowlers. On the playing front, I’d like to play and contribute."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Rajasthan Royals are set to host Mumbai Indians in the 38th match of TATA IPL 2024 at Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur on April 22nd. This encounter marks their second clash of the season, with the Royals having triumphed in their previous meeting.

 

The Rajasthan Royals are riding high this season, boasting six wins from their seven games, with their only defeat coming against Gujarat Titans while defending a score over 190. Riyan Parag has emerged as a standout performer, amassing 318 runs across seven games. Sanju Samson and Jos Buttler have also made significant contributions, scoring 276 and 250 runs respectively, with Buttler's average of 62.50 including two centuries. Yuzvendra Chahal leads their bowling attack with 12 wickets, supported by Avesh Khan and Trent Boult who have each taken seven wickets.

 

Mumbai Indians have experienced a mixed tournament, securing three wins against four losses and currently sit seventh on the points table with six points. Rohit Sharma has been a key player in their batting lineup, accumulating 297 runs, while Tilak Varma and Ishan Kishan have also contributed 208 and 192 runs respectively. The team's bowling, however, has been a concern, with only Jasprit Bumrah and Gerald Coetzee performing consistently. Mumbai is considering strategic changes, potentially bringing in Nuwan Thushara to replace either Mohammad Nabi or Romario Shepherd, aiming to revitalize their campaign. As the match approaches, both teams are gearing up for what promises to be a thrilling contest.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the 28 matches played between the two teams, Mumbai Indians edge past RR with 15 wins to 13 wins.

 

 

IPL Stats at Sawai Mansingh Stadium (Since IPL 2023)
At this venue, pace bowlers have claimed 48 wickets across nine games, while spinners have secured 37 wickets. Over the last two seasons, the average first-innings score here is 180. Teams defending a total have had a slight advantage, securing five victories compared to four wins by teams chasing. This statistic indicates a favorable trend for teams setting targets at this ground.

 

 

Milestones Alert:

1 -Yuzvendra Chahal (199) needs one scalp to complete 200 wickets in IPL.
3 -Riyan Parag (47) needs three sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL
4 -Hardik Pandya (46) needs four wickets to complete 50 wickets for Mumbai Indians in IPL.
7 -Sanju Samson (193) needs seven sixes to complete 200 sixes in IPL.
52 -Tilak Varma (948) needs 52 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL.
54 -Jos Buttler (2946) needs 54 runs to complete 3000 runs for Rajasthan Royals in IPL.
98 -Suryakumar Yadav (98) needs two maximums to complete 100 sixes for Mumbai Indians in IPL.
100 -Hardik Pandya is all set to play his 100th IPL game for Mumbai Indians.
 

Battle of Bigs to Watch Out For:

Yuzvendra Chahal faces a crucial matchup against Mumbai Indians' skipper Hardik Pandya. In their 13 previous encounters, Chahal has dismissed Pandya four times, conceding 63 runs off 69 deliveries. Another intriguing battle to watch is between Jasprit Bumrah and Jos Buttler. Bumrah has dismissed Buttler twice across 65 balls, with Buttler managing to score 62 runs in their six innings of face-offs. 
 

 


PITCH REPORT | Natalie Germanos & Brian Lara 
 

Natalie: "The IPL matches at this ground have been quite intriguing this season. Out of the four games played here, teams batting first have won twice, while teams fielding first have also emerged victorious twice. Spinners haven't dominated over seamers as expected, and the team scores have generally ranged between 180 to 190. Tonight, we find ourselves in the middle once again, with square boundaries measuring 67 meters on either side and a straight hit distance of 76 meters."

Lara: "This pitch is truly a sight to behold. It's dry, hard, and impeccably even. Addressing the question of why we haven't seen scores over 200, I believe it comes down to the lack of moisture, which typically provides bounce. Without that extra bounce, players may feel cautious about playing cross-batted shots against bowlers targeting the stumps directly. While the pitch remains conducive to batting and we may still witness scores close to 200, surpassing that milestone would likely require a bit more bounce. Nonetheless, it's a beautiful pitch to bat on, and with two formidable batting teams like the Mumbai Indians and the Rajasthan Royals, we're in for an exciting contest."




TOSS UPDATE :   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT FIRST  

   

 

 Hardik Pandya  Skipper : "We are going to bat first. It just looks like a good wicket if it slows up. We didn't see much dew in a couple of days of practice, so just thought that batting first would be ideal. It's a surreal feeling to play my 100th game for the franchise.I started my journey here, and I'm very grateful for everything I've experienced over the years. It still surprises me sometimes, the way things have unfolded for me. I think we've taken a lot of positives from all four games. While one game didn't go our way, we've also learned from the wins, aiming to rectify any mistakes. We're focused on improving with each game and looking forward to what's ahead.We have made three changes, N. Tushara, N. Wadhera, and P. Chawla come in for A. Madhwal, R. Shepherd, and S. Gopal." 

 

 Sanju Samson RR Skipper: "We had a slightly different thought about the toss, so anyway, happy to lose it; we wanted to bowl.

You know the nature of this tournament; it's a long season. When momentum is going well, you need to keep going. We had a 5-day gap, so a little reset and all about focusing on the process and leaving the result there.We have played a lot of games here, so we know how the wicket behaves and what we have to do with batting and bowling, respecting each and every opponent. We know Mumbai really well. They come back to the tournament really hard; we have to be a bit aware of that and play our best cricket. The IPL has changed wonderfully and is going up and down. Just focus on the controllables.

Sawai Mansingh Stadium roared tonight as Rajasthan Royals outclassed Mumbai Indians by a dominant nine-wicket Victory! This emphatic win solidified their position at the top of the table, leaving Mumbai with plenty to ponder.

Mumbai's batting woes started early, their top order crumbling like a sandcastle. A glimmer of hope emerged with a fiery 49 from Nehal Wadhera (24 balls) and a composed 65 from Tilak Varma (45 balls), but they could only manage 179.

Rajasthan's reply was nothing short of brutal. Jos Buttler (35 off 25) provided a quickfire start, but the evening belonged to the young gun, Yashasvi Jaiswal. Picking up from where he left off after a rain break, Jaiswal treated the Mumbai attack with disdain. His unbeaten 104 off a mere 60 deliveries – his second century against Mumbai and his first of the season – sealed the win in style.

Mumbai's bowling attack, usually their strength, faltered under pressure. Jasprit Bumrah (0 wickets, 37 runs) and debutant Nuwan Thushara (0 wickets, 28 runs) were expensive, while dropped catches added to their misery. However, the story of the night belonged to Rajasthan's Sandeep Sharma, who ripped through the Mumbai batting order with a career-best spell of 5/18.

 


 

Hardik Pandya  Skipper : "I think we put ourselves in trouble early on. But the way N. Wadhera and T. Varma batted was fantastic. We didn't finish well, and that's why we were 15 runs short.We gave a lot of width in the powerplay. We had to keep it within the stumps. It was not our best day on the field.Everyone's professional. They know their roles. Progression is important. We need to work on our flaws.I don't believe much in chopping and changing. The focus is on playing good cricket and sticking to our plans." 

 

Sanju Samson  Captain : "The credit has to go to all the players. We started off really well with the ball in the powerplay. In the end, both the left-handers played unbelievably well. Some quality spin from R. Ashwin and Y. Chahal. The way they went after them was really great. B. Kumar, S. Sharma, and A. Khan came back well, and that won the game.The wicket looked dry, but Jaipur is still colder. When the lights come on, it looks like a better wicket to bat on. It came true today.The way J. Buttler and Y. Jaiswal batted for a couple of overs after rain, we knew that we had to just reset and go back to our momentum. People are professional enough to understand what they need to do when they get a break, so I am really happy with the approach.Y. Jaiswal always gets confidence. We knew it's just a matter of one game. The way he batted in the powerplay, he was calm and composed, knowing that things are in control. We knew in the dugout that he is playing some cricketing shots and he will be fine today. I am really happy for him.We are going to Lucknow. Let's see how the wicket is out there and let's see how it goes." 


PLAYER OF THE MATCH : SANDEEP SHARMA 

Sandeep Sharma (Player of the Match): "It's going well. I got fit just two days ago, so this is my first game after recovery. Feeling really good. The pitch was on the slower and lower side, so my plan was to keep bowling those variations, including cutters. It worked out really nicely tonight.If you're bowling in the end, you have to have a big heart. As we've seen in this IPL, bowlers are under pressure and batsmen are going big. So it's important to keep believing in yourself, and execute your variations and plans. That's what I'm trying to do, and I'm enjoying myself. As you know, two years ago, I went unsold and came in as a replacement. So, any game I get to play, I consider it a bonus and just enjoy myself."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The stage is set for a riveting IPL clash in Mullanpur, where Punjab Kings  face off against Gujarat Titans . Hovering near the bottom, Punjab is desperate to climb up the ranks. They've been hit hard by injuries, notably missing Shikhar Dhawan. Yet, they've seen a glimmer of hope in the form of Shashank Singh and Ashutosh Sharma, whose heroics have snatched victory from the jaws of defeat earlier this season against Gujarat. Will they deliver another spectacular performance?

Gujarat Titans, just a spot above Punjab, haven't fared much better. Despite Shubman Gill’s steady contributions, the team's overall inconsistency is glaring. However, their bowlers, led by the adept Rashid Khan, have kept them in games, even though a recent blowout loss to Delhi Capitals rattled them.

Historically, games between these two have favored the chasers, often ending in dramatic last-over finishes. Punjab will surely look to repeat their earlier thrilling win against Gujarat in hopes of reviving their campaign.

Key players to watch include Punjab’s middle-order bats Shashank and Ashutosh, and their pacer Arshdeep Singh, who needs to snag more wickets. For Gujarat, the spotlight is on Gill for runs and Rashid Khan for tight overs.

Expect a run fest at this high-scoring venue as both teams battle it out this Sunday, each eager to assert dominance and turn their fortunes around in the league.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:

THE MATCHUP IS EVEN BETWEEN THESE TWO FRANCHISES.

 

VENUE STATS:

 HAVE WON ONLY ONE GAME IN THEIR HOME GROUND.

 

MILESTONE ALERT   :

100 - Harshal Patel is all set to play his 100th IPL game 

67 - Liam Livingstone (933) needs 67 runs to reach 1000 runs in IPL.

5 - David Miller (195) needs five fours to reach 200 fours in IPL

62 - Rahul Tewatia (938) needs 62 runs to reach 1000 runs in IPL

5- Vijay Shankar (45) needs five sixes to complete 50 IPL Sixes

4- Rashid Khan (146) is four wickets away from reaching 150 IPL Wickets.



BATTLES TO WATCH OUT FOR:
 

 

 

PITCH REPORT :

Badree: "Here we are at the new PCA Stadium in Mullanpur for PBKS vs GT. The dimensions today: 70m leg side, 63m off side, and 72m down the ground. Bowlers will favor the bigger side. All four matches here went to the final over, thrilling stuff. Seamers have taken 47 wickets, spinners just 9."

Katich: "The pitch offers pace, bounce, and swing for pacers early on, making it tough to score in the first 10 overs. MI's Sharma and Yadav showed how to build innings and accelerate later, reaching 192, the par score. Despite a 174 average first innings, today's surface looks better. PBKS' top order struggles reflect in their lower scores. Expect a close game, as 3 out of 4 clashes between these teams have gone to the wire."  




 

TOSS UPDATE:   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT FIRST   

 



Sam Curran   Skipper: "We are going to bat first. Looking to put some good runs on the board. Our record here has not been the best. This is the third time we are using this pitch. We will try to put pressure on the Gujarat Titans' bowling attack. That's the nature of IPL. It's such a big tournament; on a given day, anyone can win against any side. Absolutely. We know if we turn up with the right plans and attitude, we can win. It's about overseas players taking more responsibility and helping the Indian players. Shikhar Dhawan is still not playing. We have the same team as the last game."  
 

Shubman Gill  Skipper: "I was looking to bowl first. Looks like it's the same wicket as the last match (PBKS vs MI). Every game is important from now on. We've been inconsistent so far. We are keen to put on our best performances. We would look to keep them under 170. Just one change - Azmatullah Omarzai replaces Spencer Johnson (niggle)."

The Mullanpur stadium witnessed a dramatic comeback as Gujarat Titans snatched victory from the jaws of defeat against Punjab Kings. Chasing a below-par total of 143 runs, GT emerged triumphant by 3 wickets with 5 balls to spare, thanks to a late onslaught by the swashbuckling Rahul Tewatia. Opting to bat first, Punjab Kings got off to a promising start with openers Prabhsimran Singh and Sam Curran stitching together a 52-run partnership. However, their batting woes resurfaced as wickets fell in quick succession. The middle order failed to capitalize, leaving the team reeling at 99/7 after 16 overs. A late cameo from Harpreet Brar (29 runs off 12 balls) provided a much-needed boost, taking Punjab past the 140-run mark. The innings eventually folded for a meager 142 runs, with Sai Kishore wreaking havoc for Gujarat Titans, claiming a four-wicket haul. Mohit Sharma and Noor Ahmad chipped in with two wickets each, while Rashid Khan picked up one. Gujarat's chase began on a shaky note as they lost their prolific wicket-keeper batsman Wriddhiman Saha early on. However, the young guns Shubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan displayed maturity, consolidating the innings with a 40-run partnership. Just as GT seemed to be in control, Liam Livingstone rattled their batting order, dismissing the dangerous David Miller and the in-form Gill. With the score reading 89/4 and victory slipping away, Rahul Tewatia rose to the occasion. He played a blistering knock of 36 runs off just 18 balls, peppering the boundaries with his trademark sixes. His aggressive batting reignited Gujarat's hopes and put the pressure back on Punjab. Despite losing a couple of late wickets, GT secured a thrilling victory with 5 balls remaining, thanks to Tewatia's heroics.

 

 

Sam Curran   Skipper: "I believe we fell short by about 10-15 runs. The bowlers put in a remarkable effort, displaying exceptional commitment and determination, but it wasn't quite sufficient. The Afghanistan spinners are world-class bowlers and Sai Kishore bowled really well, credit to them. Despite this being the third match on this pitch, achieving anything above 160 would have been considered par. Prabhsimran's strong performance in the powerplay was noteworthy, but unfortunately, we lost momentum with a cluster of wickets thereafter. Moving forward, we understand the importance of winning every upcoming game."  

 

Shubman Gill  Skipper: "We would have preferred to close out the match a bit earlier, but securing those two points is always satisfying. Taking on the role of captaincy has been a thrilling experience for me, although there have been some challenges, particularly with the over-rate. When I'm batting, my focus is solely on playing my natural game without letting the captaincy responsibilities distract me. Regarding the incident with Livingstone, the decision I made to get out would have been the same whether I was captaining or not, and it wasn't influenced by any previous exchange."

 

Sai Kishore, Player of the Match :

"Just trying to give my 120% for the team, playing after 20-25 days, so just wanted to go there, enjoy myself and give my everything. Under Ashish Nehra's guidance, we've cultivated an environment where we can play fearlessly, irrespective of the outcome. He encouraged me to enjoy the game and express myself freely, which boosted my confidence. I sensed the conditions well and relied on change of pace, which proved effective. It was a collective effort from everyone, with Rahul delivering another stellar performance and Rashid and Noor bowling superbly. It feels great to contribute to such a cohesive team effort."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The heat is on, both literally and figuratively, as Kolkata Knight Riders   prepare to host Royal Challengers Bangalore   at the Eden Gardens.
KKR came into the match in a confident mood, sitting comfortably in the top half of the points table. Their batting has been a force to be reckoned with, with Sunil Narine's century still fresh in everyone's minds. Youngsters like Raghuvanshi are providing valuable support, while the experienced Andre Russell remains a constant threat. Bowling, however, has shown some inconsistency, with Mitchell Starc needing to tighten his grip in the death overs.

For RCB, it's a different story. They're languishing at the bottom after a string of demoralizing losses. Their bowling attack has been leaky, and their batting is heavily reliant on the brilliance of Virat Kohli and veteran Dinesh Karthik. Interestingly, RCB will be sporting their green jerseys, usually reserved for afternoon home games, hoping for a change in fortune.

The recent head-to-head record heavily favours KKR, who thrashed RCB by 7 wickets in their last encounter. 

HEAD TO HEAD:

KKR HAS THE EDGE AGAINST RCB. KKR ALSO WON THE REVERSE FIXTURE, THIS YEAR!

 

VENUE STATS:

EDEN GARDENS HAS ALWAYS BEEN A BATTING PARADISE. SINCE 2023, THE AVERAGE 1ST INNINGS SCORE IS 195 AND THE AVERAGE 1ST INNINGS WINNING SCORE IS 211.

  


Milestones Alert  

2- Virat Kohli (248) needs two sixes to complete 250 IPL Sixes
2- Faf du Plessis (398) is two boundaries away from reaching the milestone of 400 fours in IPL.
250- Dinesh Karthik will appear in his 250th IPL Game  
84- Shreyas Iyer (2916) needs just 84 runs to get to 3000 IPL runs
2- Philip Salt (48) needs two fours to complete 50 IPL fours.
4- Venkatesh Iyer (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL. 



PLAYER BATTLES  



Pitch Report | Sanjay Manjrekar & Graeme Swann 

Manjrekar: "I won't dwell on the scorching temperatures here because my colleagues will cover that extensively. Let's delve into recent history. Last time at Eden Gardens, Kolkata Knight Riders amassed 223, with Sunil Narine even reaching a century. Despite that, Rajasthan Royals successfully chased down the target. So, you'd expect a plethora of runs on this pitch. However, being an afternoon game alters the dynamics entirely. Let me quickly remind you of the boundaries: one short boundary to my right, roughly 61 meters, and to the left, 66 meters."

Swann: "Oh, it's incredibly hot out here today, a scorching 43 degrees in the middle. This pitch is going to feel the brunt of it. It's parched, very dry indeed. This strip has been used before, and there's one fascinating aspect I'd like to point out. Most of the pitch is fairly even, but there's this distinct band here in the good length area. It's a big circle of dryness, forming a slight arc across the wicket. The grass has been trimmed more in this section, making it a tad plainer than the rest. Whether this translates to drier conditions or more sun exposure remains to be seen. Spinners might find this intriguing as it's about a spinner's length. Bowling from that end could yield some movement, but overall, this pitch looks fantastic, and I anticipate a run-fest."
 

Manjrekar: "The burning question for an afternoon clash: win the toss, what's your call?"
 

Swann: "I'd opt to bat first. It might not be the popular choice as many prefer to chase, but considering the intense heat, it could prove to be a significant advantage. So, my vote goes to batting first." 

  



TOSS UPDATE :   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD FIRST 

 


 
Faf du Plessis  Skipper : "We've decided to chase. Eden Gardens has a history of favoring the chasing side, and we'll stick to that strategy today. We observed the conditions yesterday, and it did get cooler after a while, so we'll look to adapt accordingly. T20 cricket has evolved, and even conceding runs in the powerplay doesn't necessarily mean poor bowling. The key is to take wickets consistently, even if the opposition is scoring, and capitalize on the latter part of their innings." 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper: "Last time around, we played an afternoon game here, so we've got a good sense of how the pitch behaves. We'd have preferred to bowl first given the conditions, but now that we're batting, we'll focus on tiring them out in this sweltering heat. Our batsmen are in fine touch, so we'll aim to keep it simple and stick to the basics. No changes in our lineup. It's crucial to adapt quickly to the conditions, execute our plans, and play each ball on its merit. Let's stay focused on the present and adjust our target accordingly if the pitch conditions change."

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
KKR - 73/1 (14.6 rpo, 7x4, 3x6) || RCB - 47/4 (9.4 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

 

 

Amidst the electrifying atmosphere of the 'City of Joy', a thrilling cricket spectacle unfolded that will be etched in the memories of all who witnessed it. Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) engaged in a high-octane battle, culminating in a heart-stopping finish that saw KKR edge out by the slimmest of margins, a solitary run. The day commenced with KKR taking the crease first after RCB opted to field. The innings started on a shaky note with Sunil Narine returning to the pavilion early, managing only 10 runs off 15 balls. Despite Sunil Narine's early dismissal, Phil Salt set the stage ablaze. Displaying a masterclass in aggressive batting, Salt blazed through RCB's bowling lineup, hammering 48 runs from just 14 balls, electrifying the crowd with his audacious strokes. Though Angkrish Raghuvanshi and Venkatesh Iyer couldn’t make significant contributions, scoring 3 and 16 runs respectively, it was Shreyas Iyer who anchored the innings. Displaying maturity and finesse, Shreyas crafted a well-composed 50 off 36 balls. The innings was further bolstered by cameos from Rinku Singh, who added a quickfire 24, and the duo of Andre Russell and Ramandeep Singh, who remained not out, contributing 27 and 24 runs respectively to set a formidable target of 222/6 for RCB. As RCB began their chase, Virat Kohli launched an onslaught, albeit briefly, smashing 18 runs off just 7 balls before his dismissal. Faf du Plessis, usually reliable, faltered and was dismissed for 7, leaving RCB in a precarious position. However, the tide turned with Will Jacks and Rajat Patidar at the crease. The pair orchestrated a stunning display of batting, both reaching their fifties and adding over 100 runs together, momentarily putting RCB in a dominant position. But the game was far from over. Andre Russell, known for his knack for crucial breakthroughs, was introduced into the attack and delivered spectacularly by removing both set batters in a single over. This pivotal moment swung the momentum back in favour of KKR as RCB began losing wickets at regular intervals. Despite a valiant 25 from Dinesh Karthik, RCB found themselves needing 21 runs from the final over with Karn Sharma on strike. In an over that defined the term 'cliffhanger,' Sharma hammered Mitchell Starc for three sixes in four balls, dramatically reducing the equation to 3 runs needed from the final two deliveries. The penultimate ball saw Starc taking a stunning low catch off his own bowling to dismiss Sharma. With one ball left and the scores almost level, Lockie Ferguson came to the crease, managed to score only one run, and was run out while attempting the second run that would have tied the game. This last-ball thriller, where the match hung in balance till the final moment, was a showcase of cricket at its most exhilarating. The pendulum of fortune swung wildly before resting in KKR's favour, concluding a match that was nothing less than a saga of dramatic twists, individual brilliance, and nerve-wracking excitement.

 

 

Faf du Plessis  Skipper: "It was crazy, rules are rules. Virat and I thought that the ball was higher than the waist (on Kohli's dismissal). I guess they measured from the popping crease. One team thinks it's high, the other doesn't. That's how the game goes at times. Then the partnership, it was magnificent (on the Jacks-Patidar partnership), but when you don't win too many games, some sort of panic sets in and the Narine over was game-changing. You don't feel that you have time to settle down and bat (on the evolution of the IPL this season). The game doesn't allow it to do that; obviously, you have an extra batter, but in chases like these, you have to keep going. The match-up against Narine, I thought that was the game-changing over. The small things, I am actually proud of the boys tonight, the way we bowled and fielded. We did give away a couple of big overs towards the end, but I thought we kept them down to a par score. We thought we'll go hard in the batting powerplay, find those boundaries at the start of the innings. We were desperate, 10/10 from an effort perspective, the way we put up the effort on the ground, the faces told the story. We've got an unbelievable fanbase, we want to make them happy, we want them to have a smile on their face. We'll have to continue putting in our efforts and try to change things around." 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper: "It takes a lot off your body and drains you out completely because you go through so many emotions. It’s tough to stay calm but I’m elated. We got two points on the board and that’s all that matters. It’s extremely tough when the pressure is on; I feel that every individual should put their hands up and take the responsibility. Russell did that by picking up two wickets and completely changed the game in our favor; that kind of attitude is needed in the team. It’s a funny game, when you need 18 runs off 6 balls, the pressure is on the bowler. One six here and there, it completely changes the momentum. It is important that we maintain our calmness and stay in the present and make the batter hit where you want them to hit. We need to stick to our routines and processes and see to it that we execute the things we want. It was a pivotal knock; I wanted to stay till the end and steady the ship. We were losing wickets and I wanted to stay till the end and see it off. We got some important boundaries towards the end and I was very happy about that."

Andre Russell, Player of the match  :

"Thanks to the almighty. I always back my bowling as I said earlier. Getting the ball at a crucial time, I knew that I had to come good and thankfully it happened today. Happy for the two points. When I was batting earlier, change of pace was difficult to hit. As a bowler that’s what I wanted to do. The slower balls were gripping and holding. Was happy to get the two set batters out and I think that’s what changed the game. Those two wickets from Narine were also very important and that’s what started the slide for RCB. When I look at the bowling equation, I had two left and I conditioned myself to bowl that (19th) over. Tried to give Starc as many runs as I could. DK wasn’t getting off strike so I looked at bowling 6 deliveries to him and mix it up, thankfully it worked."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of TATA IPL 2024 match 35, which marks the end of the first half of the group stage. This is also the first match in Arun Jaitley stadium in this year's edition.  are riding a two-match winning streak and find themselves in a much better position after a shaky start. However, maintaining this momentum won't be a cakewalk, as their next challenge comes against the rampaging . SRH, fresh off setting a new IPL record for the highest total, are redefining T20 batting with their aggressive approach. Their bowling, however, has been a cause for concern. While Pat Cummins and T Natarajan have impressed so far, the rest of the attack has leaked runs. SRH will need to tighten things up if they want to continue their winning ways. For DC, bowling has been their trump card in recent wins. The Indian pace trio of Ishant Sharma, Khaleel Ahmed, and Mukesh Kumar have been firing on all cylinders. Spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel add further depth to a well-balanced attack. The arrival of Jake Fraser-McGurk has bolstered the DC batting line-up. He and the experienced duo of Rishabh Pant and Prithvi Shaw provide a solid foundation. However, a question mark hangs over David Warner's availability, which could be a concern for the Capitals. This match promises to be a thrilling battle between a resurgent DC bowling attack and a free-scoring SRH batting line-up. Can the Capitals contain the orange brigade's batting blitz? Or will SRH continue their record-breaking run? The Arun Jaitley Stadium is set to witness a high-octane encounter! 

HEAD TO HEAD:

have a 70% win rate against  in their last 10 meetings.


 

VENUE STATS:
In IPL 2023, the average 1st innings score is 176. However, the average 1st innings winning score is 196.   won only 1 game here last season!


 


PITCH REPORT:

Kevin Pietersen and Matthew Hayden: "A 67m boundary on one side and a very short boundary at 59m on the other. The straight boundary is at 74m. You can expect a run-fest tonight. This pitch looks completely different from what was served up last year. It suits the Delhi Capitals pacers, with plenty of grass, hardness, and carry. Both batters and bowlers will enjoy it, but bowlers will need to stick to their strengths despite the small dimensions. Dew could be a factor, so the captain winning the toss should opt to bowl first."
  
 

Milestones Alert :

9 - Rishabh Pant (141) needs nine sixes to get to 150 IPL Sixes
4 - Heinrich Klaasen (46) needs four fours to complete the milestone of 50 fours in the league.
4 - Abhishek Sharma (46) needs just four maximums to get to 50 IPL Sixes
31 - Axar Patel (1469) needs 31 runs to complete 1500 runs in IPL
1 - Bhuvneshwar Kumar (149) is one wicket away from completing 150 wickets for SRH in IPL 



PLAYER BATTLES  


 

 

TOSS:  WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD  

 

Rishabh Pant  Skipper: "We're going to bowl first. The wicket looks pretty good, and we prefer chasing because we're more of a batting unit with more batters. Dew might be a factor later on. The only thing we've emphasized is to "stay in the contest". While the opposition has been playing well, we can't afford to let them dominate. Regardless of the ground, we need to focus on playing good cricket. Lalit replaces Sumit, and Nortje comes in for Ishant, who had a back spasm just 5 minutes back."

 

Pat Cummins  Skipper: "We were also considering bowling first, as the wicket looks good. Given the way our boys have been batting, we expect the opposition to come hard at us. We're sticking with the same batting lineup and will assess the bowling options later on."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs):-
SRH - 125/0 (20.8 rpo, 13x4, 11x6) || DC - 88/2 (14.7 rpo, 13x4, 4x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
SRH - 80/4 (8.9 rpo, 2x4, 6x6) || DC - 78/4 (8.7 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
SRH - 61/3 (12.2 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || DC - 33/4 in 4.1 overs (7.9 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

 

The Arun Jaitley Stadium witnessed an extraordinary display of batting power by the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) as they obliterated the Delhi Capitals (DC) bowling attack! SRH, after being put to bat first, unleashed carnage from the get-go. The opening duo of Travis Head (89 off 32 balls) and Abhishek Sharma (46 off 12 balls) tore into the DC bowling, putting on a record-breaking 131-run partnership in just 38 balls! The powerplay was a nightmare for the Capitals as SRH amassed a staggering 125 runs. The onslaught continued with valuable contributions from Nitish Kumar Reddy (37 off 27 balls), Shahbaz Ahmed (59 off 29 balls), and Abdul Samad (13 off 8 balls). SRH finished their innings at a mammoth 266/7, the highest total in IPL history for the third time this season! Only the spin duo of Kuldeep Yadav (4-55) and Axar Patel (1-29) offered some resistance for DC. The pacers were taken to the cleaners, with Mukesh Kumar picking up a solitary wicket but conceding a lot of runs. Chasing a near-impossible target of 267, DC started brightly. Impact player Prithvi Shaw smashed four boundaries in the opening over but was dismissed cheaply by Washington Sundar. David Warner also departed early. However, Jake Fraser-McGurk (65 off 18 balls) and Abhishek Porel (42 off 22 balls) provided a glimmer of hope with their aggressive knocks. But the dismissal of Porel triggered a collapse, and DC were eventually bowled out for 199 in 19.1 overs.T Natarajan (4-19) was the wrecker-in-chief for SRH, picking up four crucial wickets. Nitish Kumar Reddy, Mayank Markande, Washington Sundar, and Bhuvneshwar Kumar chipped in with wickets as well. This comprehensive 67-run victory propels SRH to the second position in the points table. For DC, it's a bitter pill to swallow as they lose their first game at home. The match highlighted the destructive power of the SRH batting line-up and the need for DC to strengthen their bowling attack, especially their pace department.

 

 

Rishabh Pant  Skipper: "The decision to bowl first was mainly based on the expectation of dew, which didn't materialize. Even so, if we had limited them to 220-230, we would have had a chance. However, their strong powerplay performance, scoring 125 runs, put us on the back foot. The ball stopped more than anticipated in the second innings, making the chase challenging. Fraser-McGurk's batting has been outstanding, and as a team, we need to stay united and identify areas for improvement before the next game."

 

Pat Cummins  Skipper: "It's always great to maintain a good record here, and today's game was another fantastic display of cricket. The conditions didn't offer much to the bowlers in the powerplay, but they adapted well as the ball softened. Looking forward to our batting performance, although we'll need to bowl well in the second half. I'm pleased with the discipline shown by our bowlers; they executed their plans effectively."

 

Travis Head, Player of the match :

"It's really nice to see us continuing our winning streak. The team is performing well, and it's been a joy to be part of it. Personally, I've just been trying to stay relaxed and focus on hitting the ball. Keeping things simple and reacting to each delivery has been key for me. I'm delighted to be maintaining my form. Abhishek Sharma has been fantastic in the powerplay; he's aggressive against spin and it's great to see him doing well. Our team has a lot of depth, and everyone can contribute with both bat and ball. It's a luxury to have so many options, and that's what allows us to post such high scores. Our bowlers did a fantastic job tonight, especially in the powerplay. Personally, it's been nice to be back at the top of the order and getting back into the rhythm of T20 cricket."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Lucknow Super Giants are set to host Chennai Super Kings in match number 34 of the TATA IPL 2024 at Ekana Stadium in Lucknow on April 19th.

 

After losing their first game, Lucknow Super Giants won three consecutive matches but recently struggled to defend totals over 160 in their last two outings. This rollercoaster ride places them fifth on the points table with three wins and three losses. Nicholas Pooran and KL Rahul have been pivotal in the batting lineup, scoring 223 and 204 runs respectively. In the bowling arena, Yash Thakur leads with seven wickets, closely followed by Naveen-ul-Haq and Mayank Yadav, who have each taken six wickets. Lucknow Super Giants are eager to regain their momentum.

 

On the other side, Chennai Super Kings are riding high after clinching their first away win of the season against their arch-rivals, Mumbai Indians. Positioned third with four wins from six games, Chennai is keen to continue their strong performance. Shivam Dube has been a standout, accumulating 242 runs at an average of over 60. Meanwhile, skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad continues his consistent performance with 224 runs. Their bowling strength is significantly enhanced by the formidable death-over pair of Mustafizur Rahman and the young Matheesha Pathirana, with the former claiming 10 wickets in five innings and the latter adding eight in just three appearances.

 

Head-Tot-Head in IPL:
In the three games played between the two teams, both teams have managed to win once while the other one game has ended in no-result.

 

IPL Stats at Ekana Stadium:
In the 9 games played at the venue, pacers have picked up 71 wickets while the spin bowlers have managed to pick 52 wickets. Teams defending have the upper hand, having won six games while teams chasing have managed to win three games.

 

 


  PLAYER BATTLES   

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Kevin Pietersen and Aaron Finch: "The dimensions for today's match are 61 meters and 68 meters square, with a straight boundary of 76 meters. The pitch is made of red soil and appears drier than previous matches here. There are a couple of bare spots, but they shouldn't affect play significantly. I expect the pitch to hold a bit more due to its Wankhede-like appearance. Being inland, there may not be as much spin since the soil doesn't compact tightly. However, I anticipate it to play well overall. The new ball will be crucial, and finding wickets in the powerplay will be key on this surface. Bowlers may look to pitch it up more and seek movement off the fine green grass early on. Winning the toss and bowling first could be advantageous." 


MILESTONE ALERT  

7- Nicholas Pooran (1493) needs seven runs to complete 1500 runs in IPL
10- Krunal Pandya (140) needs 10 fours to complete 150 fours in IPL
5 - MS Dhoni (245) needs five sixes to complete 250 sixes in IPL
1- Moeen Ali (99) needs one catch to complete 100 T20 Catches




 

TOSS:  WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD 

 

KL RAHUL  SKIPPER: "We've decided to bowl first. The wicket looks good, and dew hasn't been a big factor, so hopefully, it stays that way for the entire game. We prefer knowing what we're chasing. There weren't any major blunders in our previous games, despite the big defeat against KKR. We're still pretty relaxed. I believe in maintaining a calm demeanour as a leader, as panicking can spread. Our support staff is excellent, and we're trying to keep things as relaxed as possible. The pitches have been relaid here, so each match can bring something different. We have one change: Joseph is out, and Matt Henry comes in."

 

RUTURAJ GAIKWAD  SKIPPER: "We would have bowled first. Batted well in the last game against MI, and defending that total was a big confidence boost for us. We don't want to get complacent and aim to maintain consistency. Personally, I've had a bit of luck with my batting, despite some unlucky dismissals in the first two matches. It feels good to be back and everyone is confident. Two changes: Mo comes in for Mitchell, and Deepak comes in for Shardul."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

CSK - 51/2 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || LSG - 54/0 (9 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
CSK - 54/3 (6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || LSG - 80/1 (8.8 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
CSK - 71/1 (14.2 rpo, 5x4, 6x6) || LSG - 46/1 in 19 overs (11.5 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)


 

The Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) snapped their losing streak and denied the Chennai Super Kings (CSK) a hat-trick of wins with a convincing 8-wicket thrashing at the Ekana Stadium! KL Rahul's astute decision to bowl first proved to be advantageous. CSK, with the help of a valiant 57* from Ravindra Jadeja and contributions from Ajinkya Rahane (36) and MS Dhoni (28* off 9), could manage a fighting total of 176/6. Krunal Pandya and Marcus Stoinis were the bowling stars for LSG, keeping the CSK batsmen in check. In response, Openers KL Rahul (82 off 53) and Quinton de Kock (54 off 43) stitched together a magnificent 134-run partnership to lay the foundation for victory. Even after de Kock's dismissal, Rahul continued his aggressive knock, but a sensational one-handed catch by Jadeja brought his innings to an end. Nicholas Pooran and Marcus Stoinis ensured a comfortable finish, securing the win for LSG with 1 over to spare. CSK's bowlers struggled to contain the LSG batsmen. Matheesha Pathirana (1/29 in 4 overs) offered some resistance. This win propels LSG to 8 points on the table, joining the likes of KKR, CSK, and SRH. Both CSK and LSG find themselves in the top five, with the reverse fixture scheduled for Tuesday in Chennai. This promises to be another exciting encounter as both teams look to solidify their position in the IPL 2024 standings!

 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad,  captain: "We finished well with the bat, considering the situation we were in. However, after the powerplay, we couldn't capitalize on the start and kept losing wickets at regular intervals. I believe we were 10-15 runs short of what we could have achieved. With the impact sub rule, you need extra runs. Pitches like these start off sluggish but improve with dew. 190 would have been a good score. One area we need to improve is taking wickets in the power play to put pressure on the opposition. It's good to play them again in the next game at Chepauk. We'll do our homework for the three upcoming home games."

 

KL Rahul,  captain and player of the match:"Feels good at the end of the day. When you win, most decisions feel right. We were committed to our plans, and I'm really happy with that. I deploy my bowlers based on the wicket, and we tried to mix it around. The bowlers executed really well, and the team is sticking to the plans. At the halfway stage, I would have been happy with 160, considering the slow wicket and grip. MSD walking in put pressure on the bowlers, as he has had that intimidation factor on opposition bowlers. Our young bowlers were under pressure with the crowd going berserk as well, giving the opposition 15-20 extra runs. I've been trying to assess the situation, and it came off today. I knew the CSK spinners would put pressure on, so I picked my bowlers accordingly. Quinton batted well too, making life easy for both of us. Playing in Chennai is a different ball game, especially in front of a mini Chennai crowd. As a young team, we're happy to play in front of such a crowd."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two teams at the bottom of the points table, separated only by a decimal in Net Run Rate, Punjab Kings  and Mumbai Indians , will clash in match number 33 of the TATA IPL 2024 at Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium, Mullanpur on April 18th.

 

Punjab Kings enter the fray grappling with consecutive losses in their last two matches. With four defeats out of six games, they sit in eighth place, just ahead of Mumbai Indians, who are ninth with a similar loss count. Notably, five of Punjab's six games have concluded in the last over, underscoring their "so close yet so far" scenario. Ashutosh Sharma and Shahsank Singh have been standout performers, averaging 47.5 and 73, respectively, with strike rates above 180. Arshdeep Singh and Kagiso Rabada lead their bowling attack, each having claimed nine wickets, followed by Sam Curran with eight.

 

Mumbai Indians, on the other hand, are reeling from a recent defeat against arch-rivals Chennai Super Kings. Sharing a similar plight as Punjab, Mumbai has secured only two wins in six games this season. Historically resilient, Mumbai Indians are eager to reverse their fortunes. Rohit Sharma's century in the last game, despite the loss, has been a highlight, making him the top scorer with 261 runs in six innings, while Ishan Kishan has contributed 184 runs. Jasprit Bumrah is crucial in their bowling lineup, having taken 10 wickets at an impressive economy rate of 6.08, with Gerald Coetzee adding nine wickets to his tally.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In 31 matches contested between the two teams, Mumbai Indians edge over Punjab Kings with 16 wins to 15 wins.

 

IPL Stats at Maharaja Yadavindra Singh Stadium:

In the three matches played at this venue, pacers have dominated the bowling stats, securing 33 wickets compared to just eight by the spinners. The average first-innings score here is 168. Out of these encounters, teams chasing have emerged victorious in two games, while the team defending a total has won once.

 

Milestones Alert:
68 -Liam Livingstone (932) needs 68 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL.
4 -Ashutosh Sharma (46) needs four fours to complete 50 fours in T20s.
86 -Tilak Varma (914) needs 86 runs to complete 1000 runs in the league.
60 -Hardik Pandya (2440) needs 60 runs to complete 2500 runs in IPL.
250 -Rohit Sharma is all set to play his 250th IPL game  
1 -Jitesh Sharma (49) needs one four to complete 50 fours in IPL.
2 -Suryakumar Yadav (298) is two hits away from reaching the milestone of 300 sixes in T20s.
 

 

Battle of Bigs To Watch Out For:

A key player matchup to watch in this game is between Rohit Sharma and Harshal Patel. Over six innings, Harshal has dismissed Rohit three times from 23 balls, conceding only 27 runs. Additionally, Shreyas Gopal has established a promising rhythm against Jonny Bairstow, having dismissed him once in 21 deliveries while also conceding 21 runs. These individual battles could play a pivotal role in determining the outcome of the match.

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Danny Morrison explained, "We have varied boundary lengths here: 70 meters towards the Western terrace or sunset, 63 meters to the Eastern side, and downtown at 72 meters. Another tricky aspect is the shorter boundaries behind the wicket, just 58 and 56 meters, which will have players strategizing. The pitch also has a bit of green, which I like."

Anjum Chopra added her perspective on the implications for the bowlers, "Given the pocket-sized boundaries, it's seemingly tough for the bowlers. However, this ground has been quite favourable for them. Yes, spinners have performed well, but it’s the seamers who really made a mark in the last game by hitting hard lengths and troubling the batters. The seamers have excelled, which isn't great news for the batters."

Danny also noted, "The average first innings score here is 168."

Anjum concluded, "While that's a decent score, teams might want a bit more on the board given the conditions. It's a good batting surface, but the visible grass will tempt the seam bowlers." 




TOSS UPDATE :  WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD  



Sam Curran   Skipper : "We've decided to bowl first, following the current trend here. Our goal is to bowl well and apply pressure from the start. The only concern right now is Shikhar Dhawan’s recovery; it's tough losing him, especially the close games. Despite this, we're getting a lot right at the moment. Jonny Bairstow misses out today, and Rilee Rossouw will take his place. Atharva Taide is also left out, just a couple of tactical changes to our lineup." 
 

Hardik Pandya  Skipper : "Actually, we wanted to bat first, so it's a good toss to lose. We've had our chances in previous games but failed to capitalize. The IPL really tests you. We're not being too harsh on ourselves; we need to accept things as they are and ensure we give our 100% every time we step out on the field. What's needed is for everyone to contribute, not just one individual. The team is really pumped up. We're putting the past results behind us and focusing solely on the process ahead."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs):-
MI - 54/1 (9 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || PBKS - 40/4 (6.7 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle overs (7-15 overs):-
MI - 76/1 (8.4 rpo, 4x4, 3x6) || PBKS - 101/3 (11.2 rpo, 5x4, 8x6)

Death overs (16-20 overs):-
MI - 62/5 (12.4 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || PBKS - 42/3 in 4.1 overs (10.24 rpo, 0x4, 4x6)

 

 

In a nail-biting finish, Mumbai Indians edged past Punjab Kings by a hair's breadth, securing their first away win of the season. After being put to bat first, MI faced early jitters with Kishan's dismissal. However, a solid partnership between Rohit and SKY steadied the ship. SKY then continued the momentum alongside Tilak Varma, adding another 49 runs. Late cameos from David and Pandya pushed the total to a respectable 193. Harshal Patel and Sam Curran kept things tight for Punjab with three and two wickets respectively, but the score proved challenging nonetheless. Punjab's chase began disastrously. They were in tatters at 14-4 after just 2.1 overs. Hope seemed lost as wickets continued to tumble, leaving them at a precarious 77-6 by the 10th over. Enter Ashutosh, the unlikely hero! In a stunning display of power hitting, he blazed a trail of destruction with a blistering 28-ball 61. Helicopter pulls, audacious sixes off Bumrah and Madhwal - Ashutosh, alongside Shashank, brought Punjab back into the contest. With MI gasping for air, victory seemed within reach for the Kings. But alas, it wasn't meant to be. Just when Punjab sniffed victory, Ashutosh holed out in the deep, leaving them 25 runs short of the target. The lower order couldn't manage the chase, and Mumbai's bowlers, led by the ever-reliable Bumrah, ensured their side crossed the finish line. Bumrah, with his miserly spells and crucial wickets, once again proved his worth as Mumbai's death-overs ace. Ashutosh's heroics and Shashank's gritty knock threatened to rewrite the script, but Bumrah remained unfazed. He also topped the purple cap list again . However, it was a fiery spell from the young Coetzee that ultimately swung the momentum back in Mumbai's favour. This match will be remembered for Ashutosh's valiant knock and another heart-breaking last-over defeat for Punjab Kings, their fourth in IPL 2024. 

 

Sam Curran,  captain: "It was a close one indeed. This team seems to thrive on close matches. Credit to Ashutosh for getting us so close; his effort was exceptional. Losing close games is always tough, especially when you've been losing early wickets consistently throughout the tournament. It's heartbreaking for the guys to come so close and still end up on the losing side. Ashutosh and Shashank showed incredible confidence in their game; Ashutosh's ability to sweep fast bowlers is impressive. Hopefully, we can turn these close encounters into wins and build some momentum. It's been a roller-coaster ride, winning one game and then losing the next. I'd rather lose close matches than get completely outplayed."

 

Hardik Pandya,  captain: "It was indeed a very good game of cricket. Everyone's nerves were put to the test. We discussed before the game that our character would be tested, and that's exactly what happened. Even though you feel you're ahead in the game, the IPL has a way of producing these close encounters. Ashutosh's knock was unbelievable - he was hitting almost every ball in the middle. I'm happy for him and excited for his future. During the timeout, we emphasized that it doesn't matter how good we look; we need to keep scrapping in this game. There were moments where we were a bit soft, but in the end, a win is a win." 



Jasprit Bumrah , Player of the Match: "It was a closer game than we anticipated. Naturally, as a bowler, you want to make an impact when conditions favour the ball. In this format, the ball swings for only a couple of overs, unlike Test cricket where I can bowl more and have a greater influence. T20 cricket presents challenges for bowlers due to time constraints and rules favouring impact players. The batting lineups also tend to become deeper, which is beyond our control. I try to relay messages to the bowlers when possible, but I also avoid overloading them with information during the heat of the moment."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Gujarat Titans are set to host Delhi Capitals in match number 32 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the iconic Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on April 17th.

 

Gujarat Titans enter the contest buoyed by a historic chase in their previous game, propelled by Shubman Gill's robust batting and a thrilling finish by Rashid Khan and Rahul Tewatia. Their tournament performance has been mixed, with three wins and three losses. Gill and Sai Sudharsan have been standout performers in the batting lineup, each scoring over 200 runs in six games with commendable strike rates. However, Mohit Sharma and Umesh Yadav, despite taking 8 and 7 wickets respectively, have struggled with high economy rates over 9. The confident Titans aim to extend their winning streak.

 

Delhi Capitals, placed second from the bottom with two wins in six games, come into this match after a scintillating victory against Lucknow Super Giants. They not only won but did so in spectacular fashion, becoming the first team to chase over 160 runs against LSG in the IPL. Debutant Jake Fraser McGurk made a sensational entry with a 35-ball 55, including five sixes, while Rishabh Pant and Tristan Stubbs continued their consistent run-scoring. Kuldeep Yadav's aggressive bowling was crucial in their last game. Despite their low ranking, DC is eager to climb the table by continuing to turn the tide in their favor.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the three matches played between the two teams, Gujarat Titans have managed to win twice while Delhi Capitals have won once. 

 

 

IPL Stats at Narendra Modi Stadium (Since 2022):
In the 14 matches played here at this venue since 2022, the pace bowlers have picked up 118 wickets while the spinners have managed to pick 49 wickets. Teams Batting first have won six games while the teams chasing have won 8 games. Average first batting score here is 184. 

 

 

 

Milestones Alert:
7 -David Warner (93) needs seven sixes to complete 100 sixes for DC in IPL.
5 -Rashid Khan (145) needs five wickets to get to 150 wickets in IPL.
8 -Shubman Gill (292) needs eight fours to complete 300 IPL fours.
5 -Vijay Shankar (45) needs five maximums to complete 50 sixes in IPL.
50 -Khaleel Ahmed is all set to play his 50th IPL game.
4 -Axar Patel (96) needs four catches to get to 100 catches in T20s.

 

 

Battle of Bigs to Watch Out For:
The matchup between David Warner and Umesh Yadav will be crucial in today's game, with Umesh Yadav having dismissed Warner five times across 11 innings, while conceding 99 runs from 68 deliveries. Additionally, the contest between Shubman Gill and Khaleel Ahmed also promises intrigue; in their four encounters, Gill has scored 38 runs off 25 balls but has been dismissed twice by Ahmed. These key battles could significantly influence the outcome of the match.

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Daren Ganga & Simon Katich: " We're on pitch 4 for the first time this season, which is composed of 100% black soil. This setup typically results in a great batting pitch, as there's little grass and it doesn't offer much turn for the spinners. The square boundaries measure 61m and 72m, while the straight hit extends to 75m. It's a scorching 41 degrees today, and with such high temperatures, dew might become a significant factor as the game progresses. This will definitely be something the captains consider when deciding whether to bat or bowl first after winning the toss". 

 

TOSS:
 WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD 

 

Rishabh Pant,  Skipper: "We've decided to bowl first. Given it's an unknown wicket and our batting lineup is strong, we prefer to chase. We anticipate some dew later, which could influence the game. We're focused on playing solid cricket, taking it one match at a time. While our death bowling has been a concern, our bowlers are improving with each game. We're aiming to build momentum. The team remains largely unchanged for this match, with David Warner sitting out and Sumit Kumar returning to the lineup."

 

Shubman Gill,  Skipper: "We would have chosen to bowl first as well, given it looks like a favorable wicket. Interestingly, there was no dew last night, and we're hoping for the same conditions today. Despite some losses, we've been playing well but just haven't capitalized on crucial moments. We're excited about the magnificent stadium atmosphere and the excellent support we expect here. We're making three changes to our lineup: Saha and Miller are back, and Sandeep Warrier will be making his debut, stepping in for Umesh Yadav."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-
GT - 30/4 (5 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || DC - 67/4 (11.2 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)

Middle overs (7-15 Overs):-
GT - 48/4 (5.3 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || DC - 25/0 in 2.5 overs (8.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

Death overs (16-20 Overs):-
GT - 11/2 in 1.3 overs( 7.33 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

 

The Delhi Capitals have put on a masterclass performance, dismantling the Gujarat Titans in all facets of the game! Bowling, fielding, and captaincy - everything clicked for Delhi today. Rishabh Pant's decision to bowl first, though initially hesitant, proved to be a stroke of genius. The Delhi bowlers, led by the experienced Ishant Sharma, exploited the slow pitch conditions perfectly. Some deliveries kept low, creating problems for the GT batsmen. While the spinners found some grip, the majority of the GT dismissals were self-inflicted due to poor shot selection. This is Gujarat Titans' lowest total in IPL history! Their previous lowest score of 125, coincidentally, also came against Delhi Capitals in Ahmedabad last year. Rashid Khan's valiant 31 was a lone bright spot in an otherwise disastrous batting display for GT. Mukesh Kumar emerged as the star bowler for Delhi, grabbing a well-deserved three wickets for a mere 14 runs. Fraser-McGurk, the young opener, threatened a quick chase but was dismissed by Spencer Johnson. Sandeep Warrier chipped in with a couple of wickets as well. Delhi, always keeping an eye on the Net Run Rate, ensured they wrapped up the innings quickly. They finished the chase in just 8.5 overs, giving their NRR a significant boost while simultaneously depleting Gujarat's. This comprehensive victory sees a massive shakeup in the points table! The Capitals climb from ninth to a much more comfortable sixth position, while the Titans slide down from sixth to seventh. A big day for Delhi, a day to forget for Gujarat!

 

 

 

Rishabh Pant,  Skipper and Player of the match: "There's a lot to be pleased about today. We've been focusing on adopting a champion's mindset, and I'm really happy to see our team embody that on the field. Our bowling was definitely one of the best performances thus far. It's still early in the tournament, so there's room for individual improvement. My main focus, coming back from rehab, was just to return better than before. Before the chase, we discussed aggressively going after the target to make up for earlier losses in run rate. We love playing in Ahmedabad—the stadium and the vibe here are fantastic, and we're looking forward to more games in this environment. Right now, we want to enjoy this victory, take it one game at a time, and continue learning and improving."

 

Shubman Gill,  Skipper: "Our batting was quite average today, and it's crucial that we move past this and come back stronger. The pitch itself was alright; the dismissals were more about poor shot selection than anything else. With the opposition chasing just 89, they were obviously in a strong position—unless we had something extraordinary like a double hat-trick. We're only at the halfway mark of the season, having won three games so far. Based on our track record from the last couple of years, we're hopeful to secure another 5-6 wins from our next seven matches."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two teams at the top of the points table, Kolkata Knight Riders  and Rajasthan Royals , will face off in match number 31 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the historic Eden Gardens on April 16th. Both teams enter the contest fresh off victories in their previous fixtures.

 

Kolkata Knight Riders are currently second in the table, having won four out of their five games; their sole loss came against Chennai Super Kings in their fourth game. The strategy of opening with Sunil Narine has paid dividends in the early stages of the games, as he has scored 167 runs in five games, averaging over 33 with a strike rate above 180. His opening partner, Phil Salt, has been the leading run-scorer for the team, amassing 191 runs at an average of 47.25. Their bowling unit has been robust, led by Vaibhav Arora and Andre Russell, who have claimed 6 wickets in three and five games, respectively. Mitchell Starc regained his form in the last game, picking up three wickets. They aim to maintain their winning streak.

 

On the other hand, Rajasthan Royals enter the contest riding high on confidence, having won five of their six games, currently holding the top position in the table. Riyan Parag has been a key player, contributing 284 runs in six innings at an average of 71. Captain Sanju Samson has also been in fine form, scoring 266 runs. Their bowling attack is spearheaded by Yuzvendra Chahal, who has taken 11 wickets in six games and is close to reaching the milestone of 200 IPL wickets. Trent Boult and Nandre Burger each have taken six wickets. The table-topping Rajasthan Royals will look to extend their winning run in this upcoming game.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the 27 games contested against between the two, KKR edge with 14 wins to RR's 13 wins.

 

IPL Stats at Eden Gardens (Since 2022)
In the 11 matches played at Eden Gardens since 2022, pace bowlers have claimed 68 wickets at an average of 34.31, while spinners have taken 53 wickets at an average of 31. Teams defending a total have had a slight advantage over those chasing, with six wins compared to five. The average first-innings score at this venue is 193.

 

 

Milestones Alert:

2 -Yuzvendra Chahal (198) is just two wickets away from reaching the milestone of 200 IPL Wickets.
5 -Riyan Parag (45) needs five maximums to complete 50 sixes in IPL.
95 -Shreyas Iyer (2905) needs 95 more runs to complete 3000 runs in IPL.
3 -Philip Salt (47) needs three fours to complete the milestone of 50 fours in the league.
7 -Sanju Samson (193) needs seven sixes to complete 200 sixes in IPL.
1 -Yashasvi Jaiswal (49) is one hit away from completing 50 maximums in IPL. 

 

Pitch Report | Samuel Badree and Michael Clarke

Badree: "We're back in the City of Joy for match number 31 of the IPL. It's a clash of the table-toppers, promising a high-octane match. The field dimensions here vary significantly, with a 12-meter difference square of the wicket—59 meters to the right and 71 meters to the left, with the straight boundary at 75 meters. Bowlers will likely focus on defending the bigger side. Michael, we've seen diverse outcomes here; what's your take on today's pitch?"

Clarke: "The conditions are similar to the previous game. We thought 190 was a standard score during the day. Tonight, dew will likely play a role, making teams prefer chasing. It’s a fantastic surface, complemented by a very quick outfield and fairly even boundaries. It’s an excellent pitch that favors batting at any point, especially with the new ball when the pitch is hardest."

Badree: "Considering the impact of bowlers like Sunil Narine, who has been economical here, how should teams approach facing him?"

Clarke: "Narine stands out as a key bowler for KKR, challenging batters who struggle to read him. The key against him is to watch his hand closely. Batters must pick the ball from his hand, which is easier said than done but essential for success against his spin."

 

  



TOSS:   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD 

 


Sanju Samson  Skipper :   "We've chosen to bowl first. The pitch looks good and seems like it will improve for batting as the match goes on. I’m thrilled to be back at Eden Gardens; it’s always been a positive place for us. We’re excited to have Jos and Ash bhai back in the lineup for tonight’s game."


Shreyas Iyer   Skipper:  "It was not just a kiss; it was a flying kiss to the coin before the toss. I also wanted to bowl first, especially after noticing some seam movement on the last ball in the previous game, suggesting the pitch has a lot to offer the bowlers. Sunil Narine is a crucial part of our bowling lineup. He’s difficult to read, always keeps a poker face, and we rely on him greatly. We’re fielding the same team today, hoping for strong performance

In an IPL match for the ages, the Rajasthan Royals (RR) pulled off a stunning victory at Eden Gardens, successfully chasing a colossal target of 224 set by Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). It was a night of spectacular performances and heart-stopping moments culminating in a last-ball thriller. The game kicked off with KKR's decision to bat first, a move that saw Sunil Narine stepping up in a big way. The Trinidadian exploded with a fiery century, scoring 109 runs that included a barrage of boundaries. His maiden IPL century left the Royals' spinners, including veterans like Ashwin and Chahal, scrambling for answers. Rajasthan's chase began promisingly with Yashasvi Jaiswal giving the team a brisk start. However, the innings soon encountered turbulence as wickets fell at regular intervals. Sanju Samson and Riyan Parag tried to stabilize the inning with Buttler on one end, but their efforts were insufficient to keep the required rate in check. Just when all seemed lost, Jos Buttler took charge in a display of sheer determination and skill. Alongside Rovman Powell, who contributed with a quickfire cameo, Buttler steered the chase back on track. The duo's vital partnership breathed new life into RR's innings, setting the stage for a dramatic finale. The match reached its climax in the final over. Buttler, standing firm and undeterred, struck a crucial six early in the over before playing it smart with a calculated single in the last ball. 

 


Shreyas Iyer   Skipper: “It’s a tough pill to swallow. I didn’t foresee this scenario. Cricket’s unpredictable nature struck again. Despite the setback, it’s a learning curve for us. Narine was exceptional with his momentum-building innings at the top. With Buttler striking cleanly, we tried slowing it down by giving Varun the last over, hoping the lack of pace would help, but it’s challenging with five inside the circle. We need to relax, reflect, and come back stronger after a tough, humid game.” 
 

Sanju Samson Skipper : “We’re thrilled with the win despite the early wickets we lost. Rovman Powell’s crucial hits and Jos Buttler’s consistent brilliance were instrumental. Facing quality spinners like Narine and Varun on this pitch was tough, but lucky breaks helped us stay in the hunt. Buttler’s innings, as always, was transformative, maintaining our belief in chasing any target.” 

PLAYER OF THE MATCH: JOS BUTTLER

Jos Buttler (Player of the Match): “Maintaining belief was key today, especially when I struggled for rhythm. Whenever doubts crept in, I focused on positivity. Staying calm is crucial, as unexpected outcomes are common in the IPL. Sangakkara’s advice to stay patient and wait for the momentum to shift has been invaluable. This innings, staying not out and clinching the win, is one of my most satisfying.”
