Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The finalist of the 2016 IPL, Royal Challengers Bengaluru , are gearing up to host the champions from the same year, Sunrisers Hyderabad , in match number 30 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on April 15th.

 

Royal Challengers Bengaluru, the hosts, enter the contest with a dismal performance so far in the tournament, having lost five of their six games. They are currently at the bottom of the table, and another loss could make them strong contenders for elimination. A major concern for them has been the bowling department, which has managed to secure only 25 wickets in six games—tying with their counterparts, who have played one game fewer. Kohli, Dinesh Karthik, and Faf du Plessis have been the standout performers with the bat. The team has experimented with more than 15 players in an attempt to find the right combination. RCB will look to bounce back and see every match as an opportunity to improve their standings in the tournament.

 

On the other hand, Sunrisers Hyderabad enters the contest riding high on confidence, positioned in the upper half of the table with three wins out of five games. Their batters have demonstrated skillful, ruthless power-hitting abilities, while their bowlers have consistently come to the rescue in tight situations. Pat Cummins has been impactful as a leader, making smart decisions complemented by his aggressive bowling. SRH aims to maintain their winning streak as they head into this contest.

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In as many as 22 games battled between the two, Sunrisers Hyderabad edge over RCB with 12 wins to RCB's 10 wins.

 

IPL Stats at M.Chinnaswamy Stadium ( since 2023):
In the 10 games played at this venue, the outcomes have been evenly split, with teams batting first and those chasing each securing five wins. Pace bowlers have dominated the wicket tally, capturing 78 scalps, compared to spinners who have managed to pick up 35 wickets. The average score for teams batting first here is 191.

 
 

 

Milestones Alert:
36 - Abdul Samad (464) needs 36 runs to complete 500 runs for SRH in IPL.
50 - Abhishek Sharma is all set to play his 50th IPL game for SRH
1 - Bhuvneshwar Kumar (149) is one wicket away from reaching the milestone of 150 wickets for SRH in IPL.
3 - Mohammed Siraj (147) needs three wickets to complete 150 T20 Wickets.
7 - Faf du Plessis (343) needs seven sixes to complete 350 T20 Sixes
4 - Virat Kohli (246) is four 6s away from completing 250 maximums in IPL. 

Pitch Report | Kevin Pietersen & Aaron Finch

Kevin Pietersen:"This is a crucial match for the home team in match 30 of the IPL. If they lose, expect drama. It's interesting, the boundary dimensions here—57 meters off-side, 64 meters leg side, and 69 meters straight—are so compact they hardly impact the game."

Aaron Finch: "Looking at the pitch, there’s a lot of green grass, albeit patchy. This means for fast bowlers, some balls will zip and others will skid with the new ball. More intriguing is the amount of spin we've seen here this season, more than any other venue. The pitch, with its dry spin and cracking surface, will likely favor the spinners as the game progresses. While there's some dew, it’s not as significant as Wankhede, favoring the team batting second."



TOSS: WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD  

 

 

Faf du Plessis|  Skipper: "We're set for a chase tonight, which has been typical this season. The pitch has been a bit slower. Honestly, we haven't played our best cricket yet. It often feels like we're not reaching our full potential. To shake things up, we're making some changes. Maxwell and Siraj are sitting out, with Ferguson stepping in, hoping these adjustments can turn things around for us." 
 

Pat Cummins|  Skipper: "The way we have approached the games has resulted in some great victories. It's T20 cricket; you can't win every match. We are going into this game with the same team as the last one. Here at the Chinnaswamy, even a score of 240 can seem just par."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

SRH - 76/0 (12.7 rpo, 5x4, 6x6) || RCB - 79/0 (13.2 rpo, 11x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-
SRH - 75/1 (15 rpo, 5x4, 6x6) || RCB - 75/1 (15 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)  
 

In a night of record-shattering batsmanship, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Sunrisers Hyderabad turned the M Chinnaswamy Stadium into a run-fest, with a combined total of 549 runs - the highest ever scored in a single T20 match. Despite their valiant effort, RCB fell short by 25 runs while chasing down a mammoth 288 set by SRH.A brutal opening assault laid the foundation for Hyderabad's victory. Travis Head, in particular, was unstoppable, reaching his century in a mere 39 balls - the fourth-fastest in IPL history. The carnage continued as Heinrich Klaasen blitzed his way to a 23-ball fifty. Later cameos from Aiden Markram and the big-hitting Abdul Samad ensured SRH crossed the 280-run mark with ease, posting a record-breaking total of 287.RCB's chase started brightly with Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli taking the attack to the bowlers. However, Kohli's dismissal triggered a collapse, and wickets quickly fell. Mayank Markande, the impactful substitute, and Pat Cummins stifled the chase with crucial wickets despite the pitch offering minimal assistance. Dinesh Karthik, though, provided a lone fightback with a scintillating 83 off just 35 balls, but his knock lacked support from the other end.

This match will be forever remembered for the sheer volume of runs scored. With a staggering 549 runs amassed, it rewrote the record books for the highest-scoring T20 match ever witnessed.

 

 

 

Travis Head (Man of the Match): "After my innings, I took a shower and enjoyed some good food. The pitch played beautifully today. We received some insights from the groundsmen and knew we needed to adapt during the initial six overs. Our batting order was set up nicely, giving everyone the freedom to aggressively target the bowlers. Abhishek Sharma and I have a great partnership; we really complement each other and boost each other’s confidence. I’m really enjoying batting alongside him. As for how to bowl to me, I'm not sure there’s a straightforward strategy. Bowlers have tried various approaches, but nothing specific has stood out. While my technique might not be the prettiest, I’m really pleased with how I struck the ball today."

 

Pat Cummins(SRH Skipper):"I sometimes wish I was a batter, especially after a game like today. We had a similar experience against Mumbai, and I thought it wouldn't happen again, but here we are. You do your best as a bowler. Even an over where you concede just seven or eight runs can really impact the match significantly. Honestly, I've stopped trying to predict how pitches will play here at Chinnaswamy. Despite appearances, they often turn out to be fantastic for batting. We've secured four wins so far. It's really the freedom with which our players are performing that's been the highlight. It’s great to see them continue to play with such liberty, and I’m really pleased with how everyone is performing."

 

Faf du Plessis(RCB Skipper): "Yeah, it was definitely a quintessential T20 pitch. The amount of runs scored today was extraordinary, possibly a world record. So credit to us for staying in the fight and trying to keep up, although 270 isn't too far off. Behind the scenes, we've been experimenting with different strategies to find what works best, but it's been tough. Cricket can be a merciless game. When you're struggling with confidence, there's really nowhere to hide on the field. We've been tweaking our approach, like incorporating leg spin in the middle overs. In terms of batting, we've pinpointed areas where we need to push harder, especially after the powerplay considering the high scores. Despite the resilience the team has shown, giving up 30-40 extra runs in our bowling was pivotal. After a game like this, it's crucial to take a break and clear our heads. The mental strain of such defeats is significant, and right now, it feels like we're facing an uphill battle."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The upcoming clash between and at the Wankhede Stadium in the 2024 IPL is set to be a thrilling encounter. After a rocky start to the season, MI has managed to find some form, securing their first win against Delhi Capitals and following it up with another impressive win over Royal Challengers Bangalore. This resurgence could provide them with the necessary confidence and momentum as they face a formidable opponent.

, the defending champions led by Ruturaj Gaikwad, are also in good form, positioned third in the points table with six points. Coming off a victory against Kolkata Knight Riders, CSK will be eager to continue their winning streak. The match against MI, one of their traditional rivals, is always a high-stakes game, adding an extra layer of intensity and excitement.

Both teams are likely to bring their best to this game, aiming to continue their recovery and climb up the points table, while CSK will look to solidify their position in the top tier of the standings. The Wankhede Stadium, known for its lively atmosphere and conducive pitch for high-scoring games, will be the perfect backdrop for what promises to be an enthralling match. Fans can expect a closely contested game with both teams striving to outdo the other in this iconic rivalry.

 

 

  VS    HEAD TO HEAD: 

 

The head-to-head record between and  in the IPL reveals a competitive rivalry, with 36 matches played between the two teams. Mumbai Indians hold a slight edge in this rivalry, having won 20 of these encounters, while Chennai Super Kings have secured 16 victories.

 

 

Player Milestones :

PITCH REPORT: 
Kevin Pietersen & Ian Bishop: " The expectation is for a lot of power hitting because the pitch we are on has the same dimensions as the RCB vs MI game. The shorter boundary to the left is only about 59m, and it is 65m to the right. The previous game here was a high-scoring game, but when you venture longer into the tournament the wickets tend to play a bit differently. This surface is a lot drier and when you use the same pitch consecutively then the wicket will show some semblance of dry patches. It still looks like a beautiful wicket".
 

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to first

 


Hardik Pandya,  Skipper: "We would like to bowl first, dew will come into play. It (pitch) looks better than the last game, expecting a lot of runs. Need to stick to the basics. Winning is very important to get the momentum. We were able to win two games convincingly."

 
Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: "  Same. We Would have bowled first too, toss is something we can't control. Need to do well in all three departments. IPL's nature is always fluctuating. Good contest for both teams. The team playing better will win. Pathirana comes in for Theekshana, that's the only change."

In a thrilling IPL encounter,  defeated the Mumbai Indians by 20 runs. CSK set a challenging target of 206-4 after being put into bat. Key contributions came from Ruturaj Gaikwad, who scored a vibrant 69 off 40 balls, and Shivam Dube, who remained unbeaten on 66 from 38 deliveries. 

, in their chase, were bolstered by a magnificent unbeaten 105 from captain Rohit Sharma. However, the rest of the batting lineup couldn't capitalize, with only Ishan Kishan (23) and Tilak Varma (31) getting starts but failing to convert them into significant innings. CSK's bowlers, led by Matheesha Pathirana with four wickets, kept the pressure on throughout, restricting MI to 186-6.

's strategy of aggressive batting in the final overs and tight, disciplined bowling, particularly in the death overs, proved to be the deciding factors in this high-scoring game.

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "The target was definitely gettable, but they bowled pretty well. I feel Pathirana was the difference. They were smart with their plans and their approach. There's a man behind the stumps who tells them what's working, and that helps. The pitch was holding up a bit and getting difficult. It was about batting well and keeping the intent. We were going quite well in the run chase till Pathirana came into the attack and took those two wickets."

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: "  The young wicketkeeper scoring those three sixes helped us a lot, that proved to be the difference. We needed those 10-15 extra runs for this kind of venue. In the middle phase, Bumrah bowled really well. I feel we were spot on with our execution with the ball despite them scoring some great shots. I would have taken 6 overs 60 at the powerplay. You need to be on the mark with bowling and batting at this venue. Our Malinga bowled well today, he nailed those Yorkers. Not to forget, Tushar and Shardul also did well. I think we need to keep it simple, encourage all to be in a good headspace and continue the same way."
 

 

 

Matheesha Pathirana is Player of the Match 


Matheesha Pathirana: "    I was pretty nervous When we were bowling in the powerplay. MSD told me to keep calm and that gave me confidence. I don't think too much about results, just concerned with my execution. If I execute, I will get my rewards. Sometimes I have to change my plans depending on the batters. The support staff all backed me during injury and that's been the main reason for my form."

The first match of the double-header concluded with KKR successfully chasing down the target. On a sunny afternoon, the home captain, Shreyas Iyer, won the toss and opted to bowl. 's bowlers started strong, taking a few wickets during the powerplay. KL Rahul contributed 39 off 27 balls, but the team struggled to maintain a high run rate on what was otherwise a batter-friendly pitch. For , Nicholas Pooran added a quick 45 off 32 to help set a target of 162 runs. Mitchell Starc stood out with the ball, taking 3 wickets for just 28 runs. In the chase, Phil Salt devastated the bowling attack with an unbeaten 89 off 47 balls. Despite losing two quick wickets midway, Shreyas Iyer's steady 38 runs from as many balls guided KKR to a win.

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "One of those days, it was a proper hammering. Games like these are tough to digest and we have seen in IPL and every team goes through that. We will try and work out what went wrong and come back better. The ball started nipping around a lot more in the second innings, the shots that we played in the first innings, didn't execute well and kept losing wickets in bunches we could have got a lot more runs and that's where we missed and lost the game."


Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "  Pretty much comprehensive victory. Fielded well and bowled well. Was important to bowl slower ones as much as possible because of the heat and the wicket becoming dry. We executed phenomenally well. When we got wickets, it gave us the advantage to come in and put an attacking effort. Character and attitude bowlers showed was exceptional."

 

 

Phil Salt is Player of the Match 


Phil Salt: "  Good to get another win home. Before the lights came on, it was a bit slower. After the lights came on, there was some moisture and it quickened up. I've loved it."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The eighth-placed Punjab Kings  are gearing up to host their storied rivals and the current table-toppers, Rajasthan Royals , in match number 27 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the Maharaja Yadavindra International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur, Chandigarh.

 

Rajasthan Royals enter the contest topping the table, despite a recent loss to GT in their previous fixture. Riyan Parag has been their standout batter, amassing 261 runs in five innings, including three half-centuries. Jos Buttler and Sanju Samson have also been significant contributors with the bat. In the bowling department, Yuzvendra Chahal leads with 10 wickets, supported by Nandre Burger, who has claimed six scalps. The team has performed brilliantly as a unit, with all players contributing in various situations. The Royals will be eager to return to their winning ways.

 

Punjab Kings, on the other hand, have had a topsy-turvy tournament, winning two games and losing three. They are currently placed eighth in the table, but their performance has been more impressive than their position suggests, with four of their five games ending in last-over dramas. Ashutosh Sharma and Shashank Singh have shown glimpses of their potential with powerful hitting down the order in high-stakes matches. Their bowling lineup has seen balanced contributions from Arshdeep Singh, Kagiso Rabada, Sam Curran, and Harshal Patel, with tallies of 8, 7, 6, and 6 wickets respectively across five games. Desperate for a win, PBKS will also be looking to bounce back to their winning ways.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the 26 encounters between the two teams, Rajasthan Royals (RR) hold the edge over Punjab Kings (PBKS) with 15 wins to their 11.

 

 

Milestones Alert:
3 - Yuzvendra Chahal (197) needs three wickets to reach the milestone of 200 IPL Wickets.
6 - Jonny Bairstow (144) needs six fours to complete 150 fours in IPL.
2 - Sam Curran (48) needs two wickets to complete 50 wickets in IPL.
8 - Sanju Samson (192) needs eight sixes to complete 200 sixes in IPL.
1 - Yashasvi Jaiswal (49) is one hit away from reaching the milestone of 50 IPL Sixes.
6 - Riyan Parag (44) needs six maximums to complete 50 sixes in IPL

 

Venue Stats:

Won Batting 1st - 1

Won Batting 2nd - 1

Average 1st Innings Score - 178

 

 

& JOURNEY SO FAR : 

 

:  L W L L W

 

:  L W W W W

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Darren Ganga: " We are back to Pitch Number 4, which was used for the Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals fixture. 75m hit straight down the ground. 67m square boundary to one side, 64m to the other. The shortest and longest pockets are 60m and 73m, respectively. There is a tinge of green grass on the surface and the pitch is 100% black soil. The pacers to get seam movement and be dominant".

 

 

TOSS:
  has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: " We'll field first, it looks like a decent wicket to bowl first. We've made a target to not think about the goal, focus on the process, work on building the team and we're doing a good job. A lot of challenges outside as well, we've many players missing from tonight's match. Jos Buttler isn't 100%, Ashwin bhai is having a niggle, so Rovman and Kotian come into the eleven."


Sam Curran, Skipper: " Shikhar picked up a niggle, that's why I'm here. We would have fielded first as well, but we'll now have to put the runs on the board. The balance has been good, we'd have liked to win a few more matches, but the middle-order looks good, especially Shashank and Ashutosh. We've got exciting players and plenty of quality. We've Taide coming in for Shikhar tonight."

PBKS- 38/1 (6.3 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  ||  RR- 43/0 (7.1 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

PBKS- 48/4 (5.3 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)  ||  RR- 56/3 (6.2 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

 

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-

PBKS- 61/2 (12.2 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)  ||  RR- 53/4 (10.6 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

 

 

In a closely contested IPL match, secured a 3-wicket victory against with just one ball to spare. Punjab Kings set a target of 148 runs after being put into bat first. Their innings ended at 147 for 8 wickets in the allocated 20 overs. Key contributions came from Jitesh Sharma, who scored 29 runs off 24 balls, and Atharva Taide and Jonny Bairstow, both of whom scored 15 runs each. Rajasthan Royals' bowlers, including Avesh Khan and Trent Boult, were notable for their tight bowling, picking up crucial wickets and maintaining economic rates.

Chasing the target, Rajasthan Royals managed to reach 152 for 7 in 19.5 overs. Yashasvi Jaiswal was the top scorer with 39 runs off 28 balls, while Shimron Hetmyer provided a crucial unbeaten 27 from 10 deliveries towards the end, ensuring the win. Punjab Kings’ bowlers, particularly Kagiso Rabada and Sam Curran, tried to defend the total with Rabada taking key wickets early on. However, Rajasthan's lower order managed to scrape through, thanks to Hetmyer's late fireworks.

The match was marked by tight bowling and strategic batting, reflecting the balanced nature of the game. Rajasthan's ability to maintain wicket partnerships and some critical fielding efforts, including a run-out, were significant in their victory.

 

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: " The wicket was a little slow, but we failed to start well with the bat and didn't end well. It was a good effort from the lower order, getting to 150 was excellent. The bowling was good, we kept things tight, but unfortunately another close loss. We stuck to our plans, bowled and fielded well, and I am confident we will bounce back in the next game."

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: " We had fee funny instances from last year and this year while taking high catches. But I am really happy that everyone is eager to go and catch it. The stadium is full of noise and we can't look who is coming for the catch. I need to tell my fast bowlers that it's easier to catch with the gloves and let me do it. Against Punjab in the last 3-4 years, every game is very close. They bowled well, it was a funny game going from here to there. Hetmyer has been doing it for years and years, experience and composure is the key."

 

 

Shimron Hetmyer is Player of the Match 


Shimron Hetmyer: "  It's just practice, I try as much as possible in the nets. I try my best to hit maximums. I am happy that I helped my team today. There was creeping in the first couple of balls, afterwards, I tried to keep it as clear as possible and it paid off."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Lucknow Super Giants  are gearing up to host Delhi Capitals in match number 26 of the TATA IPL 2024 at the Ekana Stadium on April 12th.

 

Delhi Capitals enter the contest after a series of disappointing performances, having secured only one win in their five games. Positioned at the bottom of the points table, they are desperate for a turnaround. Rishabh Pant, returning to the tournament after a year's hiatus, has been a notable performer. Tristan Stubbs leads their batting charts with 174 runs from five innings, followed by Warner and Pant who have contributed 158 and 153 runs, respectively. Prithvi Shaw displayed promising hitting against MI, but it only narrowed the margin of defeat. Their bowling has consistently let them down, with Khaleel Ahmed and Anrich Nortje leading the wicket tally at seven and six wickets, respectively. Every game hereon is critical for Delhi's progression in the tournament.

 

Lucknow Super Giants, on the other hand, come into this match riding a wave of confidence after establishing home dominance. Winning three of their four games, they are well-placed third in the points table. Nicholas Pooran and Quinton de Kock are key players in their batting lineup, amassing 178 and 145 runs respectively across four games, while KL Rahul has also contributed 126 runs. Yash Thakur and Mayank Yadav have been impressive with the ball, each taking six wickets in their three outings. Thakur's fearsome bowling was instrumental in defending 163 against GT, marking their first win against them. Confident Lucknow aims to continue their winning streak.

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:
In the three games battled between the two teams, Lucknow Super Giants have emrged victorious on all occasions while Delhi Capitals are yet to open their win account.

 

 

IPL Stats At Ekana Stadium:
In the 8 matches played at this venue, pacers have found themselves in a better position, picking up 65 wickets at an average of 22.20. Meanwhile, spinners have managed to claim 47 wickets, averaging 22.63. Teams defending have won six games while the teams chasing has won two games. One game has not yielded result. Average first batting score is 156.

 

 

Milestones Alert:
9 - Rishabh Pant (2991) needs nine runs to complete 3000 runs in IPL.
52 - Nicholas Pooran (1448) needs 52 runs to complete 1500 IPL runs.
4 - Marcus Stoinis (46) needs four maximums to complete 50 sixes for Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL.
7 - David Warner (93) is seven sixes away from reaching the milestone of 100 sixes for DC in IPL.

 

AND  JOURNEY SO FAR: 

 

 : W W W L

 

  : L L W L L

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sunil Gavaskar and Graeme Swann.: " We are in the land of the Super Giants, one thing we have got here is a giant boundary - 73 meters on one side and that's a lot bigger than normal, 80 meters in the corner/pockets, other side is 66 meters. As a bowler, you will be so happy to see such an expansive field. This ground has some of the longest boundaries and that's what you want to see with the kind of power that the batters exhume nowadays. As a spinner, I don't think you would enjoy this pitch as there's a lot more grass on this surface. Grass is being left on the pitches now to ensure they don't crumble and also because India has discovered so many new fast bowlers. Every team are encouraging the groundsman to put a little more grass".

 

 

TOSS:
  has won the toss and have elected to first

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "We will bat.  We want to start fresh, looks like a good pitch to bat on. I don't think dew is going to play a part. It is a new pitch. You can bowl and bat well to express yourselves, the boundaries are big so the bowlers enjoy playing here. The batters are enjoying batting as well. Arshad Khan comes in for Mayank Yadav."

 

Rishabh Pant, Skipper: "  We would have batted as well. Few of our players are injured, so we need to look for the right playing eleven. We have two changes. Mukesh Kumar and Kuldeep Yadav are back."

LSG- 57/2 (9.5 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  ll  DC - 62/1 (10.3 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

  posted a total of 167-7 in their 20 overs courtesy of  Ayush Badoni who was the top scorer with an impressive 55 runs off 35 balls, helping stabilize the innings after some quick losses. Notable contributions also came from captain K. L. Rahul, who scored 39 runs. The Delhi Capitals bowlers were effective, with Kuldeep Yadav taking three crucial wickets and Khaleel Ahmed contributing two wickets while being especially economical.
 In response, Delhi Capitals reached the target with ease, scoring 170-4 in just 18.1 overs. Jake Fraser-McGurk played a pivotal innings, scoring 55 runs from 35 balls. Prithvi Shaw and Rishabh Pant also made significant contributions with scores of 32 and 41, respectively. The Lucknow bowlers struggled to contain the Delhi batsmen, although Ravi Bishnoi managed to pick up two wickets.

 Delhi Capitals won the match by 6 wickets with 11 balls to spare. This was a well-rounded performance by Delhi, with key contributions coming from both their batsmen and bowlers. This is also 's first win against LSG in IPL. 

 

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "If I want to be harsh, I think the batting unit was 15-20 runs short, we got off to a good start, we could have capitalised and got somewhere around 180. There was a bit of help for the seamers, the odd ball kept low. Kuldeep Yadav made good use of that and got those wickets. Jake Fraser-McGurk hit the ball well, credit to him. We always walk in with the same mindset, and want to hit the right areas. We got David Warner in the powerplay, and got a couple of wickets after the powerplay. The set batters Rishabh Pant and McGurk took the game away from us. We travel tomorrow and play an afternoon game on Sunday."

 

Rishabh Pant, Skipper: " Little relief, we wanted a win badly. I was talking to the boys saying we need to think like champions, we need to keep fighting hard. We have phases where we are not up to the mark, some individuals have to take responsibility for that. However, we stick together as a group."

 

 

Kuldeep Yadav is Player of the Match 


Kuldeep Yadav: "  Got injured first game and was difficult to see the team struggling in the middle overs. Credit goes to Patrick to maintain my fitness and get me match-ready. All three were important wickets, it was crucial to get wickets in the middle overs to control the run rate. I liked the first and second wicket, I have played a lot against Nicholas Pooran and the execution for that was right. I was clear with my plans, just the length matters for me as a spinner. Very clear and confident with my skills."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two teams languishing at the bottom of the points table, the storied rivals Mumbai Indians  and Royal Challengers Bengaluru , are set to clash in the 25th fixture of the TATA IPL 2024 at Wankhede Stadium. 

 

The hosts, Mumbai Indians, are coming into this match with a much-needed boost of confidence after securing a win against the last-placed Delhi Capitals, marking their first victory after three consecutive losses. They clinched a 29-run victory defending a formidable total of 235 runs, thanks to an all-round performance from Sheperd, who blasted 32 runs in the final over and also snagged the crucial wicket of Warner. With contributions across the board and a bowling unit that picked wickets at regular intervals, MI is keen to maintain this winning streak.

 

On the other hand, Royal Challengers Bengaluru faces a challenging road ahead after losing four out of their five matches. The team has underperformed significantly compared to its potential, with Virat Kohli being the lone beacon of hope in what appears to be a faltering lineup. Currently donning the orange cap with 316 runs at an astonishing average of over 105, including a century, Kohli's efforts have yet to be matched by his teammates, as no other batter has managed to convert starts into substantial scores. Dinesh Karthik has shown flashes of form sporadically. The bowling department raises even more concerns, with Yash Dayal leading with 5 wickets across 5 games. Glenn Maxwell has surprisingly outbowled many specialists, securing four wickets in just three innings, tally matched by Siraj. RCB is desperate for a turnaround to rediscover their winning form.

 

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

In as many as 32 games contested between the two teams, Mumbai Indians  have clear edge over Royal Challengers Bengaluru  by 18:14 wins. At the Wankhede Stadium, both have contested 10 times with MI emerging victorious on seven occasions while RCB winning three games.

 

 

 

Milestones Alert:
 

4 - Virat Kohli (246) needs four sixes to complete 250 sixes in IPL
3 - Ishan Kishan (97) needs three sixes to complete 100 sixes for MI in IPL.
2 - Tilak Varma (48) needs two sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL.
3 - Mohammed Siraj (147) needs three wickets to complete 150 wickets in T20s
4 - Dinesh Karthik (146) needs four sixes to complete 150 sixes in IPL.
6 - Rohit Sharma (494) needs six maximums to complete 500 sixes in T20s

 

 

IPL Stats at Wankhede Stadium (Since 2022):

 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sanjay Manjrekar and Michael Clarke: " It's a red soil pitch as usual at the Wankhede. Square boundaries are 65m and 59m while it is 74m down the ground. So 200 could be a par score considering the dimensions. The pitch itself is an absolute belter, a batting paradise to say the least. It's been a high-scoring ground, both teams could go aggressive against the new ball in the powerplay. Not much spin on offer. The captain winning the toss would opt to field first and have a target in front".
 


TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "We will bowl first. There was dew the last couple of days.  The mood before and after the win has been the same. We play every game with a fresh start. Want to put early pressure on the new ball. About the last game I heard it was the highest score without anyone scoring fifty, gives confidence that even one guy batting long can score 234. It has been a chasing ground and looking at the tradition. We have one change Shreyas Gopal comes in for Piyush Chawla."

 

 
Faf du Plessis, Skipper: " We've tried to change things, so we've given chances to some of our players, some new players and it's up to them to take the opportunity. It's important to give players a decent run, but we've found ourselves in a stage where we haven't done so well. One thing that's important is to be consistent and that's where we've been disappointing. But we know we can turn this around."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
RCB - 44/2 (7.3 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)  || MI- 72/0 (12 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-
RCB - 86/2 (9.5 rpo, 4x4, 5x6) || MI- 116/3 (12.3 rpo, 11x4, 8x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-
RCB - 66/4 (13.2 rpo, 6x4, 4x6) || MI- 11/0 in 0.3 overs (22 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

 

 

 

In a high-scoring encounter at the IPL 2024, secured a comprehensive victory over by 7 wickets, with a stellar performance that saw them chasing down the target in just 15.3 overs.

RCB set a challenging total of 196-8 in their 20 overs. Despite an early setback with Kohli departing for a slow 3 off 9 balls, du Plessis and Will Jacks tried to stabilize the innings. It was Rajat Patidar's impressive 50 off 26 balls and Dinesh Karthik's explosive unbeaten 53 off 23 balls that propelled the team to a competitive score. Jasprit Bumrah was the standout bowler for Mumbai, picking up a fifer and effectively stifling the RCB batsmen's attempts to accelerate, supported by a disciplined bowling effort from the rest of the squad.

The chase by Mumbai Indians was nothing short of spectacular, showcasing their batting depth and aggressive intent from the get-go. Ishan Kishan led the charge with a blistering 69 off 34 balls, while Suryakumar Yadav got back to form, contributing a quickfire 52 off 19 balls. Rohit Sharma also played a vital inning of 38 off 24 balls. The team's approach was assertive, ensuring that the required run rate was always within reach. The chase was characterized by a barrage of boundaries, with Mumbai Indians reaching the target comfortably with 27 balls to spare.

 

 

 

Faf du Plessis,  Skipper: "  It's a tough pill to swallow to be honest. Combination of two things, the outfield was very wet with dew, I needed to somehow win some tosses, secondly, they played well, put pressure on us and we made a lot of mistakes, especially during the powerplay. We knew dew would be a factor, we might have needed to make 250+, but they made 196 look very less."

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "Always good to win. The way we have won, it's quite impressive. The impact player has allowed to use an extra bowler if we require it. It gives us a cushion as well. The way Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan batted gave us the platform, it was important for us to finish it early. That's the beauty of this team, players know what to do. Blessed to have Bumrah on my side. Surya does it over and over again. He practices a lot and the amount of experience and confidence he has is tremendous. I did tell him when he scored the fifty that welcome back."

 

 

Jasprit Bumrah is Player of the Match 

 


Jasprit Bumrah: "  I am very happy with the outcome. But I will not say I had always thought of taking a five-for. The wicket was sticking in the first 10 overs. One of those days where things went in my favour and catches went to hand. In this format, it's anyway very harsh on the bowlers so you need to have different skills. Can't be a one-trick pony. Everyone is doing research and data. Have trained to have different skills. Bowling is tough because you will have to take a beating, you will have to have bad days to learn from it."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The 24th match of the Indian Premier League 2024 promises to be an exciting clash as the high-flying take on the struggling  at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. With Royals unbeaten in their campaign and GT looking to find their footing, this match is set against the backdrop of contrasting fortunes for both teams.

Rajasthan Royals have been the team to beat this season, with an impeccable record of four wins in as many matches. They sit comfortably at the top of the points table, boasting eight points and an impressive net run rate of +1.120. The team's success has been a result of contributions across the board, with players like Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Sanju Samson leading from the front. The bowling department, featuring Trent Boult, Yuzvendra Chahal, and Ravichandran Ashwin, has been equally dominant, making RR a well-rounded side capable of outclassing any opponent.

on the other hand, is Seeking Redemption. IPL 2022 champions have experienced a mixed bag of results this season. With two wins and three losses from their five outings, GT finds itself in the seventh spot on the points table, accumulating a total of four points and grappling with a net run rate of -0.797. The team has showcased potential in flashes but has struggled to maintain consistency, especially in crunch situations. Stars like Kane Williamson, Shubman Gill, and Rashid Khan will be crucial for GT's aspirations to climb up the ranks and regain their championship.

 

 

 

vs : Head-to-Head Record

 

In the storied history of their encounters in the IPL, and have faced each other a total of 5 times. These matchups have predominantly swung in favour of the Titans, who have carved out victories in 4 of these encounters, showcasing their dominance over the Royals, who have managed to secure a win only once.

 

 

Key Battles to Watch to watch out: 

 

  • Jos Buttler vs Rashid Khan
  • Shubman Gill vs Trent Boult 
  • Kane Williamson vs Yuzvendra Chahal

 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 


Pommie Mbangwa and Aaron Finch: " "Slightly windy at the venue. 62 meters on one side which is against the wind and 70 meters on the other side which is with the wind. 79 meters straight down the ground. Looks like a really good track. There's just a hint of green grass on it. Hopefully, that will keep some extra pace in the wicket. We saw here last time, this was the slowest out of all the surfaces on this block of wickets in Jaipur. For me, I'll look to play straight as a batter Because we know in Jaipur, there can be some movement with the new ball. But as it goes on, I expect it to get slower. There shouldn't be much dew. Overhead conditions suggest there might be rain later on".

 

THERE IS A SLIGHT DELAY DUE TO RAIN!  

 

BUT THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT COVERS ARE COMING OFF AND THE TOSS WILL TAKE PLACE SOON!  

 

STAY TUNED! 

 

SOME MORE GOOD NEWS FOLKS, TOSS IS TO TAKE PLACE AT 7:25 PM! 

 

MATCH TO BEGIN AT 7:40 PM!   LETSS GOOO! 

 

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

Shubman Gill, Skipper: "It is always better to be chasing than batting first. Not an ideal situation where we have to select a playing eleven with main players getting injured. A couple of changes for us Matthew Wade comes in for Kane Williamson and Abhinav Manohar comes in too. We were in very good positions in the last two matches and now want to finish off games ruthlessly."

 


Sanju Samson, Skipper: "   We also wanted to field first. Journey has been special so far. But as everyone knows, leading a team can't be done alone. Grateful for the support from Sanga and team. Even if we've won all four games, there have been different challenges."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 43/2 (7.1 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  ||  GT- 44/0 (7.3 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

 

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-

RR- 91/0 (10.1 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)  ||  GT- 80/4 (8.8 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

 

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-

RR- 62/1 (12.4 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  ||  GT- 75/3 (15 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)

 

 

In a nail-biting finish to the 24th match of the Indian Premier League 2024, clinched a victory by 3 wickets against  at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The match, a thrilling display of cricket, went down to the wire, showcasing the depth and resilience of both teams.

, batting first, posted a formidable total of 196-3 in their 20 overs. The innings was anchored by a magnificent unbeaten 68 from captain Sanju Samson, who, alongside Riyan Parag's explosive 76 off 48 balls, propelled the Royals to a competitive score. The duo's partnership was crucial after the early dismissals of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Jos Buttler, who couldn't convert their starts into bigger scores. The innings was characterized by aggressive batting, with Rajasthan capitalizing in the latter half of their innings, setting a challenging target for the Titans.

Gujarat Titans' bowlers had a mixed outing, with Rashid Khan being the standout performer, taking the crucial wicket of Jos Buttler and maintaining an economical rate. Other bowlers, however, struggled to contain the Royals' batters, particularly during the death overs.

In response, Gujarat Titans showcased their batting prowess, reaching the target with 199-7 in 20 overs. The chase was marked by Shubman Gill's scintillating 72 off 44 balls, setting the tone for the Titans. Sai Sudharsan also contributed a valuable 35 at the top of the order. However, it was Rashid Khan's unbeaten 24 off 14 balls towards the end that ensured Gujarat crossed the line, amidst a tense finish.

Rajasthan Royals' bowlers, led by Kuldeep Sen and Yuzvendra Chahal, kept the match competitive, picking up crucial wickets at different stages. However, the depth in Gujarat's batting lineup and strategic run-chasing saw them through in a close finish.

 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  To be honest, it is very hard to speak after such a match. The Skipper has the hardest job to speak after losing the game and to tell where we lost is tough. Maybe after a few hours, I can figure out and tell what went wrong. You have to give credit to the Titans for the way they batted, bowled and fielded. We will learn from this and move on."

 

 

Shubman Gill, Skipper: "We were targetting around 45 in 3 overs and it is very much gettable which was the mindset at that time. Mathematically both batters needed to hit 22 off 9 balls and that's how the thinking goes and if one batter goes berserk that will do it for us. I would have loved to finish the match, especially after spending time in the middle, but very happy with Rahul Tewatia and Rashid Khan for finishing the job for us. Winning the ball off the last ball is always a great feeling."

 

 

Rashid Khan is the Player of the Match 


Rashid Khan: " Winning the match is more pleasing for me. Happy that I landed the ball where I wanted today and that gave me energy with the bat as well maybe. I haven't bowled that much in the last few months after the surgery and I just lost a bit of grip on the ball I had a good session after the last game and it helped me to get back to my best."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two teams positioned in the middle of the points table, Punjab Kings and Sunrisers Hyderabad, will face off in the crucial 23rd game of the TATA IPL 2024 at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur, Chandigarh.

 

Both teams enter the contest with identical records of two wins and two losses from the four games played so far. Punjab Kings, fresh off their victory against GT in the previous game, owe much to a sublime partnership between Shashank Singh and Ashutosh Sharma, who went berserk in the death overs, accomplishing the daunting task of chasing a mammoth 200. They aim to maintain their momentum going into this game.

 

Sunrisers Hyderabad, sharing a similar trajectory with their counterparts, come from a victory against the defending champions by a convincing six-wicket margin, thanks to an all-round bowling performance followed by Abhishek Sharma's ruthless power hitting and Markram's anchoring knock. Pat Cummins & co will be riding high on confidence and look to keep their momentum going. This match presents a battle between two middle-placed teams striving to climb up the table. Who will emerge on top with the two points?

 

 

Punjab Kings  vs Sunrisers Hyderabad  Head-To-Head in IPL:

 

VENUE STATS:
 T20 AT MULLANPUR: 
WON FIRST: 11
WON SECOND: 10
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 146

 

 

 

 

Milestones Alert:
3 - Jitesh Sharma (47) needs three fours to complete 50 fours in the league.
4 - Sam Curran (46) needs four wickets to complete 50 wickets in IPL.
98 - Aiden Markram (902) needs 98 runs to complete 1000 runs in IPL.
7 - Heinrich Klaasen (43) needs seven sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL.
4 - Abhishek Sharma (46) needs four sixes to complete 50 sixes in IPL.
50 - T.Natarajan is all set to play his 50th IPL game.

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Deep Dasgupta and Simon Katich: " This is the first evening IPL game at this venue. 63m and 70m are the square boundaries while the straight down the ground is 72m. This looks like a similar pitch to the day game that was played here, the pitch looks rock solid and it does look like a 200-run surface. There's an even covering of grass on the track, the power-packed SRH batting unit will enjoy playing here. Plenty of runs for the taking, but not much dew is expected either. Another high-scoring affair it seems like".

 

 


TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "We'll field first. The wicket will stay more or less same, so we would look to restrict them to a low total. We were lucky to have won the last match, it's good that we're not depending on any one player and all are contributing. We've won two games, looking forward to a good run. we are playing with the same team,."

 

 
Pat Cummins, Skipper: "  We would have bowled first. Overall happy with the way things are going, two wins and we could have had one more game going our direction. We've got good strength and some depth in there as well. We are going with the same team as the last game."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

SRH- 40/3 (6.6 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || PBKS- 27/3 (4.5 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

SRH- 93/2 (10.3 rpo, 8x4, 5x6) || PBKS- 78/2 (8.7 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

SRH- 49/4 (9.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || PBKS- 75/1 (15 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)

 

 

 

In a thrilling encounter at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur, Chandigarh, Sunrisers Hyderabad edged out Punjab Kings by a narrow margin of 2 runs. This exhilarating match, part of the Indian Premier League 2024, was witnessed under lights on April 9th, captivating the audience with a high-voltage showdown.

batting first, put up a competitive total of 182-9 in their allocated 20 overs. The innings had its highs and lows, with several batsmen contributing valuable runs amidst tense moments. The opener, Head, kicked things off with a brisk 21 off 15 balls, setting the tone for the innings. Notably, Abdul Samad provided a much-needed late surge, smashing 25 runs off just 12 balls, propelling the team's total with a striking rate of over 200. Nitish Reddy's 64 from 37 stood out amongst the SRH batter performances. The all-rounder showed his mettle by playing some handsome strikes with proper strike rotation.  bowlers put up a mixed performance. Arshdeep Singh was the standout, claiming 4 wickets for 29 runs in his 4 overs, proving to be a thorn in Sunrisers' side. Harshal Patel and Sam Curran also made significant contributions with the ball, keeping the run flow in check at crucial junctures of the game.

Chasing 183, Punjab Kings came agonizingly close, finishing at 180-6. The chase had its moments in the middle overs but However, but innings faced setbacks with early wickets, putting pressure on the middle order. Shashank Singh's unbeaten 46 off 25 balls and Ashutosh Sharma's unbeaten 33 off 15 kept hopes alive until the very end, but the team fell short by just 2 runs. Sikandar Raza and Sam Curran also made significant contributions, but the increasing run rate in the latter part of the innings proved too much to handle.

Sunrisers Hyderabad's bowlers executed their plans effectively, with Bhuvneshwar Kumar and T Natarajan being particularly economical while taking crucial wickets. The match was a tight contest, with the outcome uncertain till the final over.

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "I feel that Shashank Singh and Ashutosh played a great knock, we restricted them to a good total, but we couldn't cash in the powerplay, lost 3 wickets and that's where we fell behind and it cost us in the end. Every individual will have to look back and change their approach. We dropped a catch off the last ball, we could have kept them down by 10-15 runs, but our batting let us down. It's great to see youngsters chipping in with such consistency."

 


Pat Cummins, Skipper: "  Was a great game . They bowled really well at the start but we came back well and we did well to get to 180. They bowled exceptionally with the new ball. With 150, you are going to lose nine out of ten times. We were pretty happy with 180. Bhuvi and I tried to take a couple of wickets with the new ball and keep to basics. Nitish was awesome, fantastic in the field, bowled three overs which was handy too."

 

 

Nitish Kumar Reddy is Player of the Match 

 


Nitish Kumar Reddy: " For me, it's like a big contribution to my team and myself. I have been telling myself that I should believe in myself. Seamers were bowling well, I didn't want to take on them. I knew that the spinners would come and I wanted to attack them, I just did that. The whole tournament, they are bowling slow bouncers and it's working. I also used the dimensions. I just want to continue to perform for my team."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As the Indian Premier League's caravan rolls into the heart of Chennai on April 8, an epic showdown awaits cricket fans worldwide. The MA Chidambaram Stadium, a fortress of history and heritage, sets the stage for Match No. 22 of IPL 2024, where the home side lock horns with the formidable in a clash that promises fireworks.

  is currently in a Quest for Redemption as they find themselves at a crossroads early in the tournament. After a disappointing run in their recent outings, including losses away from home against Delhi Capitals and Sunrisers Hyderabad, the team is eager to return to winning ways. The batting lineup, barring the explosive Shivam Dube, has yet to fire collectively, with key players like Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ajinkya Rahane, and Daryl Mitchell struggling to leave a mark. However, the anticipated return of young sensation Matheesha Pathirana, alongside the crafty bowling of Ravindra Jadeja and Deepak Chahar, could bolster their lineup, promising a strong comeback on their home turf.

 On the other hand, Kolkata Knight Riders are Riding the Wave of Momentum. Under the astute leadership of Shreyas Iyer, KKR has been nothing short of sensational, showcasing a blend of aggressive batting and strategic bowling. Their unbeaten streak in the last three matches speaks volumes of their form and determination. The spin duo of Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil Narine, armed with their bag of tricks, is set to exploit Chennai's spin-friendly wicket, posing a significant challenge to CSK's batting aspirations. With the likes of Andre Russell and Venkatesh Iyer adding firepower to their lineup, KKR looks well-equipped to extend their winning momentum.

 

 

 

Key Battles to Watch out : 

The clash between CSK's batting prowess and KKR's spin wizards will be a spectacle, with both teams looking to leverage Chennai's pitch conditions. Shivam Dube's aggressive batting will be crucial for CSK to counter the spin threat posed by Narine and Chakravarthy. On the other hand, the battle between KKR's openers and CSK's comeback kid, Matheesha Pathirana, could set the tone for the innings.

 

 

 

CSK vs KKR Head-to-Head 

The Super Kings have got the better of their opposition KKR

Out of these 29 games between the sides, have won 18 whereas Kolkata have come out victorious on 10 occasions. 1 match ended without a result.

 

 

 

 

 

CSK & KKR JOURNEY SO FAR: 

 

:  L L W W

 

:  W W W

 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Graeme Swann: " 65m and 66m are the square boundaries and it is 80m straight down the ground. The pitch is rock solid, so the batters will have a great time here and the bowlers can expect some bounce too. The spinners might extract some bounce as well. Just a couple of cracks on the surface, but overall a good batting track".

 

 

 

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to


 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: "Good toss to win, looks quite humid, We will field first. We have confidence within the camp. We have lost by a few runs margin but it hasn't dented our confidence at all. We have had some forced changes so far. KKR are playing good brand of cricket but we would like to focus on ourselves, do simple things right and concentrate on the process. Pathirana is not available while Deepak has a niggle. So we have Shardul Thakur back and  Mustafizur is back as well."

 


Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "  "We would've bowled first as well. The approach and attitude of the team have impressed me. The way we have adapted and played fearless cricket is awesome to see. Past is past and whatever has happened is history. That was completely different. The team has also changed. Now our character will decide how we play here. If we complicate, we will struggle. Our focus is on being in the present. We are going in with the Same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 56/1 (9.3 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || CSK- 52/1 (8.6 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR - 43/4 (4.8 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)  || CSK- 63/1 (7.0 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR- 38/4 (7.6 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  || CSK- 26/1 (10.8 rpo, 1x4, 3x6) 

 

 

 

's Tactical Masterclass Secures Victory Against KKR at Chepauk

 Chennai Super Kings showcased why the MA Chidambaram Stadium is deemed their unbreachable fortress. Their victory over   wasn't just about superior skills but a demonstration of acute tactical awareness and execution that outclassed their opponents in every department. The turning point of the match undoubtedly came in the 7th over when Ravindra Jadeja, CSK's spin wizard, was introduced into the attack. With KKR off to a stable start and looking to build momentum, Jadeja's over was nothing short of a masterstroke. Claiming two crucial wickets in a single over, he not only broke the backbone of KKR's batting lineup but also significantly shifted the momentum in favour of CSK. His ability to bowl with precision and exploit the pitch conditions underscored the strategic planning behind his introduction at that juncture of the game. Following Jadeja's lead, the rest of the CSK bowling unit tightened the screws on KKR. The bowlers, backed by astute field placements, gave nothing away, showcasing discipline and control. The pressure created led to KKR's middle order crumbling, unable to find the boundary with regularity, and consequently being restricted to a below-par total of 137. CSK's Chase: A Mix of Caution and Aggression. In pursuit of a modest target, CSK approached the chase with a blend of aggression and tactical acumen. Ruturaj Gaikwad, leading from the front, notched up a vital half-century, his first as the captain of CSK, playing a captain's knock when it mattered the most. His innings were a mix of caution and calculated aggression, setting the tone for the chase. Shivam Dube's cameo further accelerated the pace, ensuring that the required run rate was always within control. Dube's ability to strike lusty blows, coupled with Gaikwad's anchoring role, exemplified CSK's batting depth and their ability to pace the innings according to the match situation.

 

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: "  It's deafening out here, but I'll try to express. We got a great start in the powerplay, but we lost consecutive wickets which tilted the momentum. We weren't able to assess the conditions quickly after the powerplay and thus scoring runs wasn't easy. They very well know the conditions and did pretty well to assess the same, they bowled according to their plans. It Wasn't easy for the new batters to go after the bowlers from the first ball. We were trying to construct the innings, but it didn't fall in place according to the plan and we fell short. We have to go back to the drawing board and got to learn from that."

 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: "Little nostalgic for me. The same as my first IPL fifty, similar situation, Mahi bhai was with me and we finished the match. Tonight the pitch was slightly tricky, didn't want to put the side under pressure. Was a 150-160 wicket. With this team I don't need to tell anything to anyone. In T20 sometimes you need little bit of luck to get going."

 

 

Ravindra Jadeja is Player of the Match 


Ravindra Jadeja: " I always enjoy my time here, and love to bowl. My plan was just to bowl in good areas. I have practiced a lot here and if you bowl in good areas it will definitely assist you. Takes time for visiting teams to settle down and plan something in such conditions. It proved to be difficult for them to come here and assess the surface."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 33  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 33  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) are red hot! After a stutter in their first match, they've been on a rampage, leaving opponents in smoldering ruins. Their secret weapon? Mayank Yadav, a 21-year-old pace bowling beast who hurls thunderbolts (seriously, over 150 kph!) that leave batsmen flat-footed and confused. He's already bagged two Player of the Match awards, and a stellar performance against the Titans could see him fast-tracked to the T20 World Cup squad.The Gujarat Titans (GT), on the other hand, are a bit of a mystery. They're like a coin toss – win one, lose one. Can they find their mojo and stop LSG's juggernaut, or will they be steamrolled?

LSG has been keeping everyone guessing with their ever-changing Impact Player strategy. Will skipper KL Rahul stay put this time, or will they throw another curveball?The Titans, meanwhile, are sweating over David Miller's fitness. Kane Williamson filled the gap in their last match, but can he consistently deliver the goods?Devdutt Padikkal, LSG's crucial number 3 batsman, has been a major disappointment so far. Three ducks in a row have put him on the firing line. He desperately needs to find his form to ensure a smooth transition between the explosive openers and the middle-order powerhouses.Vijay Shankar is another player under the microscope for the Titans. With Hardik Pandya out and Miller's status up in the air, Shankar's contributions in the middle order are vital. Can he step up to the plate? 

Head-To-Head In IPL:

 

Pitch Report Darren Ganga and Matthew Hayden:

 

Ganga "The pitch at Ekana Stadium looks promising for batting. With consistent dimensions around the square, batters have the opportunity to play freely. However, the slightly shorter boundary towards fine leg could indeed become a strategic focal point for the teams. Given LSG's history with GT, adapting their game plan to these conditions will be crucial. Overall, expect a competitive clash with plenty of runs and strategic bowling to counteract the boundary dimensions."

TOSS UPDATE:  WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT  

 

KL Rahul  Skipper 

"Choosing to bat first on this promising wicket. Our strategy to put up a solid score and defend has been effective, so we're sticking with it.Hearing about our 0-4 record against GT for the first time, but past results aren't our focus. Acknowledging GT's edge in previous seasons, it's about looking forward now.Mayank Yadav is navigating his debut season with remarkable professionalism despite injuries. It's crucial we support him, with experienced hands like Morne Morkel guiding our pace attack. No changes to our team lineup."

 

Shubman Gill  Skipper

"Had we won the toss, we'd have bowled, but it's all good. We dominated most of the previous game, though the final overs didn't pan out as expected—a typical twist of cricket.Injury updates include Wriddhiman Saha out with a neck issue, bringing Sharath BR for his debut, and Spencer replaces Omarzai.Catching errors happen; the key is staying mentally present, ready to move past any mishaps and focus solely on the immediate task."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1 - 6 overs) :-
LSG - 47/2 (7.8 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || GT - 54/1 (9 rpo , 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7 - 15 overs) :-
LSG - 67/2 (7.4 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) || GT - 39/6 (4.3 rpo , 0x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16 - 20 overs) :-
LSG - 49/1 (9.8 rpo, 3x4, 3x6) || GT - 37/3 in 18.5 overs (9.6rpo , 3x4, 2x6)

 

 

In an exhilarating 21st match,  secured their first victory over  by a margin of 33 runs, thanks to a gritty fifty from Marcus Stoinis and a fearsome bowling performance from Yash Thakur and Krunal Pandya. Batting first upon winning the toss, LSG posted a competitive total of 163/5, highlighted by Stoinis's robust fifty and valuable contributions from KL Rahul (33) and Nicholas Pooran (32*). In response, GT started strong with 54 runs in the powerplay, but the momentum shifted when Thakur removed Gill for 19. LSG's spinners, Ravi Bishnoi and Krunal Pandya, then took control, claiming four wickets between them. Thakur's return to the attack was stellar, as he swept through the tail, earning a five-wicket haul and guiding LSG to a convincing win..

 

Shubman Gill  Skipper

"I think it was a good wicket to bat on, to be honest. It was just a really poor batting performance from us. We got a decent start but we lost it in the middle overs and we were never able to get back to momentum or we were never able to recover from that. To restrict them to 160 on a wicket like this was impressive. We were expecting them to score around 175-180, but to limit them to 160 was a tremendous effort by the bowlers. Our batters let us down.Talking about Miller, he's the kind of player who can change the game for you anytime. We had a couple of hinges in this game, but irrespective of that, this total was very gettable for us.I thought it was the last over of the power play. We got off to a decent start. I just wanted to capitalize on the last over of the power play. With everyone up on the offside, I wanted to give myself a bit of room. As for the ball I got out to, I was actually trying to play it a bit square, but I missed it.He's (Umesh Yadav) someone who's very experienced, and even Darshan, the way our bowlers bowled in this game, as I've already mentioned, was tremendous to watch. They got off to a decent start, and to restrict them to around 160-165 runs was what we were hoping for."

 

KL Rahul  Skipper

"We'll take the win, I am not going to make too much out of it. I think for the young bowling group that we have, it helps when we bat first and they get a bit of an idea of how the wicket's playing and they've also been adapting really well. [On 100% record of defending 160+ total] Yeah, it's a good record to have, obviously. But I also think it's because of where we've played and the conditions. Last time we played here in Lucknow, the wickets were very low-scoring, and it's a low-scoring ground. So, we defended quite well there. Having that home advantage obviously helps a little bit. And yes, I mean, the bowlers have come through the ranks in the last couple of years. You've seen the same guys playing last season as well, and they've adjusted to their roles. They're reading the wickets really well. That's something that I try to discuss with them a lot more off the field and even during practice.

 

Player of The Match: Yash Thakur

I am happy for the first 5-wicket haul and first player of the match award. I saw Gill trying to make some room and hit in the leg side as there were 2 fielders behind square. Rahul bhai told me to bowl at my plan. Unfortunate to lose Mayank bhai but the skipper told me that its your day and you will win us the game.Last 2 seasons we never won against them so very happy to win against them today. Shubman's wicket was the most special one."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It's desperation hour for Mumbai Indians. But hey, this is Mumbai, the land of comebacks, right? All eyes will be on Ishan Kishan. The wicketkeeper-batsman's bat has been as quiet as a mime trapped in a library. With Rishabh Pant, his "competitor" for the World Cup spot, lighting up the scoreboard, the pressure is on. Will Kishan finally unleash his inner beast, or will Pant add another flamboyant knock to his collection

There's a glimmer of hope for Mumbai though. The mighty Suryakumar Yadav is back in the camp! Whether he's 100% fit or not remains a mystery, but his mere presence could be a game-changer. Will his return push Naman Dhir, the current stroke-making machine, to the sidelines?

Let's not forget Delhi Capitals. They're not exactly cruising either, with just two points separating them from the bottom of the table. Their bowling attack got mauled by KKR, and their chase against the mammoth total was a mere formality. 

This match is like a fight between two boxers who've been knocked down a couple of times. Both are wobbly, but a win here could be the confidence booster they desperately need. Will Mumbai, under Hardik Pandya's leadership, finally get off the mark? Or will Delhi find a way to bounce back and leave Mumbai with their fourth consecutive loss?

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

 

Stats At Wankhede Stadium:




MILESTONE ALERT  

Rishabh Pant (2990) needs 10 runs to complete 3000 runs in the IPL.

Rohit Sharma (99) needs one catch to complete 100 catches in the IPL.

Jasprit Bumrah (148) is two wickets away from 150 IPL wickets.

Anrich Nortje (148) needs two wickets to complete 150 wickets in T20s 


 Pitch Report Mpumelelo Mbangwa and Simon Katich :

Mbangwa: "Welcome to the iconic Wankhede Stadium, a premier venue for cricket. Starting with the outfield, it's in pristine condition, allowing for ground shots instead of just lofted hits. The square boundaries measure 63 and 62 meters, while the straight boundary stretches to 74 meters, the longest here. Turning our attention to the pitch, I've got Simon Katich with me. Simon, what's your take on the pitch?"

Katich: "We're looking at pitch number seven today, and it's as hard as concrete. It's the same strip from the recent game against Rajasthan Royals, where Trent Boult showcased his swing bowling prowess. However, with today's hotter conditions, I'm anticipating a high-scoring game. The pitch has a covering of grass, but it's really set up for the batsmen. Last year, we saw four centuries scored here, and many of Mumbai's batsmen relish playing at the Wankhede. Statistically, spinners have been more economical than pacers here and have a better average. But given the small dimensions of the ground, bowling spin comes with its own set of risks due to the likelihood of the ball sailing over the boundary."

Mbangwa: "The decision at the toss is a tricky one, as historical data suggests chasing teams often have the upper hand. Expect a run fest today at the Wankhede." 

 

Players Battle to Watch Out For:

Rohit Sharma vs Ishant Sharma
Rishabh Pant vs Jasprit Bumrah

 





TOSS UPDATE :  WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD FIRST  



 

Rishabh Pant |  Skipper: "Opting to bowl first since Wankhede allows chasing any target. It's crucial we stay united as a team despite individual performances. Being back on the field is a joy, and with each match, I feel increasingly at ease.Our bowling has been inconsistent, a challenge in T20s given batter-friendly wickets. But that's part and parcel of their role.


Hardik Pandya | Skipper: "We'd have chosen to bowl too, but batting first on this pitch, used in the last game, isn't an issue. The surface might not favor the ball coming on later, yet it's been well-prepared. Securing a win is our immediate goal, confident that it'll set off a chain of victories. Having 18,000 kids in the stands is extraordinary, making this match special, aiming to send them home with smiles."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

Death Overs(16-20 Overs) :-
