Mumbai Indians  triumphed over Delhi Capitals  with a 29-run victory, marking DC's fourth loss in the season. Key performances from Romario Shepherd, Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan, Jasprit Bumrah, and Gerald Coetzee were instrumental in MI's win. Facing a daunting target of 235, DC's start was less than ideal with an early loss of David Warner. Abishek Porel, despite attempting to accelerate, couldn't maintain a rapid pace. Prithvi Shaw's quick fifty provided some momentum, but Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional yorker cut his innings short. Tristan Stubbs offered a glimmer of hope with a rapid half-century, but the absence of a powerful hitter alongside him left DC struggling. Bumrah's critical bowling spells, featuring yorkers and cutters, placed MI in a dominant position through the game.

 

 

Rishabh Pant  Skipper 

"We were in the game but fell short in the powerplay. Trying to catch up later with a soaring required rate proved tough.An over can shift the game's momentum. We need to focus on improvement rather than assigning blame.The pitch was decent for batting, yet slower deliveries gripped the surface. Adapting to this could've been advantageous.Enhancing our performance in both the powerplay and at the death is our aim."

 

Hardik Pandya   Skipper 

"Experiencing this victory is something I crave more of. Our execution was spot-on, and I'm proud of how we implemented our strategy. We're open to tactical shifts, keeping our core 12 players excited and ready.The team radiates support and belief. Securing a solid start in the initial overs set us up well, with everyone stepping up when needed. Romario Shepherd's innings was pivotal; his performance stood out significantly against Delhi.Bowling wasn't necessary for me in this match, but I'll step in when the time is right."

 

Player of The Match: Romario Shepherd:

"This performance is a testament to my dedication. I was encouraged to play freely.In the death overs, focusing on each delivery with a clear mindset was key.My form allowed me to make the most of the opportunities presented.Attributing my strength to Indian cuisine with a laugh."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Sawai Mansingh Stadium is set to sizzle as the red-hot Rajasthan Royals  clash with the struggling Royal Challengers Bengaluru   in a battle for supremacy today.RR are on a tear, boasting an unblemished 3-0 record. Their bowling attack, a miserly metronome led by Boult and Chahal, has been a revelation. Explosive batting from Parag and skipper Samson's experience provide the firepower. But all eyes are on the silent giants – Buttler and Jaiswal. A big knock from either could send shivers down RCB's spine.RCB, on the other hand, are desperate to turn things around. With a solitary win in four, their campaign is riddled with inconsistency, especially from their star-studded batting line-up. 

This clash promises a fascinating battle between contrasting bowling attacks. However, RR's  bowling mastery, currently the best in the IPL, could be RCB's lower order's undoing. The explosive Shimron Hetmyer, often used as a late-innings finisher by RR, could be the game-changer. If he unleashes his six-hitting prowess against RCB's leaky death bowling, it could be curtains for the Challengers. Jaipur has been a happy hunting ground for RR, with two wins coming at home. RCB, on the other hand, haven't fared well here. Can they overcome these hurdles and steal a victory away from the in-form Royals?

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

 

Stats At Sawai Mansingh Stadium: 



MILESTONE ALERT 

3- Sanju Samson (3997) needs three runs to complete 4000 runs in IPL

1- Yashasvi Jaiswal (49) needs one six to complete 50 sixes in IPL

4- Faf du Plessis (146) needs four sixes to complete 150 sixes in IPL. 
 

Pitch Report:| Deep Dasgupta and WV Raman :

Dasgupta "We're at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium, gearing up for a royal clash. Previously, this pitch has seen scores around 180. It's a large ground, with boundaries at 69 meters on the right and 63 meters on the left, while straight down the ground it stretches to 76 meters. So, the pitch must be the high-scoring enabler. Joining me is WV Raman. WV, your insights on this pitch?"

Raman: "This pitch mirrors the typical conditions found here—hard with a hint of grass. It's well-maintained, promising high-scoring affairs. Fast bowlers can look forward to some extra bounce with the new ball, yet it's not all challenging for the spinners. This surface, in particular, offers more turn, around 2.2 degrees, more than the usual 1.8 degrees on other pitches at this venue."

Dasgupta: "WV points this out because upon close inspection, the grass is quite patchy. There are spots completely devoid of grass, and then there are grassy patches."
Raman: "Indeed, and despite the dry patches, the spinners can be heartened by the bigger boundaries compared to other venues, giving them a unique advantage."

 

PLAYER BATTLES TO LOOK OUT FOR 

Virat Kohli vs Sandeep Sharma

Jos Buttler vs Mohammed Siraj

Glenn Maxwell vs Yuzvendra Chahal 

 

TOSS UPDATE:   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD   
 

Sanju Samson |  Skipper : "We've decided to bowl first on this pitch. Our decision factors in both the opposition and the current conditions. We're on a fresh wicket today, which should assist our seamers early on and we anticipate some dew later on.

It's encouraging to see our team members stepping up and taking charge, especially in closing games. While we have several potential match-winners, not every day will be theirs. We're sticking with the same squad for today's match, though Sandeep Sharma won't be available." 

 

Faf du Plessis |   Skipper: "We were on the fence about our decision, but this wicket looks promising and should play consistently throughout the game.To add some firepower to our lineup, we're making a change by adding an extra batsman. Our batting hasn't quite fired yet, so we're hoping this tweak will spark something. We know we haven't played up to our potential yet, but it's all about making minor adjustments. If we can bring our best game, we'll be formidable opponents. Today presents another chance for us to turn things around.
Finding the right roles for our players is crucial. We want them to feel confident about their positions and believe they're batting where they're most effective. So far, our batting hasn't clicked, but we're working on it."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
RCB - 53/0 (8.8 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) ||  RR- 54/1 (9 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs(7-15 Overs) :- 
RCB - 76/2 (8.4 rpo, 2x4, 4x6) ||  RR- 98/1 (10.9 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)

Death Overs(16-20 Overs) :- 
RCB - 54/1 (10.8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6) ||  RR- 37/2 in 19.1 overs (8.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

 

Buttler's masterclass and Samson's electrifying fifty powered  to a commanding six-wicket victory over . The toss favored  the host, who decided to field first. Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis unleashed a storm against RR, crafting a dazzling century partnership for the opening wicket until Chahal struck, providing the much-needed breakthrough for RR. Following this, RR tightened their bowling, ramping up the pressure on RCB. Despite the mounting pressure, Kohli's brilliant century propelled RCB to a competitive total of 183/3 in 20 overs, with Chahal snaring two crucial wickets and Nandre Burger adding another to his tally for RR.

In their chase of 184, RR stumbled early, losing Jaiswal to a duck in just the second delivery. However, the formidable duo of Samson and Buttler swiftly turned the tide, weaving together a stellar 100-run partnership. After Samson's departure for a well-made 69, Buttler continued his onslaught, notching up his sixth league century and sealing RR's fourth consecutive win with style and substance.

 

Faf du Plessis  Skipper “The pitch in the first innings was challenging, coming off slow and low. We aimed for 190, but fell short by 10-15 runs towards the end, especially with their spinners making it tough in the middle overs. Despite our efforts, hitting was difficult, with many shots not connecting as intended.Virat was in fine form, and with partners like Green or DK, we aimed to capitalize in the final overs, given our wicket reserve. However, the pitch improved, and the dew made conditions better for batting, which was an advantage for them. We started well in the powerplay but a costly over shifted momentum.Opting not to bowl Maxwell was strategic, given the two right-handed batsmen at the crease, preferring Mayank's form this season. The decision for a leg-spinner as an impact player was to target a breakthrough, reserving Maxwell for a potential left-hander.Fielding was below par, and although catches are crucial, the overall energy and commitment on the field were lacking, which we've discussed."

 

Sanju Samson  Skipper "Considering the conditions, a score below 190 was within our reach, especially with our batting lineup and the anticipated dew.With a few games ahead and a break allowing for rest and recovery, we’re optimistic. On rating our bowling and batting, I’d say our bowling is a 9 and batting an 8.7.Jos Buttler’s form was key; knowing if he got past the powerplay, the game could tilt in our favor. I aimed to support him, and his performance was crucial to our win. It was a well-deserved victory."

 

PLAYER OF THE MATCH: JOS BUTTLER

 

Jos Buttler: "It was a mix of good timing and a bit of fortune. Contributing to the team’s win always feels great. Despite the pressures and anxieties, maintaining a positive mindset and focusing on the strengths is vital.I felt a shift in momentum during the last game and carried that confidence from a successful stint in South Africa. One good innings was all I needed to regain my form.Our team has gelled well over three seasons, fostering a comfortable and supportive environment. With the coaching staff’s backing, we've created a positive atmosphere. It’s important we continue to work hard and maintain our form."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the 18th match of the IPL, folks, and buckle up for a spicy showdown that's hotter than a vindaloo on a sweltering evening! The Sunrisers Hyderabad, battling a case of the yips at the crease (all starts, no big scores) and a bowling attack that's as reliable as a fidget spinner, are hungry to snap their losing streak. But standing in their way are the mighty Chennai Super Kings, still licking their wounds from their first defeat this season. This Hyderabad pitch, though, could throw a real bouncer.

Forget the usual six-fests Hyderabad has witnessed this season – that black soil might morph into a spinner's paradise, leaving CSK's new ball wizards, used to their zippy swing, with a case of the wobbly seam. Don't expect those clean hitters to have it easy either; they'll need to be on their toes for some surprise doosras and slower balls that could leave them bamboozled like a rabbit in the headlights.

This match is as hard to predict as a googly gone right. Will CSK's experience and championship pedigree rise to the occasion, or will the Orange Army, fueled by the roar of the home crowd, pull off a heist? The key lies in who reads the pitch quicker and adapts their batting like a chameleon. One team might come out swinging for the fences, while the other might need to play the sheet anchor role and build a platform. Don't blink for a second, folks, because this match promises fireworks – the kind that could see boundaries raining down like monsoon showers or a nail-biting finish that goes down to the wire, leaving everyone on the edge of their seats. 

 

Head-To-Head in IPL    VS  

 

Stats at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium:


Pitch Report : 

Samuel Badree and Brian Lara at the Pitch Report: Badree: "We're feeling the buzz here at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, ready for an electrifying southern derby between CSK and SRH. The dimensions are interesting here; one side's a bit longer, with square boundaries under 70 meters and longer straight hits. Records were shattered last week on this ground. Joining me is Brian Lara. What do you make of it?"

Lara: "Looks like we've got a different pitch today, but it's ripe for scoring. There are some visible cracks, though I doubt they'll impact the game significantly. The skipper who wins the toss would likely opt to bat, eyeing a hefty score. We could be looking at a match where even 10 runs an over might not suffice. In my view, anything less than 200 might fall short on this fabulous batting wicket. Expect a bit of pace for the quicks initially, but overall, it's a dream track for batters."



TOSS UPDATE:   WON THE TOSS AND CHOOSE TO FIELD 




Pat Cummins |  Skipper: "We've opted to field first. The pitch looks promising and should hold up well throughout the game. We're still adapting to the new impact player rule, but with the depth in our squad, we aim for consistent performance." 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad |   Skipper: "Everything's been pretty solid so far. Sure, the last match didn't go our way, but it was a tight contest. The team's morale is high, which is crucial. Leadership isn't new to me, so there's no drastic change in approach. I aim to stay relaxed and perform at my peak. Indeed, we're without Fizz, and Pathirana is dealing with a minor issue. Thus, Theekshana and Mukesh are stepping in.
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
CSK - 48/1 (8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6) ll SRH - 78/1 (13 rpo, 9x4, 5x6)

Middle Overs(7-15 Overs) :- 
CSK - 79/3 (8.8 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) ll SRH - 57/2 (6.3 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

Death Overs(16-20 Overs) :- 
CSK - 38/1 (7.6 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) ll SRH - 31/1 in 18.1 overs (9.8 rpo, 2x4, 2x6) 


Pat Cummins flipped the coin, and  chose to bowl first at the Rajiv Gandhi Stadium. The sluggish pitch surprised , who could only manage 165/5 despite a fiery 45 from Shivam Dube. Openers failed to adapt, but Shivam Dube's knock provided a spark. Enter SRH's reply! Abhishek Sharma's 12-ball 37 turned the Powerplay into a party, setting a record-breaking 78/1 score.
CSK's bowlers? More like leaky faucets with an 8.25 economy rate! While Head-Markram waltzed to a 50-run stand, a late cameo from Nitish Kumar Reddy sealed the deal. Bhuvi and Nattu kept things tight with their economical spells, though Moeen Ali provided a glimmer of hope for CSK with two wickets. This dominant display by SRH showcases their adaptability, securing a convincing 6-wicket victory and their second consecutive home win. Looks like the Orange Army is just getting warmed up, while the Yellow Lions need to find their mojo back, fast! 




 



 

Ruturaj Gaikwad   Captain: "The pitch was on the slower side. In the last five overs, their bowling tightened, limiting our scoring. Midway, we were set for a strong finish, but they executed well in the end.It was a black soil pitch, expected to be slow. As the game progressed, the ball slowed down more, affecting our late innings surge. They played the conditions better on their end.Our start with the ball wasn't ideal, with a dropped catch and a costly over. Nonetheless, extending the match to the 18th over was commendable. A score around 170-175 would've been competitive. A stronger start could've tilted the game in our favor. Dew appeared later, but it didn't significantly alter conditions, as seen with Moeen's spin."


 

Pat Cummins  Skipper "The pitch, made of different soil, did slow down as the match progressed, working to our advantage. With Shivam striking well against spin, we leaned on our pace attack.Securing the points was pivotal. Watching Abhishek bat is a delight; I'm glad I'm not on the receiving end of his batting. We encourage him to play freely, and it's fantastic to witness.The audience was electrifying, especially with MS Dhoni's entrance. With five more games here, we're aiming for a clean sweep." 


PLAYER OF THE MATCH: ABHISHEK SHARMA 


Abhishek Sharma: "Noticing the pitch's slowness, we aimed to capitalise during the powerplay. Our pre-IPL preparations gave us insights into such conditions. Big scores are crucial, and today, I just flowed with the game, aiming to carry this form forward. My performance today is a testament to the hard work and guidance from my father, Yuvraj Singh, and Brian Lara."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The IPL gears up for another exciting encounter as the Gujarat Titans   lock horns with the Punjab Kings   at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. While GT has impressed with a 2-1 record, PBKS needs a win to avoid falling deeper into the hole after two consecutive defeats.GT boasts a well-rounded bowling attack.
Veteran pacer Mohit Sharma's death-bowling prowess complements the spin wizardry of Rashid Khan. The emergence of young Afghan quick Azmatullah Omarzai adds another dimension to their fast-paced attack. This variety keeps the opposition batsmen guessing.PBKS's batting woes lie in their inconsistent middle order.

Openers Shikhar Dhawan and Jonny Bairstow have provided flying starts, but the middle order has failed to capitalize, leading to collapses. Spin has also been a concern, with Harshal Patel and Rahul Chahar leaking runs. All eyes will be on Gujarat's captain Shubman Gill, a Punjab-born player leading his team against his home state's franchise. His performance will be a major factor for GT. This match presents a crucial opportunity for PBKS to turn their fortunes around. Overcoming GT's balanced bowling attack and finding batting consistency from the middle order will be key to their success. The spin battle between Rashid Khan and Rahul Chahar is another intriguing subplot.

With GT aiming to extend their winning streak and PBKS desperate for redemption, this encounter promises to be thrilling. 

 

Head-To-Head in IPL:

 

MILESTONE ALERT 

30- Shikhar Dhawan(970) needs 30 runs to Complete 1000 runs for PBKS in IPL

5- David Miller (195) needs five fours to complete 200 fours in IPL

50- Sam Curran will appear in his 50th IPL Game

34- Sam Curran (2966) needs 34 runs to complete 3000 runs in T20s.  

 

Pitch Report: WV Raman and Simon Katich

"Raman: We're right here at the center of the Narendra Modi Stadium in Motera. Looking at the pitch dimensions, it's 63 meters square both on the off and leg sides. The boundary to the off-side fine is 56 meters, while the leg side fine is 55 meters.

Katich: Today, we're looking at pitch number 6, which saw action four times last season, including the final. In those matches, teams chasing won three times, hinting at a potential advantage for tonight's toss winner.

This pitch combines red and black soil, presenting a rock-hard surface with about 3mm of grass, promising some pace and bounce. It's likely to be a high-scoring game. A point of interest is GT's strong performance here, winning 8 of their 12 games. This sets a challenging scene for the Punjab Kings tonight.

Raman: Overall, the pitch is in excellent condition. We're anticipating some great batting performances and an exciting game of cricket." 




TOSS UPDATE :   WON THE TOSS AND BOWL FIRST  

 

Shikhar Dhawan |  Skipper : "We've decided to bowl first. The wicket looks good and I believe it will remain consistent, which is why we prefer to have them set a target and then chase it down.Though there have been a few games where the scores skyrocketed, it's not a given for every match. Still, you anticipate a solid score since all the teams are exceptionally competitive.I think we're playing well as a team; we just need to fine-tune about 10% more. We're not significantly lacking in any area. It's early in the tournament, and facing these challenges now is beneficial. We're learning and looking to apply those lessons in the upcoming matches for better outcomes. 

Shubman Gill |  Skipper : "We would have chosen to bowl first, too. The pitch seems promising. It's a bit overcast, and we're hoping the dew won't affect the evening play.This season marks our first encounter here against them, having played in the bubble before and meeting just once last year. It's great to finally play them on this ground.We've had a strong start to the season. With a couple of away games coming up after this, winning tonight is crucial, especially considering our performance in away games last year.We're making a single change in our lineup; Miller is out with a minor issue, and Kane will be taking his place."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
GT - 52/1 (8.7 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || PBKS - 54/2 (9 rpo, 8x4, 1x6) 

Middle Overs(7-15 Overs) :- 
GT - 82/2 (9.1 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)  || PBKS - 84/3 (9.3 rpo, 6x4, 3x6) 

Death Overs(16-20 Overs) :-
GT - 65/1 (13 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  || PBKS - 62/2 (12.4 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  
 

In a heart-stopping encounter at the Narendra Modi Stadium, the Punjab Kings snatched an improbable victory from the jaws of defeat against the Gujarat Titans. Set a daunting target of 200 runs, thanks to Shubman Gill's unbeaten 89, the Kings chased valiantly, led by a whirlwind 61* off 29 balls from Shashank Singh and a crucial 31 off 17 balls from Ashutosh Sharma.

Both teams displayed exceptional batting skills, keeping the scoreboard ticking. However, it was the boundaries, especially the sixes, that proved decisive. Punjab's middle and lower order, defying Gujarat's bowling attack, emerged as the unlikely heroes.

The turning point came in Noor Ahmad's spell, where he scalped two crucial wickets for Gujarat. But the Kings' lower order, with their fearless hitting, kept them in the hunt. The Penultimate ball of the match saw a tense scramble, with Punjab emerging victorious by a narrow margin of 3 wickets.  

 

Shubman Gill |  Skipper: "The dropped catches really set us back. Our bowlers, though, did their job well. It's challenging to defend totals with the dew factor.I wouldn't say we were 20 runs short. The ball had some movement early on. There's always room for improvement, but 199 was a competitive score. We were right in it until the 15th over. However, those missed catches...Choosing Darshan (Nalkande) was straightforward given his performance in the last game against Sunrisers Hyderabad. He was the clear pick.That's the thrill of the IPL for you. There are always players who step up and deliver unexpectedly. It's what makes this league so special." 

 

Shikhar Dhawan |  Captain: "What a thrilling game it was, coming down to the wire, but our team held on to clinch it. Our strategy was to attack from the get-go. Despite my early departure, we made the most of the powerplay. Maintaining a positive intent is key, and Shashank epitomized that with his outstanding play.In chasing a hefty total, keeping up the momentum is crucial. Shashank's sixes seemed almost effortless, a joy to have on our side. His timing and ability to finish the game highlighted his skill, especially considering his hiatus from the IPL. His performance from batting at number seven to now showcases his strong mindset.I also want to acknowledge Ashutosh. Watching him stay composed under pressure and perform well was impressive." 


PLAYER OF THE MATCH: SHASHANK SINGH 
 

Shashank Singh : "It's surreal, almost like I visualized all of this before the match. To see it happen is a fantastic feeling. I'm proud of myself. Focusing on playing proper cricket shots, I just aimed to watch the ball closely and react. That was the coach's advice. Usually, I bat at number 7, but today I was at 5, so it was about playing each ball on its merit.The pitch was excellent, offering good bounce. With both teams scoring 200, it's clear the wicket was prime for batting.Facing bowlers like Rashid Khan, who are considered cricket legends, I step up believing I'm the best in the world. It's all about reacting to the ball.This experience means a lot. I didn't get many opportunities before. My time with SRH was valuable, but here, the coaching staff, management, and owners have shown great faith in me during practice sessions, boosting my confidence."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.GroundName: Dr YS Rajasekhara Reddy ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 106  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 106  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Alright, let's dial up the energy and dive into the electric arena of IPL 2024 where Delhi Capitals and Kolkata Knight Riders are locking horns in a showdown that's nothing short of epic. Picture this: the vibrant city of Visakhapatnam, the stage is set, the lights are dazzling, and the crowd is buzzing with anticipation.

Delhi Capitals, after a rollercoaster start, have flipped the script with a thrilling victory against the defending champs, Chennai Super Kings. Warner and Shaw at the helm, setting the tone, while Pant, back with a bang, delivers a powerhouse performance. This squad's comeback has been nothing short of a blockbuster. But hold up, because on the other side, we've got the Kolkata Knight Riders, unbeaten gladiators, showcasing a blend of brute force and tactical finesse. Narine's explosive cameo and Venkatesh Iyer's classy half-ton in their previous match? Pure gold!

Now, as these Titans gear up for a clash that's got everyone on the edge of their seats, it's not just about the runs or the wickets; it's about making a statement. With DC's balanced attack squaring off against KKR's dynamite lineup, we're in for a cricketing spectacle loaded with nail-biting moments and heart-thumping action.

So, strap in, folks. Whether you're Team Delhi, rooting for that strategic masterclass, or Team Kolkata, all about that unbeatable streak, one thing's for sure – this clash is going to light up the night sky. Let the games begin!  

Pitch Report | Ian Bishop : 

"I'm absolutely delighted to be here in Visakhapatnam, surrounded by the beauty of this fantastic stadium. The weather is pleasantly cool, making for a comfortable environment. This ground isn't the largest, which is evident from the boundary dimensions – 60 meters square on both sides. For a right-hander, behind me, the distance is even shorter at 53 meters, making it quite easy to notch up a few quick runs to that boundary. The deep third man stands at 59 meters. Given that KKR, known for their high six-hitting capabilities, is in town, we're in for a thrilling match.

Examining the pitch, it's extremely well-maintained and incredibly firm. The lack of live grass suggests that spinners might find it challenging to extract much deviation or manipulate the pace and line effectively.This element will definitely add an exciting dimension to tonight's game.The pitch appears to offer a balanced surface throughout. I'm hopeful it will remain consistent, allowing the batsmen to execute a full range of shots. Let's anticipate a game rich with sixes this evening."

 


Balancing Act: Strategy and Fortune 

At the picturesque Dr. Y.S. Rajasekhara Reddy ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam, the battleground of the IPL reveals a unique narrative: a perfect balance between teams winning batting first and second, with 7 victories each across 14 matches. This equilibrium underscores the venue's unbiased pitch, which neither favours the chasers nor the defenders, presenting an open field for teams to strategize and adapt. Delhi Capitals, with a history of 8 matches, have won 3 and lost 5, indicating a quest for consistency, whereas Kolkata Knight Riders, having played only once and faced defeat, eye redemption.

As both teams gear up for their next clash in this evenly-poised venue, it’s the blend of strategy, execution, and perhaps a dash of fortune, that will dictate the day.
 

Head to Head  



TOSS UPDATE :   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT    

 


 

Shreyas Iyer |  Skipper : "We've decided to take the bat first today. Upon arrival, it was clear that the pitch presented an excellent batting opportunity. Moreover, we observed significant changes in the pitch behavior during the last game, prompting our decision to bat first.

My tenure with Delhi was exceptional, and now, being with Kolkata, I've received immense support from both the staff and management. I'm really looking forward to the game tonight.

Truthfully, cricket is unpredictable; anything can happen on any given day. Each team poses unique challenges, making it crucial to remain focused and perform our best every time we step onto the field. We've strategically adjusted our lineup, promoting Sunil to bat in the powerplay. His task is to aggressively take on the bowlers, a role he clearly understands. Similarly, every other player knows their importance. They're aware they're champions in their own right, and the importance of adhering to their roles cannot be overstated."

 

Rishab Pant | Skipper: "We would have chosen to bat first as well, since the pitch might turn slower in the second innings. But, we're not too worried about that. It's great to be back with the team. We're not looking too far ahead, just taking things as they come. The bowlers really stepped up during the Powerplay, and we came together well as a team. Our batting needs to pick up a bit too. After some discussion, we felt Prithvi Shaw wasn't at his best to start the tournament.

We're making one change for today's match. Mukesh Kumar is out with an injury, and Sumit Kumar will take his place."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
KKR - 88/1 (14.6 rpo, 12x4, 4x6) ||  DC - 51/4 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs(7-15 Overs) :-
KKR - 107/2 (11.9 rpo, 7x4, 7x6) ||  DC - 108/4 (12 rpo, 6x4, 9x6)

Death Overs(16-20 Overs) :-
KKR - 77/4 (15.4 rpo, 3x4, 7x6) ||  DC - 7/2 in 17.2 Overs (3 rpo, 0x4, 0x6) 

 

In a high-scoring encounter at Vizag, the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) continued their dominant start to the IPL season with a crushing 106-run victory over the Delhi Capitals (DC). KKR's batting masterclass laid the foundation for their win, with a record-breaking 272 runs on the board (2nd highest IPL total).
Their dominance was evident in a staggering 73.53% boundary percentage (fours and sixes) and a minimal 29.75% dot ball percentage, showcasing their aggressive intent and minimal time spent without scoring. Chasing a mammoth target, DC (166 all out) faltered under pressure. 
KKR's disciplined bowling attack, with a dot ball frequency of 3.36 compared to DC's 2.14, further restricted DC's scoring opportunities. This clinical bowling performance, featuring impressive debuts from Vaibhav Arora (3/27) and impactful spells from Varun Chakaravarthy (3/33) and Mitchell Starc (2/25), ensured KKR's emphatic win and their historic feat of winning their opening three IPL matches for the first time ever. 

 

Rishabh Pant |   skipper: "Today was a bit off for us with the ball; we know we could have performed better. It's just one of those days, really. As for our batting strategy, we're all about chasing aggressively. We believe it's better to fall trying than to fall short without giving it our all. The noise at the venue made it tough to see the DRS timer, plus there were some technical glitches too. But, some things are in our control and some aren't—we just roll with it. Now's the time for us to regroup, reflect, and come back stronger. On a personal note, enjoying my cricket every day, embracing the highs and lows, and always aiming to give my best."

Shreyas Iyer |   skipper: "Actually, our score exceeded our expectations. We aimed for 210-220, but hitting 270 was just phenomenal. As I mentioned before, Sunny's role is to give us a solid start, and it's fine if it doesn't always work out. But today, he was absolutely fearless right from the start, and his attitude on the field is just outstanding. Watching him play is a treat. It's fantastic to see our bowlers stepping up when needed and making the most of their moments. Regarding the injury concern on the field, I can empathize; I've been there. Vaibhav Arora really stood out tonight with his crucial wickets, truly stepping up for the team." 

PLAYER OF THE MATCH: SUNIL NARINE 

Sunil Narine: "Ahh... I reckon cricket largely is about batting. Contributing more with the bat is always pleasing, both for me and the team. Yet, I find joy in my bowling. My philosophy is simple: Knowing less is often better. On a pitch as good as this, my aim was to maintain a tight line. The scoreboard pressure made things somewhat easier tonight. In summary, it was a comprehensive performance with the ball by the team. Taking wickets early with the new ball and controlling the scoring rate was crucial."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As Royal Challengers Bengaluru grapple with strategic dilemmas early in IPL 2024, their quest to fine-tune their bowling strategy amidst the high-scoring nature of their home venue becomes more pressing. With two losses in defensive stands and only one victory in a chase, the team faces the familiar scrutiny over its bowling capabilities. Ahead of their clash against the Lucknow Super Giants—a side that previously snatched a dramatic victory from their grasp—the challenge of overcoming the venue's inherent disadvantages looms large.Nicholas Pooran, pivotal in LSG's last-season win against RCB, steps up again amid speculation around KL Rahul's role due to fitness concerns. Boosted by a recent win against Punjab Kings and the spotlight on Mayank Yadav's pace prowess, LSG's confidence is high.RCB, on the other hand, pins hopes on its batting powerhouses like Faf du Plessis, Glenn Maxwell, and Rajat Patidar to make their mark. Amidst this, the bowling lineup seeks to reinforce its support for Virat Kohli, who is playing his 100th game in BengaluruLSG, similar to RCB in navigating early-season jitters, eyes continuity in victory. Both teams, poised at a crucial juncture, aim to shed their early inconsistencies. This confrontation at M.Chinnaswamy Stadium is not just a test of strategy and skill but also a momentous occasion marking Kohli's centenary of appearances, promising a duel rich in narratives and the potential for an epic showdown in IPL 2024's unfolding saga.  

Pitch Report | Murali Kartik and Graeme Swann :

"Pitch number 7, previously seen in the game against Punjab Kings where 175 was scored, now shows an average first innings score of 196 in recent years. Immediately noticeable is its dryness, suggesting significant spin potential, particularly for Glenn Maxwell. In the recent clash between RCB and PBKS, spinners from both disciplines found turn on this surface. This year, it's emerged as the IPL's top spinner-friendly venue. Maxwell, and other spinners, will likely target the dry, crack-laden areas outside the right-handers' off-stump, resembling a riverbed with interspersed grass patches. This could introduce variable bounce and turn, making it an intriguing pitch for spin bowling."   

 



Head-to-Head at Bengaluru – The single encounter between RCB and LSG at this venue saw the latter emerging victorious, setting the stage for a revenge saga this season.  


 AND   FORM IN IPL 2024

  L  W  L
 L  W 



 

 

TOSS :   WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD  

Faf du Plessis: "We've decided to chase today. The last game we played here, the pitch was slower in the first innings, with some areas patchy and dry. It's crucial for us to keep learning from our past games. We've had productive discussions and are looking to correct our mistakes. There's a bit of moisture on the pitch, so let's see how it unfolds. Topley will be joining us in place of Alzarri."  


KL Rahul: "It feels a bit unusual today, used to walking into the home dressing room here, and now I'm heading to the visitors'. Our team has shown great character in both matches so far. It's heartening to see everyone contributing, which boosts our confidence. We're getting better with every season, and our team combination is strengthening. Our goal now is to score substantial runs and apply pressure on the opposition. Beyond our victories, there's been a lot of talk about Mayank's pace. He's been a part of our team since the beginning and it was unfortunate he missed last season due to injury. We're making just one change today - Moshin Khan is out with a sore back, and Yash Thakur steps in."

LSG - 54/1 (9 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  ||  RCB - 48/3 (8 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

LSG - 50/2 (10 rpo, 3x4,5x6)  || RCB - 49/4 (9.8 rpo, 2x4, 5x6)  


 

In a captivating showdown, Lucknow Super Giants outplayed Royal Challengers Bengaluru by 20 runs, turning stats and strategy into their winning mantra. Quinton de Kock's explosive 81 off 56 balls spearheaded LSG's robust total of 181/5. LSG's innings was marked by a strategic assault, amassing 25 boundaries, including 10 fours and 14 sixes, pushing the boundary percentage to an impressive 70.72%. Their disciplined approach saw a run rate of 9.05, despite facing 51 dot balls. Nicholas Pooran’s late onslaught, smashing 5 sixes in the last 12 balls, epitomized LSG’s aggressive finish, propelling them past the critical 180 mark.

RCB's chase stuttered from the start, with their top order collapsing under pressure. The early deployment of left-arm spinners against RCB's openers set the tone, with M Siddharth removing the in-form Kohli, and Mayank Yadav's pivotal powerplay over further denting their momentum. RCB's innings struggled for rhythm, evidenced by a higher dot ball percentage of 45.76% and a subdued run rate of 7.78. Despite Rajat Patidar and Mahipal Lomror's efforts, their chase was constrained by efficient LSG bowling, underscored by Mayank Yadav’s critical spell, taking 3 wickets with an economy of 3.50 Yadav's early breakthroughs and economical spells kept RCB's batsmen in check, culminating in a spectacular catch by Pooran to dismiss Mohammed Siraj, emblematic of LSG's fielding superiority and sealing a well-fought victory. 

 

 

 Faf du Plessis| Skipper : " Quinton de Kock and Nicky P were let off early, and that mistake cost us about 60-65 extra runs. In the IPL, errors like that can be quite expensive.Facing Mayank Yadav initially was a challenge due to his unique action. It takes a while for batters to adjust and understand the delivery. His pace was impressive, but even more so was his control over lengths, especially with that extra pace. Our bowling in the powerplay wasn't up to mark, too many deliveries played to their strengths. Maxwell did a great job pulling us back into the game, and we managed to restrict them towards the end. However, when chasing, building partnerships is crucial, and we failed to do that. We need to show some strong character in our next games to chase down totals successfully." 


 

KL Rahul |  Skipper: "Overall, it was a solid team performance. The pitch offered some help for the fast bowlers, making it slightly tricky. By the time their bowlers figured out the right lengths to bowl, we had already put up a competitive score. We opted not to target the yorkers immediately, considering the pressure at Chinnaswamy can be overwhelming, and focused instead on bowling the right lengths.Keeping to Mayank Yadav was an experience, especially with one delivery hitting me quite hard. It’s been fantastic watching Mayank's growth, especially after his patience through injury and training in Bombay.Regarding our record while defending, despite the trend in T20 to bowl first, our history suggests batting first works well for us. My strategy of losing the toss seems to work in our favor (laughs).
We don’t see setbacks in a negative light; it’s all about how we stay engaged in the game. If we’re outplayed, then it’s a different discussion, but making mistakes is part of the game since the opposition also aims to win. Our focus is on improving our powerplay bowling, which has been a concern. This game we opted for spin, which worked well against their lineup, and we’ll continue to work on taking early wickets."


PLAYER OF THE MATCH : MAYANK YADAV   

Mayank Yadav: "Winning the Player of the Match in two consecutive games feels great, but seeing my team win is even more satisfying. My goal is to represent my country for as long as I can, and this is just the beginning. Dismissing Cameron Green was a highlight for me. To maintain pace, focusing on my diet, sleep, and recovery is essential, among other things."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As IPL 2024 unfolds, a captivating encounter awaits at Mumbai's iconic Wankhede Stadium where the Mumbai Indians , led by Hardik Pandya, are set to face off against the formidable Rajasthan Royals  in what promises to be a clash of titans. Mumbai, seeking redemption and buoyed by their home crowd, is under the spotlight as Pandya navigates the challenges of his captaincy, distinct from his tenure with the Gujarat Titans.

The narrative for MI this season has been a tale of highs and lows, marked by a dramatic run-fest in Hyderabad and a poignant setback against their former leader's squad. Their strategy, especially in utilizing pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah and contending with the highest-ever IPL team total posted by SRH, has been under scrutiny. Despite these hurdles, MI's resolve remains unshaken, with performances like Tilak Varma's half-century highlighting their potential to strike back.

Rajasthan Royals, on the other hand, have hit the ground running with a perfect start, showcasing a balanced attack that has outclassed opponents with both bat and ball. The promotion of Riyan Parag to number 4 has paid dividends, adding depth and firepower to their lineup. Yet, the Royals are not without their concerns, particularly around the form of explosive opener Jos Buttler, whose performance will be crucial as the tournament progresses.

A telling statistic that shines a light on Pandya's evolving leadership is his increased role in opening the bowling, a strategy that underscores MI's adaptive approach but also calls for a reevaluation of tactics. Amidst the strategic debates, the unity and spirit within the MI camp remain steadfast, embodied by spinner Piyush Chawla's defense of their decisions under fire.

The showdown at Wankhede is more than just a match; it's a test of MI's resilience against RR's burgeoning dominance. With MI's historical knack for a comeback, especially on home turf, and RR's all-round prowess, led by the astute captaincy of Sanju Samson, the stage is set for an epic encounter. As Mumbai looks to ignite their campaign with a victory, Rajasthan aims to continue their winning streak, making this matchup a pivotal moment in IPL 2024's narrative. 


Head to Head   VS  
 

Pitch Report: (Natalie Germanos and Brian Lara)
 Natalie Germanos sets the scene at Wankhede Stadium, highlighting pitch number seven's distinct characteristics with boundaries of 63m and 65m for right-handers, and a straight boundary of 74m, noting its absence from last year's IPL lineup. "Brian, how do you assess this pitch?" she inquires. Brian Lara, observing the pitch's verdant sheen and red soil, rich with grass, predicts, "Teams bowling first should look to capitalize, but given this season's trend, we're in for a high run count. It's a batter's paradise, and while spinners might struggle, the high scores in powerplays suggest plenty of action." Germanos questions the home advantage, especially for Mumbai playing their first game at home. Lara reflects, "Home advantage will indeed influence toss decisions. With the successes in defending and chasing seen so far, the team winning the toss and batting first might just have the upper hand." 

 

Stats At Wankhede Stadium:

IN IPL 2024 
  L L 
 W W 

TOSS :   Won the Toss and elected to Field First     




Sanju Samson ( Skipper): "We've decided to bowl first, given the fresh condition of the wicket. It's the season's opener here, and we aim to leverage any potential swing, especially with our swing bowlers in the squad. Our goal is to maintain our winning momentum without altering our approach too much

 

Hardik Pandya ( Captain): "Bowling first was our preference, but losing the toss isn't a setback. We're eager to see the total we can set. This franchise and its fanbase mean a lot, and I'm thrilled to be part of its 250th IPL game—a significant milestone. Our slow start doesn't concern us; our focus is always on what lies ahead. We trust our process and are committed to playing the cricket that our fans adore. There will be no changes to our line-up; it's the same XI."

The Rajasthan Royals continued their dream run in IPL 2024, hammering Mumbai Indians by 6 wickets at the Wankhede Stadium. This emphatic victory, their third in a row, sees them climb to the top of the points table.
Mumbai's struggles continued as they were bundled out for a mere 125/9. Trent Boult's fiery opening spell was the highlight, dismissing Rohit Sharma, Naman Dhir, and Dewald Brevis for first-ball ducks. Boult (3/22) was ably supported by Yuzvendra Chahal's (3/11) controlled spin in the middle overs, ensuring Mumbai never recovered. Hardik Pandya (34) and Tilak Varma (32) offered a brief fightback with a 56-run partnership, but their efforts were in vain.
It's no surprise that Rajasthan Royals are on top. Their bowling attack, particularly in the powerplay, has been exceptional. They've taken the most wickets (9) in the first six overs this season, showcasing their early dominance. This aggressive approach has stifled opposition batting lineups, putting them on the back foot from the get-go.

Chasing a modest target, Rajasthan Royals stumbled initially, losing Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson cheaply. However, the hero of their previous match, Riyan Parag (54*), emerged once again. Displaying a newfound maturity, Parag anchored the chase with a composed knock. Jos Buttler (13) and Ravichandran Ashwin (16) provided valuable support before falling. Despite losing wickets, the small target allowed the Royals to play with freedom. Parag   combined with debutant Shubham Dubey to see his team home comfortably with 4 overs to spare. 

Hardik Pandya ( Skipper): “The start wasn’t ideal for us, and losing my wicket was a turning point, hindering our chances of reaching a competitive total. However, this game's nature offers both challenges and opportunities, and I’m not one to shy away from difficult pitches. It’s about sticking to our strengths and maintaining discipline. Despite today’s outcome, I have full faith in our comeback. It's about courage and discipline now.”  

 

Sanju Samson ( Skipper): "Winning the toss definitely turned the tide in our favor. It played a pivotal role, especially with the conditions being quite challenging initially. Leveraging Trent Boult and Nandre Burger's expertise early on was key to our strategy.Their experience really shone through. Having Boult, with his extensive international cricket background, alongside Burger made a significant difference. Honestly, the early wickets were beyond our expectations, but their performances were exceptional.Our team is blessed with notable talents, yet it's the collective understanding of our role within the team that truly makes us stand out. Ashwin, for instance, adapting his bowling to the slowing pitch, exemplifies this perfectly, maintaining pressure during the crucial middle overs.There's a unique zeal within the squad to excel every IPL season. Watching Yuzvendra Chahal step up and deliver such an impactful performance tonight was a testament to that spirit."  
 
PLAYER OF THE MATCH: TRENT BOULT 

Trent Boult (POTM): "Certainly, in this format, nothing's guaranteed, yet I'm pleased to fulfil my role, especially taking wickets early on. Winning the toss and executing our plan set the tone, putting them under pressure right from the start. Facing Rohit, I always aim to mix it up; it's rewarding when the plan succeeds. Nandre Burger brings immense value with his confident South African bowling style, complementing our attack that includes consistent performers like Sandeep, Ashwin, and Chahal. It's an honour to be part of this unit."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the enthralling Match 13 of IPL 2024, where Chennai Super Kings  clash with Delhi Capitals  in what appears to be a David vs. Goliath encounter. CSK enters the fray riding high on consecutive victories, while the Capitals are seeking redemption after two initial setbacks.Beyond their contrasting starts to the season, DC is grappling with injury woes that add to their challenges. Ishant Sharma's absence since the opener and Shai Hope's back spasm sidelining him in their last outing underscore their predicament. Anrich Nortje and Jhye Richardson's gradual return to action offers a glimmer of hope, but the road to recovery and form is steep.

Adding another layer to DC's uphill battle is the venue — Visakhapatnam, DC's alternative home ground, where their record is less than favorable, with three losses out of five IPL encounters played here. This setting away from the familiar turf of Delhi adds an unpredictable element to their campaign.

Tonight's match isn't just a contest between two teams but a test of resilience for the Capitals against a formidable CSK, determined to maintain their winning streak. As  looks to consolidate their position at the top,  eyes a much-needed turnaround in their season. Will the underdog rise, or will the favorites continue their dominance? 

HEAD-TO-HEAD IN IPL:


 

 and  IPL 2024 :

 :      L    L

 :    W    W  

PITCH REPORT 

Darren Ganga and Rohan Gavaskar. "The climate conditions are ideal for cricket today. A pleasant breeze is sweeping across the field, and we're positioned on pitch number 4, perfectly centered. The boundaries measure 62m on either side of the wicket and extend to 71m down the ground. The pitch sports an even grass cover, and the robust root structure is holding the soil well, indicating limited turn. It looks like a fantastic pitch for batting. While the average first innings score from games prior to 2019 hovered around 157, it's a bit outdated. We anticipate the current average first innings score to be in the range of 175-180. Bowlers will need to be strategic in their approach, leaning towards back of a length deliveries, varying pace, and employing cutters effectively. It seems to be a bat first wicket,"


TOSS :  WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT FIRST  

Rishabh Pant   Skipper "We've decided to bat first. The pitch seems promising, and we aim to maximize it with our batting. Our goal is to post a solid total and then effectively defend it with our bowling. Practicing here has made a significant difference. We're making two adjustments to our lineup today. Kuldeep Yadav is dealing with a minor issue, so he's out, and Prithvi Shaw will be taking his place. Ishant Sharma will be stepping in for Ricky Bhui. Our focus is on extracting the best performance from our team. Playing quality cricket is crucial for us. By doing so, we believe we can change our fortunes and secure a win."  

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad,  Skipper "Our preference was indeed to field first. Given it's the first match on this fresh wicket, we're yet to fully assess its character. We'll adapt as the game progresses, aiming to successfully chase the target. Today feels like a home game for us. Our strategy remains unchanged. We aim to keep our approach straightforward, concentrating on executing the basics well and clinching those crucial individual contests and moments, which I believe are key. We've decided to stick with the same lineup for this match."

DC 62/0 ( 10.33 rpo 8x4 , 2x6 ) || CSK 32/2 ( 5.3 rpo 3x4 1x6 )
Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-

In a match that will be remembered for MS Dhoni's electrifying assault in the final stages, sending the crowd into a frenzy, it was ultimately Delhi Capitals who emerged victorious by a margin of 20 runs. The spectacle of Dhoni's late onslaught, while thrilling, wasn't enough to bridge the gap for Chennai Super Kings. From the outset, Delhi Capitals executed their game plan with precision, maintaining control over the proceedings. The target of 192, initially seen as reachable given the favorable pitch conditions and shorter boundaries, became a daunting task under the spell of Khaleel Ahmed's remarkable opening spell. Ahmed's prowess not only led to the dismissal of CSK's crucial openers but also showcased his dominance over a talent like Rachin, highlighting the effectiveness of his attack.

Throughout the game, Delhi Capitals balanced aggression with strategic play, setting a formidable score thanks, in part, to Rishabh Pant's aggressive half-century. Despite the magical moments provided by Dhoni, it was the collective effort and strategic execution by the Capitals that sealed the deal. DC's bowlers, with Ahmed leading the charge, effectively dismantled the opposing lineup, ensuring their strategy culminated in a well-deserved 20-run victory over CSK 

Ruturaj Gaikwad  Skipper: "Honestly, I was pleased with our comeback after the initial overs. Considering their start at 60 for no loss, pulling them back to 190 felt like a solid effort. Throughout the game, the pitch seemed consistent, though Rachin appeared to struggle a bit with the spongy bounce. Our start wasn't ideal, and that gap became the critical difference. Initially, the target seemed achievable, but we soon faced significant seam movement and struggled to catch up, lacking those crucial big overs. Regarding Deepak, he's accustomed to bowling three overs upfront, although the last over in the powerplay turned out costly. After two wins, a setback in the third game isn't unexpected. Losing by 20 runs came down to just a few shots, and overall, our bowlers performed commendably." 

Rishabh Pant,  Skipper: "Today, our bowlers were spot on. We've taken our previous lessons to heart. Shaw has been putting in the effort for the last two weeks, and giving him the opportunity paid off today. Mukesh's role, especially at the death, will vary from game to game. For me, cricket has always been my life, and giving my all is non-negotiable. After not playing much for 1.5 years, it took some time to adjust, but my self-belief has never wavered. It's crucial to keep coming back, no matter what."

Khaleel Ahmed (Player of the Match): "My performance today is the fruit of relentless hard work at the domestic level. I've focused on enhancing my swing, and it's gratifying to see the outcomes. There's a unique joy in watching batters struggle against my swing. Of course, making a comeback to the Indian team remains my ultimate aim. I appreciate all the blessings and support."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The are gearing up to welcome for the 12th clash of the IPL 2024, scheduled to unfold at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on March 31, Sunday.

Under Shubman Gill's captaincy, GT kicked off their IPL 2024 campaign on a high note with a narrow six-run victory over the Mumbai Indians (MI), a team with five IPL titles to their name. However, their subsequent encounter saw them face a significant setback, as they endured a 63-run loss to the reigning champions, Chennai Super Kings (CSK), at Chepauk.

Despite opting to field first in that match, GT allowed CSK to amass a daunting total of 206 runs. CSK's bowling unit then took centre stage, curtailing GT's chase to 143/8.

SRH, meanwhile, has been the talk of the tournament following their explosive performance against MI, where they racked up the highest-ever IPL team total of 277 runs. The trio of Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma, and Heinrich Klaasen were instrumental in this historic feat, scoring 62, 63, and an unbeaten 80 runs, respectively. Despite a valiant effort from the Hardik Pandya-led MI, SRH's bowling attack managed to hold them to 246, showcasing their team's depth and prowess.

Dimensions square of the wicket is 66 metres, dab towards the third man that's just 58 metres, pull/hook is 63 metres, scoop is 53 metres and down the ground it is 73 metres. On the surface, this looks like a very good wicket. Looks like a batting track. It's an absolute road, it looks like a tremendous wicket. There's quite a nice breeze flowing across the ground, so that might help the players tremendously. It's going to get up to 38 or 40 degrees here. In the day games played here, teams batting first have scored 200, once it was defended and on another occasion it wasn't".

Shubman Gill, Skipper: "  We would have first, looks like a good pitch. Have a lot of good memories to look back on here and would like to make more good memories here. The support that I get from Ashish Nehra and the management is great. We have got two changes today Nalkande and Noor come in "

A masterful display from the home side saw securing a convincing 7-wicket victory over ! GT's bowling unit was instrumental in holding SRH to a modest 162, with Rashid Khan and Noor Ahmed tightening the screws during the middle overs. Mohit Sharma emerged as the standout bowler, claiming three vital wickets. The chase was set up nicely by an opening partnership between Saha and Gill, while the middle-order duo of Sudharsan and Miller took over with poise, guiding GT to triumph with five balls remaining.

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: " Good game of cricket, was tight in the end, probably we needed 10-15 more runs. I think they bowled well, just losing a couple of wickets, didn’t have that one person who kicked on to get a fifty, that happens. Today it was, we thought the wicket was going to get a bit slow, but the off-cutters did grip, we had 8 bowling options in our side but still could not do it. I thought the wicket played the same in both innings. Had a fantastic couple of games with the bat, today we didn’t quite click. That is the beauty of T20 cricket."
 

Shubman Gill,   Skipper "It's great to win two matches at home. Two more to go and then we go on the road. Our bowlers were splendid in the middle overs. Both Rashid (Khan) and Noor (Ahmad) were great. Rashid is world-class. Mohit (Sharma) is such an experienced bowler. He comes in and bowls the slower bouncers. Executes his variations perfectly. All credit to him. In this heat, it's easier to bat early in day games. So, we wanted to make them hit to the bigger boundary off slower balls. We thought 160-170 would be a good score. Our bowlers restricted them. The players are clear with their respective roles. It was important for (David) Miller to get back in form. Thankfully, he came good. He's not injured. Just cramps."

 

Mohit Sharma Player of the Match. "The key is to deploy variations at just the right moment. You have to be a step ahead of the batters. Making the right field adjustments is also crucial. Regarding the dew, we've been practicing with the wet ball to get used to it. It's really about learning from past errors. Our spinners came through when it mattered most."
