Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 21  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the thrilling live action from Lucknow, where the 11th match of the Indian Premier League 2024 will see the take on the at Ekana Stadium.

Both teams come into this clash on the back of defeats in their respective last games. Lucknow, despite a commendable effort, fell short against the Rajasthan Royals. KL Rahul found form with a fluent 58 off 44 balls, and Nicholas Pooran contributed a vigorous unbeaten 64, but their efforts were insufficient to secure a victory, ending up 20 runs behind. With such explosive talent in their lineup, expectations are high for them to make a significant impact as the tournament progresses.

On the flip side, the Punjab Kings have experienced mixed fortunes with a win and a loss so far in the competition. Their most recent outing saw them falter against RCB, with Dinesh Karthik's finishing prowess proving too much to handle. While their batters have shown promise with solid starts, it's their performance at the death that raises concerns, particularly Harshal Patel's bowling in the crucial final overs. The team is keenly aware of this and is expected to strategize effectively to bolster their late-game bowling.

Head-to-Head in IPL:

 

PITCH REPORT: 
BC Lara and Matthew Hayden:  "The square boundaries are at 61m and 68m respectively, down the ground is 76m. There is a bit more grass on this pitch, it's a bit thicker, so there might be something in it for the pacers and the spinners too. But it does look good for batting with no cracks. Dew could be a factor though and the captain winning the toss could field first".

 

VENUE STATS:
 IPL 2023 AT LUCKNOW: 
WON FIRST: 4
WON SECOND : 3
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 148

 

TOSS:
 has won the toss and have elected to  

 

 

Nicholas Pooran, Skipper: " KL Rahul is playing as an impact player, we are easing him in as he is returning from an injury so he would definitely be here and we will see how it goes. We would look to put up a good total and defend it. We have lots of changes."

 


Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: " We would have bowled first anyway because of the dew we saw last night and would look to take advantage of the dew. Bowlers need to get their lines tight and also for batters to not lose back-to-back wickets in clusters. We are going in unchanged."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

LSG- 54/2 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  || PBKS- 61/0 (10.1 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

LSG - 92/2 (10.2 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)  || PBKS- 75/2 (8.3 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

LSG- 53/4 (10.6 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)   || PBKS- 42/3 (8.4 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

 

notch their inaugural victory of the season, making their presence felt in the points tally. After setting a challenging total of 199/8, Shikhar Dhawan and Jonny Bairstow launched an aggressive assault during the powerplay, forging a formidable opening stand of 102. seemed poised for victory until Mayank Yadav entered the fray, delivering a pacey spell that frequently breached the 150-kph mark, unsettling the Punjab lineup with his pace and bounce. Yadav's crucial breakthroughs included the wicket of Bairstow, followed by Prabhsimran Singh and Jitesh Sharma, shifting the momentum in LSG's favour. Dhawan, amidst the falling wickets, eventually faltered, and Punjab's innings was in all sorts of trouble . Despite Liam Livingstone's spirited effort, Punjab couldn't bridge the 21-run gap, underscoring LSG's comprehensive bowling performance.

 

Shikhar Dhawan,  Skipper: " They played well, Liam Livingstone got injured which impacted us. He would have come in at 4 and things would have been different. Mayank Yadav bowled well. His pace outsmarted us. He surprised me with that extra pace.I looked to use his extra pace but he figured it out and bowled yorkers to keep me down to a dot and a single. I told my partners to use the short side and his pace. He bowled at Prabh's body and got him out. Told Jitesh to leave Mayank and take on the other bowlers but they bowled well too and then used the pressure against us. We need to analyse the game. We gotta take catches because dropping catches takes the momentum away and gets the energy down. We need to come up with better plans and more importantly, implement them is what we need to do. We're close but need to do 10% more."

 

Nicholas Pooran, Skipper: " Wonderful start in front of a home crowd. With regards to the batting order, we had a start at the chat of the tournament. Use the lefty-righty combination as needed. It's a big ground, one side is pretty big. Shikhar and Bairstow played well, but they didn't take the game away from us. Mayank Yadav was the story of the night for us. It was an inspiring performance on debut. Every person in the team is happy he got a chance and performed tonight. It was wonderful watching him from the field."

 

 

Mayank Yadav is the Player of the Match 

Mayank Yadav: " Never ever thought it would be such a good debut. I Was nervous before the match. All I did was try to stick to my pace and aim at the stumps. Was thinking about using slower ones initially, but stuck to the quick ones. My first wicket that of Bairstow was special indeed. It's good to debut at such a young age. Had a few goals, but can't help if injuries come in the way."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the blockbuster showdown as Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders prepare for an electrifying clash in match number 10 of the Indian Premier League 2024 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. The host,   steps into the arena with a win and a loss from their opening two encounters. Despite a setback against CSK in the opener, they bounced back to defeat  in their second outing, thanks to Virat Kohli's landmark 100th T20 fifty-plus score. Dinesh Karthik and Mahipal Lomror played pivotal roles, stitching together a 48-run partnership for the sixth wicket and remaining unbeaten to clinch victory with four balls to spare.

 , buoyed by their narrow four-run victory over  in a high-octane opener, courtesy of Andre Russell's dynamic all-around performance and Phil Salt's stabilizing innings at the top, are eager to extend their winning momentum. Starc had a game to forget as he was taken to the cleaners in his comeback game. The Singh duos of Ramandeep and Rinku played a pivotal role for  . With all nine matches this season favoring the home side, and KKR's impressive track record of defeating  at the Chinnaswamy Stadium in their last five meetings, the stage is set for a potentially history-making encounter. Will  continue their dominance or will   halt their streak and maintain the home side's winning trend in 2024? 

 vs  Head-to-Head  

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sunil Gavaskar and Ian Bishop:  "It looks like a glorious evening here at the Chinnaswamy. The square is a little bit used, but the outfield looks superb. The dimensions of the ground aren't huge. We are the centre of the square - 61 metres (square) on either side and 75 metres straight. A high six-hitting ground. In the first game played here, we saw a number of seam bowlers taking pace off the ball and using the slower option. Maybe that's something faster bowlers may go to today. It looks interesting. It's still a good wicket and if the spinners keep landing the ball well it can get you a little more turn. We hope there'll be no dew factor". 

 

TOSS: 




 has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: " We are going to field first. Had a brief chat with the curator who was of the opinion that the ball will spin as well. The Morale of the team is fantastic, everyone is in high spirits. We have to carry forward the same momentum throughout. It is important to be in the present. My role is to play an anchor role. It's always good to have a lethal bowling line-up like ours. It is important to stay in the present. We have to see to it that we capitalize on the start. Anukul roy comes in."

 


Faf du Plessis, Skipper: " We would have bowled first as well. It's a fresh track, and looks a good wicket, you have to see how it plays in the first innings. It's important to close games early in the season. It's important to assess the conditions. We love the support and atmosphere here at home. We will go with the same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 61/1 (10.1 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || KKR- 85/0 (14.1 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB - 73/2 (8.1 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || KKR- 82/2 (9.1 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 48/3 (9.6 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)   || KKR- 19/1 (12.7 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

 

The streak of home victories is broken as extends their triumphs at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium, decisively overtaking RCB. Despite being put into bat, RCB reached a respectable 182, fueled by Kohli's second consecutive fifty and Dinesh Karthik's late fireworks, including three sixes. KKR's opening duo, Salt and Narine, launched an aggressive start, racking up 85 in the powerplay. Venkatesh Iyer, batting at three, kept the pressure on, delivering a swift 50 off just 30 balls to further unsettle RCB. Among RCB's bowlers, impact player Vyshak Vijaykumar stood out with four tight overs, showcasing his bowling prowess. KKR is unbeaten at the venue since 2015!

 

 


Faf du Plessis,Skipper: " Strange game, first innings we thought that the wicket was two-paced, you could see that when the guys bowled the cutters, batters struggled. We thought it was a decent score knowing that it gets a little easier in the evening, there was a little bit of dew coming in too. Looking at the way we batted in the first innings it was tough due to the lack of pace. We could have tried one or two things differently but the way the Salt and Narine batted, put immense pressure on our bowlers. They hit strong cricket shots and pretty much took the game away."

 


Shreyas Iyer, Skipper: " It was helpful to get some practice sessions here, we were in good shape from the previous game too. Personally Coming and hitting a few balls in the middle, it felt comfortable from within. The way Andre Russell came in and realised the wicket wasn't giving much assistance to the bowlers, made us resort to slower ones, analysing the conditions on the spot was pleasing to the eye. The communication was brilliant. When Narine comes in to open, he knows he has one job which is to clear the infield. Today we were contemplating whether to start with him or not but he did a brilliant job and took the game away from the opposition."

 

 

Sunil Narine is the Player of the Match 

Sunil Narine: " It's a nice milestone to reach 500 T20s. Hopefully 500 more to come. It's just the self-belief and the support staff encouraging. Also the hard work. Powerplay over is the hardest over - just have to let that go and keep it tight. Helps when you win. Players have full freedom to do what they want to do."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The IPL 2024's 9th match is set to unfold at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur, where will face off against on Thursday, March 28. The Capitals are looking to rebound from an initial setback, having faced a defeat in their opening match against Punjab Kings. Batting first, DC, led by Rishabh Pant, managed to set a decent target of 175 runs in their 20 overs. A collective effort from the top order and Abishek Porel's final burst proved crucial for them. But, on the back of Sam Curran's brilliant half-century, Shikhar Dhawan and his team overcame the target with four balls to spare.

Contrastingly, kicked off their season on a high note, securing a victory against Lucknow Super Giants on March 24 in Jaipur. For the Royals, captain Sanju Samson was the key to getting them to a competitive total of 193/4. The right-handed batter smashed a blazing 82 off 52, while Riyan Parag also contributed with a 29-ball 43. Nicholas Pooran and skipper KL Rahul toiled for LSG, but an impressive bowling effort, especially from Sandeep Sharma, restricted them to 173/6. With their sights set on continuing their success streak, the Royals are gearing up for their second home game with anticipation and the determination to extend their winning momentum. 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

RISHABH PANT VS R ASHWIN

DAVID WARNER VS TRENT BOULT
 

 

Vs Head To Head :
 

and have squared off 27 times in the IPL, with Capitals claiming victory in 13 encounters, while Royals has edged ahead with 14 wins.

 

VENUE STATS:
NIGHT GAMES OF IPL 2023 AT JAIPUR: 
WON FIRST: 2
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 172

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Katich and Samuel Badree:  "It's a fresh track. 67m square boundaries on both sides and 76m down the ground. We're playing on pitch number 5 today, it is absolutely rock solid, but there are some cracks which move as you press. It means that the bounce could be low initially, it means the tactics could be similar to that of the last game. It wouldn't be surprising that the Royals could be wanting to bat first again today". 

 

TOSS: 


has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Rishabh Pant, Skipper: "Wicket is fine but we want to use it when conditions are dry. Feels good to play 100 games for the same franchise but not thinking about it too much. Most of our concerns will be injury-based. We could've got the last game if Ishant's injury wasn't there. Gotta control the controllables. Ishant Sharma hasn't recovered and Shai Hope has a bad back, so two changes Nortje comes in and Mukesh Sharma comes in too."

 

 
Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  We also would've bowled first because of the dew factor. Both pitches look quite similar, this has an even covering of grass. All the teams here are very competitive. We have good players and will play good sides. Playing the same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 31/2 (5.2 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  || DC- 59/2 (9.8 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR - 77/2 (8.6 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)  || DC- 61/2 (6.8 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 77/1 (15.4 rpo, 8x4, 5x6)  || DC- 53/1 (10.6 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

 

 

Winning the toss proved advantageous for the Capitals, who initially subdued the RR lineup, quickly dismissing Jaiswal and Samson. However, a resilient stand between Riyan Parag and R Ashwin kept RR competitive. Parag's spectacular unbeaten 84, with a strike rate of 187, and Dhruv Jurel's timely cameo propelled RR to a final score of 185. Khaleel Ahmed excelled with the new ball, setting the tone early on.

Despite a brisk start by Marsh and Warner, Burger's double strike disrupted their momentum. Following this, a partnership between Pant and Warner built slowly, with Warner departing just short of a half-century. The pace faltered further after Pant's exit. Impact Player Porel couldn't make a significant dent, and despite Stubbs' late efforts, Sandeep Sharma and Avesh Khan clinched the victory for Rajasthan with composed bowling in the crucial moments

 

Rishabh Pant, Skipper: "Definitely disappointed. Best thing we can do from this is learn and move on. The bowlers did really well till 15-16 overs, batters sometimes go on at the death and score quickly, that happened in this game. Mitch Marsh and David Warner gave a good start, but we lost a few wickets in the middle-over phase and in the end we had to catch up. Hopefully, we can do better in the next match."

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  The way we started, the first ten overs, we were like Rovman, be ready you might have to bat! The IPL is changing and we all have to be flexible. Earlier it was about 11 players, now it is about all 15 players. Me and Sanga had a lot of chats between the 15th and 17th before deciding on the Impact Player. It's all about gauging in which zone they are. You have to look at that and take your call. I saw Sandy was calm and Avesh was also looking good, so I went with that. Riyan Parag has been a big name in the last few years. So happy he cashed in tonight"

 

 

Riyan Parag is Player of the Match 

Riyan Parag: " Emotions are settled, mother is here as well. She's seen the struggles, this feels very special. I know what my ability is and I never let that change - irrespective of whether I perform or not. A lot to do with the domestic season, where I scored a lot of runs."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
is gearing up to clash with Mumbai Indians (MI) in the eighth fixture of the Indian Premier League 2024 at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium, Hyderabad, on March 27, 2024. Having both faced setbacks in their opening matches of the season, each team is eager to chart a course back to victory. For the Sunrisers, this match marks their inaugural home game of IPL 2024, presenting a perfect opportunity to clinch their first win in the comfort of their stadium, buoyed by the support of their fans.

Under the leadership of Pat Cummins, SRH's journey in the 2024 edition commenced on a sombre note, succumbing to a heartbreakingly close four-run defeat against the two-time champions, Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. Despite this initial stumble, the team is poised for a resurgence as they face off against Mumbai Indians in what promises to be a riveting encounter.

, under Hardik Pandya's leadership, initiated their IPL 2024 campaign with a narrow defeat to Gujarat Titans (GT) by six runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Despite being in a promising position by the 15th over during the chase, MI couldn't capitalize towards the end, leaving them eager to move past this setback and seek victory in their upcoming matches. Notably, since IPL 2013, MI has historically found themselves on the back foot in season openers.

In their opening game, Jasprit Bumrah delivered an exceptional performance, with figures of 4-0-14-3, playing a crucial role in containing GT to a manageable total. Rohit Sharma, the stalwart Mumbaikar, contributed a fiery 43 off 29 balls, keeping MI's chase on track before his dismissal turned the tide of the game. Looking ahead, MI is counting on the continued form of these key players to drive them towards their first win of the season and build the momentum they are known for.

 

 

Vs Head To Head: 

SRH and MI have encountered in 21 matches in the IPL. Out of these 21 games, Sunrisers have won 9 whereas Mumbai have come out victorious on 12 occasions.

 

PITCH REPORT: 
 Brian Lara ."First home game for SRH. Leg-side is 66 metres, off-side is 63 metres, 76 metres down the ground. Looks like a great batting wicket, this one's void of grass. The best time to bat is against the brand-new ball. As the ball loses shine, the bowlers who use variations and bowl slower ones will get a purchase from the wicket. Teams need to capitalize in the first 5-10 overs while batting. There's going to be something in it for the fast bowlers in the beginning, and something in it for the spinners throughout. Bowlers who hit the hard length will enjoy bowling here. A bat first wicket" 

 

VENUE STATS:
NIGHT GAMES OF IPL 2023 AT HYDERABAD: 
WON FIRST : 3
WON SECOND: 2




 

 

TOSS: 




MI has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "We are going to field first. Looks like a good wicket, we were solid in the first game. Didn't plan properly, and that cost us the game. 13 games to go, so we need to keep doing the right things. We are positive and looking forward to the challenge. We have one change, Luke Wood misses out and Maphaka comes in."

 


Pat Cummins, Skipper: "  Looks like a good wicket. Not too upset with anything. It's a tough tournament, the crowd and conditions will help. We have a couple of changes. Travis Head comes in for Marco Jansen. T Natarajan has a niggle. We got a great squad, the players playing tonight got to give their everything."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
SRH - 81/1 (13.5 rpo, 10x4, 4x6)  || MI- 76/2 (12.7 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)
Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 
SRH - 121/2 (13.4 rpo, 4x4, 10x6)  || MI- 109/2 (12.1 rpo, 4x4, 9x6)
Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 
SRH - 75/0 (15 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)  || MI- 61/1 (12.2 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)

 

A monumental clash witnessed by 35,000 fans, breaks records as the T20 match with the most sixes and the highest collective run total! Despite the 30-run margin, the match teetered on the edge until the second strategic timeout. SRH were brilliant right from the beginning courtesy Travis Head who announced his arrival in style for the orange army while the young star Abhishek Sharma was on a hitting streak of his own registering the fastest 50 for SRH. Klaasen doing the late damage made things difficult for in the deathovers! Despite a daunting total on board, Mumbai Indians launched into action with Rohit Sharma aggressively targeting Jaydev Unadkat, and Ishan Kishan dismantling Bhuvneshwar Kumar. The opening duo quickly racked up 56 runs in just 3.2 overs before Kishan departed, followed by Sharma. The momentum continued with Naman Dhir and Tilak Varma, who dominated the spinners, with Varma notching up a rapid fifty. Post-timeout, Pat Cummins, the captain, claimed Varma's crucial wicket. Hardik Pandya and Tim David struggled to accelerate against SRH's pacers, who skillfully restricted pace and angles. An epic encounter that kept fans on the edge of their seats till the very end. 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "Wicket was really good, 277 no matter how bad or good you bowl, if the opposition scores that much, they have batted well. They bowled well too. It was tough out there, almost 500 runs were scored and the wicket was assisting the batters. we could have done a few things differently, but having said that, we have a young bowling attack and we will learn from this. All the batters looked good and it is just a matter of time before we put things right."

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: "  That was insane, wasn't it?. The ball was pinging around. Not until we bowled, it get a bit too close for comfort. They found a boundary whenever they needed it, but we finished it off well. Abhishek Sharma is impressive, in IPL you play with a lot of pressure but he plays with great freedom. When batting You never play for 270, but we wanted to be positive and be aggressive from the beginning and take the game on. It was a good wicket, so we have to suck it up knowing we would go for a few boundaries. What's important is to have clear plans with the ball."

 

 

Abhishek Sharma is the Player of the Match 

Abhishek Sharma: " I said in the previous interview too, the domestic season gives us a lot of confidence. The message for the batters is simple - go out and express yourself. The plan was to attack, I enjoyed batting with Head, he's one of my favourite batters, and I admire him. He told me to go for it if it was in my zone. I'm happy to be getting my chances, doesn't matter what position I'm playing. I had a chance to talk to Brian Lara last night, that helped me massively."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 63  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 63  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The top two teams from the last edition of the Indian Premier League, Chennai Super Kings and Gujarat Titans, are gearing up for the seventh match of IPL 2024 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium on March 26, 2024. Both teams have won their respective openers, with CSK defeating their rival RCB, while GT overcame the five-time champions, Mumbai. 

For CSK, Mustafizur Rahman delivered a fearsome spell in the first game, claiming four important wickets, including those of Kohli, Faf, Patidar, and Green, while Deepak Chahar accounted for the dangerous Maxwell. Rachin Ravindra had an impressive debut, going berserk against the opposition with a quickfire 37 off 15 balls, while his compatriot, Daryl Mitchell, also made a notable debut, scoring 22 off 18, including two sixes. The duo of Shivam Dube and Ravindra Jadeja provided a perfect finish to the game with a solid half-century partnership. 

For GT, Sai Sudharsan and Shubman Gill picked up where they left off, impressing the management with a flurry of runs, with the former scoring 45 and the latter adding an important 31. The pace department collectively secured 8 wickets, with all four bowlers—Umesh Yadav, Mohit Sharma, Spencer Johnson, and Azmatullah Omarzai—picking up two wickets each. The spin duo of Sai Kishore and Rashid Khan bowled economically in the middle overs, conceding only 47 runs in their eight overs and taking a wicket. 

Both teams will look to carry the winning momentum going ahead. 

 

 

vs Head-to-Head: 

In the five games battled, GT won three games while CSK won two. 

 

Stats and Records at MA Chidambaram Stadium: 

The Pacers have picked as many as 506 wickets in the 77 matches played at this venue while spinners have picked 331 wickets in as many games. 46 of the games have been won by teams defending while 31 games have been won by teams chasing.  

 

Ground Dimensions:

 

PITCH REPORT:

Matthew Hayden : "It's a different track tonight. Looks like a really good pitch, there was bounce and carry in the first match. There's a lot of grass cover on the surface, unusual for a Chepauk pitch. There are a few patches where there's an uneven covering of grass too. The spinners will come into play in the middle overs. It's a bat-first wicket".

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

 

Shubman Gill, Skipper: "We will field first. Everyone is well rested and well settled with 10 teams playing. We get enough rest time between games. It shows the character of the team, the way our bowlers bounced back against Mumbai was good to see. We are going in with the same team."

 

 
Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: "  We were looking to bowl first as well, the wicket is hard and looks similar to the first match. It was a rusty start against RCB but we came back well to win the match. Everyone showed good intent throughout the game. Our Malinga Pathirana comes in for Theekshana."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 69/1 (11.5 rpo, 9x4, 3x6)  || GT- 43/2 (7.1 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK - 86/2 (9.6 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)  || GT- 71/3 (7.9 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 51/3 (10.2 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)   || GT- 29/3 (5.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) 

 

showcased their prowess at the Chepauk stronghold, putting on a batting clinic first up as directed by Shubman Gill. The innings were marked by notable contributions from their lineup, particularly the left-handed duo Rachin Ravindra and Shivam Dube. Ravindra delivered a fiery 46 at a strike rate of 230, while Dube unleashed a barrage of hits, amassing 51 off just 23 balls. Tasked with a daunting target of 206, GT faced an uphill battle right from the onset, compounded by the early loss of their captain, Shubman Gill, during the powerplay. Deepak Chahar's initial breakthroughs, removing both openers, laid the groundwork for CSK's dominance in the subsequent overs. GT struggled to find their rhythm, with CSK's bowlers efficiently dismantling their batting lineup and ensuring wickets fell consistently. Ultimately, GT could not surmount the challenge, falling short by 63 runs, as CSK's fortress remained unbreached.

 

Shubman Gill, GT Skipper: "They outplayed us in the second innings and their execution was spot on. We backed ourselves to get a decent score in the powerplay and once we didn’t, we were always behind the 8th ball. On this wicket, we were expecting to chase 190-200. I think it’s a great learning for the bowlers. I think it’s better to have this kind of game early on in the tournament rather than in the latter stage. A lot of new learnings for me and new experiences. It’s exciting to captain a team like , we’ve made it to the finals in the last couple of years so very exciting to be leading such a side."

 

 
Ruturaj Gaikwad, CSK Skipper: "  Definitely today's game was perfect in all three departments batting, bowling and fielding, and against a team like Gujarat we needed to come up with a performance like this. In Chennai we are not sure how the wicket will be, we need to do well irrespective of batting or bowling first. Here if we have wickets in hand at the end it helps. Personally felt, that Rachin batted brilliantly in the powerplay and took the game away. From there we were always ahead. Shivam Dube is high on confidence, the management and Mahi bhai worked with him, and his confidence is very high. He knows his roles very well. Definitely he is a big plus for us. Personally very happy with fielding as well"

 

 

Shivam Dube is Player of the Match 

Shivam Dube: " This franchise is different from all others. This franchise is giving me freedom and I also want to win some matches for them. I worked in that way as well - it is helping me, I know they are going to bowl short balls and I'm ready for that. They want me to go on a higher strike rate and I want to do that."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 4  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 4  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
As the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 gears up for its sixth game at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, the stakes are high for the Royal Challengers Bangalore , led by Faf du Plessis, who is keen to overturn their recent misfortune. In stark contrast, the Punjab Kings stride into the fray buoyed by an assertive victory, showcasing their formidable form early in the tournament. 

In their opening match, RCB’s promising start was swiftly undone by a tactical masterclass from 'Fizz', whose devastating spell left RCB floundering at a precarious 78/5 by the 12th over. Despite the dire straits, Dinesh Karthik and Anuj Rawat valiantly spearheaded a counter-attack, elevating their team to a respectable 173/6. Their efforts painted a picture of resilience, yet the inability of RCB's bowlers to defend this total, resulting in a 6-wicket loss, underscored a pressing need for strategic recalibrations. 

Conversely, the have carved a narrative of confidence and aggression right from the outset. With a blend of disciplined bowling led by Arshdeep Singh and Harshal Patel, each clinching two wickets, and dynamic batting performances from Sam Curran and Liam Livingstone, they notched up a convincing victory against the Delhi Capitals. This win not only set a robust tone for their campaign but also showcased their capacity to execute their plans with precision. 

 

RCB vs PBKS Head-to-Head: 

In as many as 31 matches contested between the two teams, edge over with 17 wins to 14 wins. 

 

 

Stats at M Chinnaswamy Stadium: 


The Pacers here, have picked 623 wickets while the spinners have picked 291 wickets. 

 

Players Battle to watch out for: 

Virat Kohli vs Kagiso Rabada: 

6 –Inns 

27 –Runs 

24 –Balls 

3 –Outs 

9 –Avg 

112.50 -SR 

3 –4s 

0-6s 

8 –Dots 

 

Shikhar Dhawan vs Glenn Maxwell: 

9 –Inns 

76 –Runs 

47 –Balls 

38 –Avg 

2 –Outs 

161.70 -SR 

7 –4s 

3 –6s 

10 –Dots 

 

VENUE STATS:
NIGHT GAMES OF IPL 2023 AT BENGALURU: 
WON FIRST : 2
WON SECOND : 3
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 202

 

PITCH REPORT:  

Deep Dasgupta and Simon Katich "First of three back-to-back home games for RCB as they take on the Kings from Punjab. This has been a high-scoring ground because of the ground dimensions and the centre pitch is being used; 60 meters on either side and straight down the ground is 70 meters. It certainly does look like a high-scoring Chinnaswamy pitch. The pitch is rock hard, there's a bit of grass on it and what we know about last year's IPL is the average first innings score is 196. The ball is going to fly everywhere. The trend in this IPL so far has been the home team winning. Can the RCB get off the mark tonight in front of their adoring fans? There are a few cracks but they look superficial and it also looks patchy with patches of grass. Maybe a little bit two-paced because it is dry where there are cracks but under lights you expect the ball to come on to the bat". 

 

TOSS: 

 

has won the toss and have elected to   first

 

Faf du Plesis, Skipper: "We are going to have a bowl. It looks like a pretty good wicket but also because of the way our team is set up. The boys are excited for the season. In any game of cricket, you can't have clusters of wickets and we have to improve on that. Same team and one or two options on changing the substitutions."

 


Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: " We would have bowled first. But looking forward to batting first now. We did a lot of right things in the first game and that's why we ended up on the winning side. We have to keep improving each game. Same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 40/1 (6.6 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || RCB- 50/2 (8.3 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS - 88/3 (9.8 rpo, 4x4, 6x6)  || RCB- 68/2 (7.6 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 48/2 (9.6 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)  || RCB- 60/2 (13.3 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

 

Winning the toss and electing to field first proved advantageous for RCB as they successfully stifled the Kings, limiting them to 40 in the initial powerplay and continually taking wickets at crucial junctures. Despite promising starts from the PBKS lineup, a substantial innings eluded them. Yash Dayal's formidable powerplay overs, coupled with Siraj's adept run rate management, saw the duo surrender a mere 49 runs across their combined 8 overs while claiming three vital wickets. Shashank Singh's spirited charge towards the end propelled PBKS to a commendable 176.

RCB's chase witnessed early setbacks, losing two wickets early on, yet Kohli, true to his moniker 'King Kohli,' kept the scoreboard ticking, crafting a masterful 77 off 49 balls. However, his dismissal by Harshal Patel set the stage for a thrilling climax, with RCB needing 47 off the final 24 balls. It was then that DK stepped up, epitomizing the adage "cometh the hour, cometh the man," alongside Mahipal Lomror, who unleashed a flurry of shots. Lomror's rapid 17 off 8 and DK's explosive 28 at an astounding strike rate of 280 ushered RCB to victory with four balls to spare, illustrating the dynamic, unpredictable nature of cricket where heroes emerge in the face of adversity.

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "  It was a decent game, we came back and again lost it. We scored 10-15 runs less, in the powerplay as I played a bit slow. Those 10-15 runs cost us and the dropped catch did not help either.  Virat scored 70-odd runs after we dropped a catch of a class player like him, we paid the price. If we had taken that catch, the momentum would have come from the second ball. But we lost the momentum over there and then we paid the price for that."

 

Faf du Plessis, RCB Skipper: Talking about the calmness "On the outside, not as much on the inside. Early in the competition you want to make sure you get over the line. Felt we were in the position to do that sooner. With the new rule, we knew we had Mahipal coming in - has a lot of power. Now with the extra batter, you feel like even 14-15 rpo is gettable. Pleased DK. I said the other night that it is really important for him to get his IPL going with confidence."

 

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: " People talk about a lot of other things when you play sport - achievement, stats, numbers. But when you look back it's the memories you create. The love, appreciation and backing I've received has been amazing. I try to give the team a blazing start, but if wickets fall you have to assess. Wasn't the usual flat pitch. Disappointed I couldn't finish the game. Was in the slot but sliced it to a deep point. They know I play the cover drive well, so they're not going to allow me to hit gaps. You have to come up with a game plan here and there. I know my name is now attached to just promoting the game in different parts of the world when it comes to T20 cricket. I've still got it I guess."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the fifth game of the IPL, where past alliances are tested, and new rivalries are born. Hardik, after propelling Gujarat Titans to remarkable heights, including an IPL championship and a runner-up finish while consistently leading the league table, now dons the Mumbai jersey once more. The Western Derby between Mumbai and Gujarat is set to become a fixture highlight, marking a riveting chapter in the IPL saga. In the wake of Hardik's departure, Gujarat appointed Shubman Gill as captain. Despite his scoring prowess, Gill steps into leadership. As both teams gear up, injuries have sidelined key players, including Mumbai's Suryakumar Yadav and Gujarat's Mohammed Shami, testing the depth and adaptability of their squads. Will the experienced Mumbai turn victorious or will the successful Titans start their campaign with a win?

 

 vs  Head-to-Head in IPL:

Across their four previous meetings, both teams have clinched victory twice. Today's clash poses the question: Who will break the tie and take the lead in their head-to-head record? 


Venue Stats 

 

TOSS:- 


MUMBAI INDIANS GET THE TOSS IN THEIR FAVOUR AND DECIDE TO FIELD FIRST!  


Hardik Pandya  Skipper : "We've decided to bowl first, considering the track looks decent and might improve with dew. It's great to be back, especially in Gujarat where I've had significant success and received immense support—very thankful for that. My cricket journey started in Mumbai, so it feels special returning. The team's been preparing for nearly two weeks, full of eagerness to perform. We've had excellent practice matches and sessions, and everyone's looking sharp. The squad's balance feels right, with four quicks, three spinners, and seven batters, ensuring we're well-prepared in all aspects. "
 

Shubman Gill  Skipper : " I'm truly excited to captain in a stadium filled with so many personal memories. Our fan support over the last few seasons has been a key strength, giving us incredible backing. Arriving a week early, I participated in a practice match and sessions, finding everyone in great form and fitness. Today marks the debut for GT of Umesh bhai, Spencer, and Omarzai, with several newcomers, like Sushant from the U-19s and Sai Sudharsan, expected to debut later this season. Everyone's showing promising form in our recent sessions."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 47/1 (7.8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || MI- 52/2 (8.7 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT - 77/2 (8.5 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || MI- 74/1 (8.2 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 44/3 (8.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || MI- 36/6 (7.2 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

 

 

At the eagerly awaited clash in Ahmedabad, Hardik Pandya won the toss and chose to field first, marking his debut as Mumbai Indians captain. Gujarat Titans' opening duo, Wriddhiman Saha and Shubman Gill, got off to a swift start. Gill contributed 31 from 22 deliveries, B Sai Sudharsan compiled 45 from 39, and Azmatullah Omarzai's brief appearance yielded 17 runs off 11 balls. Bumrah's tight bowling was the highlight, ending the figures of 4-0-14-3. Rahul Tewatia's quick 22 off 15 helped set GT's score at 168/6 by the end of their innings. Omarzai early on rattled MI with the dismissal of Ishan Kishan for a duck and later Naman Dhir, who had started aggressively with 20 runs from 10 balls. Rohit Sharma and Dewald Brevis stitched together a promising 77-run partnership, seemingly steering Mumbai towards a comfortable chase during the mid-overs. However, Sai Kishore, managed to dismiss Rohit for 43 off 29 balls, signaling a shift in momentum. As the match progressed, GT's bowlers excellently exploited the conditions, elevating the required run rate and putting pressure on the Mumbai lineup, which faltered despite having power hitters like Tim David and Pandya. Mohit Sharma's spell of 4-0-32-2 and Spencer Johnson's crucial 19th over, where he claimed two vital wickets, underscored a remarkable turnaround by the Titans just as MI appeared in control of their chase. Needing 19 runs off the last over, Pandya's initial boundaries brought hope, narrowing it down to 9 required from 4 balls. However, Yadav's experience prevailed, ensuring a victorious start for Gill's captaincy tenure against his predecessor.

 

Hardik Pandya,  Skipper: "We were confident in our ability to chase down the 42 runs, yet, unfortunately, today wasn't our day as we lost momentum. Returning here is always a pleasure, the stadium offers a vibrant atmosphere, and with the stands packed, the crowd certainly witnessed an exciting match. We still have 13 matches to go." 
 

Shubman Gill,  Skipper, "Absolutely, the team did exceptionally well to keep their composure despite the dew setting in. There was significant dew, but even then, Rashid and Sai bowled magnificently to keep us in contention. Mohit Sharma has been a phenomenal asset since joining us, continuing his stellar performance from last season. Our strategy was all about ramping up the pressure on the opposition.The fans have been incredible, turning up in full force, day or night, to cheer us on. Ideally, a total of 170 would have been more comforting, yet we fell short by 10 runs. Such is the nature of cricket. There were moments they seemed to be getting ahead, but striking the ball wasn’t straightforward here."

 


Sai Sudharsan is the Player of the Match:


Sai Sudharsan: "I feel it was slightly difficult in both the first and second innings. Because of the dew, they were able to play a few shots, but we pulled off a great game. I am just taking it as an extra opportunity to try and win a game for my team. After a few balls, I felt this is that kind of a wicket where you can go hard everywhere and wanted to build on the momentum. Too many great contributions in the second innings. As a batter, I found it tough when they took the pace off and our bowlers executed really well today"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of Match 4 of the TATA IPL between Rajasthan Royals  and Lucknow Super Giants ! In IPL 2023, the Royals experienced a tough home ground scenario, securing victory in only one out of five matches at Jaipur. Despite these challenges, their batsmen lit up the powerplays, marking themselves as the most aggressive starters, a stark contrast to LSG's more measured approach, which ranked them among the slowest. Looking ahead to IPL 2024, both Rajasthan Royals and Lucknow Super Giants maintain their squad cores without major overhauls. Royals' strategy revolves around the formidable Jos Buttler, while LSG will lean on KL Rahul's prowess, with Devdutt Padikkal potentially leading their charge as the opener. The spin duo of Ravi Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal for Rajasthan, and Naveen-ul-Haq with Ravi Bishnoi for Lucknow, are set to headline their respective bowling attacks. As we stand on the threshold of IPL 2024's fourth match at the iconic Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur, the stage is set for an intriguing clash.

 

 vs  Head to Head:-

Both teams have clashed against each other thrice in the IPL and Rajasthan leads the tally with 2 victories and LSG have won one here at the same venue! Will it be Pink or Blue waves at the stadium? 


Venue Stats 

 

Pitch Report: 
Samuel Badree and Matthew Hayden: "Match number 4 of the Tata IPL brings us to Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. This venue has been historically a fortress for the Rajasthan. However, last year, they managed to win only one game out of five matches played here. The ground dimensions are 70m towards the left and 62m towards the right. The straight hit is 79m. The pitch looks dry and doesn't have a lot of grass on it. Spinners will play a big role here." 

 

Toss:

Sanju Samson calls right and Rajasthan Royals elect to bat  first!

 

Sanju Samson, RR Captain: "We want to bat first today. Feels like a good batting wicket. We have a different combination today. It feels positive to be in Jaipur. Riyan Parag will be our number 4, Jos, Hetmeyer, Boult are playing. Powell could come in as an impact player." 

 

KL Rahul, LSG Captain: "We wanted to bat first as well, but the wicket looks good. I'm happy to be back on the field after the injury. It makes me hungry and perform much better when you're back. Q de Kock, Pooran, Stoinis and Naveen-ul-Haq are our four overseas options. The focus is on this game for us at the moment."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 54/2 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  || LSG- 47/3 (7.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR - 89/1 (9.9 rpo, 3x4, 6x6)  || LSG- 87/1 (9.7 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 50/1 (10.0 rpo, 1x4, 3x6) || LSG- 39/2 (7.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

 

Rajasthan Royals kick off their IPL 2024 journey with a commanding 20-run victory, thanks to the clinical performances of Sandeep Sharma and Ravichandran Ashwin during the crucial death overs. Earlier in the day, after electing to bat, RR's Buttler and Jaiswal provided a solid start, though quick dismissals followed. Riyan Parag then took charge, contributing a valuable 43 to the innings. The partnership between Samson and Parag laid the foundation for RR's substantial total. Samson's innings, coupled with Dhruv Jurel's quickfire cameo, propelled RR to 193/4. On the LSG front, Naveen-ul-Haq emerged as the lead bowler, claiming two crucial wickets. LSG initially lost 3 wickets in the powerplay and was put on the backfoot. KL held one end and Hooda provided the acceleration! As the chase intensified, LSG found themselves in a crunch situation, needing 49 runs off the final 24 deliveries. It was Sharma's crucial over, culminating in Rahul's wicket, that tipped the scales. Despite Rahul's patient 58 and Pooran's more aggressive 64* off 41, their efforts fell short. Initially, RR seemed to lose grip after reducing LSG to a precarious position, but Sharma, with his 1 for 22 in three overs, was precisely what RR needed. Their tight bowling restricted LSG, sealing a pivotal win for the home side.

 

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper and Player of the Match: "Always great to spend time in the middle and it becomes more special when you win the game. This time I've been given a different kind of role with a new combination we have. I've been playing IPL for 10 years and there has to be some experience coming in. I feel I need to spend more time and understand the conditions. Playing ODIs also helped me. It's all about understanding your strengths and weaknesses. I should give this trophy to him Sandeep. He has that in his eyes, in his body language that you can trust that guy."

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "The target wasn't a lot but we made a few mistakes. Good to see Mohsin back bowling well. Naveen has been crucial for us. We need to learn from our mistakes and find ways to win games. Langer has bought a lot of calmness to the group. We enjoy having him around."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 4  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 4  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
are set to kick off their journey by welcoming for the third match of the Indian Premier League 2024 at the iconic Eden Gardens on 23rd March 2024. Neither team managed to secure a spot in the playoffs in the previous season. 
This year, both teams will be steered by new captains, bringing a fresh perspective to the field. Shreyas Iyer makes his much-anticipated return to KKR, ready to lead the team with renewed vigour after a year's absence. Meanwhile, Pat Cummins, known for his cool and composed demeanor, takes the helm of SRH following a series of global cricketing successes. The inclusion of Travis Head and Wanindu Hasaranga, alongside the trade for Shahbaz Ahmed, positions SRH as one of the most well-rounded teams in the competition. With Marco Jansen and Aiden Markram also key figures, SRH is looking forward to initiating their campaign on a triumphant note.
On the other side, KKR is eager to make a strong start under the leadership of Shreyas Iyer, who is back to infuse dynamism and strategic prowess into the team. The acquisition of Mitchell Starc represents a significant investment, adding a layer of rich experience to the squad. The team also welcomed Dushmantha Chameera as a replacement for the injured Atkinson, and Phill Salt steps in for Jason Roy, who opted out of the IPL to manage his workload. With such strategic changes, KKR aims to embark on this tournament with high spirits and a winning mindset. 

 

KKR vs SRH Head-to-Head 

In the 25 games contested between the two, KKR has won 16 games while SRH has managed to win the rest of the nine.  

 

Stats at Eden Garden: 

The Pacers have picked 503 wickets at this venue while the spinners have managed to pick 378 wickets. The average score batting first here is 160.  

 

 

 

TOSS: 


 has won the toss and have elected to first 

Pat Cummins  Skipper: We've decided to bowl first; the pitch looks great. Jansen, Klaasen, and Markram will be joining me out there. This marks my debut game with Sunrisers, and the atmosphere in the camp leading up to this has been incredible. There's a lot of confidence among us. 
 
Shreyas Iyer Skipper : I'm feeling fantastic about my recovery from the back injury. I've had some good training sessions and played a few matches too. Our spinners have been exceptional for the last few seasons, each bringing something unique to the table. The pitch seems a bit dry today, which should play to their strengths. We've got Salt, Narine, Russell, and Starc in the lineup today.
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 43/3 (7.1 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)  || SRH- 65/1 (10.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR - 80/3 (8.9 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)  || SRH- 63/3 (7.0 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR- 85/1 (17.0 rpo, 6x4, 7x6)  || SRH- 76/3 (15.2 rpo, 2x4, 9x6) 
 

Harshit Rana's steely last over secures a heart-stopping 4-run win for KKR at Eden Gardens, despite Heinrich Klaasen's explosive effort for SRH. In a match where momentum swung wildly, KKR's 208/7, fueled by Andre Russell's devastating 64 off 25 and Phil Salt's brisk fifty, proved just enough.The match kicked off with KKR batting first; Phil Salt’s aggressive 54 set the tone, despite early wickets tumbling. Ramandeep Singh’s quickfire 35 and Russell’s late blitz propelled KKR past the 200-mark, a total that looked distant midway. T Natarajan was the pick of the bowlers for SRH, snagging three key wickets.SRH’s chase ignited with Mayank Agarwal and Abhishek Sharma putting up a swift 60-run opening stand. However, KKR's spinners, led by Sunil Narine, tightened the screws in the middle overs, making the chase increasingly arduous. Klaasen's late surge, scoring a fiery 63 in 29, brought SRH tantalizingly close, but Rana's cool final over, defending 13 runs, clinched the thriller for KKR.This electrifying clash wasn't just a game; it was a testament to KKR's resilience and strategic brilliance, echoing the golden era of 2014 with Gambhir's spirit felt in the dugout and Russell and Narine turning back the clock with their match-winning performances. As KKR embarks on their campaign with a nail-biting victory, the echoes of Eden Gardens' roars remind us of the magic of cricket and the fine margins that define it.  


 

Pat Cummins  Skipper : "It was a nail-biter, truly a fantastic display of cricket. Sadly, it didn’t swing in our favor. I’m largely pleased with our bowling effort through the game. Andre Russell, in the closing stages, did what he’s known for, proving to be a formidable challenge to contain. On the whole, I believe we managed quite well. Despite the planning and execution, facing someone like Dre Russ is always a tough call. He played some exceptional shots, though there were a few deliveries we possibly could have executed differently. Bowling to a powerhouse like him in the final overs is arguably the most challenging task in cricket. It can go either way, but it was remarkable how Klaas (Klaasen) and Shahbaz brought us back into contention and nearly across the line. It was unexpected yet impressive to get that close. Competing against such a strong team, especially at their home ground, is commendable. There's a lot from this game that’s encouraging, alongside standout performances, but also a few aspects we need to tweak. I’m content with how the coin toss turned out."  
 

Shreyas Iyer  Skipper: "Heading into the 17th over, my stomach was in knots, sensing the game could swing any way in the final moments. With 13 runs needed and a less experienced bowler at the helm, the pressure was palpable. Yet, my belief in him was unwavering. I reassured him, urging him to have faith in his abilities, emphasizing that the outcome was secondary. He seemed anxious, but I made it a point to look him straight in the eyes and remind him, 'this is your moment, buddy.' Encouraging him to trust in his skills, regardless of the game's direction. Their team's experience is formidable. Watching Andre excel with both bat and ball, along with Sunny's exceptional performance with the ball, was heartening. Having such talent in the team not only motivates but also brings a wealth of knowledge. Kicking off with a victory always boosts morale. Nevertheless, this match has been a learning curve, offering insights we're keen to carry forward. Fielding, in particular, is one aspect we're looking to bolster." 



Andre Russell | Player of the Match: Honestly, it's not often that I pay attention, but occasionally, I'll notice highlights on my Instagram and realize just how well I've been hitting the ball. It's a nice reminder that things are going well. I've had to adapt to whatever's thrown my way, especially in the past couple of years, as bowlers craft specific plans against me. Despite that, I've managed to score runs, fully aware that every opponent has a strategy for me. Reflecting on my time with KKR, I started off on the sidelines, but I always aimed to contribute meaningfully. This team holds a special place in my heart, and what I achieved tonight is a testament to the significance of wearing this jersey. I'm hopeful to continue delivering performances like this. Speaking of Harshit Rana, his actions speak volumes about his character. He was adamant about bowling the final over, took the responsibility upon himself, and remarkably bounced back after the first delivery was hit for a six.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals will start their campaign facing each other in match number 2 of the Indian Premier League 2024 at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur, Chandigarh. Both teams had a dismal outing last season, having been placed at 8th and 9th in the table and would look to erase those memories this season.  Rishabh Pant, after missing out on the entire season last time, is all set to join their team to lead from the front this season. The presence of Pant will set the balance of Delhi in the batting department, while they have invested a huge price for the young sensation, Kumar Kushagra, who showed promise in the domestic circuits. Australian Captain Mitchell Marsh and Axar Patel are their key all-rounders, while Anrich Nortje will spearhead their pace bowling attack, and David Warner will be the key prospect with the bat, given the huge amount of experience he has got. The new-look Delhi will be keen to start their campaign on a high.Punjab Kings, on the other hand, led by Shikhar Dhawan, will be finding their combinations right this season. The trio of Rabada, Sam Curran, and Arshdeep Singh form the base of their bowling attack, while the addition of Harshal Patel has strengthened their bowling unit, providing a variety of options in the death. In the batting department, they have invested a good price in Rilee Rossouw, who will combine with Dhawan and Livingstone, forming a strong batting core. Jonny Bairstow is set to return to the squad to provide depth in the batting, along with the finisher, Jitesh Sharma. Punjab has ticked all the boxes this season and will hope their combinations work well to go deep in the tournament.  

 

vs  Head-to-Head in IPL: 

Both the teams have met on 32 occasions, with the results being even-steven, both winning 16 matches each and losing as many games. 

  



 

Milestones to Watch out for: 

3 –David Warner (647) needs three fours to complete 650 fours in IPL. 

2 –Shikhar Dhawan (148) needs two sixes to complete 150 sixes in IPL.  

3 –Liam Livingstone (397) needs three fours to complete 400 fours in T20s. 

4 –Shikhar Dhawan (96) needs four fours to complete 100 fours for PBKS in IPL. 

6 –Anrich Nortje (144) needs six wickets to complete 150 wickets in T20s. 

 

PITCH REPORT:  "It is 75 metres straight down the ground at one end and 64 metres at the other end. It is black soil and won't turn much. There is a lot of breeze. It is more of an 8 and a half or 9 runs per over kind of a venue."

 

 

TOSS:
PBKS has won the toss and have elected to    first

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: " We are gonna bowl first. It is a new Wicket. We will try to come up with new strategies. We have made some changes to our set up. We are used to this ground now. We had a practice match as well. We will look for some good luck on this new venue."

 


Rishabh Pant, Skipper: " We would have batted first. The Pitch looks a little on the slower side. Emotional time for me. Just want to enjoy the moment. Really exciting times. We have been preparing well. Four overseas batters for us. Shai Hope, Mitch Marsh, David Warner, Tristan Stubbs."

Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

DC- 54/1 (9.0 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || PBKS- 60/2 (10.0 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

DC- 50/4 (10.0 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  || PBKS- 47/2 (11.1 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)   
 

Punjab Kings secured a nail-biting 4-wicket win over Delhi Capitals, powered by Liam Livingstone's decisive six in the final moments. The match was marked by Delhi's missed opportunities in the field, which proved costly. Punjab's chase of 175 started strong with Dhawan and Bairstow but stumbled briefly. Sam Curran, batting at No. 4, alongside Prabhsimran Singh, kept the scoreboard ticking, capitalizing on DC's fielding lapses. Curran's crucial 63 set the stage, despite Khaleel Ahmed's late attempt to swing the match in DC's favor with two 19th-over wickets.Earlier, DC had set a target of 174, boosted by a 25-run onslaught in the last over. Despite getting starts, DC's batters, including Warner and Marsh, failed to convert. Shai Hope's 33 was the top score, with a cameo from Abishek Porel adding to their total. Punjab's bowlers, particularly Arshdeep Singh and Harshal Patel, kept things tight, each taking two wickets.The match underscored the importance of fielding and seizing moments, with Punjab Kings outmaneuvering Delhi Capitals to kick off their campaign on a winning note. 

 

Rishabh Pant   Skipper: "Losing Ishant to injury really affected us, essentially leaving us a bowler short. Abishek's performance was a highlight, but being a bowler down made it tough. Despite the nerves, I felt our score was competitive, but Ishant's absence due to injury put us at a disadvantage. We're not looking for excuses, but playing short-handed on this pitch was a challenge. Abishek's innings was exceptional, especially considering his limited experience; his effort really lifted our finale."  
 

Shikhar Dhawan  Skipper: "It's a fantastic feeling to start with a win. Being back on the field and gearing up for this tournament has been my focus since the last IPL ended. I won't lie, stepping into this competitive arena again had me a bit nervous. After the explosive last over, I chose not to engage with anyone immediately since I was about to bat, and I believe in giving the bowlers their space to process their emotions. We've got time tomorrow to regroup, discuss, and enhance our game for the better."  

Sam Curran (Player of the Match): "Feeling great about our opening win and my performance. The key was to stay until the end. Cricket's about taking calculated risks at the right moments. Having a bit of luck on your side definitely helps. The conditions were in our favor tonight, with minimal spin and the pace on the ball aiding my gameplay."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The unfolding IPL saga captures the anticipation as the defending Champions, Chennai Super Kings, gear up to begin their title defence by hosting their rivals, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, in the TATA IPL 2024's curtain-raiser on 22nd March 2024 at the famed MA Chidambaram Stadium.  

Last season, CSK had a remarkable run, defeating the then-defending champions, Gujarat Titans, both in Qualifier-1 and the finals. However, this season, they'll be without key players Devon Conway and Matheesha Pathirana, who were instrumental in their success, as well as Ambati Rayudu, who will be missed following his retirement. Despite these absences, CSK has refreshed its squad with promising talents such as Sameer Rizvi and Aravelley Avanish, who have shown remarkable performance in local circuits recently. The inclusion of potent players like Daryl Mitchell and Rachin Ravindra adds a dynamic edge to the team, making CSK a well-balanced mix of experience and youthful exuberance. 

On the other hand, Royal Challengers Bengaluru is looking to bounce back from a rather ordinary season last year, finishing in sixth place with an equal number of wins and losses. Their performance heavily relied on the batting prowess of Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis, and Glenn Maxwell, while their bowling lineup struggled to make an impact. To revamp their bowling attack, RCB released Harshal Patel, Wanindu Hasaranga, and Josh Hazlewood, bringing in Alzarri Joseph, Lockie Ferguson, and Yash Dayal. All eyes will be on Virat Kohli, whose performance is eagerly anticipated, especially with the World Cup considerations on the horizon. 

 

CSK vs RCB Head-to-Head in IPL: 

In as many as 31 games played between the two, has dominated the contest with 20 wins while has managed to win on 10 occasions. One game ended in no-result.

 

CSK vs RCB Head-to-Head in IPL at MA Chidambaram Stadium: 

In the eight games played here, CSK has won seven games while RCB has won one game. 

 

 

Stats and Records at MA Chidambaram Stadium: 

The Pacers have picked as many as 498 wickets in the 76 matches played at this venue while spinners have picked 330 wickets in as many games. 46 of the games have been won by teams defending while 30 games have been won by teams chasing.  

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL 2023 AT CHENNAI: 
WON FIRST : 5
WON SECOND : 4
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL : 170

 

Milestones to watch out for: 

 

43 -MS Dhoni (4957) needs 43 runs to complete 5000 runs for CSK, and will become the second player after Raina to achieve this feat 

23 -MS Dhoni (839) needs 23 runs to surpass David Warner's 861 to become the leading run-scorer against RCB in IPL 

15 -Virat Kohli (985) needs 15 runs to complete 1000 runs against CSK in IPL. Shikhar Dhawan (1057) is the only player to do so in IPL against CSK scoring over 1000 runs. 

250 –CSK will appear in their 250th T20 game. 

 

 

TOSS:
has won the toss and have elected to first

 

 

Faf du Plesis, Skipper: " We'll bat first. Looks a good pitch, conditions here are always a bat first wicket. First time back here, great to see the Chennai fans again but I'm here with RCB and hopefully we can turn over a very good CSK team. Prep has been good, we need to turn up now. Andy Flower is a seasoned campaigner, brings that experience. Our bowling resources fit well. Got more backup. Hopefully, injuires don't concern us much. Alzarri Joseph comes in tonight, got a few spinners in the middle. And since we are batting first, we'll see how it goes."


Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: " Feel priviledged to be in the position. But I want to try and be in my shoes, not fill MSD's shoes. I got to know last week, but Mahi bhai hinted at it last year. Everyone is experienced here, sadly we are missing Conway and Pathirana. We've got Rachin and Mitchell coming in though this year so they should fit in well. Four overseas - Mitchell, Rachin, Fizz and Theekshana. The mystery spinner Sameer Rizvi is making his debut as well."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 42/3 (7.0 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)  || CSK- 62/1 (10.3 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB - 60/2 (6.6 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)  || CSK- 66/3 (7.3 rpo, 0x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 71/1 (14.2 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)  || CSK- 48/0 (14.1 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

 

The reigning champs are off to a strong start, led by a new captain while maintaining much of the same culture. They continue their incredible home record against RCB, and now leads 8-1. Although it may not have been the suspenseful drama that some had anticipated, this major competition is off to a great start. RCB performed admirably earlier, posting 173 after struggling at 78/5. Courtesy of Mustafizur Rahman who bagged 4 wickets on his CSK Debut. Although it was a respectable score and RCB would have realized that they needed to bowl well because the surface became slightly more favorable for batting under lights. The opening pair for CSK were off to a flying start, with Rachin making a memorable debut with a 15-ball 37. RCB somewhat recovered during the middle overs. But the onslaught from Dube and Jadeja gave no chance to RCB bowlers to stage a comeback during the death overs. 

 

 

Mustafizur Rahman is Player of the Match

 

 

Faf du Plesis, Skipper: " Always when you play, you get a bit of dip after the powerplay. Chennai is a very good team in the middle overs, they squeeze you with their spinners. Maybe we were about 15-20 runs short, the pitch wasn’t as bad as we played in the first 10 overs. They were always ahead in the chase, we tried to squeeze and get a couple of wickets, but in the end, we didn’t have enough runs on the board. On this pitch, it is always better to bat first. Last year, the record leans towards teams that batted first. The ball started to grip a bit with our spinners. Good for DK to set up his season, especially for someone who hasn’t played a lot of cricket. Anuj Rawat has shown some great promise for us, he showed great composure for a young guy and great power through the backend."

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad, Skipper: " Total control I would say, right from the start apart from two-three overs in the middle over phase. Would’ve loved 10-15 runs less but I think they played well towards the end to get to that score. I feel that was a big turning point to get Maxwell and Faf out. We got three quick wickets and it helped us control the next overs, that was the real turning point. I’ve always enjoyed it captaincy, but never felt it as an additional pressure. Role clarity helps. Couple of things to work on, everyone batted well but I think if someone from the top 3 batted till the 15th over it would’ve been even easier."
